bullet_points: EXCLUSIVE TO MONOCHROME HOMES;PRICES FROM £550,000;ONLY 2 PLOTS REMAINING;TWO DOUBLE BEDROOMS;51SQM PRIVATE GARDENS;PRIVATE GATED DEVELOPMENT;LUXURY FINISHING AND DESIGN;HELP TO BUY 40% AVAILABLE;ALLOCATED PARKING;RESERVATIONS OFF PLAN
long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Monochrome Homes (LAST PLOT AVAILABLE  ) Monochrome Homes X Novo Land and Development are proud to present a collection of just five, two bedroom mews style houses set within it's own exclusive gated development, all available with the London Help to Buy Scheme. Finished to the usual impeccable Novo standards these properties all benefit from private gardens and allocated parking. Completion December 2022 Accommodation  - Novo Land and Development’s unquestionable attention to detail produces unrivalled quality throughout to create only the best homes. Expertly crafted and finished to the highest specification, each home is complete with Herringbone patterned flooring on the ground floor, additional luxury W/C, and sleek handleless matt finished open plan kitchens, accompanied by stunning quartz worktops, integrated Bosch appliances and a bespoke wine fridge. Custom fit bifold doors open out to the rear garden, which has been thoughtfully designed, with covered Lanai’s to enjoy and entertain all year round. Each bathroom, W/C and en-suite is fitted with high end Villeroy & Boch, Vado and Grohe sanitaryware, and tiled with Porcelanosa tiles, illuding luxury. Both double bedrooms are generously sized and thoughtfully designed to maximise space. Further to the sizeable storage cupboards, carefully placed custom fitted wardrobes are included in every bedroom. Each home benefits from Air Source Heat Pumps for ultra-low-cost energy along with bike storage and private off street parking. Location  - Location is key and this development is located less then half a mile from West Sutton Station. This provides a great commute into central London in under 30 minutes, there is also many bus links which will take you towards Kingston and Wimbledon. Cheam Village and  Sutton High Street which offers a mainline station and a  number of fantastic schools and shops, restaurants , bars and other amenities is also within close proximity. Current Availability  - Plot 1 - 82 sqm - Garden - 51 sqm LAST PLOT AVAILABLE  Plot 2 - 82 sqm - Garden - 51 sqm - RESERVED Plot 3 - 82 sqm - Garden - 51 sqm - RESERVED  Plot 4 - 82 sqm - Garden - 51 sqm - RESERVED Plot 5 - 82 sqm - Garden - 64 sqm - RESERVED Novo Land And Development  - Who We Are We love what we do and it shows. With more than 75 years of experience in the field, we know our industry like the back of our hands. There’s no challenge too big or too small and we dedicate our utmost energy to every project we take on. How are we different? Every project to us is unique. That’s why we start from a blank sheet and design from the ground up. Unlike others however, our approach is always design, practicality and functionality led first. We design from furniture layouts to electrical layouts to window and wall positions and not the other way round. Award Winning We’ve won some very prestigious awards between us which is great and we are extremely proud of, but they were for previous projects. We always look for the next project to improve upon the last and is what keeps us motivated for more successes.  Quality Guaranteed Take a look at our imagery throughout our website. It is all ours, we don't use stock imagery, we don't need to! The Agent will not be responsible for any verbal statement made by any member of staff, as only a specific written confirmation should be relied upon. The Agent will not be responsible for any loss other than when specific written confirmation has been requested." Disclaimer – The photography used in this advert has been taken from a previous development by Novo Land and Developments.. Brochures St Alban's Mews, Cheam  Brochure

bullet_points: Excellent location;Large period family home;Four double bedrooms;Large reception rooms;Spacious kitchen;Family bathroom;Off street parking;Scope to extend subject to Planning Permission;95ft secluded garden with outbuilding;No onward chain
long_description: Cromwells are delighted to offer this very good size, four double bedroom, period family home. It has flexible accommodation and there is scope to extend, subject to planning permission.  This great location is a short walk from amenities including shops, restaurants and gyms, and there are  several well regarded schools close by. West Sutton and Sutton mainline railway stations are within easy walking distance, with good links into Central London. No onward chain. EPC rating E. Accommodation The property has a spacious entrance hall, leading to an unusually large reception room. The kitchen/breakfast room is also a generous size and overlooks the rear garden.  On the first floor are three of the double bedrooms, two with built in wardrobes. The largest bedroom is particularly light and bright, with a wide bay window and a further window to the front aspect. The family bathroom is on this level.    Upstairs, on the second floor, there is a further large double bedroom. Outside There is off street parking for several cars on the driveway to the front of the property. The rear garden extends to approximately 95ft, with a large workshop/garden room at the rear. There is also an outside wc. Brochures Property Brochure Full Details

DESCRIPTION An attractive and extended two/three bedroom terraced family home situated in a popular location. This super house enjoys good living space, a rear garden and a driveway to the front. The property is just 2/3 of a mile of Worcester Park's mainline station & town centre. There is no onward chain Worcester Park is an ideal destination for commuters, with a direct Zone 4 rail link to Waterloo in under 30 minutes and departing every 15 minutes. Worcester Park is located just off the A3, which offers road links to Central London, the M25 and both of London's Airports. Bus services run to Morden's Northern Line Station in approx. 15 minutes. The attractive & bustling High Street enjoys a host of familiar brands including: Waitrose, Sainsburys, Pizza Express, Nandos, Costa, Caffe Nero, Starbucks Boots, WH Smiths & Superdrug as well as an array of independents.There is a broad selection of pubs & bars and of eateries to satisfy most culinary requests. Young families are attracted to the area's plethora of high performing schools and no less than seven parks. 1. The site has a Development Manager can be contacted from various points within the property in case of an emergency during working hours Monday to Friday 9-5 and for periods when the manager is off duty there is a 24 hour emergency Appello call system. Residents must be over 60 years of age. This delightful flat is on the lower ground level with beautiful views of the peaceful tree lined car park, which is full of activity of the local wildlife. If you enjoy seeing the comings and goings of your ‘friends’ who will give you a wave, this is ideal for you! It is located at the end of the corridor with only one other flat connecting, giving a quiet, private location. There are 93 years left on the lease and the maintenance charge is £2,300 pear annum. Other benefits include two resident lounges with kitchen, two lifts, guest suite, hairdressing salon, CCTV, residents parking and a pretty communal garden.  NO CHAIN. EPC Rating; C. bullet_points: Convenient location;Four bedrooms;Two reception rooms;Fitted kitchen;Utility room;Downstairs cloakroom;Family Bathroom;Off road parking;Garden;Garage area for storage
long_description: Cromwells are pleased to offer to the market this spacious, four bedroom, semi detached family home. It is set well back from the road, behind a wide grassed verge with mature tree planting, and conveniently located within walking distance to Cheam Village. Local amenities include a variety of shops, restaurants, gyms, open spaces and good transport services. Cheam and Sutton main line railway stations are close by, with excellent links to Central London. There are also several well regarded local schools. Accommodation The property is entered via an enclosed porch, leading to the spacious entrance hallway with under stair storage. There are two large reception rooms: that to the front has a feature fireplace, that to the rear has a large bay window with double doors leading to the rear garden. The modern kitchen also overlooks the rear garden, there is a separate utility room and a cloakroom.  Stairs lead up to the spacious landing and to three double bedrooms and a single bedroom, currently in use as a study. The largest bedroom has a wide bay window overlooking the rear garden and a fitted unit with cupboards, hand wash basin and shaving point. The family bathroom with both bath and enclosed shower cubicle is also on this level. Outside The front driveway offers off street parking for several vehicles. The integral garage with up and over door has been converted into a storage area for bikes etc. The rear garden has a raised patio accessed from the house, with steps down to a large lawn and further patio with pergola over, as well as a substantial garden shed/outbuilding. Brochures Property Brochure Full Details

long_description: Retirement Homes that stand apart! A home is so much more than just bricks and mortar. It's a place where memories are made and moments are shared with friends, neighbours and family. Each home at Brio Button House has been carefully designed with this in mind. Brio homes are built to the highest standards combining the best in traditional craftsmanship and modern building techniques. Here at Button House we offer one and two-bedroom apartments over four floors, with a range of layouts to suit your lifestyle and living arrangement needs. The unique community at Brio Button House looks and feels like no other. From beautiful apartments to welcoming social spaces, every detail has been designed with you in mind. Life here is all about enjoying a healthier, happier lifestyle and having the freedom to do what you want, when you want. From the inviting landscaped terraces to the fitness suite and community hub - the social heartbeat of Button House - you'll find everything right on your doorstep. Plus, the Slate & Grain brasserie, bar and coffee lounge offers the perfect place to bring friends and family together over good food, good drink and good conversation. Located in the London Borough of Sutton, just nine miles south of Charing Cross Station, Button House is part of the New Mill Quarter development, situated opposite Hackbridge railway station in a well-established residential area. You will find everything you need right on your doorstep, as well as being moments from 58 hectares of green open space. The area is extremely well-served with transport links including approximately half hour journeys to London Victoria (by train) and Gatwick Airport (by car). At the heart of New Mill Quarter is Hackbridge Gardens, a central open space complete with seating and plenty of greenery. The kitchen with central island has a separate utility room and all rooms benefit from high ceilings. The property is very well located for local transport links/schools etc and as such offers a very rare opportunity in the current market, with the number of such homes available right now being so low. long_description: The Property Three bedroom end of terrace house with a separate lounge & dining room, potential to extend to the rear & loft space (STPP), driveway, garage and within 0.5 miles of Waddon train station make this a great family home. Entering the property, there is a spacious hallway with storage space to one side under the stairs. There are separate reception rooms with the lounge to the front of the property and the dining room to the rear with doors leading out to the rear garden. The kitchen has cupboard space to two sides, integrated fan oven, gas hob, space and plumbing for a washing machine & dishwasher. To the first floor, there are two double bedrooms to the front & rear of the house and a slightly smaller third bedroom ideally used as a child's room or study/office space. The modern family bathroom has a stand-alone bath, separate shower cubicle, w/c, hand basin and towel rail. Outside - To the front of the property there is a block paved driveway for multiple cars and access to the garage at the side of the property which has an up & over door. The private rear garden is a fantastic space with a patio area leading onto the lawn surrounded by mature shrubs & trees. The property has potential to be extended to the rear, side & loft space, subject to planning permission. Location The property is located 0.5 miles from Waddon train station which has links to London Bridge, London Victoria, Sutton & Epsom. Wandle Park tram stop is 0.9 miles away and has links to both Croydon & Wimbledon. There are regular bus links to both Wallington & Croydon Stafford Road. For primary schools, both Harris Primary Academy Purley Way & High View Primary School are within 0.3 miles and St Elphege's RC Infants' & Junior School is within 0.5 miles. For secondary schools, Wilson's School is 0.3 miles away, Harris Academy Purley is 0.9 miles away and Carew Academy is within 1 mile. Wallington & Croydon town centres are within a short distance and offer a great range of shops, restaurants and local amenities for all ages. long_description: JT CLARKE LONDON PROUDLY PRESENTS THIS DELIGHTFUL SEMI DETACHED THREE BED MAISONETTE AND RETAIL UNIT WITH PLANNING SUBMITTED FOR CHANGE TO RESIDENTIAL. This property has provided a loving home and successful business for its current owners who-s desire to move further out have brought this phenomenal freehold plot to the market. This property truly is a developers delight as within its current configuration offers a magnitude of space, however with a bit of investment could be transformed into something spectacular. Upstairs you will find a large family sized bathroom and three double bedrooms, the primary bedroom with a walk-in closet the size of a single bedroom. Downstairs you have a conservatory, open plan kitchen, dining and reception area along with downstair WC. The retail space to the front of the property boasts an additional 299 sq foot of space which combined with the ability to complete side return, additional kitchenette and storage space really does set the pace for development whether you are looking to create the perfect family space or maximize on return on investment once converted. With off street parking for three cars, large two-tiered garden space and residential planning already submitted this property really does have everything to offer regardless of your intention. Located on Malden Road you have the vast green spaces of Cheam Park right at your doorstep not to mention both Cheam Village and North Cheam an equidistant 8 mins away offering a plethora or coffee shops, restaurants, popular pubs and high street retail stores. Cheam Train station is approximately a 20 mins walk away with Worcester Park station supplying back up just 1.7 miles in the opposite direction. This really is a unique offering to the market and not one that you want to miss. Viewings are by appointment only.

This super house enjoys generous living space and a modern fitted kitchen. There is a pretty rear garden with a large workshop/ garden room/ home gym and there is a driveway to the front. The property is located a mile from Worcester Park Station. Worcester Park is located on the borders of Surrey & South West London. Located just 10 miles from Central London, Worcester Park is an ideal destination for commuters, with a direct Zone 4 rail link to London's Waterloo via Clapham Junction & Wimbledon in under 30 minutes and departing every 15 minutes. Worcester Park is located just off the A3, which offers road links to Central London, the M25 and London's Gatwick & Heathrow Airports. Local bus services will get you to Morden's Northern Line Station in approx. 15 minutes. Worcester Park's attractive & bustling High Street enjoys a host of familiar brands including: Waitrose, Sainsburys, Pizza Express, Costa, Cafe Nero, Boots, WH Smiths & Superdrug as well as an array of independents. There is a broad selection of pubs & bars and a diverse array of eateries to satisfy most culinary requests. Young families are attracted to Worcester Park's plethora of high performing schools and no less than seven parks including the vast and picturesque Nonsuch Park, formally the site of Henry VIII's Nonsuch Palace. 1. bullet_points: One bedroom, first floor retirement apartment;Fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances;Lodge manager available 5 days a week;Owners lounge & Kitchen with regular social events;24 Hour Careline system for safety and security ;Guest suite for visitors & use of over 150 guest suites in Retirement lodges across the country;Owners private car park;Great location close to the town centre & excellent transport links
long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Stratton & King Ltd Stratton and King are delighted to be marketing this lovely one bedroom first floor apartment which is situated in the popular Hampton Lodge. The Lounge offers ample space for living and dining room furniture and has a feature electric fireplace with attractive surround. The Kitchen, which is accessed via the Lounge, offers a range of eye and base level units with working surfaces over and tiled splashbacks. There is a waist height oven, 4 ring electric hob, fridge and freezer. The generous double bedroom has a useful built-in mirror fronted wardrobe and also offers space for additional bedroom furniture if required. The Shower room has a shower cubicle, WC and a wash hand basin with vanity unit beneath. Perfectly complementing this wonderful home is a useful storage cupboard which is located in the hallway.  Hampton Lodge is a prestigious and stylish development of one and two bedroom purpose built apartments constructed by Churchill Retirement Living. The development comprises of 39 properties arranged over 3 floors and is ideally located a short distance from the High Street shops and local amenities.  Hampton Lodge’s manager, is on hand throughout the day to support the owners and keep the development in perfect shape. During periods when the Lodge Manager is off duty, any emergencies are covered by the 24 hour Careline response system.  They arrange many regular events in the Owners’ Lounge from coffee mornings to games afternoons. For any visiting guests, the furnished twin Guest Suite is perfect and available for just £15 per night for 1 visitor and £20 (£10 each) for 2 visitors. The same excellent value is available across more than 150 Retirement Lodges for owners to visit throughout the UK.  Hampton Lodge is managed by the award winning Millstream Management Services, working closely with Churchill Retirement Living and Stratton & King to maintain the highest standards of maintenance and service for every lodge and owner.  Hampton Lodge requires at least one apartment resident to be over the age of 60 with any second resident over the age of 55. Each Apartment is completely self-contained with its own front door, providing you with privacy and peace and quiet when you want it. When you fancy some company, you’ll find the Owners’ Lounge a popular and relaxed place to meet.  Additional Information: Service Charge (Year Ending 31st May 2022) : £1,989.68 per annum. Ground rent £660.85 per annum.  Council Tax Band C 125 year Lease commencing 2006 Please check regarding Pets with Millstream Management Services Limited Service charges include: Careline system, buildings insurance, water and sewerage rates, communal cleaning, utilities and maintenance, garden maintenance, lift maintenance, lodge manager and a contribution to the contingency fund. A 1% contribution of the final selling price to the contingency fund is payable by the Seller upon completion of the sale of the property.    DESCRIPTION Measurements are approximate and some may be maximum on irregular walls.  CONSENTS We have not had sight of any relevant building regulations, guarantees or planning consents all relevant documentation pertaining to this property should be checked with your legal advisor before exchanging contracts.  Property Particulars Disclaimer: These particulars are intended only as general guidance. bullet_points: DETACHED FAMILY HOME;FIVE BEDROOM / THREE BATHROOMS (2 ENSUITES);APPROX 2500FT2;LARGE KITCHEN DINER;THREE RECEPTIONS;LARGE OFF STREET PARKING FRONTAGE;LARGE GARDEN WITH SWIMMING POOL;INTEGRATED DOUBLE GARAGE;SOUGHT AFTER LOCATION;QUIET RESIDENTIAL LOCATION
long_description: The Property PURPLEBRICKS are delighted to offer this fantastic FIVE BEDROOM, THREE BATHROOM DETACHED FAMILY HOME to the open market located in the highly sought after and desirable Belmont/Cheam area. The property sits on a large flat plot with the added benefit of a family SWIMMING POOL  in the large rear garden and a HUGE front paved garden with room for 10+ vehicles. The house offers approximately 2,500ft of well proportioned and configured accommodation and has the additional benefit of offering further scope to extend STPP. As you approach the house you arrive at a huge frontage with ample off street parking. The house is stand alone detached with side access on both sides of the house. As you enter, you find a large entrance hallway and a downstairs cloakroom. There is also a large under stair storage cupboard. Off the hallway on the right hand side is the principle main reception measuring 20'2 x 11'11. You can continue into the spacious formal dining area from the main reception which then leads you on into the large and well appointed modern kitchen. Just off the kitchen is a good sized study room which accesses the garden via French doors, One can also access the large rear garden through French doors from both the main reception and dining room. Finally, you have access from the superb family kitchen/diner in to the integrated double garage. Upstairs you will find FIVE good sized double bedrooms with the largest offering 20'2 x 12'1. There are three bathrooms on this floor including TWO ENSUITES. Four of the five bedrooms are located at the back of the house, therefore, offering brilliant views of the large garden and swimming pool area. This house flows very well. The standard of finish throughout is very good and there is great scope to develop further should you so wish. This really is a great home in a wonderfully quiet residential location close to some fantastic and well regarded schools, commuter links and amenities. ***VIEWING  BY APPOINTMENT *** Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

bullet_points: Open plan;Modern kitchen;Off street parking;Local amenities;Transport links
long_description: This lovely home is well presented and finished to a high standard throughout. The kitchen is modern and highly functional with plenty of storage thanks to the wall and ground mounted units.  The open plan design creates a large reception area that gets plenty of natural light and is the perfect space to spend time with friends and family or to enjoy individual pursuits.  The bedroom is large enough for a double bed plus additional bedroom furniture or extra storage.  The bathroom is modern and finished to a high standard, finished with a three-piece suite.  This home benefits from having an allocated parking space and is located close to an array of local amenities such as bars, cafes, restaurants, shops, green spaces and much more.  Transport links include Wallington train station with lines in to London East Croydon, West Croydon, Sutton and more all easily reachable. There are also a number of local bus routes.  Viewings at this property are highly recommended!

bullet_points: No Onward Chain;Three Double Bedroom Split Level Flat;0.4 Miles To Sutton Train Station;Private Balcony & Roof Terrace;Large Open Plan Kitchen-Living Room;Two En-Suite Shower Rooms;Secure Gated Allocated Parking For One Car;0.5 Miles To Sutton Common Train Station;Ideal For First Time Buyers & Young Families;Close To Great Primary & Secondary Schools
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 100 years remaining The Property No Onward Chain. Three double bedroom split level flat with stunning open kitchen-reception room, large private south-west facing balcony & roof terrace area, two en-suite bathrooms, 100 year lease, gated parking and 0.4 miles to Sutton train station. There is a secure communal access with stairs & lift access to the fourth floor. Entering the property there is a spacious hallway area with spiral stairs leading up to the open plan reception room with kitchen to one side. There is plenty of space for seating and dining table & chairs, large windows and patio doors leading out to the roof terrace area. The kitchen has cupboard space to three sides, integrated electric hob, fan oven and space for a fridge-freezer. The lower floor has three double bedrooms with two benefitting from en-suite shower rooms and built in wardrobes. The family bathroom has a shower attachment over the bath, w/c, hand basin and towel rail. The master bedroom also benefits from it's own private balcony accessed via double doors. Outside - The property has it's own south-west private roof terrace area with great views over the surrounding area. There is a gated parking area below the property with one allocated space. Location The property is located 0.4 miles from Sutton train station which has links into London Victoria, London Bridge, Epsom & West Croydon. West Sutton train station is 0.5 miles away and has links into London Blackfriars. For primary schools, Robin Hood Junior School is 0.1 miles away, Robin Hood Infants' School is 0.2 miles away and Sutton High School GDST is within 0.3 miles. For secondary schools, Sutton Grammar School is within 0.2 miles, Sutton High School GDST is 0.3 miles away, Overton Grange School is 0.8 miles away and both Cheam High School & Greenshaw High School are within 1 mile. Sutton town centre is a short walk away and offers a great range of shops, restaurants and local amenities for all ages. long_description: Relax and retire in style. Brio Button House is our latest age-exclusive assisted living retirement community in the pretty South London suburb of Hackbridge Button House features 80 stylish 1- and 2-Bedroom apartments over four floors, with a range of exciting facilities right on your doorstep, including a fitness studio, our exclusive Slate & Grain brasserie, bar and coffee lounge, a community hub and much more! Life at Brio Button House offers the very best of both worlds. Open green space is just a few minutes’ walk away at Beddington Park where the River Wandle runs, giving the impression of being in the rolling countryside, and the hustle bustle of central London just a 23-minute train journey away.  Fees Concierge fees - From £510 - £600pm, includes communal facilities, buildings insurance, upkeep / maintenance of communal areas and facilities, structure of the buildings, team on site 24/7 to help and assist you, Wifi in communal areas, and use of communal facilities Deferred Management fee of 0% if occupied for less than one year to a maximum of 15% if occupied for over five years of the selling price when sold. About 30% of this goes into a sinking fund for the development. Open weekends will start 28th May until 19th June. Please see added brochure for details. long_description: This property is to be offered for sale by PROPERTY SOLVERS ONLINE CONDITIONAL AUCTION (56-DAy EXCHANGE/COMPLETION).    Bidding opens on Wednesday 18th May at 12:00 and closes on Tuesday 24th May at 12:00 with a GUIDE PRICE of £130,000.    Property Description   This 1-bed flat is situated above shops in close proximity to a bustling high street, with an array of shops and amenities. Accessed via a spiral staircase leading to a large enclosed terrace.  Lounge   An open-plan lounge leads from the kitchen with a direct door that leads into the bedroom area.  Kitchen   A stylish kitchen featuring: a range of modern floor and wall-mounted cupboards, French doors leading to the roof terrace, integrated oven, 4 ring hob, extractor hood, stainless steel sink with drainer and mixer tap, space for washing machine, tiled walls.  Bedroom   A compact small double room featuring: sloping ceilings, ceiling mounted light fitting, electric storage heater.  Bathroom   The bathroom features a modern shower enclosure, white toilet, white basin, floor-to-ceiling tiling, and tiled flooring.  Terrace   Large outside space (rare for location) with potential to extend the existing accommodation, subject to planning permission.  Location   The flat is situated approximately 10 miles from central London in the leafy suburbs of Surrey and South West London. With regular trains every 15 minutes, various Central London stations are accessible within approximately 30 minutes.  More Information   Our enquiry line is open 24/7 and we're happy to answer any questions.  Auction terms + conditions, AML requirements and fees are available on our website [Google: Property Solvers Auctions > Auction Property for Sale (in navigation) > Select Property].   Alternatively, email   or call   (lines are open 24/7).  The legal pack will be uploaded in good time prior to the auction bidding process. Property Solvers Auctions suggest taking Professional Indemnity Insurance to cover the absence of any searches or any associated issues.  Property Solvers Online Auctions will be running open mornings/afternoons and independent viewings (where required).  All viewers must observe our COVID-19 Viewing Policy (available on the listing).  Notice to Bidders   As part of the Property Solvers Online Auction process, bidders will be required to register online and provide proof of ID documents (passport and photo driving license).  For a full list of requirements please see the legal pack documents.  Buyer Reservation Fee   2% + VAT (non-refundable) fee + £125 + VAT processing fee will be due from the winning bidder.  Exchange and Completion   The winning bidder for this property will enter into a reservation agreement with the seller and have 56 days to exchange contracts and complete the sale transaction unless the Special Conditions of Sale specify otherwise. Failing to do so could result in losing your reservation fee. Brochures Brochure 1

bullet_points: 2 Double bedroom apartment;No onward chain;Prestigious development;Share of freehold;2 Shower rooms;Large lounge/diner;Garage en-bloc;Recently replaced windows;Close to transport & amenities;Good internal order
long_description: Homefield Park is one of the most coveted developments in Sutton due to the central location and being so well maintained - with this particular apartment benefiting from a share in the freehold and having had replacement windows.  Inside, you'll be amazed sitting in your spacious living room that doesn't just have ample room for you to sit back and relax in, but also has ample room for you to dine, whether it be with family or friends, grabbing breakfast with the kids before work or even when you throw one of your dinner parties. What's more, the room has views over a gorgeous communal garden that you can also use if you want to get everyone outside and into the fresh summer air!  So, what about the rest of the property? Well you'll certainly not be disappointed with the well-proportioned kitchen that has more than enough space to cook up a storm in, also benefiting from those lovely views when you do. When it's time to catch up on some sleep, we'll bet that you'll have an amazing nights rest in your large master bedroom that will be your own little sanctuary of style and peace. The second double bedroom is also a great size and one which would be perfect for your kids or friends when they stay, and is certainly big enough for you to also set up your home office in, which is invaluable during these times. All the rooms are served by not one, but two modern shower rooms - meaning no arguments when everyone wants to get out in the morning!  Outside, we've already mentioned the landscaped gardens but the property features another big bonus - a garage! So there is no worries parking - which is also the case for your guests due to the array of visitor spaces within the development. Lastly we have to mention the location. Situated so close to town, you are only a stones throw from Sutton mainline station, the high street with fabulous shopping & amenities and how can we not mention the schools? The kids will benefit from some of the finest education in the country! bullet_points: GROUND FLOOR RETIREMENT FLAT;ENTRANCE HALL;STUDIO ROOM;KITCHEN;SHOWER ROOM;COMMUNAL LOUNGE;COMMUNAL CONSERVATORY;COMMUNAL GARDENS;SHARE OF FREEHOLD;NO CHAIN
long_description: Kenyons are pleased to offer for sale this well presented ground floor studio retirement flat which forms part of this popular retirement block. The development benefits from a good size communal lounge with kitchen area and conservatory leading to the well-kept communal gardens to the rear of the block. The flat itself is neutrally decorated and benefits from a combined security entry system and a 24-hour emergency call system within the flat and a Careline pendant is available to residents. The block is located within easy reach of Wallington town centre which offers a wide range of amenities including shopping and transport facilities with various bus routes and a mainline train station. Also within walking distance is the Jubilee Health Centre at Shotfield, Wallington. long_description: SUMMARY A fantastic one bedroom freehold house with a lovely open plan layout and offered to the market with vacant possession. Barnard Marcus are now in receipt of an offer for the sum of £332,000 for Cotswold Way.  Anyone wishing to place an offer on this property should contact Barnard Marcus, Worces DESCRIPTION A fantastic one bedroom freehold house with a lovely open plan layout and offered to the market with vacant possession. Worcester Park & North Cheam are located on the borders of Surrey & South West London. Located just 10 miles from Central London, Worcester Park is an ideal destination for commuters, with a direct Zone 4 rail link to London's Waterloo via Clapham Junction & Wimbledon in under 30 minutes and departing every 15 minutes. Worcester Park is located just off the A3, which offers road links to Central London, the M25 and both of London's Gatwick & Heathrow Airports. Local bus services will get you to Morden's Northern Line Station in approx. 15 minutes. Worcester Park's attractive & bustling High Street enjoys a host of familiar brands including: Waitrose, Sainsburys, Pizza Express, Costa, Boots, WH Smiths & Superdrug as well as an array of independents. There is a broad selection of pubs & bars and a diverse array of eateries to satisfy most culinary requests. Young families are attracted to Worcester Park's plethora of high performing schools and no less than seven parks including the vast and picturesque Nonsuch Park, formally the site of Henry VIII's Nonsuch Palace. long_description: A two double bedroom, first floor apartment located within a nature park. Bishopsford House was once the grand residence of a worldwide pharmaceutical mogul, now converted to a number of exclusive gated apartments with excellent views. The open plan kitchen/diner was individually designed by our client and boats a large amount of storage throughout including plenty of cooking and entertaining space! Both bathrooms have also been fully re-fitted with the main bathroom having both a separate shower and bath. long_description: This beautifully presented four/five bedroom detached family house with large South/South East facing garden set in a cul de sac location is within the London borough of Sutton.   The property boasts three reception rooms, a modern refitted kitchen/breakfast room, downstairs wc, a lovely refurbished family bathroom & ensuite shower room, four bedrooms, detached double garage and driveway. This beautifully presented, four bedroom detached family home is set on a bold corner plot within a popular cul de sac location. The property briefly comprises an enclosed porch, a lovely bright & spacious lounge that leads into the dining room that overlooks and opens onto a fabulous garden. There's also an additional third reception room that could be an office or even a 5th bedroom if need be.  The kitchen has been refitted recently comprising of a range of modern cupboards & drawers at base and eye level, worktop surfaces and matching breakfast bar and space for all the usual appliances.  There's also a rather convenient downstairs cloakroom for guests to use whilst upstairs you'll find a modern family bathroom and luxurious en-suite shower room to the master bedroom. There are three further bedrooms and access into a large loft space.  Outside, there is a detached double garage with driveway in front for 2 cars and a side opening into an amazing South, South East facing rear garden that is mainly laid to lawn.

long_description: For sale by modern method of auction. Situated in a popular residential road this property is in need of a complete refurbishment throughout and is the the perfect opportunity to put your own stamp on. Offered to the market with no onward chain!   Please refer to the footnote regarding the services and appliances. Room sizes: Entrance Hall : 12'3 x 2'7 (3.74m x 0.79m) Living Room : 12'7 into bay x 10'4 maximum (3.84m x 3.15m) Dining Room : 11'8 x 10'3 (3.56m x 3.13m) Kitchen : 12'3 x 8'4 (3.74m x 2.54m) Bathroom : 7'9 x 5'3 (2.36m x 1.60m) Separate Toilet Landing Bedroom 1 : 13'4 x 10'2 (4.07m x 3.10m) Bedroom 2 : 11'8 x 7'7 (3.56m x 2.31m) Bedroom 3 : 11'3 x 8'10 (3.43m x 2.69m) Rear Garden   AUCTIONEER'S COMMENTS This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction - powered by iamsold Ltd. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold. This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 3.6% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded. This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold. The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change. REFERRAL ARRANGEMENTS Cubitt & West and Auctioneer may recommend the services of third parties to you. Whilst these services are recommended as it is believed they will be of benefit; you are under no obligation to use any of these services and you should always consider your options before services are accepted. Where services are accepted the Auctioneer or Cubitt & West may receive payment for the recommendation and you will be informed of any referral arrangement and payment prior to any services being taken by you. These flats are all available on London 40% help to buy scheme and will be available to move in from May 2022. Properties finished to a high specification and parking available to purchase. bullet_points: Two Double Bedroom Flat;0.2 Miles To Hackbridge Train Station;Open Plan Kitchen-Living Room;Private Balcony;Ideal For First Time Buyers & Investors;Close To Great Primary & Secondary Schools;First Floor;Built In 2017;Double Glazed & Central Heating
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 120 years remaining The Property Two double bedroom flat with open plan kitchen-living room, private balcony, 120 year lease and located within 0.2 miles of Hackbridge train station making this ideal for first time buyers and investors. There is a secure communal entrance with stairs up to the first floor. The property has an entrance hallway with cupboard storage space to one side leading through to the kitchen-living room. The kitchen has cupboard space to two sides with integrated electric hob, fan oven and fridge-freezer. There is space for a dining table & chairs and the living room area has patio doors leading out to the private balcony which has space for a table & chairs. There are two double bedrooms and the family bathroom has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail. Outside - There are communal garden areas for residents use only. Lease - 120 Years Remaining. Location The property is located 0.2 mile from Hackbridge train station which has links into London Victoria, London Bridge & Clapham Junction. For primary schools, Hackbridge Primary School is within 0.1 mile and Culvers House Primary School is 0.3 miles away. For secondary schools, Wallington County Grammar School, Carshalton Boys Sports College and Carshalton High School for Girls are all within 0.7 miles. Hackbridge, Carshalton & Wallington are all within walking distance and offer a great range of shops, restaurants and local amenities. Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

Retirement one bedroom flat situated in a desirable block in a popular road in Sutton, close to transport links and shops.  The flat is warden assisted and the development manager can be contacted from various points within the property in case of an emergency and for periods when the manager is off duty there is a 24 hour emergency Appello call system.  Residents must be over 60 years of age. Other benefits include two resident lounges with kitchen, two lifts, guest suite, hairdressing salon, CCTV, residents parking and a pretty communal garden. Accommodation  - Front door to Entrance Hall Large storage cupboard with water tank, wall mounted fuse boards. Lounge   16’6 x 10’ UPVC double glazed bay window with pleasant views overlooking communal garden, coved ceiling, electric heater, fitted carpet, emergency pull cord, security phone entry system, archway to Kitchen   7’10 x 6’ Work surfaces with drawers and cupboards below, matching wall units, stainless steel sink with chrome mixer taps, space for cooker with extractor fan above, space for tall fridge freezer, Metro tiled splashback, vinyl floor. Bedroom  13'2 x 8'6 UPVC double glazed windows, built-in wardrobe, electric storage heater, fitted carpet, emergency pull cord. Bathroom White three-piece shower suite comprising large shower cubicle with electric power shower, pedestal wash hand basin with chrome mixer tap, low-level WC with push button flush, part tiled walls, wall mounted fan heater. Brochures Thicket Road, Sutton Brochure

** NO ONWARD CHAIN **  A chance to acquire an extended four bedroom detached family home sold with no onward chain, located in a desirable cul-de-sac location in Purley.  The property offers spacious accommodation downstairs with a lounge, dining room and extended conservatory room. There is also an ample sized kitchen and a downstairs WC. Upstairs there are four bedrooms, with the master bedroom also featuring an en-suite shower. Other benefits are a garage and off street parking, and a wide garden with side access.  Goldcrest Way is ideally positioned for excellent local schools, with John Fisher High School, Wallington High School for Girls and Wilsons Grammar School all within easy walking distance. It is also close to bus links, and local shops and parks are easily accessible. Accommodation  - Room Measurements Lounge 16'00 x 15'03 Dining Room 9'10 x 8'07 Kitchen 10'02 x 9'10 Conservatory 16'05 x 9'06 Bedroom One 13'03 x 11'03 (plus ensuite shower) Bedroom Two 8'11 x 7'07 Bedroom Three 10'08 x 10'02 Bedroom Four 8'02 x 6'10 Bathroom 8'11 x 4'04 Brochures Goldcrest Way, Purley Brochure

bullet_points: DETACHED FAMILY HOME;IN NEED OF MODERNISATION;FOUR BEDROOMS;TWO RECEPTION ROOMS;CONSERVATORY;MANY LOCAL SCHOOLS;GARAGE;OFF STREET PARKING;CLOAKROOM;CUL DE SAC LOCATION
long_description: PUBLIC NOTICE – 7 Goldcrest Way, CR8 3QW - We are in receipt of an offer of £685,000 subject to contract for this property. Anyone wishing to place a higher offer must do so before legal exchange of contracts. Offered to the market with "No onward chain" is this four bedroom detached family home in the desirable West side of Purley and within easy access of several sought after schools including Johns Fisher, Wilsons, Wallington High School for Girls the school is also twinned with Wallington County Grammar School for Boys. Situated within close proximity to some of the areas most sought after schools is this detached  four bed family home within a West side of Purley in a cul-de-sac. The property is in need of modernisation, but has so much potential. Consisting of entrance hall, living room with triple windows, second reception/dining area lead to the conservatory and patio doors to the garden, separate kitchen which leads back round to the entrance hall and cloakroom. To the first floor and off of the landing are the four bedrooms, ensuite shower to main as well as the family shower room. Outside the property offers off street parking and garage to side with access to the landscaped rear garden. The property has no onward chain and is well worth an early viewing.

bullet_points: Light & spacious open plan design;Brasserie & bar, fitness suite & club lounge on site;Private balcony/terrace;Landscaped outdoor terraces;Video door entry system;On-site call system;24-hour on-site staff presence;A vibrant community exclusively for over 65;Just a stone's throw away, shops, cafes , restaurants, doctors, pharmacy and more;Within Zone 4 - London Victoria is 25 mins direct;1 & 2 bedroom apartments ;Open green space is just a few minutes walk away at Beddington Park ;80 stylish apartments;Central London just a 23-minute train journey away;Independant Living in a Retirement Community;Now Open For Viewings;Full Purchase or Part Buy Available (ask for further details);Ideal Location for Shops & Parks;Range of Amenities On Your Doorstep;24hr On Site Support Team For Your Peace Of Mind
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 250 years remaining Our Button House community features 80 beautifully designed one and two-bedroom apartments, each offering everything you need to live life to the full during your retirement.  This spacious, modern apartment features a roomy living/dining area, kitchen, en-suite bathroom and private balcony, plus plenty of in-home storage space.  The Hub is at the heart of the community at Button house. Here, you can take part in a range of events and activities, from wine or whisky tasting to gardening club, cookery classes and much more. Daily exercise and wellbeing classes take place in the fitness suite, including yoga and Pilates, plus you can enjoy unlimited use of the fitness equipment. The hobby room and club lounge offer a space to relax with friends and family or discover a new hobby. Plus, the onsite Slate & Grain brasserie and bar offers the perfect place to bring loved ones together over good food, good drink, and conversation.  Feeling part of a community undoubtedly makes life more meaningful and enjoyable. Button House is a community in its own right, however great care has been taken to choose a location where you will feel part of the wider community.   Shops, places to eat and drink and other amenities such as health centres and pharmacies, can all be found close by. Plus, the beautiful rolling green space at Beddington Park, where the River Wandle runs, is just a short walk away.   A couple of miles up the road is neighbouring Sutton which has two indoor shopping centres, a bustling high street, Sutton's library, and all the main supermarkets. It's also home to the renowned Royal Marsden Hospital and a satellite of the Moorfields Eye Hospital. For those who love getting into the city - the centre of London is only 25 minutes away by train and if travelling abroad, Gatwick airport is a convenient 17 miles away.  Discreet care can be provided by our trusted care provider (registered with the Care Quality Commission). We also offer a range of lifestyle support services. Charges apply for these services.    All homes are available to rent, buy or part buy, part buy.  Please note that service charges* apply to prices shown. Please get in touch with a member of the Brio team for further information on what this fee covers.   * Concierge Fees:  A monthly Concierge Fee covers a range of on site facilities and services- please see the brochure for full details.  ** Deferred Management Fee: On reselling the property, owners pay a Deferred Management Fee (DMF) of up to 15% of the property value; an Estate Agency Fee of 1% of the sale price achieved; and an Administration Fee of at least £500.   ***Some photographs may not necessarily be of the specific property for sale.

bullet_points: One Double Bedroom;Lease - 120 Years Remaining;9 Minute Bus Route To Morden Tube Station;1 Mile To Sutton Common Train Station;Allocated Parking;Open Plan Lounge-Dining Room;Modern Shower Room;Juliet Balcony;Ideal For First Time Buyers & Young Professionals;Double Glazed & Central Heating

long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 120 years remaining The Property One double bedroom flat with open plan lounge-dining-kitchen, 120 year lease, allocated parking and only 1 mile to Sutton Common train station and 9-minute bus to Morden Tube Station, making this ideal for 1st time buyers and young professionals. The property has a secure communal entrance and concierge service and lift access to each floor. The property has an entrance hallway leading through to the spacious lounge-dining room with juliet balcony to one side and space for a sofa and table & chairs. The kitchen has cupboard space to either side, integrated electric hob, fan oven, fridge-freezer, microwave. There is a double bedroom with storage space to the side and the modern shower room has a shower cubicle, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail. Outside - There is one allocated parking space for this property. Lease - 120 years remaining. Location The property is conveniently located within easy access of both Sutton Common and West Sutton stations (each within approximately a mile), as well as numerous regular bus routes providing links to the surrounding area. There is a 9 minute bus link to Morden Tube Station (Northern Line). There are a variety of local shops nearby, with Sutton just a short distance away offering a wider selection of shops, cafes, bars, restaurants and leisure facilities. long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 250 years remaining Our Button House community features 80 beautifully designed one and two-bedroom apartments, each offering everything you need to live life to the full during your retirement.  This modern, spacious one-bedroom apartment features a roomy, open plan kitchen and living/dining area, a well-sized bedroom with en-suite bathroom, private balcony, plus plenty of storage space and natural light.  The Hub is at the heart of the community at Button house. Here, you can take part in a range of events and activities, from wine or whisky tasting to gardening club, cookery classes and much more. Daily exercise and wellbeing classes take place in the fitness suite, including yoga and Pilates, plus you can enjoy unlimited use of the fitness equipment. The hobby room and club lounge offer a space to relax with friends and family or discover a new hobby. Plus, the onsite Slate & Grain brasserie and bar offers the perfect place to bring loved ones together over good food, good drink, and conversation.  Feeling part of a community undoubtedly makes life more meaningful and enjoyable. Button House is a community in its own right, however great care has been taken to choose a location where you will feel part of the wider community.   Shops, places to eat and drink and other amenities such as health centres and pharmacies, can all be found close by. Plus, the beautiful rolling green space at Beddington Park, where the River Wandle runs, is just a short walk away.   A couple of miles up the road is neighbouring Sutton which has two indoor shopping centres, a bustling high street, Sutton's library, and all the main supermarkets. It's also home to the renowned Royal Marsden Hospital and a satellite of the Moorfields Eye Hospital. For those who love getting into the city - the centre of London is only 25 minutes away by train and if travelling abroad, Gatwick airport is a convenient 17 miles away.  Discreet care can be provided by our trusted care provider (registered with the Care Quality Commission). We also offer a range of lifestyle support services. Charges apply for these services.    All homes are available to rent, buy or part buy, part buy.  Please note that service charges* apply to prices shown. Please get in touch with a member of the Brio team for further information on what this fee covers.   * Concierge Fees:  A monthly Concierge Fee covers a range of on site facilities and services- please see the brochure for full details.  ** Deferred Management Fee: On reselling the property, owners pay a Deferred Management Fee (DMF) of up to 15% of the property value; an Estate Agency Fee of 1% of the sale price achieved; and an Administration Fee of at least £500.    ***Some photographs may not necessarily be of the specific property for sale.

long_description: Next Step Estates are pleased to offer to the market this delightful two double bedroom apartment located in Rosehill. Conveniently located near St Helier Hospital and with easy access to Sutton and Morden via a short bus ride.  The property itself is presented in good decorative order throughout. The open kitchen / diner / lounge area offers a decent amount of living space with juliet style balcony doors. Each bedroom is very well proportioned with the main bedroom benefiting from an en-suite shower room.  This is a fantastic property and will be suitable for many such as first time buyers, a small family or if you are downsizing

bullet_points: Beautiful Georgian Style House;Elegant and Spacious Interior;Stunning Kitchen/Dining Room;Adjoining Sitting Room with Atrium;25'2 Through Lounge with Fireplace;Two Study's;Six Double Bedrooms;Four Bath/Shower Rooms (Three En-Suite);Manicured South Westerly Garden;Carriage Driveway & Garaging
long_description: THE   PROPERTY    A simply stunning, detached family home finished to an elegant Georgian style with wonderfully bright and spacious interior extending to approximately 3781sq.ft and featuring a manicured southerly westerly aspect rear garden. Behind the classical double fronted façade lies a modern and sophisticated interior which has been finished with a fine attention to detail. Built in 2014, this fine home spans three floors and presents the perfect layout for modern and discerning families. An internal porch leads to a generous hall with handmade oak staircase with storage beneath rises to the first and second floors and a study and an office both overlook the driveway. The double aspect through lounge measures an impressive 25'2 x 14'6 with double doors opening to the garden and an exposed brick fireplace with timber mantle housing a wood burning stove being the focal point of the room. The kitchen/dining room comprises a beautiful range of bespoke in-frame cabinets and drawers with granite work tops with a contrasting 'Butchers Block' style peninsular breakfast bar. The dining area features an exposed brick corner fireplace with stove and double doors leading to the rear garden. There is an opening to the adjoining sitting/family room which is double aspect with double doors leading to the garden an atrium allowing light to flood in. A cloakroom and utility room complete the ground floor. The first floor comprises a principal suite of bedroom, walk-in wardrobe and shower room and there are four further double bedrooms and two bath/shower rooms of which one is en-suite. There is a further suite on the second floor with bedroom, walk-in wardrobe and bathroom. Outside, there are immaculate wrap around gardens to the side and rear, enjoying east, south and westerly aspects and laid to a level lawns, there are also two patios on which to entertain. Beneath the garden lies a 3000 litre rainwater harvesting tank and solar panels provide approx. 1Kw of energy. Walled boundaries line the property with pretty red robin hedging. The front comprises a gravel carriage driveway providing ample parking with garaging for one car as well as further storage space. Solar panels also generate 1kw of energy per year (not verified).  LOCATION    Education Purley and the surrounding areas are well known for their very good choice of reputable schools including Cumnor House, St. David's, Margaret Roper Catholic, St. Nicholas, Beaumont and Oakwood. At senior level, there is John Fisher, Riddlesdown Collegiate and Woodcote and from the private sector, Whitgift, Trinity, Old Palace and Croydon High.  Sports & Leisure There are numerous facilities in the area including Purley Sports Club with its squash, cricket and tennis courts and there are two golf courses in Purley as well as a number of individual tennis and bowls clubs. There are also plenty of opportunities to relax and socialise in the many local restaurants and cafes. Transport Purley station provides rail services to London Bridge (from 25 minutes), London Victoria (from 24 minutes) and Gatwick (from 26 minutes) whilst Riddlesdown and Reedham will get you to London Bridge from 23 & 32 minutes and Victoria from 26 & 37 minutes respctively. Numerous bus services provide transport to all the surrounding and the M25/M23 intersection at Hooley is approximately 4-5 miles away. Gatwick and Heathrow Airports are within about 30 and 60 minutes drive respectively.

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Silverman Black Silverman Black is delighted to offer this spacious and well presented one bedroom upper floor maisonette, located only 100 yards from Carshalton Ponds and the High Street, and approximately 8 minutes walk (0.3 miles) from the local BR station. The property benefits from it's own front door, opening to a small ground floor reception area, whilst on the first floor the accommodation incorporates a spacious living room with views over school playing fields located opposite, a generously proportioned double bedroom with built in wardrobes, a well equipped kitchen and a good size bathroom with a modern white suite. Other benefits include double glazed windows throughout, use of a substantial loft for storage, gas/radiator central heating and a recently renewed lease with 120 years unexpired on the term. Presented for sale in excellent decorative condition and ready for occupation, we consider this to be an excellent first time purchase, pied-a-terre in London or investment. Carshalton Village BR station which affords four fast trains per hour to London Victoria is only about 8 minutes walk away, Carshalton Beeches BR station (giving access to London Bridge) is about 12 minutes walk away (0.6 miles), whilst shopping, entertainment and restaurant facilities are easily accessible in Carshalton, Sutton or Wallington. Viewing is highly recommended - so call today to book your appointment. Brochures Pound Street, Carshalton Brochure

long_description: Laurels are proud to present this outstanding one bedroom house. The property is immaculately presented throughout, situated in a fantastic location with the mainline station (Zone 4, Waterloo approx. 20 mins) and local shops within walking distance.  The property comprises an impeccably presented spacious living area, adjacent to a modern kitchen. Upstairs there is a large bedroom which is elegantly decorated along with a sizeable modern bathroom.  Further benefits include a private parking space, an outside garden area and ample storage throughout. The property is within walking distance of Worcester Park Station which is serviced by South West Trains every 15 minutes. You can also access Morden Tube Station with access into London via several local busses. The A3 is a short 5-minute drive with access to London, the M25, and sits in the middle of both Heathrow and Gatwick airports.  The property is in Sutton council and has a council tax band "C". long_description: Located in the prestigious, award winning development, The Hamptons in Worcester Park.  Set in a 24 hectare development of stunning New England style homes and parkland.  As you approach the property, there is a fountain water feature and seating area.   The Hamptons is a vibrant, diverse, family community, built around parkland incorporating a nature reserve and wetland habit.  This is a larger than average mid-terrace town house, of almost 1500 sq feet. The family home is set over 3 floors, with a first floor balcony overlooking the fountains in front of the property. The house has wood effect flooring fitted throughout, apart from carpeted staircases, and is neutrally decorated ready to personalise.   There is off-street parking for 1 car and a separate garage.  The garage has an enhanced power supply, ready to connect to an electric car charging point. As you enter the property through the hallway, there is a downstairs WC, and two separate doorways leading to the open-plan family space.  A fully fitted kitchen at the front of the house, has a window overlooking the fountains.  The living space benefits from abundant natural light and is a lovely space for family life, dining and entertaining. French doors lead out onto the southerly facing garden with a ‘sun trap' patio area, with space for outdoor seating.  A 14ft Hydropool Swimspa is installed in the garden, with resistance jets allowing you to swim or exercise against the current, then relax in the jacuzzi seats.  This is removable, or could remain as an optional extra (price on application).   The first floor has 2nd large living room, with French doors opening onto the balcony. This is a lovely space to sit outside and relax, with space for lounge seating, or a small table and chairs.  The light and airy main bedroom is on the first floor, with windows overlooking the back garden, fitted wardrobes and an en-suite shower room.  The second floor has 2 large double bedrooms with free-standing wardrobes and an office, which could be used as a single bedroom or nursery.  There is also a family bathroom with a bath and shower unit.   The loft space is boarded for storage, with a large loft hatch and fitted stairs. The Hamptons is a fantastic place to live, with a real sense of community, set in 20 acres of parkland.  It is a great environment for families to live and play in green space. There are also 2 tennis courts for residents and access to tennis coaches.  The parkland has 3 children’s play equipment areas, with a fenced ‘under 10’s’ area and 2 areas for older children.   The community hall, Maple Lodge has a large room available to hire for children’s birthday parties.  There is also a fully fitted gym with manager and personal trainers available to book for residents.  The gym runs classes ranging from children’s dance classes to yoga, pilates and HIT training.  The lodge also contains meeting rooms, a business suite and the Estate Management office. The development is only a 10 minute walk away from the local high street, which has a range of coffee shops, restaurants, shops, banks and other amenities. Worcester Park train station is less than a 15 minutes walk, with a 28 minute overground train commute into London Waterloo or just 10 minutes to Wimbledon and the District Line.   Morden underground station, with the Northern Line,  is approximately a 15 minute drive away. The A3 is 5-10 minutes away, providing access to the M25 and other major road links. The Hamptons, Worcester Park development has previously won the following awards; Evening Standard New Homes Award 2011 - Best new large development. What House Awards 2010 - Best development and best exterior design.

bullet_points: GUIDE PRICE £245,000 - £255,000;Fantastic one bedroom apartment;South Sutton location;No onward chain;Excellent internal order;Second floor with great views;Spacious proportions;Quiet cul-de-sac setting;Communal grounds;Close to great transport links and amenities
long_description: GUIDE PRICE £245,000 - £255,000 Located in South Sutton, this wonderful top floor purpose built apartment has so much to offer, both inside and out. Firstly, we have to talk location. Have you ever dreamed of living in a quiet cul-de-sac, yet on the doorstep of fabulous amenities, open spaces, schools and transport links?   Abbotsleigh Close will surpass your expectations, as it's just a quick stroll into Sutton with fabulous shops and restaurants, with Sutton train station whizzing you into the City - you can be from the sofa to London in just under an hour, amazing!  Despite all of this, sitting in your spacious lounge, you'd be forgiven for thinking you were in the middle of nowhere - a tranquil space for you to enjoy a good book, catch up on those box sets you haven’t got around to finishing yet - or even have a few friends over.   If we're on the money with the latter, the wonderful kitchen means you can cook up a storm in what is a truly well thought out and designed place for you to enhance your culinary skills!  When it’s time to catch up on some sleep, this property doesn't let you down; with a generous double bedroom, there is even plenty of room for large wardrobes! Finishing off this amazing home is a lovely bathroom serving the apartment. Outside, well-kept communal grounds wrap around the block and provide a place for you to catch some rays, well when the sun decides to finally come out! Want more? Parking in available on a first come basis. If we were you, we’d get in touch with us pretty quickly! Second Floor  -  Hallway  -  Living/Dining Room  - 4.24m x 3.63m (13'11 x 11'11) -  Kitchen  - 3.43m x 1.78m (11'3 x 5'10) -  Bedroom  - 4.32m x 3.15m (14'2 x 10'4) -  Bathroom  - 2.64m x 1.83m (8'8 x 6) -  Outside  -  Communal Grounds  -  Brochures Abbotsleigh Close, Sutton Brochure

bullet_points: Great location for local shops and schools;2nd floor;Reception room;Modern Kitchen;Family bathroom;2 double Bedrooms;Loft space;Allocated parking for 1 car.;Easy access for local bus routes.;EPC C
long_description: An impressive 2nd floor, purpose built flat which has been well maintained by the current owner and needs to be viewed to be appreciated.  Entrance to the block is through a communal hallway which has a security entrance phone system with stairs leading up to the 2nd floor landing.   As you enter the flat the entrance hallway has two built in storage cupboards, access to the loft and the security entrance phone. To the left hand side is the main reception room and directly off the reception room is the modern kitchen which has a 4 ring gas hob and plumbing for a washing machine.   There are 2 double bedrooms with the main bedroom having built in storage and a new modern family bathroom. There are communal gardens to the rear of the property and there is allocated parking for 1 car. All viewings are strictly by appointment only through Andrews Estate Agents. LOCATION  The sought after development is located just off Abbotts Road and ideally situated for access to local shops and bus routes on Priory and Malden Road. This area is well known for its family atmosphere and some great local schools for all ages.  North Cheam has many diverse shops, restaurants and a Sainsbury’s Super Store. From the high street you can jump on the 93 bus which will take you through to Morden Underground Station which is on the Northern Line and through to Wimbledon and Putney High Streets. From Malden Road the 213 will take you through to Kingston via Worcester Park train station. DISCLAIMER  As this is a leasehold property you are likely to be responsible for management charges and ground rent. You may also incur for items such as leasehold packs and in addition you will also need to check the remaining length of the lease. You must therefore consult with your legal representative. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold. This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 3.6% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded. This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold. The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change. Updated and extended, this detached home offers an attractive set up for any growing family. Sat in the heart of Wallington, you will be walking distance from mainline train stations, including Hackbridge (Zone 4), also just a short walk to all the shops and convenience the High Street has to offer. There is a driveway for 2 cars and access to a garage for storage and bikes, at the front of the property, there is also side access to the rear garden too. Once inside you are welcomed by an open plan, modern feel in this well presented home. The bright space flows through to the refitted kitchen/dining area with double doors which open up onto the rear garden. Further extended space to both sides, offering a study/family area and large utility room, both with further access to the rear garden. There is also a downstairs WC. Upstairs there are 3 good size bedrooms and a modern family bathroom. This home is ready to move into and has no chain! In such a great location, this will not be available long, so contact us today to book your time to view! Brochures Parkgate Road, Wallington Brochure

bullet_points: Wonderful Central Location ;Close To Transport Links ;Modern Living ;Large Open Plan Reception Room ;Off Street Parking
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 105 years remaining The Property Ideally situated a stones throw from Sutton Town Centre and Sutton Train Station, close to all amenities the area has to offer; this one bedroom modern flat would make an ideal pied-à-terre for those looking for a bolt hole in London, a great rental investment  or perfect for someone looking for their first purchase locally.   Upon entering the apartment through the secured communal hallway you are greeted with a spacious hallway with generous storage cupboards ideal for storing shoes, coats and life's essentials.  Off the hallway you will find entrances to a great sized double bedroom which is incredibly bright and airy given the apartments position within the building. The large double bedroom has the addition of fitted wardrobes. Continuing into the property there is a great size modern family bathroom equipped with separate bath and rain shower.  The feature of this apartment is the perfectly sized open plan kitchen / reception room. The epitome of modern living, this room is a super size and features large windows which allows plenty of light into the room and makes the space feel incredibly bright and airy. The kitchen is fitted with quality appliances and has everything a budding chef needs to cook up a storm. For those who like to entertain there is enough room for a dining table which makes this space and apartment  incredibly social. The property also comes with private allocated parking which is situated in a secure underground residential car park. This is a wonderful flat which would make an ideal first time purchase or rental investment. Early viewing is recommended to avoid disappointment. Location Located on the Surrey and London borders and in the heart of a vibrant town centre you will find this stunning apartment in the middle of Sutton Town Centre, you couldn't get closer to bars, restaurants, cafes and shops that the Sutton area has to offer.  The area boasts some outstanding schools both in the state and private sectors. For those fitness fanatics, there are a number of gyms close by, there are also some great walks and trails to explore which offers some lovely dog walking opportunities.  Sutton Station is only a short walk away - which is in Zone 5. It is ideal for travel being only a short commute to hotspots such as Clapham (21 mins) and Wimbledon (17 mins) whilst also having direct train lines to London Bridge, London Victoria, Blackfriars and St Pancras - the former two being sub 30 minutes.  There are excellent road links to the A217, A3, M23 and M25. Gatwick airport can be easily accessed within 30 minutes, Heathrow only an hour away and the seaside resort of Brighton can also be reached within the hour.  Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure
