bullet_points: Kitchen with integrated appliances;Balconies & Terraces;Double glazing;Ofsted rated 'Outstanding' schools nearby;Adjacent to Hackbridge station - Zone 4 location;High specification;Private outside space;10 year build warranty;Communal gardens;Modern, open plan living/dining area
long_description: ONE OF THE LAST REMAINING!! A one bedroom apartment available to purchase from a 50% share at £146,250 with a deposit of £7,312.50. Full market value £292,500. Call today to arrange your appointment to discuss this stunning home! This one bedroom apartment situated on the popular development of New Mill Quarter comprises of  an open plan kitchen/lounge/dining area. The apartment  has a three piece bathroom with shower over bath and spacious cupboards in the hallway. You also have access to an allocated parking space. INCENTIVES -  Contribution to your utility bills for the first year (max £1000) And  Your Legal fees paid (max £1000)* Plus one of these Help with your moving costs (max £500) or Housewarming voucher to spend (max £500) *legal fee incentive only available when using Sage’s preferred solicitor Full Market Value: £292,500 50% Share £146,250 - Rent £335.16 pcm  60% Share £175,500 - Rent £268.13 pcm  75% Share £219,375 - Rent £167.58 pcm  Minimum 5% Mortgage Deposit (50% share): £7,312.50 Approximate Service Charges: £127.11 New Mill Quarter is an exciting new development, offering a collection of 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments, as well as luxury 4 bedroom homes, all set within landscaped gardens and finished to an impeccable standard. Ideal for commuters, the development is adjacent to Hackbridge railway station, connecting you to London in approximately 30 minutes, as well as a bus stop just outside the development giving great transport connections. With a high-quality specification by Barratt Homes London, these  homes are designed to appeal to families and professionals travelling into central London and the City. New Mill Quarter neighbours vibrant areas such as Croydon, Kingston and Wimbledon where you will find everything you need nearby including good schools within close proximity, and on-site amenities including the award winning Lidl supermarket. Hackbridge is a leafy suburb in the London Borough of Sutton, offering all the benefits of proximity to Central London yet close by to expansive parks. This combined with the distinctive town centres Hackbridge offers residents a peaceful but vibrant lifestyle. Nestled between the banks of the River Wandle and Beddington Park, Hackbridge provides residents with the best of both worlds, connectivity to central London and other key local employment hubs such as Sutton, Croydon and Wimbledon.  Residents of Hackbridge not only has one of the largest green spaces in the borough, Beddington Park, right on their doorstep, but they benefit from excellent transport links. Hackbridge railway station provides regular train services into London Victoria, Clapham Junction, London Blackfriars, Farringdon, Wimbledon, Sutton and further afield destinations such as St Albans and Luton. There are also several London bus routes serving Hackbridge and other destinations such as Tooting, Morden and Carshalton. The Shared Ownership scheme is a Part Buy, Part Rent way of owning your own home for a smaller up front payment. With Shared Ownership, you buy a share of your home using a mortgage from a bank or building society and pay a subsidised rent on the share you did not purchase. The combined mortgage and rent is usually less than you'd expect to pay if you bought a similar property outright. At New Mill Quarter  you can buy a minimum 50% share of your home (the maximum you can buy initially is 75%). When you're ready, you can buy more shares until you staircase to owning 100% of your home. These apartments will appeal to professionals working locally and those commuting into London. Incentives - *Rent Holiday - Terms and conditions apply.  No rent will be collected for the first 3-month period following the date of completion. Mortgage payments will be due on the purchased share, 3-month rent holiday applies to the unpurchased share. **Love2shop Voucher - Terms and conditions apply. Voucher will be provided to the customer on completion.  †Reservation fee - Terms and conditions apply. Offer only valid on selected plots, other plots are available.  ‡Legal fees - Terms and conditions apply. The legal cost contribution will only be made if a recommended solicitor's is used.  The purchase is subject to exchange of contracts up to 28 days after reservation. Please speak to a member of our Sales Team for more details. June 2021.

Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Mann SHARED OWNERSHIP A one bedroom apartment available to purchase from a 75% share at £238,125 with a deposit of £11,906.25. Full market value £317,500. Call today to arrange your appointment to discuss this stunning home! This one bedroom apartment situated on the popular development of New Mill Quarter comprises of  an open plan kitchen/lounge/ dining area. The apartment  has a three piece bathroom with shower over bath and spacious cupboards in the hallway. You also have access to an allocated parking space. INCENTIVES -  Contribution to your utility bills for the first year (max £1000) And  Your Legal fees paid (max £1000)* Plus one of these Help with your moving costs (max £500) or Housewarming voucher to spend (max £500) *legal fee incentive only available when using Sage’s preferred solicitor The purchase is subject to exchange of contracts up to 28 days after reservation. Please speak to a member of our Sales Team for more details. June 2021. Full Market Value: £317,500 75% Share £238,125 - Rent £181.90 pcm  Minimum 5% Mortgage Deposit (75% share): £11,906.25 Approximate Service Charges: £128.82 New Mill Quarter is an exciting new development, offering a collection of 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments, as well as luxury 4 bedroom homes, all set within landscaped gardens and finished to an impeccable standard. Ideal for commuters, the development is adjacent to Hackbridge railway station, connecting you to London in approximately 30 minutes, as well as a bus stop just outside the development giving great transport connections. With a high-quality specification by Barratt Homes London, these  homes are designed to appeal to families and professionals travelling into central London and the City. New Mill Quarter neighbours vibrant areas such as Croydon, Kingston and Wimbledon where you will find everything you need nearby including good schools within close proximity, and on-site amenities including the award winning Lidl supermarket. Hackbridge is a leafy suburb in the London Borough of Sutton, offering all the benefits of proximity to Central London yet close by to expansive parks. This combined with the distinctive town centres Hackbridge offers residents a peaceful but vibrant lifestyle. Nestled between the banks of the River Wandle and Beddington Park, Hackbridge provides residents with the best of both worlds, connectivity to central London and other key local employment hubs such as Sutton, Croydon and Wimbledon.  Residents of Hackbridge not only has one of the largest green spaces in the borough, Beddington Park, right on their doorstep, but they benefit from excellent transport links. Hackbridge railway station provides regular train services into London Victoria, Clapham Junction, London Blackfriars, Farringdon, Wimbledon, Sutton and further afield destinations such as St Albans and Luton. There are also several London bus routes serving Hackbridge and other destinations such as Tooting, Morden and Carshalton. The Shared Ownership scheme is a Part Buy, Part Rent way of owning your own home for a smaller up front payment. With Shared Ownership, you buy a share of your home using a mortgage from a bank or building society and pay a subsidised rent on the share you did not purchase. The combined mortgage and rent is usually less than you'd expect to pay if you bought a similar property outright. At New Mill Quarter  you can buy a minimum 50% share of your home (the maximum you can buy initially is 75%). When you're ready, you can buy more shares until you staircase to owning 100% of your home. These apartments will appeal to professionals working locally and those commuting into London.

long_description: A spacious and contemporary apartment set on the second floor of this modern purpose built block. Benefits include a large open-plan living room/kitchen/dining area, a balcony and allocated parking.  The area offers fantastic transport links including bus routes to Kingston, Sutton, Epsom and Morden. Worcester Park high street has a variety of shops, restaurants and coffee shops plus a mainline station offering fast and frequent services into Central London. Local education includes well-regarded primary and high schools plus grammar schools at Cheam and Sutton.  The accommodation is light and airy with modern fittings to the kitchen and bathroom, the bedroom is a good size plus the entrance hall has a large cupboard ideal for storage.  Externally, the property benefits from well-kept communal gardens, allocated resident’s parking and a secure, gated entrance. Brochures Web Details Particulars

bullet_points: 3 bedroom split level penthouse apartment;No onward chain;Allocated residents parking;1382sqft of spacious accommodation;Three double bedrooms;Ensuite Shower Room and Family Bathroom;Open plan Living;Central Wallington location, close to transport links, shops and amenities
long_description: THREE BEDROOM PENTHOUSE APARTMENT CLOSE TO WALLINGTON STATION - 1382sqft OF ACCOMMODATION OVER TWO FLOORS A chance to acquire this rarely available three bedroom split level penthouse apartment, in a sought after modern gated development. Situated in a prime central Wallington location close to all shops, amenities, bus links and  Wallington mainline train station with its easy access into Central London.  This spacious property offers 1382 sqft of accommodation over two levels, with three double bedrooms, two luxury bathrooms (one ensuite), and an open plan living dining and kitchen area, ideal for entertaining family and friends! There is also the benefit of an allocated residents parking space and no onward chain.   A viewing is recommended to appreciate the size and space of this fantastic property. Lease term - 125yrs from 1st January 2002 Lease remaining - 105yrs Accommodation  - Security phone entry system, glazed doors into communal hall. Stairs to 2nd floor. Front door into Entrance Hall Coved ceiling, electric radiator, fitted carpet, storage cupboard, cupboard housing electric boiler, security phone entry system. Bedroom One Coved ceiling, electric radiator, built-in wardrobe, fitted carpet, UPVC double glazed window to front aspect. Door to Ensuite Shower Room Corner shower cubicle with sliding doors, thermostatic shower, vanity wash hand basin with chrome mixer tap and storage below, enclosed WC with pushbutton flush control, mirrored wall unit, extractor fan, part tiled walls, laminate floor, heated chrome towel rail, UPVC double glazed obscure window to side aspect.  Bedroom Two Coved ceiling, electric radiator, fitted carpet, built-in wardrobe, UPVC double glazed window to rear aspect. Bedroom Three Coved ceiling, electric radiator, fitted carpet, UPVC double glazed window to front aspect. Bathroom Panel enclosed bath with chrome mixer tap and hand shower attachment, vanity wash hand basin with chrome mixer tap and storage below, enclosed WC with pushbutton flush control, shower cubicle with sliding door, thermostatic shower, extractor fan, mirrored wall unit, part tiled walls, laminate floor, UPVC double glazed obscure window to rear aspect.  Stairs to top floor Open plan Living Room, Dining Room and Kitchen Lounge Area Coved ceiling, two electric radiators, fitted carpet, UPVC double glazed window to front aspect, Velux window, built-in storage cupboard. Dining Area Coved ceiling, electric radiator, fitted carpet, UPVC double glazed windows to rear aspect, alternative front door (to communal hall).  Kitchen Laminate worksurface with drawers and cupboards below, matching wall units above, inset 1 1/2 bowl stainless steel sink with chrome mixer tap, integrated electric oven and hob with extractor fan above, integrated fridge freezer, integrated dishwasher and washing machine, breakfast bar, tiled splashback, tiled floor, Velux window, ceiling mounted extractor fan. Outside Gated complex with one allocated residents parking space, visitors bay parking, bike shed. Brochures Derby House, Melbourne Road, Wallington Brochure

bullet_points: Lease - 138 Years Remaining;Two Bedroom Ground Floor Flat;0.3 Miles To West Sutton Train Station;No Onward Chain;0.5 Miles To Sutton Train Station;Spacious Lounge-Dining Room;Garage En Bloc;Ideal For First Time Buyers & Investors;Double Glazed & Central Heating
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 138 years remaining The Property No Onward Chain. Two bedroom ground floor flat with spacious lounge-dining room, separate kitchen, 138 year lease remaining, garage and within 0.3 miles of West Sutton train station making this ideal for first time buyers, families and investors. There is a secure communal entrance into the building and the property is located on the ground floor. The property has an entrance hallway with storage cupboard space at the far end. The spacious lounge-dining room has space for seating and a table & chairs, there is a separate kitchen with cupboard space to three sides, space & plumbing for a gas cooker, fridge-freezer and washing machine. There are two bedrooms with second bedroom benefiting from built in wardrobes to one side and the family bathroom has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin and radiator. Outside - The property has a garage with up & over door which can be used for additional storage space. There are well maintained communal gardens surrounding the property for residents use only. Lease - 138 years remaining. Location The property is located 0.3 miles from West Sutton train station which has links into London Blackfriars, London Bridge & Wimbledon. Sutton train station is 0.5 miles away and also has links into London Victoria, Epsom & West Croydon. For primary schools, Robin Hood Infants' School is 0.1 miles away, Sutton High School GDST is 0.2 miles away and Robin Hood Junior School is within 0.3 miles. For secondary schools, Sutton High School GDST is 0.2 miles away, Sutton Grammar School is 0.5 miles away and both Cheam High School & Overton Grange School are within 0.8 miles. Sutton town center is a short walk away and offers a great range of shops, restaurants and local amenities for all ages. The flat has a spacious entrance hallway leading through to the open plan kitchen-living room area which has a large balcony with space for seating overlooking the surrounding area. The kitchen has cupboard space to two sides with integrated electric hob,  washing machine, fan oven, fridge-freezer and dishwasher. There is plenty of space for sofas and a dining table & chairs making it a great space for entertaining. There are two double bedrooms with the master bedroom benefiting from an en-suite shower room with walk-in shower unit, w/c, hand basin with storage below and heated towel rail and the second double bedrooms benefits from a built in wardrobe to one side. There is a well maintained large communal garden for residents use only. Lease - 121 years remaining. Location The property is located 0.9 miles from Wallington & Waddon train stations which have links into London Bridge, London Victoria, Sutton & West Croydon. There is easy access to Wallington town center which offers a great range of shops, restaurants and local amenities for all ages. long_description: Laurels are delighted to bring to the market this stunning, one-bedroom apartment in a highly sought-after area in Sutton. This property is located less than a five-minute walk to Sutton Station (Zone 5 – Southern and Thameslink trains to London Bridge) and local bus routes.  As you enter the property you are greeted by high ceilings throughout and a large bright hallway featuring two storage cupboards. This leads to a considerably sized open plan kitchen/living area which truly is the heart of the home, perfect for entertaining. The modern kitchen comes with integrated appliances and stylish finish. The superb double bedroom offers built in wardrobe space as well an abundance of light. The family bathroom includes both a spacious shower, as well as bath suite.  Further benefits of this property include the close proximity to transport links, a number of outstanding local schools as well as a plethora of amenities such as cafes, shops and restaurants. The property also offers one allocated parking space in a secure underground car park and is just a short walk away from the beautiful open space of Manor Park.  The local authority is Sutton London Borough Council, with a council tax band of C. Early viewings are highly recommended, and viewings can be accommodated seven days a week including bank holidays! Brochures Full Details

long_description: Superbly located just a short walk from the centre of Wallington, this well presented two bedroom ground floor flat offers bright and spacious, well-planned accommodation with stylish interiors and neutral décor throughout. Accommodation comprises entrance hall leading into the bright and spacious reception room with ample space for relaxing and dining, and direct access out onto a delightful private balcony. The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and metro-tiled splash-back, incorporating an inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are two well-sized bedrooms with plenty of space for free-standing furniture, plus a stylish family bathroom with a white three piece suite and elegant tiling. The property is conveniently located within a short distance of Wallington station as well as regular bus routes providing useful links into both Sutton and Croydon. There are a variety of local amenities nearby, with Sutton and Croydon each offering a larger variety of shops, bars, and restaurants. Purley Way is also close-by for branded shopping, supermarkets, a cinema complex and further leisure facilities, and the area is also well served by good schools and open spaces including beautiful nearby Beddington Park. long_description: The Property Four bedroom end of terrace family house with kitchen-dining room, separate reception room, large private garden to the rear & side, within 0.3 miles from St. Helier Train Station and close to great primary & secondary schools making this a great family home. The property has an entrance hallway leading through to the kitchen-dining room which has cupboard space to two sides, integrated gas hob, fan oven, space and plumbing for a fridge-freezer and washing machine. There is space for a dining table & chairs and door leading out to the rear garden. There is a separate reception room with wooden flooring running throughout, feature fireplace to one side and double doors to the garden. The family bathroom has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin and towel rail. To the first floor, there are four bedrooms with two of them benefiting from built in wardrobes to one side.  Outside - To the front there is a gated front garden area with lawn and shrubs. The rear garden is a fantastic space as it is to the rear and side of the property mostly laid to lawn with a patio area for seating. Location The property is located 0.3 miles from St. Helier Train Station with links into London Blackfriars, London Bridge and Wimbledon. There are bus links into Morden for tube links (Northern Line). For primary schools, Abbey Primary School is 0.1 miles away and both Malmesbury Primary School & Morden Primary School are within 0.6 miles. For secondary schools, Glenthorne High School is 0.3 miles away and both Greenshaw High School & Harris Academy Morden are within 0.9 miles. Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. bullet_points: No Onward Chain;Two Double Bedroom Flat;0.2 Miles To Wallington Train Station;Ideal For First Time Buyers & Young Families;Modern Fitted Kitchen;Spacious Lounge-Dining Room;Residents Parking;Double Glazed & Central Heating
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 210 years remaining The Property No Onward Chain. Two bedroom flat with spacious lounge-dining room, separate modern kitchen & bathroom, residents parking and within 0.2 miles to Wallington train station making this an ideal property for first time buyers and investors. There is a secure communal entrance with stairs leading up to the property. The flat has an entrance hallway area with storage space to one side. There is modern fitted kitchen with cupboard space to two sides, integrated gas hob, electric fan oven, fridge-freezer and space for a washing machine. There is a spacious lounge-dining room with windows to two sides, there are two double bedrooms and the bathroom has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin with storage below and heated towel rail. Outside - There are communal gardens surrounding the property and there is off street parking for residents use only. Lease - 210 years remaining. Location The property is located 0.2 miles from Wallington train station which has links into London Victoria, London Bridge, Sutton, Epsom & West Croydon. There are also regular bus links into Sutton, Croydon and Morden. For primary schools, Bandon Hill Primary School is 0.5 miles away and both Foresters Primary School & Stanley Park Junior School are within 0.6 miles. For secondary schools, Wallington High School for Girls is 0.5 miles away and both Wilson's School & Wallington County Grammar School are within 0.9 miles. Wallington high street offers a fantastic range of shops, restaurants and local amenities for all ages. long_description: A 2 double bedroom maisonette featuring a garage, parking and an impressive garden (measuring 35'7 x 31'1). Located well for transport and shops. A viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the accommodation on offer. As you enter this property from the ground floor, stairs will take you up to the 1st floor landing which has storage cupboard and laminate flooring. A huge advantage to this property is the sizable loft space which is accessed from the landing.     The main reception room measures 13'9 x 12'8 and has a large rear aspect window that allows in plenty of natural light during day light hours and has laminate flooring.   The kitchen measures 9' x 7'7’, has space for a gas cooker, and there is plumbing for washing machine and dishwasher along with an additional storage cupboards.   There are 2 double bedrooms, the largest of which measures 15'1 x 10'8.  The family bathroom has a white hand basin, low level WC , panel bath, tiled floor and part tiled walls.    To the rear of the property is a garden which is approached via side pedestrian access. The garden measures 35'7 x 31'1 and has a single garage and parking space.    If you’re looking for a maisonette that you can make your own with a garden and parking, then we would recommend a viewing in person to fully appreciate the accommodation on offer.     LOCATION      This property is located inbetween St Dunstans Hill & Gander Green Lane. There are local shops on the A217 and West Sutton Station which is served by Thameslink Trains which is on the Sutton Loop in Travel Card Zone 5. There are local bus route to Sutton Town Centre, Carshalton and Cheam Village.  This area is well known for its local schools for all ages and if you are looking for High Street shopping then Sutton Town Centre offers many diverse shops, restuarants along with the St Nicholas Shopping Centre. LEASEHOLD DISCLAIMER   As this is a leasehold property you are likely to be responsible for management charges and ground rent. You may also incur fees for items such as leasehold packs and in addition you will also need to check the remaining length of the lease. You must therefore consult with your legal representatives on these matters at the earliest opportunity before making a decision to purchase”. long_description: Relax and retire in style. Brio Button House is our latest age-exclusive assisted living retirement community in the pretty South London suburb of Hackbridge. Button House features 80 stylish 1- and 2-Bedroom apartments over four floors, with a range of exciting facilities right on your doorstep, including a fitness studio, our exclusive Slate & Grain brasserie, bar and coffee lounge, a community hub and much more! Life at Brio Button House offers the very best of both worlds. Open green space is just a few minutes’ walk away at Beddington Park where the River Wandle runs, giving the impression of being in the rolling countryside, and the hustle bustle of central London just a 23-minute train journey away.  Fees Concierge fees - From £510 - £600pm, includes communal facilities, buildings insurance, upkeep / maintenance of communal areas and facilities, structure of the buildings, team on site 24/7 to help and assist you, Wifi in communal areas, and use of communal facilities Deferred Management fee of 0% if occupied for less than one year to a maximum of 15% if occupied for over five years of the selling price when sold. About 30% of this goes into a sinking fund for the development. Open weekends will start 28th May until 19th June.  Please see added brochure for details. This deceptively spacious, three bedroom semi-detached family house is beautifully presented throughout.  There are three good size reception rooms, a lovely modern kitchen, stunning bathroom and separate shower room. Other features include double glazed windows, gas central heating, off road parking & an enclosed secluded 45ft rear garden. This deceptively spacious, three double bedroom,  semi-detached family house situated along a popular road is beautifully presented throughout.   The property has been professionally extended in recent years and now briefly comprises a lovely bay fronted reception room, a good size rear reception room that was formally used as the dining room but now is used for family entertaining. There's a lovely modern fitted kitchen that opens into a fabulous conservatory that opens and overlooks the rear garden. There's a stunning downstairs bathroom and a luxurious first floor shower room.  Other features include a brick paved driveway providing off road parking, there’s a shared driveway with side access leading to a 45ft secluded rear garden.

There is an entrance hall with CLOAKROOM, a spacious 20'4 x 17'5 living/dining room adjoining a modern fitted kitchen. bullet_points: One bedroom first floor apartment;Good decorative order throughout;Conveniently located for the stairs and lift;Fully Fitted Kitchen with Integrated Appliances;Lodge manager available 5 days a week;Owners' Lounge & Kitchen with regular social events;24 hour Careline system for safety and security;Guest Suite for visitors & use of over 100 guest suites in Churchill Retirement lodges across the country;Owners' private car park;Great location close to the town centre & excellent transport links
long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Stratton & King Ltd Stratton and King are delighted to be marketing this lovely one bedroom first floor apartment which offers deceptively spacious accommodation throughout. The apartment is conveniently located for both the stairs and lift. The Lounge offers ample space for living and dining room furniture and has a feature electric fireplace with attractive surround. The Kitchen, which is accessed via the Lounge, offers a range of eye and base level units with working surfaces over and tiled splashbacks. There is a built in waist height oven, 4 ring electric hob with extractor hood over, a fridge and a freezer. A window lets in light and ventilation. The Bedroom is a generous double room with plenty of space for additional bedroom furniture if required. The Shower Room offers a large shower cubicle with handrail, heated towel rail, a WC and wash hand basin with vanity unit beneath. Perfectly complementing this wonderful apartment is a useful storage cupboard located in the hallway.  Bramble Lodge is a stylish development of 42 one and two bedroom retirement apartments in Wallington, a London Borough of Sutton. The Freedom Pass really comes into its own in the area with free travel on almost all public transport in London allowing you to take full advantage of the many shopping, theatre and leisure attractions. Wallington town centre offers a wealth of High Street stores, coffee shops and restaurants as well as a weekend farmers market for fresh local produce. Transport links are excellent with frequent bus services from right outside the Lodge, to direct trains into London Bridge and Victoria stations.  The Lodge manager is on hand throughout the day to support the Owners and keep the development in perfect shape as well as arranging many regular events in the Owners’ Lounge from coffee mornings to games afternoons.  A Guest Suite is available for visitors & use of over 150 guest suites in Retirement lodges across the country. Prices are available on request from the Lodge Manager.  Bramble Lodge has been designed with safety and security at the forefront, The Apartment has an emergency Careline system installed, monitored by the onsite Lodge Manager during the day and 24 hours, 365 days a year by the Careline team. Careline integrated intruder alarm, secure video entry system and sophisticated fire and smoke detection systems throughout both the apartment and communal areas provide unrivalled peace of mind. Bramble Lodge has a fully equipped laundry room and a private owners’ car park.   Bramble Lodge is managed by the award winning Millstream Management Services, working closely with Churchill Retirement Living and Stratton & King to maintain the highest standards of maintenance and service for every lodge and owner.   Bramble Lodge requires at least one apartment resident to be over the age of 60 with any second resident over the age of 55.    Additional Information Service charge (Year Ending 31st May 2022): £2,101.81 per annum.  Ground Rent:  £588.65 per annum.  Council Tax: Band C 125 year lease commencing 2011  Please check regarding Pets with Millstream Management Services Limited Service charges include: Careline system, buildings insurance, water and sewerage rates, communal cleaning, utilities and maintenance, garden maintenance, lift maintenance, lodge manager and a contribution to the contingency fund.  A 1% contribution of the final selling price to the contingency fund is payable by the Seller upon completion of the sale of the property.   DESCRIPTION Measurements are approximate and some may be maximum on irregular walls.   CONSENTS We have not had sight of any relevant building regulations, guarantees or planning consents all relevant documentation pertaining to this property should be checked with your legal advisor before exchanging contracts.   Property Particulars Disclaimer: These particulars are intended only as general guidance. The Company therefore gives notice that none of the material issued or visual depictions of any kind made on behalf of the Company can be relied upon as accurately describing any of the Specified Matters prescribed by any Order made under the Consumer Protection from Unfair Trading Regulations, 2008. Nor do they constitute a contract, part of a contract or a warranty. Brochures Full Details

long_description: This well-presented, three bedroom family home is ideally situated within the ever popular Park Farm area of Cheam, providing easy access into Cheam Village with its range of  shops, restaurants and amenities including Cheam mainline rail station and the sought after Nonsuch High School for Girls. Several other well-regarded schools are close by, including Cheam Park Farm Infants and Cheam High School.  The accommodation on the ground floor consists of a front aspect living room, an open-plan kitchen/dining room, utility room, study area and shower room/WC. Upstairs, there are three well-proportioned double bedrooms and the family bathroom.  Externally, you will find a well-kept mature rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn with an area of patio whilst to the front of the property, a driveway provides ample off street parking and gives access to the detached garage. What three words Location: sends.barks.reader Wallington is a town in the London Borough of Sutton, in South London, England. It is 9.7 miles (15.6 km) south south-west of Charing Cross. Before the Municipal Borough of Beddington and Wallington merged into the London Borough of Sutton in Greater London in 1965, it was part of the county of Surrey. Wallington is a post town in the SM postcode area. Buyer’s Premium: Applies on the fall of the hammer. The purchaser shall pay a 10% deposit. Plus, In addition a buyer’s premium of 2% of the sale price, Subject to a minimum of £5000 + VAT upon the exchange of contract. bullet_points: Spacious retirement apartment;No onward chain;First floor, Lift serviced;Excellent internal order;Central Sutton location;Residents lounge and amenities;On-site house manager;Brilliantly located for amenities & transport;Updated heaters and communal parking
long_description: Located in one of Sutton's most convenient and sought after retirement developments, this first floor apartment is in excellent condition and is perfect to living in or has potential for a buy to let. The block is quiet, yet on the doorstep of a huge amount of local shops, medical center's, recreational clubs, theaters and excellent transport links getting you into the city in around half an hour.  The seller says "I enjoy a safe and secure space with no worries. I can enjoy in-house activities and making friends with residents - and family can visit, with easy parking. Everything I need is close at hand." Inside the property there has been some significant upgrades, such as new heaters that are individually controlled and new spotlights. The west facing lounge is slightly larger than some others in the block and also light and airy. As you are in the center of town - the space is perfect for you to people-watch, relax, and even have a few friends over.   Adjacent to the lounge, there is a modern kitchen meaning one less thing to refurbish and worry about.  When it’s time to catch up on some sleep, there is a generous double bedroom, which even has integrated wardrobe space. Finishing off the internal accommodation is a lovely shower room serving the apartment and plenty of storage, rare for an apartment in this price range.  Outside, well-kept, communal grounds wrap around the block and provide a place for you to relax in. Inside the building, for the residents, there is also a communal lounge for socialising and regular events, friendly house manager, efficient laundry room and residents/visitors parking. In our opinion, this apartment truly represents the best value property currently available to buy in Forest Dene. First Floor  -  Hallway  -  Living Room  - 5.38m x 3.23m (17'8 x 10'7) -  Kitchen  - 2.18m x 1.63m (7'2 x 5'4) -  Bedroom  - 4.32m x 2.64m (14'2 x 8'8) -  Shower Room  - 2.03m x 1.60m (6'8 x 5'3) -  Outside  -  Communal Grounds  -  Communal/Visitor Parking  -  Other Benefits  -  Residents Lounge  -  Laundry Room  -  Brochures Cedar Road, Sutton Brochure

bullet_points: 1 Bedroom conversion apartment;No onward chain;Share of Freehold;In need of some updating;Top floor with fantastic views;Modern bathroom;Updated central heating system;Central Sutton location;Generously proportioned;Close to fantastic transport & amenities
long_description: NO ONWARD CHAIN! Offering more than the average one bedroom property, this top (2nd) floor converted apartment is not only generously proportioned but also offers the potential to update to the new owners taste. The great news is that lots of the hard work has already been done, with a recently refitted bathroom and modern central heating system, with the property also benefitted from being double glazed, so you can get down to B&Q and grab those tins of paint at the ready before moving in! So what about inside the property? Having a generous lounge/diner, there is ample space to not just relax in and catch up on your favorite box set in front of the TV, but there is also space for you to entertain, with enough room for a dining table that will allow you to throw one of your famous dinner parties!  As we've already mentioned, the bathroom is modern and in great condition, the bedroom is a true double size and the kitchen has a fabulous amount of workspace to cook up a storm in - and you'll be doing so with fantastic elevated views across Sutton! Location wise, you aren't just incredibly well located next to fantastic local amenities at hand on the High Street but also have a smaller convenience stores on your doorstep, such as a Tesco's Express only a short walk away, with a bus route almost on your doorstep. Need a train? Sutton & Carshalton/Beeches Stations are also close by, proving great links into the City. So what are you waiting for? Also boasting a Share in the Freehold, don't delay and miss out on this little gem! Top (2nd) Floor  -  Hallway  -  Living Room  - 4.57m x 3.94m (15' x 12'11) -  Kitchen  - 2.97m x 1.78m (9'9 x 5'10) -  Bedroom  - 3.28m x 3.10m (10'9 x 10'2) -  Bathroom  - 2.18m x 2.06m (7'2 x 6'9) -  Brochures Thicket Road, Sutton Brochure

bullet_points: *CASH BUYERS ONLY*;Well Presented First Floor Flat;Open Plan Living Space;Modern Kitchen with Integral Appliances;Double Bedroom with Built-In Storage;Modern Bathroom with Shower Over Bath;Spacious & Private Balcony;Pleasant Communal Gardens;Close to Amenities & Transport Links;5 Minutes to Wallington Station
long_description: INTERNAL: Entrance Hall - The entrance door opens to the hall, with doors to the lounge/kitchen, the bedroom and the bathroom. Lounge/Kitchen - Open plan living space with ample space for furniture for both living and dining, a modern fitted kitchen, wood laminate flooring, a double glazed window and set of doors opening to the balcony. The kitchen is fitted with a range of modern grey wall and base units with marble effect worktops, stylish splashbacks and plinth lighting. Inset sink basin with a drainer and mixer tap and an integrated fridge-freezer, dishwasher and electric oven with a countertop gas hob and overhead extractor hood. Bedroom - Double size room with a double glazed window, a built-in wardrobe with double doors, a further storage space, space for freestanding furniture and carpeted flooring. Bathroom - Modern suite comprising a wall-fitted WC, a vanity unit fitted wash hand basin with a mirror over, and an integrated bath with an overhead shower with both a glass screen and curtain rail. Tiled walls and flooring, a chrome heated towel rail and an extractor fan. EXTERNAL: The property has its own private balcony laid with decking and raised plant beds with generous space for outdoor furniture and elevated views. The development has a large communal garden with both lawned and patio areas with plenty of seating space. The property is conveniently located near to local shops, amenities and transport links, with Wallington Station only a five minutes wall with services to London Bridge, London Victoria, Guilford, West Croydon and Dorking. Early viewing is highly recommended due to the property being realistically priced. bullet_points: For Persons aged 55+;Assisted Living Lifestyle Development;First Floor Apartment;24/7 Carers Available On Site;Modern Wet Room;One Double Bedroom;Restaurant On Site;Additional Support Packages Available
long_description: Retirement Apartment for Persons over 55 This one bedroom, first floor apartment has been redecorated throughout and consists of a large reception with bay window, large modern kitchen with fully fitted appliances, large double bedroom with Jack & Jill wet room. The property benefits from under floor heating and there are no additional heating or water costs. Belsize Court is an impressive development, built and completed in 2008 and made up of 63 one and two bedroom apartments set over 3 floors with two lifts accessing each floor. Belsize Court also boasts an incredible list of development facilities, which include; a restaurant, Owner`s Lounge, outdoor seating / garden, Hair and Beauty salon, Treatment Room, buggy store, a guest suite for friends and relatives, and a welcoming reception area that is staffed daily. For added peace of mind, the development is staffed 24/7  should any residents have concerns after reception hours. There are a number of weekly events and social activities, which include coffee mornings, various card games and even film nights. For those looking for additional care or simply thinking ahead, there are care and support packages available from Housing 21. These services range, depending on personal needs, from basis housekeeping to personal care service. Please ask a member of Rice & Roman staff for additional information. The development is also dementia friendly and is an ideal for persons wanting an independent life but having the security of the staff on site 24/7 50% SHARED OWNERSHIP  (additional 25% can be purchased reducing the annual charge by £3,000 per annum) SERVICE CHARGE: £6,993.84 PA 50% RENT CHARGE: £3.182.88 PA LEASE LENGTH: 111 Years Remaining what3words ///   circle.minus.twigs Notice Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. long_description: SUMMARY ***IDEAL FOR COMMUTERS*** A rarely available two DOUBLE bedroom SPACIOUS FIRST floor maisonette with access into its own private garden. The property is positioned a stone's throw away from Mitcham Junction. A must VIEW! This property is for sale by iamsold Ltd. DESCRIPTION ***MASSIVE TWO DOUBLE BEDROOM SPLIT LEVEL MAISONETTE*** A rarely available two DOUBLE bedroom SPACIOUS first floor maisonette with access into its own private garden. The property is positioned a stone's throw away from Mitcham Junction station. The property has a traditional layout and comprises SPACIOUS Reception room, fully fitted kitchen, two DOUBLE bedrooms, FAMILY bathroom and private rear GARDEN.  Percy Road sits on the boarders of Mitcham and Wallington close to reputable schools and fantastic transportation links.  Early inspection is required.  VIEWINGS are HIGHLY recommended! This property is for sale by iamsold Ltd. Auctioneer's Comments   This property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited.  This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.  The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 inc VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack. The estate agent and auctioneer may recommend the services of other providers to you, in which they will be paid for the referral. These services are optional, and you will be advised of any payment, in writing before any services are accepted. Listing is subject to a start price and undisclosed reserve price that can change. We currently hold lease details as displayed above, should you require further information please contact the branch. Marlborough Court consists of 35 one & 21 two-bedroom flats arranged over 4 floors with a minimum age restriction of 60 years old. There is a lift service to all floors, a development manager on site & the lease has approximately 102 years remaining. This lovely flat is ready to move straight into, has spacious rooms and a nice kitchen for those wishing to have their own independence. Brochures Particulars

long_description: Exclusive to Andrews a 1st floor one-bedroom retirement apartment which is a specialist Retirement/sheltered housing development of 39 flats, built in 1989 for the over 60s.Living room, with a kitchen with views onto the communal gardens, shower room with electric shower and a double bedroom with built in wardrobes. Exclusive to Andrews a 1st floor one-bedroom retirement apartment which is a specialist Retirement/sheltered housing development of 39 flats, built in 1989 for the over 60s.Living room, with a kitchen with views onto the communal gardens, shower room with electric shower and a double bedroom with built in wardrobes. These properties also benefit from a resident’s lounge, visitors room, communal kitchen for visitors, lifts to all floors, security entry phone as well as an emergency alert pulley cord systems so attention can be sought should a resident need assistance. Plus the added benefit of communal parking, guest suite, residential manager and security phone system. LOCATION  Located just off the London Road, North Cheam High Street offers many different shops and restaurants with most tastes in food being catered for plus the Sainsbury Super store is located with 0.5 miles and you’re only 0.02 miles from the famous Nonsuch Park if you fancy a stroll.  From North Cheam you can catch the 93 bus which will take you directly to Morden Underground station which is on the Northern Line and then onto Wimbledon and Putney High Streets and the bus stops directly outside East Putney Station. LEASEHOLD DISCLAIMER  As this is a leasehold property you are likely to be responsible for management charges and ground rent. long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 100 years remaining The Property A superb one bedroom retirement apartment situated in the heart of Sutton Town Centre.  This lovely home is offered with no ongoing chain and has many features to boast including a new fitted kitchen, modern bathroom suite, double glazing and electric heating.  Other features include use of a residents lounge, laundry room, and guest suite. The development also benefits from a private residents  communal garden. The property is ideally located in Sutton close to the High Street and its array of transport links and  facilities. Location Located on the Surrey and London boarders in the heart of a vibrant town centre you will find this charming flat in the middle of Sutton, you couldn't get closer to bars, restaurants, cafes and shops that the Sutton area has to offer.  For those fitness fanatics, there are a number of gyms close by, there are also some great walks and trails to explore which offers some lovely dog walking opportunities.  Sutton Station is only a short distance away - which is in Zone 5. It is ideal for travel being only a short commute to hotspots such as Clapham (21 mins) and Wimbledon (17 mins) whilst also having direct train lines to London Bridge, London Victoria, Blackfriars and St Pancras - the former two being sub 30 minutes.  There are excellent road links to the A217, A3, M23 and M25. Gatwick airport can be easily accessed within 30 minutes, Heathrow only an hour away and the seaside resort of Brighton can also be reached within the hour. Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. bullet_points: One bedroom second floor apartment;Situated at the rear of the development;Conveniently located for the lift;No forward chain;Fully Fitted Kitchen with Integrated Appliances;Lodge manager available 5 days a week;Owners' Lounge & Kitchen with regular social events;24 hour Careline system for safety and security;Guest Suite for visitors & use of over 100 guest suites in Churchill Retirement lodges across the country;Owners' private car park
long_description: Stratton and King are delighted to be marketing this wonderful one bedroom second floor apartment which is situated in a peaceful position, at the rear of the development. Ideally located for the lift, the property offers deceptively spacious accommodation and no forward chain. The Lounge is a lovely room with ample space for living and dining room furniture and a feature electric fireplace with attractive surround. A door leads through to the Kitchen and offers a range of eye and base level units with working surfaces over and tiled splashbacks. There is a built in waist height oven, 4 ring electric hob with extractor hood over, a fridge and a freezer. A window provides a pleasant outlook and ventilation. The Bedroom is a spacious room which has a useful built in mirror fronted wardrobe and offers space for additional bedroom furniture if required. The Shower Room has a curved glass shower cubicle, a WC and a wash hand basin with vanity unit beneath. Perfectly complementing this wonderful apartment is a useful storage cupboard situated in the hallway.  Bramble Lodge is a stylish development of 42 one and two bedroom retirement apartments in Wallington, a London Borough of Sutton. The Freedom Pass really comes into its own in the area with free travel on almost all public transport in London allowing you to take full advantage of the many shopping, theatre and leisure attractions. Wallington town centre offers a wealth of High Street stores, coffee shops and restaurants as well as a weekend farmers market for fresh local produce. Transport links are excellent with frequent bus services from right outside the Lodge, to direct trains into London Bridge and Victoria stations.  The Lodge manager is on hand throughout the day to support the Owners and keep the development in perfect shape as well as arranging many regular events in the Owners’ Lounge from coffee mornings to games afternoons.  A Guest Suite is available for visitors & use of over 150 guest suites in Retirement lodges across the country. Prices are available on request from the Lodge Manager.  Bramble Lodge has been designed with safety and security at the forefront, The Apartment has an emergency Careline system installed, monitored by the onsite Lodge Manager during the day and 24 hours, 365 days a year by the Careline team. Careline integrated intruder alarm, secure video entry system and sophisticated fire and smoke detection systems throughout both the apartment and communal areas provide unrivalled peace of mind. Bramble Lodge has a fully equipped laundry room and a private owners’ car park.   Bramble Lodge is managed by the award winning Millstream Management Services, working closely with Churchill Retirement Living and Stratton & King to maintain the highest standards of maintenance and service for every lodge and owner.   Bramble Lodge requires at least one apartment resident to be over the age of 60 with any second resident over the age of 55.    Additional Information Service charge (Year Ending 31st May 2022): £2,101.81 per annum. Ground Rent:  £588.65 per annum.  Council Tax: Band C 125 year lease commencing 2011  Please check regarding Pets with Millstream Management Services Limited Service charges include: Careline system, buildings insurance, water and sewerage rates, communal cleaning, utilities and maintenance, garden maintenance, lift maintenance, lodge manager and a contribution to the contingency fund.  A 1% contribution of the final selling price to the contingency fund is payable by the Seller upon completion of the sale of the property.   DESCRIPTION Measurements are approximate and some may be maximum on irregular walls.   CONSENTS We have not had sight of any relevant building regulations, guarantees or planning consents all relevant documentation pertaining to this property should be checked with your legal advisor before exchanging contracts.   Property Particulars Disclaimer: These particulars are intended only as general guidance. The Company therefore gives notice that none of the material issued or visual depictions of any kind made on behalf of the Company can be relied upon as accurately describing any of the Specified Matters prescribed by any Order made under the Consumer Protection from Unfair Trading Regulations, 2008. Nor do they constitute a contract, part of a contract or a warranty. Brochures Full Details

This "no onward chain" property also boasts a lift, residents lounge and conservatory along with well maintained communal gardens and residents parking. If your current property is too much to handle and you are looking to downsize - but without feeling you are compromising on size and location - then this appealing flat could be ideal. Fitted kitchen, downstairs cloakroom which also comprises a shower. To the first floor is three double bedrooms, a family bathroom with new flooring recently fitted and an large airing cupboard on the landing area. Further benefits include an established secluded rear garden, front garden with quality artificial turf and block paved driveway allowing off street parking for several cars. The property is conveniently located within walking distance to local amenities, many transport links and well regarded schools. long_description: A recently decorated 1st floor bedroom retirement apartment which is a specialist Retirement/sheltered housing development of 39 flats, built in 1989 for the over 60s. Comprising; living room, kitchen with views onto the communal gardens, shower room with electric shower and a double bedroom with built in wardrobes. This is a 1st floor, recently decorated, 1 bedroom retirement apartment set in a specialist retirement/sheltered housing development of 39 flats, built in 1989 for the over 60s.  Comprising; living room, kitchen with views onto the communal gardens, shower room with electric shower and a double bedroom with built in wardrobes.  These properties also benefit from a resident’s lounge, visitors room, communal kitchen for visitors, lifts to all floors, security entry phone as well as an emergency alert pulley cord systems so attention can be sought should a resident need assistance.    As a resident you will also be able to enjoy socialising with the other residents in the communal lounge and venture into the well-stocked communal grounds. The property also has the added benefit of communal parking, guest suite, residential manager and security phone system.   LOCATION    Located just off the London Road, North Cheam High Street offers many different shops and restaurants with most tastes in food being catered for plus the Sainsbury Super store is located with 0.5 miles and you’re only 0.02 miles from the famous Nonsuch Park if you fancy a stroll.   From North Cheam you can catch the 93 bus which will take you directly to Morden Underground station which is on the Northern Line and then onto Wimbledon and Putney High Streets and the bus stops directly outside East Putney Station.   LEASEHOLD DISCLAIMER   As this is a leasehold property you are likely to be responsible for management charges and ground rent. You may also incur fees for items such as leasehold packs and in addition you will also need to check the remaining length of the lease. You must therefore consult with your legal representative. bullet_points: Sale by Modern Auction (T&Cs apply);Subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price;Buyers fees apply;Open Plan Living Room;Large Bedroom ;Close To Sutton Town Centre;Built In Storage
long_description: SUMMARY *CASH BUYERS ONLY* The accommodation comprises of a spacious and modern lounge dining area, a fully fitted kitchen with eye and base level units, also integrated appliances. This property also comes with a private garage and off street parking at the rear! DESCRIPTION A well-presented one bedroom apartment on the second floor. Well located, being a short walk from Sutton town centre, Sutton mainline station and transport links. The accommodation comprises of a spacious and modern lounge dining area, a fully fitted kitchen with eye and base level units, also integrated appliances. Walking into the hallway you have a well sized master bedroom with built in storage, a family bathroom and further storage cupboards.This property also comes with a private garage and off street parking at the rear. Auctioneer's Comments   This property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited.  This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.  The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 inc VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack. The estate agent and auctioneer may recommend the services of other providers to you, in which they will be paid for the referral. These services are optional, and you will be advised of any payment, in writing before any services are accepted. Listing is subject to a start price and undisclosed reserve price that can change. bullet_points: ONE BEDROOM APARTMENT;Modern Kitchen;Great Location ;Modern Bathroom ;Bright And Spacious;Ideal First Time Purchase Or Rental Investment ;10 Min Walk To Sutton Train Station ;Beautiful Communal Gardens ;RESIDENTS PARKING;** CASH BUYER ONLY**
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 75 years remaining The Property  A very unique, bright and airy one bedroom apartment situated on a popular residential road.  This property would be an ideal first time purchase, rental investment.  Upon entering the flat through the front door you are greeted with a spacious hallway with plenty of space for storage ideal for shoes and coats. Off the hallway you will the great size double room and a modern bathroom. At the end of the hallway is the large open plan reception / kitchen which has huge  windows allowing for lots of light in this room. The modern kitchen itself has all of the mod-cons one would come to expect and will help a budding chef cook a culinary masterpiece. This flat utilises its space incredibly well and being in a super location this property not to be missed and early viewing is recommended. Location Located on the Surrey and London boarders, within walking distance to a vibrant town centre, you will find this charming flat nestled in between Sutton and Cheam. You couldn't get closer to the bars, restaurants, cafes and shops both areas have to offer.  The area boasts some outstanding schools, both in the state and private sectors. For those fitness fanatics, there are a number of gyms close by, and some great walks and trails to explore which offer some lovely dog walking opportunities.  Cheam and Sutton Stations are a short distance away, the later being in Zone 5 and ideal for travel into central London. It is only a short commute to hotspots such as Clapham (21 mins) and Wimbledon (17 mins) whilst also having frequent direct train lines to London Bridge, London Victoria, Blackfriars and St Pancras, the former two being sub 30 minutes.  There are excellent road links to the A217, A3, M23 and M25. Gatwick airport can be easily accessed within 30 minutes, Heathrow only an hour away and the seaside resort of Brighton can also be reached within the hour. Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

long_description: ** JUST ONE APARTMENT REMAINING – A ONE BEDROOM WITH BALCONY: £365,000 ** This superb new build apartment is set within a development of just fifteen properties and has been thoughtfully designed in a contemporary style with high quality specifications.  The apartment is sold with a share of freehold and the Government's Help to Buy scheme is available, meaning the government could lend buyers up to 40% of the cost of a newly built home.  Apartment 7 is set on the first floor and is reached via the lift or staircase from the communal ground floor hallway.  The accommodation consists of a private entrance hall, spacious living/dining room with high spec. open plan kitchen, one good sized bedroom, luxury bathroom and a large terrace accessed from both the living room and bedroom.   Timber Court is situated in the heart of Cheam Village, just a stone’s throw from the wide open spaces of Cheam and Nonsuch Parks.  This prime location, close to a comprehensive village centre, mainline train station and excellent local schooling, including Nonsuch High School, will ensure the development retains an exclusive edge over larger schemes in the future. Comprising; living room, kitchen with dual aspect windows, shower room with electric shower and 2 double bedrooms with built in wardrobes. This first floor, 2 bedroom retirement apartment set in a specialist retirement/sheltered housing development of 39 flats, built in 1989 for the over 60s.  Comprising of a living room with front aspect bayt window. There is kitchen with bult in electrical appliances and a shower room with grab rails with an electric shower and 2 double bedrooms with built in wardrobes.  These properties also benefit from a resident’s lounge, visitors over night room, communal kitchen for visitors, lifts to all floors, security entry phone as well as an emergency alert pulley cord systems so attention can be sought should a resident need assistance.   As a resident you will also be able to enjoy socialising with the other residents in the communal lounge and venture into the well-stocked communal grounds. The property also has the added benefit of a a residential manager and security phone system. To the rear of communal garden is the visitors parking. LOCATION  Located just off the London Road, North Cheam High Street offers many different shops and restaurants with most tastes in food being catered for plus the Sainsbury Super store and Nirth Cheam High Street.  From North Cheam you can catch the 93 bus which will take you directly to Morden Underground station which is on the Northern Line and then onto Wimbledon and Putney High Streets and the bus stops directly outside East Putney Station. long_description: ONE OF THE LAST REMAINING!! A three bedroom apartment available to purchase from a 50% share at £217,500 with a deposit of £10,875. Full market value £435,000. Call today to arrange your appointment to discuss this stunning home! This three bedroom apartment situated on the popular development of New Mill Quarter comprises of  an open plan kitchen/lounge/ dining area. There are three bedrooms in the apartment. The apartment  has a three piece bathroom with shower over bath and spacious cupboards in the hallway. You also have access to an allocated parking space. INCENTIVES -  Contribution to your utility bills for the first year (max £1000) And  Your Legal fees paid (max £1000)* Plus one of these Help with your moving costs (max £500) or Housewarming voucher to spend (max £500) *legal fee incentive only available when using Sage’s preferred solicitor Full Market Value: £435,000 50% Share £217,500 - Rent £498.44 pcm  60% Share £261,000 - Rent £398,75 pcm  75% Share £326,250 - Rent £249.22 pcm  Minimum 5% Mortgage Deposit (50% share): £10,875 Approximate Service Charges: £169.09 New Mill Quarter is an exciting new development, offering a collection of 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments, as well as luxury 4 bedroom homes, all set within landscaped gardens and finished to an impeccable standard. Ideal for commuters, the development is adjacent to Hackbridge railway station, connecting you to London in approximately 30 minutes, as well as a bus stop just outside the development giving great transport connections. With a high-quality specification by Barratt Homes London, these  homes are designed to appeal to families and professionals travelling into central London and the City. New Mill Quarter neighbours vibrant areas such as Croydon, Kingston and Wimbledon where you will find everything you need nearby including good schools within close proximity, and on-site amenities including the award winning Lidl supermarket. Hackbridge is a leafy suburb in the London Borough of Sutton, offering all the benefits of proximity to Central London yet close by to expansive parks. This combined with the distinctive town centres Hackbridge offers residents a peaceful but vibrant lifestyle. Nestled between the banks of the River Wandle and Beddington Park, Hackbridge provides residents with the best of both worlds, connectivity to central London and other key local employment hubs such as Sutton, Croydon and Wimbledon.  Residents of Hackbridge not only has one of the largest green spaces in the borough, Beddington Park, right on their doorstep, but they benefit from excellent transport links. Hackbridge railway station provides regular train services into London Victoria, Clapham Junction, London Blackfriars, Farringdon, Wimbledon, Sutton and further afield destinations such as St Albans and Luton. There are also several London bus routes serving Hackbridge and other destinations such as Tooting, Morden and Carshalton. The Shared Ownership scheme is a Part Buy, Part Rent way of owning your own home for a smaller up front payment. With Shared Ownership, you buy a share of your home using a mortgage from a bank or building society and pay a subsidised rent on the share you did not purchase. The combined mortgage and rent is usually less than you'd expect. Incentives - *Rent Holiday - Terms and conditions apply.  No rent will be collected for the first 3-month period following the date of completion. Mortgage payments will be due on the purchased share, 3-month rent holiday applies to the unpurchased share. **Love2shop Voucher - Terms and conditions apply. Voucher will be provided to the customer on completion.  †Reservation fee - Terms and conditions apply. Offer only valid on selected plots, other plots are available.  ‡Legal fees - Terms and conditions apply. The legal cost contribution will only be made if a recommended solicitor's is used.  The purchase is subject to exchange of contracts up to 28 days after reservation. Please speak to a member of our Sales Team for more details. June 2021.

long_description: This is one Not to Be Missed. This beautifully kept four double bedroom family home is full of original character and features, this grade II listed property built in 1808 is included in Carshalton Village's 'Places of Beauty & Local Interest'. Situated between Carshalton Village and Carshalton Beeches; the property is within walking distance of two mainline stations make the commute into London easy. The property has flexible family accommodation which includes a large T shaped living room which offers a fantastic space for those who enjoy entertaining, a modern kitchen with integrated appliances; the kitchen is open to a further reception room, ideal as a dining room or further family space. The garage is currently converted to a utility room with large storage area and can be accessed from the front garden and from the kitchen. The spacious upstairs accommodation consists of four double bedrooms and two bathrooms. Outside to the rear is a secluded southerly aspect courtyard garden. To the front there is a block paved driveway and parking for one car. Bac to the location you will fine only a stone’s throw away, an array of local and convenience stores, restaurants plus those into sports leisure and recreational facilities are within minutes. Those families with children will pleased to know the property is within easy reach of several highly sought after primary and secondary schools along with local amenities on Banstead Road, ser are also serval beautiful parks locally including Oaks Park and golf course.  Exclusive to Goodfellows.  Call today to book your appointment. long_description: GUIDE PRICE £230,000 - £235,000 We are delighted to introduce to the market this first floor two double bedroom retirement home set within the very popular over 60's Brook Court development. This property is well equipped for convenience, providing immediate access to North Cheam with access to the many restaurants and amenities the high street has to offer, not forgetting easy access to Stoneleigh and Worcester Park main line train station with access into London Waterloo and within walking distance to nearby bus routes to Cheam Village, Worcester Park and Morden Tube Station.  The open and spacious accommodation comprises two double bedrooms, a large reception/dining room, kitchen and bathroom. Further features complimenting this home include secure road entry system, lift access, resident parking, warden assistance with emergency pully cord system, residents lounge and communal kitchen, communal garden.  This property is offered to the market with no onward chain. bullet_points: 2 Bedrooms;Living/Dining Room;Kitchen;En-suite Shower Room;Family Bathroom;No Onward Chain
long_description: This modern first floor apartment is set within Brabham Court, a sought after Art Deco inspired building set on Worcester Park's Central Road, meaning that a wide array of shops, restaurants and amenities are  on your doorstep, including Waitrose and Pizza Express. Numerous transport links are also close by, including Worcester Park mainline station. Upon arrival at Brabham Court, you are welcomed by an opulent lobby, where you can access one of two elevators to all floors. Continue on through the lobby and you'll gain access to the well-tended, landscaped communal gardens. Resident's also benefit from secure gated allocated parking, located to the side of the building. The apartment itself offers a spacious lounge/diner which in turn opens onto a fitted kitchen with integrated appliances. There are two double bedrooms, with the master bedroom offering an en-suite shower room, along with a family bathroom.  No onward chain. Living/Dining Room 5.8m x 3.43m Kitchen 3.56m x 2.41m Bedroom 4.72m x 3.28m En-suite Shower Room Bedroom 3.45m x 2.95m Family Bathroom No Onward Chain Brochures Web Details Particulars

Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Bairstow Eves SHARED OWNERSHIP A one bedroom apartment available to purchase from a 60% share at £190,500 with a deposit of £9,525. Full market value £317,500. Call today to arrange your appointment to discuss this stunning home! This one bedroom apartment situated on the popular development of New Mill Quarter comprises of  an open plan kitchen/lounge/ dining area. The apartment  has a three piece bathroom with shower over bath and spacious cupboards in the hallway. You also have access to an allocated parking space. INCENTIVES -  Contribution to your utility bills for the first year (max £1000) And  Your Legal fees paid (max £1000)* Plus one of these Help with your moving costs (max £500) or Housewarming voucher to spend (max £500) *legal fee incentive only available when using Sage’s preferred solicitor The purchase is subject to exchange of contracts up to 28 days after reservation. Please speak to a member of our Sales Team for more details. June 2021. Full Market Value: £317,500 60% Share £190,500 - Rent £291.04 pcm  Minimum 5% Mortgage Deposit (60% share): £9,525.00 Approximate Service Charges: £128.82 New Mill Quarter is an exciting new development, offering a collection of 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments, as well as luxury 4 bedroom homes, all set within landscaped gardens and finished to an impeccable standard. Ideal for commuters, the development is adjacent to Hackbridge railway station, connecting you to London in approximately 30 minutes, as well as a bus stop just outside the development giving great transport connections. With a high-quality specification by Barratt Homes London, these  homes are designed to appeal to families and professionals travelling into central London and the City. New Mill Quarter neighbours vibrant areas such as Croydon, Kingston and Wimbledon where you will find everything you need nearby including good schools within close proximity, and on-site amenities including the award winning Lidl supermarket. Hackbridge is a leafy suburb in the London Borough of Sutton, offering all the benefits of proximity to Central London yet close by to expansive parks. This combined with the distinctive town centres Hackbridge offers residents a peaceful but vibrant lifestyle. Nestled between the banks of the River Wandle and Beddington Park, Hackbridge provides residents with the best of both worlds, connectivity to central London and other key local employment hubs such as Sutton, Croydon and Wimbledon.  Residents of Hackbridge not only has one of the largest green spaces in the borough, Beddington Park, right on their doorstep, but they benefit from excellent transport links. Hackbridge railway station provides regular train services into London Victoria, Clapham Junction, London Blackfriars, Farringdon, Wimbledon, Sutton and further afield destinations such as St Albans and Luton. There are also several London bus routes serving Hackbridge and other destinations such as Tooting, Morden and Carshalton. The Shared Ownership scheme is a Part Buy, Part Rent way of owning your own home for a smaller up front payment. With Shared Ownership, you buy a share of your home using a mortgage from a bank or building society and pay a subsidised rent on the share you did not purchase. The combined mortgage and rent is usually less than you'd expect to pay if you bought a similar property outright. At New Mill Quarter  you can buy a minimum 50% share of your home (the maximum you can buy initially is 75%). When you're ready, you can buy more shares until you staircase to owning 100% of your home. These apartments will appeal to professionals working locally and those commuting into London.

long_description: LUXURY 2 BEDROOM APARTMENT FOR OVER 55'S. 95% shared ownership.  Dillon Court is a modern development of lift serviced apartments located in a highly desirable South Sutton location. Communal facilities include a residents lounge with kitchenette, a rooftop terrace, and a landscaped garden.  This immaculately presented two bedroom apartment has its own private balcony, and is situated to the rear of the building. There is a fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, open plan living and dining space, a modern bathroom and two good sized bedrooms. Other benefits include residents parking, a long lease and no onward chain. Conveniently situated close to a multitude of transport links, and close to Sutton town centre with its shops and amenities. Accommodation  - Double glazed front door and security entryphone system to communal entrance Stairs and lift service to 1st floor UPVC double glazed front door to Spacious Entrance Hall Wood effect flooring, large storage cupboard housing fuse board, double glazed window to side aspect, wall mounted panic alarm, wall mounted thermostat, wall mounted security video entryphone. Lounge/Diner/Kitchen, 21’11” X 13’3” Kitchen Area Range of fitted wall units with matching cupboards and drawers below, granite effect rolltop worksurfaces with inlaid 1 1/2 bowl stainless steel sink and chrome mixer tap, inset gas hob with oven/grill below and extractor fan above, integrated washing machine, integrated fridge/freezer, wood effect flooring, double panelled radiator, double glazed doors to private balcony. Lounge/Dining Area Double glazed window to side aspect, wood effect flooring, double panelled radiator. Bedroom One, 21‘2“ X 10‘0” Double glazed bay window to side aspect, wood effect flooring, double panelled radiator, built in wardrobe.  Bedroom Two, 13‘0“ X 8‘0” Large double glazed window to side aspect, double panel radiator, wood effect flooring. Outside Well-kept communal grounds and residents parking. Brochures Brighton Road, Sutton
