station_info: [(0.3, 'Clapham Junction Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-overground'), (0.9, 'Queenstown Road (Battersea) Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (1.0, 'Battersea Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: An exciting opportunity to acquire this extraordinary four-bedroom duplex apartment, set within an exclusive village school conversion in Battersea.  The Village on Amies Street is a landmark building, ideally located to enjoy a buzz of culture, with cafes, boutique shops and trendy bars right on your doorstep.  It is one of 32 flats within this prestigious gated development, where the historical character and architecture of an original Victorian schoolhouse is masterfully incorporated into first class, contemporary accommodation. The Apartment, located across the second floor, offers 4,596sq.ft of outstanding accommodation. Comprising four double bedrooms, three bathrooms, private study and TV lounge arranged around a mezzanine area, fully fitted kitchen, pantry and utility room, completed by a spectacular open plan reception room.  The reception room, formerly the old schools sports hall, boasts magnificent dimensions, with over 1,500sq.ft of living space, 15ft high ceilings, and five full length south facing windows which flood this extravagant space with natural light.  The kitchen, contemporary in style, has built in appliances and a breakfast bar, accompanied by a utility room and walk in pantry giving extensive storage.  The mezzanine space provides a stunning vantage point over the reception room below, whilst also offering a private study area and separate TV lounge adjacent.  The principal bedroom is a suite to behold, huge in proportions with a luxurious en suite bathroom and additional dressing room above.  A further three double bedrooms are all of great size, benefitting from built in storage and access to two family bathrooms.  The property is finished to an exceptional standard, offering an unbeatable space for versatile family living and entertaining en masse.  Beautifully maintained grounds, including a communal walled garden, offer residents wonderful outdoor areas for peace within the city.  The secure development of The Village comes with concierge service, a lift and allocated parking for two vehicles. Ideally positioned on the popular residential road of Amies Street, the property is close to a huge host of amenities, from a number of cafés and diverse dineries, to classic bars on nearby Lavender Hill.  The vast green spaces of both Clapham Common and Battersea Park are within walking distance, creating the perfect spots for recreation, leisure and serenity.  Clapham Junction station is a convenient 0.3miles from the property with express lines into London Waterloo and Victoria, and multiple cross-country routes, making this a prime location for commuters.  Within The Village, residents can enjoy seclusion and exclusivity in this spectacular gated community.

long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 999 years remaining The Modern, Embassy Gardens 6th Floor - MB0607    This amazing 634sqft 1 bedroom apartment boasts a fully integrated kitchen and appliances with custom wardrobes in the bedroom and bespoke bathroom and a very spacious 171sqft balcony.  Each apartment has its own aspect, whether that's looking up to the Sky Pool, across to the US Embassy, or into one of our beautiful garden squares  The aesthetic is inspired by classic 1950s American design which manifests itself through the creative use of space, materials and detailing. Generous spaces and floor to ceiling windows together with materials such as marble and walnut parquet flooring quietly impart quality and class, reinforcing the sense of solidity and enduring good taste.   About Embassy Gardens   Embassy Gardens is a 21st-century development on the South Bank of London, looking across the River Thames to Chelsea and Kensington. With its own green space, art trail, shops, restaurants and cafés, Embassy Gardens offers residents and their guests the complete London experience in the centre of the city.   3 minute walk to the new Nine Elms tube station  10 minute walk to Vauxhall overground/tube station   7 minutes to Oxford Circus from Vauxhall station  12 minutes to Eurostar and Kings Cross from Vauxhall station   24 minute walk to Battersea Park   Less than 40 minutes to London Gatwick, Heathrow and London City Airports   All Embassy Garden residents gain exclusive membership to the Eg:le Club which grants our residents and their guests access to the Sky Deck with Sky Pool and Orangery rooftop bar, Maureen O'Hara private cinema, Belmont Gym and so much more.  Residents at Embassy gardens will be able to float through the air in the world's one and only Sky Pool. Spanning the Embassy Gardens' Legacy Buildings, the Sky Pool is the world's first 'floating' swimming pool. Once installed, the 25-metre long acrylic pool will allow members of the development's exclusive Eg:le Club to glide between buildings 35 metres up in the sky.

long_description: An exceptional 4/5 bedroom end of terrace Victorian house requiring some modernisation, in this sought after mature and established location. An exceptional End of Terrace Victorian home ideally positioned in this well sought after and much-admired location. Extending to approx. 1,590 Sqft (147.8 Sqm) and spread over three floors, the house requires some modernisation throughout, and would lend itself well to further development, subject to the necessary consents. The house has a small front yard and a lovely L shaped private rear garden. Internally, the existing accommodation is spacious and very well proportioned and includes high ceilings and some original features. On the ground floor, an entrance hallway leading to two reception rooms and a kitchen, which further leads to the dining room, which has access to the rear garden through sliding glass doors. The garden is very private and well-manicured. On the first floor return there is a double bedroom and a bathroom. On the first floor itself, there are two further double bedrooms, including the generous main bedroom to the front. The loft has been converted and is currently in use as a fourth bedroom. There is good storage space in the eaves. This excellent house will suit those buyers seeking a property that affords the opportunity for one to place their on mark on it.  Opportunities of this calibre are rare in the current market, and this is one not to overlook. Viewing is essential and highly recommended. The house is perfectly situation on a desirable tree lined avenue. Those seeking green pastures are spoilt with Wandsworth Common, with its walkways, playing fields, ponds, Skylark Café, tennis courts and park space just 0.6m away. There is ample on street parking available with residents permits. Transport links are nearby, with Wandsworth Town Station just 0.8m away, providing excellent connections to London Waterloo, which in turn has connections to the London Underground, Airports and the primary business, shopping, and entertainment districts of Central London. There are a number of reliable bus services nearby that link the property to major locations and beyond. The area is popular with families due to the considerable availability of Schools and Nurseries in the state and private sector including, Beatrix Potter Primary, Allfarthing Primary, Southfields Academy, Swaffield Primary and the Emanuel School to name but a few.

long_description: A wonderful six bedroom Victorian house covering in excess of 3600 sq ft that has been extended and updated to a very high specification by the current owners. The property is approached through a private 49 ft gated front garden and has generous entertaining and family accommodation over five floors.  On the ground floor is a double reception room with a large bay window, pretty ornate cornice and built in dwarf cupboards. The reception room opens onto the wonderful extended handmade kitchen breakfast room with stunning shaker style units complete with a new electric Aga. The kitchen has been cleverly designed to allow for a large dining table and a seating area that in turn gives access to the artificially lawned rear garden. On the lower ground floor is a large family room with generous ceiling height and a large storage area. To the rear is a bedroom and shower room ideal for a guest room or a nanny with a utility room and under stairs cupboard. Access to the front garden can be found here. On the first floor is a formal reception room with far reaching views over Clapham Common a stunning wooden floor and a wood burner. Two double bedrooms and a bathroom complete the first floor. On the second floor is the primary bedroom with large en suite bathroom with a free standing claw foot bath. There are a further two bedrooms and bathroom which complete the accommodation. Clapham Common North Side runs parallel to the open expanses of Clapham Common with its tennis courts, a bowling green, cricket nets and café. The property is ideally located for access to the charming shops, cafes and restaurants located on Battersea Rise, Northcote Road and Clapham Old Town. For transport, Clapham Common Underground Station (Northern Line) offers services into the City and West End and Clapham Junction Station mainline also provides services into London Victoria and London Waterloo. The area further benefits from an excellent selection of schools. Brochures More Details

long_description: *** Guide Price of £900,000 to £925,000 **A beautifully presented three double bedroom freehold house, benefitting from off street parking and a private garden. The property is being offered chain free. The property is arranged over three floors, with a wealth of versatile entertaining spaces offering a style of living that is not common in the surrounding area. The accommodation comprises of a welcoming hallway on the ground floor, leading to the first bright reception room with direct access on to the private garden. A downstairs loo and double bedroom with a feature glass panel set into the hardwood floors makes up the ground floor. There is a large void on the first floor that allows natural light to flood into the lower ground floor. The lower ground floor comprises a fantastic open plan kitchen, dining and living space, providing a flexible living and entertaining area with excellent natural light from the atrium above. The kitchen benefits from an array of integrated appliances and a plethora of storage space. On the first floor of the property there are two double bedrooms, one of which boasts a well presented en-suite bathroom and the other a walk in wardrobe. A spacious family bathroom makes up the first floor. The property also benefits from an invaluable private off-street parking space and a private, gated bike storage area. Bedford Villas is a popular road ideally situated for both Earlsfield and Wandsworth Town mainline stations. It also benefit from a wide variety of shops and restaurants both in Earlsfield and in the Southside Centre and is just a short walk to King George's Park. Brochures Brochure 1

A beautifully presented and fully extended five bedroom,two bathroom family home with a charming private garden. The accommodation arranged over three floors briefly comprises; entrance hall, a wonderful reception room with bay window to the front, impressive 24 ft kitchen/dining room with and extremely useful cloakroom/utility room. The eat in kitchen is of an excellent finish with granite worktops and penninsular island leading to the landscaped garden. Upstairs on the first floor there is a sizeable principal bedroom, two further bedrooms and a large family bathroom. On the top floor there is a spacious final guest bedroom, anoter double bedroom and the additional bathroom. A particular feature of the property is the overall sense of space and light, which is complimented by the large garden. Situated on the Wandsworth / Tooting borders, the local area has been in the press recently as (justifiably) being a great place to live and there is a real buzz about the place with its food halls, shops, malls, cafes and bars.  As well as the good private and state schools there are also great transport links with the Overground and Underground both being nearby.  The house would suit a wide demographic of potential buyers,  from local families looking for a London home to professional  commuters and socialites. Brochures Particulars

bullet_points: Two Double Bedrooms;Split Level Apartment;Private Entrance;913 sq ft (84 sq m);Eat-In Fully Fitted Kitchen;Stunning Reception Room/Study;Large Loft Storage;Private Roof Terrace;Close To The River;Close To Bars & Shops
long_description: An absolutely stunning split-level ‘‘Turn-Key’’ apartment in West Putney, with its own private roof terrace. 0.5 Miles to Putney Bridge Underground Station | 0.6 Miles to Putney Mainline Station | 0.2 Miles to Putney Pier River Taxi | 0.2 Miles to St Mary’s Primary School | 0.4 Miles to Putney High Street | 0.4 Miles to Waitrose & Partners | 0.1 Miles to the London Rowing Club | 0.1 Miles to River Thames  ***Guide Price £700,000-£730,000***  This stunning two bedroom split-level apartment must be seen internally to be fully appreciated. Moments away from the River Thames with its rowing clubs, bars, pubs and restaurants.   On entering through your own private door, you immediately get the feeling of being in a house rather than an apartment. Up a flight of stairs on the mezzanine level there is a downstairs cloakroom, a rare find in properties of this type.  The large lounge is a wonderful relaxing space with a bank of double height windows affording lots of natural light and wood flooring throughout. Centring the room is a feature mantelpiece with storage units to either side and on the opposite wall the current owners have cleverly installed a large study area.  The lounge opens onto a beautiful modern fully fitted kitchen, with a dining table, wood flooring and an abundance of storage.  The staircase off the landing leads up to a pretty private roof terrace ideal for entertaining/barbecues or just to read a book with a glass of prosecco in hand whiling away the summer days.  There are two good sized double bedrooms again with lots of eaves storage and windows affording far reaching views and a family bathroom which has been refurbished to a high standard.  On the landing there is access to a large loft storage area, again a rare find.  The apartment is located on the Lower Richmond Road where there are a number of eclectic restaurants, bars and pubs. It is close to Putney Common, and the River Thames is a few yards away down Glendarvon Street, with its popular rowing clubs just at the end of the street.   Putney Bridge Underground Station is within walking distance, as is Putney main Line Station. The River Taxi from Putney Pier to the City is only a short walk away.  As advised by the sellers: Council Tax Band: D Tenure: Leasehold Length of Lease: 125 years from November 2011 Ground Rent: £350 per annum Age of Boiler: 2011 Location of Boiler: Landing Cupboard Parking: On street permit Vendor’s Position: Potential End Of Chain Agent: Roberto Ghirardani *Please verify all details through the conveyancing process *All distances or travel times are based on Google Maps

long_description: A four bedroom family home in a superb location close to Tooting Common.  Description Located in very close proximity to Tooting common is this four bedroom home which benefits from a beautiful 40 ft garden and off-street parking. The property is presented in wonderful condition and comprises to the rear a spacious kitchen/breakfast room which is fitted with contemporary built-in units, integrated appliances and an abundance of space for a dining table. The bright kitchen opens onto the conservatory through sliding doors and provides a wonderful space to relax and access to the garden. To the front of the house is a garage which has been divided into a store area and a utility room. The first floor features a spacious reception room to the rear which provides an excellent space for relaxing and entertaining and a bedroom/reception room to the front which is currently used as a study. There is a bathroom with shower on this floor. There an additional three bedrooms on the second floor.  The primary bedroom is situated to the rear and boasts an en-suite. A family bathroom with bath completes this floor. long_description: This luxury 2 bedroom apartment, located on the 4th floor and offering approximately 1,381 sq ft of living space, is in the sought after Albion Riverside development, with an allocated underground car parking space. The property comprises of an open-plan, fully integrated modern kitchen and spacious reception/dining area, which leads on to the private balcony with views across the River Thames and the iconic Albert Bridge. The expansive principal suite benefits from a separate dressing area with fitted wardrobes and modern bathroom; the generous-sized second bedroom has sliding doors which opens on to the living area which means it can be enclosed or opened up, making it ideal for a home office or further living space. There is additional storage within the utility room and a further family bathroom.  The property further benefits from a designated, secure underground car parking space, along with on-site facilities which include 24-hour concierge and security, gym and swimming pool. The Albion Riverside development is located on the south bank of the River Thames just across the river from Chelsea, with Battersea Bridge to the west and Albert Bridge and the 200 acre Battersea Park to the east.  Clapham Junction Station and Sloane Square underground station (Circle and District lines, zone 1) are within 1.4 miles and regular buses run from Battersea Bridge to these locations.  Families will benefit from the excellent schooling nearby, such as Newton Prep or Thomas's.  Positioned close to the green spaces of Battersea Park, with its many wonderful attributes including formal and natural planting, walkways, cycle lanes, an athletics track, tennis courts and a zoo. The peace pagoda, lake and fountains, as well as "Go Ape" climbing area are just a few more features.  The property benefits from the many amenities including restaurants, shops, bar & cinemas from the surrounding roads along with the newly developed Battersea Power station  which is 1 mile away, which is sure to be come one of London's new hotspots in the coming years. Brochures More Details

long_description: A superb three bedroom maisonette moments away from the popular Northcote Road.  Description Situated over three floors is this beautifully presented three bedroom maisonette offering approximately 1233sqft of accommodation. Upon entry you are welcomed into a spacious reception room fitted with a trio of sash windows allowing light to flood in alongside built in cabinetry flanking the stylish fireplace. The kitchen is adjacent and is fitted with fully integrated Miele appliances as well as a butlers sink and ample cupboard space. The second floor is comprised of two sizable double bedrooms both benefitting from built in storage and served by a family bathroom. The third floor completes the property and houses the principal suite, from which you can access a beautiful west facing balcony as well as the spacious eaves storage. The bedroom includes an ensuite bathroom with freestanding bath tub. Location Webb's Road runs between Wandsworth and Clapham Common, parallel to the wonderful shops and restaurants on the popular Northcote Road. Transport connections are excellent with mainline trains from Wandsworth Common, Clapham Junction and Clapham South underground close by. Square Footage: 1,233 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 125 years remaining The Property A well-presented 2 double bedroom Share of Freehold garden flat in a great area.  The property has 2 unusual features - a conservatory leading out to the garden and a summer house ready to be used for fun stuff or a large home office.  The accommodation is spread out over 2 floors with the lower gound floor hosting a large double bedroom and spacious bathroom.  Totalling 1217 sqft (including Sumer House),  and with good ceiling heights, there is plenty of volume, the proportions are good and there is plenty of 'elbow room' and a lovely balanced flow of space. There are many popular and high-achieving schools in the area and the flat is located within easy walking distance of the bars, restaurants and shops of the ever-popular Bellevue and Northcote Roads. For those who love walking, the leafy and green spaces of Wandsworth Common are on the doorstep, while commuters benefit from the close proximity of Wandsworth Common and Clapham South stations (overground and underground) within a 10 minute walk. This area has deservedley eraned itself the reputation as a great place to live and it is obvious why. long_description: Located on a desirable street, close to convenient transport links and Wandsworth Common, this modern, classically designed, four storey family home provides plenty of accommodation.  The house provides fantastic living space. To the front of the property is a well finished reception room benefitting from great lighting and tasteful cornicing. To the rear of this floor is a well designed kitchen/dining room. The kitchen benefits from modern units and integrated appliances. The conservatory serves an excellent dining area, providing a lovely aspect over the South Westerly facing garden.  On the first floor are two double bedrooms, both with the convenience of built-in wardrobes and their own en-suites. On the second floor is a naturally bright bedroom with bay window, a further bedroom and separate bathroom, this floor also benefits form a utility room. The property is completed by a further bedroom on the top floor. Barmouth Road is a tree lined no though Street in a sought after part of Wandsworth, close to Killarney and Crieff Road. The property is close to good transport links, with Earlsfield and Wandsworth Town being nearby.  The house is ideal for families, Wandsworth Common is nearby and there are good schools in the area. long_description: This spacious one bedroom flat (518 Sq. Ft.) is located close to Putney Heath and the amenities of Roehampton Lane.   The flat comprises a light kitchen/breakfast room with an electric hob and space for a breakfast table. The large reception room also has space for a dining table and lovely views over the communal garden. The double bedroom is a good size with a large built in wardrobe and space for additional storage. The bathroom contains new bath and basin. There is a shower over the bath and a vanity cabinet.. The flat has plenty of storage throughout and is very light. It also benefits from lovely, well maintained communal gardens and gated off-street parking.  Kings Court is located just off Roehampton Lane which benefits from a Little Waitrose, many other shops, a post office and a Library. There are also surgeries, schools and dental practices in the area and Queen Mary’s Hospital (NHS). Richmond Park and its Golf Course are nearby. The bus links are excellent and frequent from the stop by the side of the building to: Hammersmith, Putney, St Georges Hospital Tooting, Richmond and beyond. There are direct services to Putney Bridge Underground and to Putney and Barnes mainline stations.  The information contained in these particulars is for general information purposes only. Douglas & Gordon does not provide information or give any warranty with regards to train, tube, tram lines or flight paths. long_description: With its east to west facing rooms, the property is flooded with natural light throughout and has unencumbered westerly views to the rear. Briefly comprising its own entrance on the ground floor, ascending stairs to a brightly lit half landing, then on to the reception room which adjoins the kitchen breakfast room, all of which are pleasantly decorated with wooden floors throughout, bespoke cabinetry and Chesneys gas fireplace with stone surround. The 2nd floor has two double bedrooms and family bathroom, with the principal bedroom and ensuite bathroom, complete with free standing roll top claw foot bath, situated on the third floor offering wide stretching views from the Juliette balcony. Webb's Road features wonderful boutique cafes, shops and galleries, running parallel to the ever popular and amenity filled Northcote Road and sitting between the great green expanses of both Clapham and Wandsworth Commons. Transport links of Clapham Junction over ground, or Clapham South and Common Tube Stations can all be found an easy walk away, along with plentiful bus routes. Both Belleville and Honeywell Primary schools are approximately 200m and 400m walk respectively with numerous other highly regarded private schools close at hand such as Thomas' Clapham, Broomwood Hall to name a few and secondary options of Belleville Academy and Emanuel Also close by.  *N.B this property is owned by a director of NVP.   Brochures Brochure

bullet_points: Detached;Drive Way;South Facing Garden ;Cellar;Three Bathrooms;Well Preserved Period Features
long_description: The Property A substantial detached period property built in 1904, with an impressive entrance hall and a wealth of beautifully retained period features, high ceilings, a south facing garden and a front driveway. The front door opens to a stunning  reception hallway with original tiled floor and grand staircase.  A formal dining room is located to the front of the house with  large bay windows, panelled walls , perfectly preserved ceiling plaster work and marble fireplace.  To the rear of the building on one side is a bright kitchen / breakfast room ( with a small utility/laundry room) that leads through to the conservatory. To the other side, is an elegant sitting room with marble fireplace and original French doors out on to the south facing rear garden. The terrace and lovely mature garden feel extremely private and not overlooked, and looking back to the house, the original brickwork is on full show through the conservatory. On the first floor the staircase leads to a huge U shaped landing which gives access to three bedrooms and two bathrooms, one of which is ensuite to the sizeable master bedroom to the front. The second floor gives two further well proportioned bedrooms and a shower room.  The property benefits from a full head-height cellar and a new clay-tiled roof was installed 5 years ago. Hazlewell Road is a sought-after prime location in West Putney. It is close to the shops and restaurants on Putney High Street, the Mainline Station and East Putney Tube. The green open spaces of Putney Heath/Wimbledon Common are up the road and Richmond Park is nearby. Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

station_info: [(0.6, 'Clapham Common Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.7, 'Wandsworth Road Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.8, 'Clapham South Station', 'svg-underground')]
long_description: Finished to an exceptional standard, this house offers a purchaser the opportunity to acquire a turnkey home in a sought after residential location. Set back from the street on a quiet cul-de-sac, the house is approached either from the pedestrian walkway, which runs from at the head of Wix's Lane ti Lavender Hill, or down the driveway and into the private secure parking area and garage.  The ground floor holds a versatile room which could either be used as a bedroom or a sizeable home office, as well as a modern WC and shower room. Access through to the garage is on this floor, whilst the stairs lead up to the bright, expansive living area.  The entirety of the first floor is dedicated to the kitchen and reception space. Flooded in natural light due to the large terrace facing floor to ceiling windows this area is perfect for entertaining. The kitchen benefits from a wealth of storage and integrated appliances throughout. The large landscaped terrace (c.630 sq ft) serves as an extension of the reception space, a tranquil south facing suntrap perfect for alfresco dining and relaxing.  The attention to detail is second to none, with a fresh air heat recovery system, hardwood flooring,  detailed shadow gaps and skirting and exquisite workmanship throughout the house.  A large wrap around glass feature above the first floor staircase draws light into the house and upstairs are two further bedrooms. The principal suite, benefits from a south facing balcony, a wealth of storage and a sizeable en-suite bathroom. The last bedroom looks north with a leafy, calm vista and again benefits from built in storage and an en-suite.  The garage is entered via the driveway, with electric up and over doors opening to the large shared manouvering area, also containing the bin store and the air source heat pump, and to the private garage. The private garage has ample room for a large car and motrorcycle or bicyles and includes an electric vehicle charging supply. Wix's Lane is a popular residential street just off Clapham Common.  The area is one popular with families due to the wealth of outstanding schooling options in the immediate area,  including Belleville Wix Academy Primary School (only 174 meters from the house) Parkgate House School, Eaton House The Manor School, Ecole de Wix Primary School, Macaulay Church of England School and Clapham Manor Primary School.  At the end of the road is the open green space Clapham Common and incoming purchasers will also benefit from access to first class local amenities, be that the independent cafes and bars in Clapham Old Town, or the restaurants and shopping available around Battersea Rise, Northcote Road and Clapham Junction. Transport links are available from Clapham Common (Northern) and Clapham Junction (Overground) into Central London and beyond, via Victoria and Waterloo. Brochures More Details

bullet_points: Four double bedrooms;Immaculate south facing garden;Stylish kitchen fitted with integrated Miele appliances;Three bathrooms, two of which are ensuite;Moments away from Wandsworth Common;EPC Rating = D
long_description: An immaculate four bedroom house with a South West facing garden.  Description Arranged over three beautifully presented floors is this outstanding four bedroom family home, boasting over 2,280sqft of well-organized living and entertaining space.  The ground floor is comprised of a spacious double reception room fitted with a pretty period bay window and ornate cornicing that flows seamlessly into the stylish, open-plan kitchen/ breakfast room. The kitchen was refurbished by the current owners and comes fully kitted out with a range of high specification Miele appliances such as, a steam oven, induction hob, and dishwasher. Large bifolding doors to the rear as well as trio of skylights running down the left hand side of the kitchen flood the room with light and give access to the approximately 20ft, south west facing garden. The garden has been beautifully landscaped and provides a fantastic space to enjoy during the sunnier months.  The first floor holds the principal bedroom which benefits from a sizable bay window, a walk-through wardrobe and ensuite bathroom featuring a double vanity, roll top bath and walk-in shower. There is a further double bedroom to the rear which is served by a family bathroom  fitted with a walk in shower. The second floor completes the property with a two large double bedrooms, one of which has an ensuite shower room and access to the sizable eaves storage. This level also includes an airing cupboard and a home office/ storage area. Location Cicada Road is a popular residential road close to the open spaces of Wandsworth Common and the shops and amenities of the Southside Centre.  There are a variety of local shops and restaurants nearby and transport is good from Wandsworth Town mainline station plus numerous bus services in the area.  The area is well known for its superb schools both state and private. Square Footage: 2,280 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: A highly desirable two bedroom split level Victorian maisonette situated over the top two floors and offering an exceptional amount of light and space. The flat comprises a large, modern, fully fitted eat-in kitchen that is perfect for entertaining which leads on to the private sunny roof terrace. It also features a generous separate reception room, two double bedrooms and a good sized contemporary bathroom. The property further benefits from fantastic storage throughout, potential to extend STTP and is located in the ever popular diamond conservation area.   Ingelow Road runs parallel to Queenstown Road and is a Victorian residential tree-lined street. It is conveniently located for the shops, bars and restaurants along Queenstown Road and Lavender Hill. Queenstown Road and Battersea Park mainline stations provide direct links to Waterloo and Victoria respectively whilst local bus routes offer services north of the river to Sloane Square and onto the West End. The continued regeneration of Battersea Power Station and Nine Elms are a short walk away with Circus Village West offering an abundance of restaurants, bars and cinema. The new Northern line tube station is close by and makes this a great investment opportunity.   The information contained in these particulars is for general information purposes only. The kitchen is open plan to the reception room with high gloss white cabinetry and integrated modern appliances, opening to a stylish island. Also on this floor is a beautiful, modern shower room. Stairs lead from the reception room up to the principal bedroom on the mezzanine opening onto built-in storage and a en-suite family bathroom.  The property has the additional benefit of a concierge. It is ideally positioned between Forfar Road and Macduff Road for the amenities of Battersea High Street and Battersea Park Road. station_info: [(0.7, 'Wandsworth Common Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.8, 'Wandsworth Town Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.8, 'Clapham Junction Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-overground')]
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 106 years remaining A beautifully presented, top floor, one double bedroom flat with stunning views is available through Nested. The property is well proportioned and has a spacious reception room with a balcony. Both the bathroom and the well-presented kitchen have been modernised and residents can enjoy the benefit of a free residents parking permit. Fitzhugh Grove is a sought after location within walking distance of Wandsworth Common Station and within easy reach of Clapham Junction, Wandsworth Town and Earlsfield Train Stations. With Wandsworth Common on your doorstep and Wandsworth and Northcote Road within walking distance, the new owner of this apartment will have plenty of places to shop, eat out and socialise with friends. This property is great for a first time buyer and also offers excellent return on investment. Some Words From The Owner: What do you love most about your home? I love the views, looking out to the greenery of south London, and getting to witness a different beautiful sunset every evening. It's very peaceful up here. The estate has also just started up a community garden where vegetables and flowers are being grown.  Why are you moving? I started working from home during the pandemic and my business is expanding, I'd like to be able to upsize so I can see clients at home rather than rent a studio.  What do you love about the area? Being right on the edge of Wandsworth common is amazing, the fact that I can walk right out and be in the greenery is something I love. The area feels very safe and has a friendly slower paced feel to other parts of south London. The transport links to Clapham junction and Tooting Bec are also really easy (I walk to Clapham junction in 15 minutes) meaning getting into town takes no time.

bullet_points: Reception room;Kitchen/family room;Garden;Five bedrooms;Three bathrooms;Off-street parking;EPC Rating = C
long_description: A exceptional five bedroom home with a wealth of living space and off-street parking.  Description In a quiet and highly desirable location 'Between the Commons' is this superb five bedroom home which boasts a 25 ft garden and off-street parking.  Upon entering the property you are welcomed on the left hand side by the stunning reception room which boasts a gas fireplace, large glass windows flooding the room with light and offers a brilliant sitting room for relaxing and entertaining. The rear of the ground floor features the kitchen/family room. The kitchen is fitted with white high gloss units, integrated NEF appliances an island in the middle and offers an abundance of space for a large dining table. The room opens onto the garden via floor to ceiling glass doors. The ground floor is compete with a utility room and WC.  The south facing 25 ft garden extends out from the kitchen and then hosts a raised decking area with Astro to one side. It provides a brilliantly private outdoor space to enjoy.  The first floor boasts three bedrooms. The primary bedroom is situated to the rear of this floor and comprises built in wardrobes, offers an abundance of space and benefits from an en-suite bathroom. There are an additional two bedrooms on this floor both with built in wardrobes and a family bathroom with bath.  The second floor hosts an additional two bedrooms as well as a further bathroom with shower and eaves storage.  This superb property also benefits from off-street parking and has two bike sheds that can accommodate upwards of five bikes. Location Sudbrooke Road is a popular residential road ideally situated 'Between the Commons'.  The green open space of Clapham Common is approximately 0.4 miles away and Wandsworth Common is approximately 0.4 miles away.  It is also ideally located for the excellent selection of shops, bars and restaurants on both Northcote Road and Bellevue Roads. Transport is good either from Clapham South Underground Station which is approximately 0.6 miles away or Wandsworth Common mainline station which is approximately 0.5 miles away. Square Footage: 1,925 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: Measuring in excess of 1,300 sq ft this superb three-bedroom flat occupies the first and second floor of a converted Victorian house. The extra width gives this attractive property a good sense of space and light throughout. The kitchen breakfast room can be found to the rear of the first floor along with a family bathroom. The charming kitchen benefits from both wall and base units and integrated appliances. The reception room is positioned to the front of the building and benefits from a feature fireplace.  A double-bedroom with a stunning fireplace and built-in storage completes this floor.  On the second floor there are two double-bedrooms all with built-in storage, one of the bedrooms benefits from a beautiful fireplace and the other from skylights that flood the bedroom with lots of light. A charming second bathroom can also be found on this floor. Great storage can be found in the eaves of the loft conversion. Winsham Grove is widely regarded as one of the most sought-after residential street between the commons. The open spaces of Clapham Common are literally at the end of the street and the amenities of Northcote Road are approximately a five minute walk. long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 999 years remaining The Modern, Embassy Gardens 1th Floor - MB01102    This stunning 634sqft 1 bedroom apartment boasts a fully integrated kitchen and appliances with a very well sized 111sqft balcony.  Each apartment has its own aspect, whether that's looking up to the Sky Pool, across to the US Embassy, or into one of our beautiful garden squares  The aesthetic is inspired by classic 1950s American design which manifests itself through the creative use of space, materials and detailing. Generous spaces and floor to ceiling windows together with materials such as marble and walnut parquet flooring quietly impart quality and class, reinforcing the sense of solidity and enduring good taste.   About Embassy Gardens   Embassy Gardens is a 21st-century development on the South Bank of London, looking across the River Thames to Chelsea and Kensington. With its own green space, art trail, shops, restaurants and cafés, Embassy Gardens offers residents and their guests the complete London experience in the centre of the city.   10 minute walk to Vauxhall overground/tube station   7 minutes to Oxford Circus from Vauxhall station  12 minutes to Eurostar and Kings Cross from Vauxhall station   24 minute walk to Battersea Park   Less than 40 minutes to London Gatwick, Heathrow and London City Airports   All Embassy Garden residents gain exclusive membership to the Eg:le Club which grants our residents and their guests access to the Sky Deck with Sky Pool and Orangery rooftop bar, Maureen O'Hara private cinema, Belmont Gym and so much more.  Residents at Embassy gardens will be able to float through the air in the world's one and only Sky Pool. Spanning the Embassy Gardens' Legacy Buildings, the Sky Pool is the world's first 'floating' swimming pool. Once installed, the 25-metre long acrylic pool will allow members of the development's exclusive Eg:le Club to glide between buildings 35 metres up in the sky.

long_description: SUMMARY A beautiful, bright, RECENTLY REFURBISHED top floor VICTORIAN apartment with additional mezzanine study/office space and adjacent to CLAPHAM COMMON for more details Click HERE.... DESCRIPTION Located in the popular area known as "Between the Commons" on a very desirable street, this fabulous, light and airy apartment would make an excellent home for a first time buyer or couple. The property is situated on the second floor of a converted Victorian terraced house and has access to an additional mezzanine floor that can be used as an office/storage space. On the second floor the recently renovated kitchen is equipped with the latest appliances and includes an induction hob. The spacious bedroom is complete with fitted wardrobes providing ample storage and the bathroom is finished to a very high standard with Crittall style doors and a waterfall shower. The reception room over looks Clapham Common West Side, with wooden flooring and a fitted cupboard providing additional storage.  The property is moments from the shops, bars and restaurants on nearby Northcote Road and Battersea Rise, as well as Clapham Junction mainline rail station, giving commute times to Victoria and Waterloo in around 10 minutes. We currently hold lease details as displayed above, should you require further information please contact the branch.  Please note additional fees could be incurred for items such as leasehold packs. 1. MONEY LAUNDERING REGULATIONS: Intending purchasers will be asked to produce identification documentation at a later stage and we would ask for your co-operation in order that there will be no delay in agreeing the sale. 2. General: While we endeavour to make our sales particulars fair, accurate and reliable, they are only a general guide to the property and, accordingly, if there is any point which is of particular importance to you, please contact the office and we will be pleased to check the position for you, especially if you are contemplating travelling some distance to view the property. 3. The measurements indicated are supplied for guidance only and as such must be considered incorrect. 4. Services: Please note we have not tested the services or any of the equipment or appliances in this property, accordingly we strongly advise prospective buyers to commission their own survey or service reports before finalising their offer to purchase. 5. THESE PARTICULARS ARE ISSUED IN GOOD FAITH BUT DO NOT CONSTITUTE REPRESENTATIONS OF FACT OR FORM PART OF ANY OFFER OR CONTRACT. THE MATTERS REFERRED TO IN THESE PARTICULARS SHOULD BE INDEPENDENTLY VERIFIED BY PROSPECTIVE BUYERS OR TENANTS. NEITHER SEQUENCE (UK) LIMITED NOR ANY OF ITS EMPLOYEES OR AGENTS HAS ANY AUTHORITY TO MAKE OR GIVE ANY REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY WHATEVER IN RELATION TO THIS PROPERTY. station_info: [(0.6, 'Wandsworth Road Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.6, 'Queenstown Road (Battersea) Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.6, 'Clapham Common Station', 'svg-underground')]
long_description: A great opportunity to purchase a stunning two-bedroom Mews house in a gated residential street just off Garfield Road. The accommodation is presented in good decorative order and split over two floors with a great feeling of light and space. The ground floor living space is completely open plan with a reception area, dining area and kitchen. The entire space has been finished with smart wood flooring. The contemporary kitchen is fitted with white gloss base and wall units, black marble work tops as well as integrated appliances. The space works well for everyday living as well as entertaining. The living area opens onto a large patio garden.  On the first floor two double-bedrooms benefit from stunning skylights and built-in storage. Also on this floor is a modern, beautifully finished bathroom with skylights that flood the bathroom with light.  Garfield Road is a well-regarded street in the residential area known as North side. Transport can either be found at Clapham Common Tube or Clapham Junction overland. The house is well positioned for the sought after Wix’s school (subject to entrance in the catchment each year).  There is a fantastic choice of shops, bars and restaurants nearby in Clapham Old Town, Lavender Hill or on Northcote Road. In addition, the open spaces of Clapham Common are literally at the end of the street. Council Tax Band: E | EPC: C  | Tenure: Freehold Brochures Particulars

long_description: A delightful second floor flat in a Victorian conversion moments from Battersea Park. The property, which is flooded with light, offers a great balance of accomodation and living space and further benefits from access to a communal garden. The property is situated in the "one way" section of Prince of Wales Drive which runs between Battersea Bridge Road and Albert Bridge Road close to the south west entrance into Battersea Park and its extensive leisure facilities. A good selection of local shops and restaurants are to be found on Battersea Park Road, and the area is well served by buses including the 344 to Liverpool Street, the 319 to the Kings Road and Sloane Square, and the 345 to South Kensington. The new Battersea Power Station development is within easy reach through the park offering cinema,  restaurants, cafes and river boat as well as being the home to the new Apple Headquarters. Overland rail services can be found at Clapham Junction and the northern line extension has been opened at Battersea Power Station.  Brochures Particulars

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with JOHNS&CO A one bedroom apartment, c.760 sq. ft., with an internal winter garden offering beautiful views, set on the 7th floor of the Capital Building, in the heart of Embassy Gardens in Nine Elms. long_description: Two-bedroom large duplex apartment with mezzanine bedrooms, study area and impressive ceiling located in a Grade II listed building in one of London’s most sought after neighbourhoods.  Description  Completing Soon  Make a booking with our team today to view our marketing suite and show apartments.  Now Available to View 70% of Phase One sold  The 1840  Meticulously restored to its former glory, this magnificent building combines period grandeur with contemporary styling and makes for a truly spectacular place to call home. Blending heritage architecture with modern style, The 1840 offers stylish living spaces alongside beautifully restored, original character features and a superior specification. bullet_points: Five double bedrooms;Five bathrooms;Double reception room;Kitchen;Dining room;Family room;Study;Utility room;Off street parking;Private 80ft garden
long_description: The ground floor is traditionally arranged with a double aspect drawing room.  Access to the garden is via a decorative door at the back of the room and there is a bay window to the front. A further reception room overlooks the front garden. The expansive kitchen leads to a conservatory dining area surrounded by traditional glazed windows and doors that open into the garden. There is also a pantry area running off the kitchen which leads into a large, separate utility room which also has direct access to the front of the house. Stairs lead from the kitchen to the lower ground floor where there is a sixth bedroom/TV room/gym with an ensuite bathroom. The lower ground floor has a wine cellar. The generous master bedroom suite comprises an ensuite bathroom and dressing area. There are three further double bedrooms and two bathrooms on the first floor and a fifth bedroom with a ensuite bathroom on the second floor. The large garden is mainly lawn with mature shrub borders.   This charming property is the perfect family home in this highly sought after area of West Putney has many excellent schools nearby.  The Falcon School for girls and Putney High are a short walk and Prospect House,Ibstock Place, the Harrodian, St Pauls & Kings College Wimbledon also easily accessible. Transport links are found either at Putney or Barnes mainline stations or East Putney Underground Station.   Brochures 2-Page Landscape

long_description: A long term investment opportunity has arisen to purchase this two bedroom period ground floor garden flat with two bathrooms situated between The Commons.  Thid property comprises of two bedrroms, kitchen/diner, bathroom and a cellar. Bathroom Cellar 7.18m x 2m Garden 6.1m x 5.15m Auctioneers Additional Comments Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.   Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.  This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent.  The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website. Auctioneers Additional Comments Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer.  A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. Auctioneers Additional Comments In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon exchange of contracts the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit of 5% of the purchase price of the property. The deposit will be a contribution to the purchase price. A non-refundable reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of 6,000 inc VAT) is also required to be paid upon agreement of sale. The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs.  Both the Marketing Agent and The Auctioneer may believe it necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or indeed obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services. Brochures Brochure

long_description: This well-proportioned ground floor apartment consists of a bright and spacious reception room with sliding doors providing access to the private patio, a separate kitchen with integrated appliances, a modern family bathroom with built-in cabinets, a double bedroom, and finally the spacious master bedroom offering built-in storage and an en-suite with shower. The property is offered with a long lease of over 900 years and is ideally located with quick access to all the amenities of Lavender hill. The airy green, open space of Clapham Common is only a short walk away.  Transportation is provided by Clapham Junction mainline station which offers train links into Central London as well as up and down the country. There is also an abundance of bus routes available. Local amenities on Northcote Road and Lavender Hill include shops, restaurants/bars, gyms, and other community facilities including the Art Centre and Public Library.

An utterly charming, three-bedroom, end of terrace home located in the highly sought-after Dover House Conservation area. The house boasts excellent family accommodation and ample amount of outside space. The property is approached via a charming, gated picket fence, benefiting from its own generous 49ft south-west facing front garden. The entrance hall leads to a sizable reception room, opening to a well-designed spacious kitchen/dining room boasting wonderful views of the mature rear garden and patio area. The ground floor further benefits from a shower room. The upper floor offers flexible accommodation with three bedrooms and a family bathroom. Pleasance Road is a quiet residential road located between, Dover House Road and Putney Park Lane, close to the leafy, open expanse of Putney Heath and the Dover House Parade. There are regular numerous bus services to Putney High Street, and is therefore within easy reach of both Putney Mainline Station (National Rail) and East Putney Underground Station (District Line) offering swift West End and City communications. Motorists are equally well served by the nearby A3. Brochures Web Details

bullet_points: 2 bedrooms;2 bathrooms;Kitchen / breakfast room;Over 1000sqft;Roof terrace;Utility room
long_description: A beautifully presented two bedroom flat situated on the top floor of a semi-detached period property with brilliant living and entertaining space.   This property has a large kitchen / dining room leading out to the east facing, roof terrace; the amount of natural light creates a wonderfully bright and airy space. The kitchen is fitted with stylish units and offers ample storage and preparation space. The master bedroom is generously sized with built-in wardrobes and an en-suite. There is a further double bedroom, a contemporary family bathroom and a utility room and separate living room which also leads out onto the roof terrace .  Santos Road runs between West Hill and Oakhill Road and is a short distance from the shops, restaurants and transport facilities of Putney High Street. long_description: This well-presented natural four-bedroom family home is ideally positioned on one of the most sought-after residential streets Between the Commons and is in catchment for both Honeywell and Belleville schools. The accommodation has been extended into the side return and the wider than average property boasts excellent proportions and benefits from a combination of period features and contemporary design. There is room for further extensions into the loft space and cellar subject to planning permission.   Situated on the ground floor is double reception room with high ceilings, period features and a stunning bay window. To the rear of the house is the kitchen breakfast room, using the width of the property the side return extension has a glass roof which creates a bright and airy space. French doors lead out on to a landscaped garden which offers space for seating perfect for al fresco dining, with patio area and storage.   On the first floor there are three double bedrooms and family bathroom and separate WC. The fourth double bedroom is peacefully located at the rear of the second floor where there is also a family bathroom.   The property lies “Between the Commons” and is only a stone’s throw from all the shops, bars and restaurants of the sought after location of Northcote Road. The wide open spaces of Wandsworth and Clapham Common are only minutes away, and transportation links into central London (Clapham Junction, Wandsworth Common and Clapham South) are all within easy walking distance. Brochures Particulars

long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 999 years remaining Larger than average 953 sq. ft. off-plan resale two-bedroom apartment with two balconies and a winter garden on the 9th floor of the Battersea Roof Gardens. Overlooking the Electric Boulevard the apartment offers stunning views and quiet aspect over the architecturally stunning Gehry Buildings and the Power Station. Battersea Power Station is Central London's most eagerly anticipated new development. Fantastic opportunity whether you are an end user or investor looking to buy in the Battersea Power Station Development.  At the Roof Gardens building designed by Foster+Partners apartments have access to the new Art'otel facilities. A rooftop infinity pool boasting views over Battersea Power Station a 250-square-meter roof garden designed by New York landscape firm James Corner Field Operations which was also behind the High Line. The Skyline is designed as an undulating volume containing shops a medical center and the hotel itself. Art'otel plans to also create an elevated bar and restaurant offering panoramic views of the city skyline as well as a public art gallery accompanied by a lounge and cafe.  Residents will also benefit from fantastic transport connections. The Zone 1 Northline Line Extension opened in Autumn 2021  connecting Battersea Power Station to all the key hubs of Central London and beyond within a matter of minutes and the Thames Clippers water boats already providing a frequent service to West and East London. As well as having one of London's finest parks within walking distance along the river residents will have access to some of the exciting new outside spaces being created on site including a 6-acre riverside park in front of the Power Station as well as a new park and children's play area next to the architecturally stunning Frank Gehry Buildings.  * This is an off-plan property and the vendor is selling the original contract with the developer (re-assignment).  ** Computer generated or show room images are for illustrative purposes only Tenure: Leasehold (999 years) Brochures Brochure

bullet_points: Semi-detached Victorian house;Reception room;Open plan kitchen/dining room;Family/games room;Principal bedroom, dressing room and en suite bathroom;Four double bedrooms;Two further bathrooms;Cinema/gym room;36ft west-facing garden;Council Tax rating: G
long_description: A substantial and beautifully presented five bedroom semi-detached house measuring over 3,000 sq. ft with a 36ft west-facing garden. This stunning and fully extended five bedroom Victorian house is set back from the road and offers four floors of flexible living space measuring over 3,000 sq. ft and benefiting from a bright west-facing garden. In excellent condition, this family home has been immaculately extended by the current owners to a very high specification and has a great sense of natural light and space throughout. With Amtico flooring, Lutron lighting and Sonos sound system running throughout, the ground floor is predominantly open-plan which allows for an abundance of light and a sense of a modern family living space. To the front is an elegant dining room boasting a range of built-in cabinetry, housing two Gaggenau wine fridges and providing plenty of storage. This spacious room boasts a bay window, a working gas fireplace with stone surround and enough space to hold large dinner parties.   The generous Poliform kitchen has a large array of modern wall and base units and features multiple integrated Gaggenau appliances such as an American-style fridge freezer, induction hob and oven boasting additional steam oven and warming drawer. There is counter-top seating at the end of the kitchen with pendant lighting above which is perfect for daily life. The wide reception room to the rear of the house benefits from elegant floor to ceiling bespoke carpentry with book shelving, drawers and features inbuilt technology for a home entertainment system. This bright room leads onto the garden through huge glass sliding doors which span the width of the house.  The garden is zoned perfectly and is divided into patio and lawned areas. The patio is laid with limestone tiles and features raised flower beds, Sonos speakers and an outdoor gas fireplace for evening enjoyment. The rear of the garden is laid with artificial lawn and has a children’s play area and storage shed. Given the aspect of the house, this garden attracts the sun for much of the day, in particular the evening time. There is also a covered and secure side access to the front and rear of the house, which is useful general storage including bicycles and scooters. The lower ground floor of the house comprises of a large family/games room to the front with built in bookshelves and speakers integrated into the ceiling. Adjacent is the good-sized utility room with further storage, countertop with sink and is fully plumbed for appliances. There is a guest cloakroom before you step into a room which was designed for a home cinema. Through one further door you enter the wine room which was built to accommodate extensive number of bottles. There is water based underfloor heating throughout the basement and ground floor, with electric underfloor heating in all upstairs bathrooms. The first floor and to the front of the house you find the principal bedroom suite. The bedroom has excellent ceiling height and boasts a large bay window and a significant range of built-in wardrobes. Through the tailormade dressing room area, you find the luxurious en suite bathroom boasting a large bath, separate shower with glass surround and double sinks sunken into a floating vanity unit with a mirrored cabinet above. To the rear of the first floor you find a family bathroom and two further double bedrooms, one of which is currently being used as a home office, and both with views over the garden. Completing this floor is an all essential airing cupboard on the first floor landing. The second floor comprises a very large double bedroom on the rear mezzanine floor which has a pleasant westerly aspect over the surrounding gardens. Up a short flight of stairs you find a second very generous family bathroom with a bath, separate shower and double sinks. To the front is another substantial and pretty double bedroom with built in desk and book shelves. Running along the side of this bedroom are eaves that can be accessed from either end and was used as a play den by the owners children. There is also access to loft storage which is boarded and accessed via a drop down ladder. Laitwood Road is situated just to the south of Balham High Road and runs between Ormeley Road and Cavendish Road. Within a few minutes walk is Bedford Hill which has multiple restaurants, cafes and boutique shops. Additionally, Hildreth Street market is moments away, as is Waitrose and the new Soho House’s Little House Balham which is opening in 2022. Tooting Common is closely with all its amenities, including tennis courts, sports pitches, ponds and Tooting Lido. Balham station is the nearest for both underground and overground transport, with services into the City and West End. There are an excellent selection of schools locally including Henry Cavendish Primary School. Declaration: in line with the Estate Agency Act 1979 there is a family connection between the owner of the property and Chelwood Partners.

long_description: A beautifully presented ground floor purpose built flat situated in a small cul-de-sac between Putney and Barnes.  This light and spacious property provides 507 sq ft of internal living accommodation. The living room is a very good size with space to dine, this leads to a separate fitted modern kitchen with appliances and a recently replaced combination boiler.   The hallway provides a large storage cupboard for additional appliances for items such as, coats, shoes, hoover and ironing board. The bathroom has been finished to an excellent standard with quality fixings and storage; finally leading through to the double bedroom which can be arranged in a number of different ways with ample storage space. The property is ideally located for Barnes station providing regular and direct train services to London Waterloo and for public transport amenities to Hammersmith, Putney and Richmond. The outstanding Barnes Primary and East Sheen Primary Schools are within 0.7 miles and 0.6 miles respectively, whilst the extensive recreational amenities of Barnes Common, Palewell Common and Richmond Park are moments away. Brochures Rockingham Close, Putney

bullet_points: Beautifully presented;Spacious;Recently refurbished;Long lease;Light and airy
long_description: An immaculate one-bedroom flat on the second floor of this building in the heart of Earlsfield, less than 350 metres from Earlsfield Station. The area is well served for shops, restaurants and bars and is close to Garratt Park and Garratt Green. The bright and spacious apartment is smart and stylish with neutral decoration throughout and has a large west-facing reception room, eat-in kitchen, a stylish contemporary shower room, separate WC and a generous double bedroom.  In addition, the loft area above the property is demised to the flat and, subject to planning and the necessary licences, could be developed into further accommodation. Brochures Particulars

bullet_points: Detached Victorian house;Double fronted;Four bedrooms;Two living rooms;Kitchen;Two bathrooms;South facing garden;Cellar;2056 sq ft
long_description: This unique home is a wonderful Victorian house and offers something that so few do, as not only is it double fronted, it is also detached.  The wide hallway has a living room either side, both with high ceilings, traditional fireplaces and bay windows.  The kitchen is at the rear, next to the very useful utility room, and opens out into the pretty south facing paved garden which has side access.  Upstairs there are four great bedrooms and two bathrooms.  There is also a cellar, ideal for extra storage. Situation Sistova Road is situated right in the heart of Balham, just a few yards from the increasingly popular Hildreth Street which has an excellent collection of cafes and artisan bakeries.  Balham train station (Northern line and National Rail) is just 0.2 miles away from the house and there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.  There is also a great collection of schools in the area, both private and state. Brochures Particulars

bullet_points: 4 bedrooms (1 En Suite);Bathroom;Shower Room;Reception Room;Dining Room;Kitchen;Annexe

bathrooms: A wonderful opportunity to purchase this semi-detached house ideally located for Ofsted primary and secondary schools as well as transport, shopping and recreational facilities. This spacious family house offers an abundance of living space. On the ground floor there a spacious lounge, shower room and a modern kitchen/breakfast room, leading out to an unusually large garden that has been managed with care by the current owners.  The upstairs provides four bedrooms, family bathroom and a further shower room. Further benefits include off-street parking and a newly converted, self-contained split level annexe that has been designed and decorated to a high standard which offers the potential of a rental income via air bnb.  Sutherland Grove is a highly convenient location situated close to Southfields Village with its District Line station, bus routes to various locations, shopping, restaurant and cafe facilities. Wimbledon Park and King George's Park with their recreational facilities are also close by.  Brochures Particulars

bullet_points: First floor flat in secure building;Off street parking;Excellent move-in condition throughout;Lots of light;Green surroundings;Near to Putney shops & stations
long_description: A really spacious and bright flat with two double bedrooms and parking.  It is favourably positioned in a quieter section on an upper floor and predominantly facing south. The flat is presented in completely ready move-in condition - it was entirely refurbished in 2016 with a new kitchen, bathroom, electric heating system, carpets, woodwork and was painted throughout.   It has a homely feel and plenty of light as it is mostly facing south with a pleasant outlook and lots of greenery. Additional specification includes a farmhouse sink, Bosch dishwasher, oven and hob, plus a wine fridge and space for a washing machine and fridge freezer.  The bathroom has a rainfall shower, heated towel rail, and mirrored cabinets. The flat also has plentiful storage and two off-street parking spaces (permits), one designated space and one as unallocated parking. Nearby amenities include the following: 2 min walk to bus stops and Putney Leisure Centre 15 min walk to Barnes train station and Putney train station 15 min walk to Putney high street with East Putney tube Just round the corner there is a lovely parade of shops including Tried and True café, The Arab Boy pub, Gerhold’s cornershop, and a local florist. There are Sainsburys & Tesco supermarkets within a 5 min walk. The green spaces are of Putney and Barnes Common are nearby as is the River Tames towpath and Richmond Park. Brochures Web Details Particulars

station_info: [(0.2, 'Battersea Power Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.3, 'Battersea Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.5, 'Queenstown Road (Battersea) Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Copperstones Opportunity to acquire an amazing off-plan, spacious 2 bed, 2 bath apartment on the 2nd floor of Gehry Partners designed Prospect Place 2 building at the Battersea Power Station development in Nine Elms, London. The apartment benefits from a generous winter garden overlooking Flower Building. Prospect Place 2 is located next to Prospect Place 1 building hwich is on Electric Boulevard -  a wide and multilevel street which connects the new Zone 1 London Underground station to the south, with the Power Station itself. Lined with shops, restaurants and cafes, the new landmark buildings create the gateway to the Battersea Power Station. 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms Internal area:  907 sq. ft. / 84.3 sq. m. Winter Garden:  77 sq. ft. / 7.2 sq. m. Gross area:  984 sq. ft. / 91.5 sq. m. Indicative aspect:   Flower Building Lease:  999 years from 2013 Amenities & Facilities Residents will enjoy ample amount of amenities and facilities such as 24 hours concierge, a residents' lounge, bar, business centre, fully equipped gym, swimming pool, spa, games room, private cinema, roof garden and much more.  A carefully chosen retailers based on site will mean that whatever you need will be right there. Moreover, a theatre, fashion houses, bars and food outlets will make living here a remarkably convenient and an enjoyable experience. And yes, if you do need to travel in and around London, just walk to the new Battersea Power Station northern line tube located right within the development or choose the river taxi service off the jetty. About Battersea Power Station: Battersea Power Station is one of central London’s largest, most visionary and eagerly anticipated new town centres in which roughly half the development will be comprised of shops, restaurants and office space. In addition, there will be a six-acre public park, a town square and a new tube station (scheduled to be within Zone 1). The Battersea Power Station project covers 42 acres and includes 3.5m sq ft of mixed commercial space, together with 4,364 new homes. The successful regeneration of Battersea Power Station will create 20,000 new jobs, inject £20bn into the UK economy and create a funding mechanism for the first major tube line extension since the Millennium. A new NHS medical facility is also being built. The Battersea Power Station Foundation supports local charities and community projects. Over £3.3m has been awarded since it launched in 2016; on average, £207,000 is granted per month and the largest grant awarded was to Battersea Arts Centre for £305,000. Circus West Village is the neighbourhood centre for the first part of the development. It opened to the public in Spring 2017 and since then more than 350,000 people have visited to enjoy the ongoing programme of events and the new shops and restaurants. Residents started to move in to Circus West early in 2017 and continue to do so. The Village Hall, a new performance space, has opened at Circus West Village and a new MBNA Thames Clippers River Bus service commenced on 1 November 2017.  The Battersea Academy of Skills Excellence (BASE), the development company’s bespoke jobs and training service created for those living locally, was launched in 2016. It is focused on matching people with jobs at Battersea as well as providing training relevant to the job pipeline at the development. Battersea Power Station is owned by a consortium of Malaysian investors comprised of Sime Darby, S P Setia and the Employees’ Provident Fund. Management of the development is being undertaken by the British-based Battersea Power Station Development Company.

bullet_points: One bedroom;One bathroom;Off-street parking;Moments away from Wandsworth Town Station;Southerly aspect;EPC Rating = C
long_description: A charming one bedroom flat with off-street parking in the Tonsleys.  Description Situated on the raised ground floor of this beautiful Victorian terrace is this fantastic one bedroom flat providing approximately 560sqft of accommodation.  The reception room is situated towards the front of the property and benefits from a southerly aspect, allowing light to pour through the large bay window throughout the day. Adjacent to this is the kitchen, fitted with a variety of appliances including a Bosch oven and grill. The kitchen has a large sash window to the rear and a convenient breakfast bar with seating for two.  Towards the rear of the property is the generously proportioned double bedroom boasting built in wardrobes. This is served by the family bathroom located off the hallway, fitted with a bath and overhead shower.  A useful storage cupboard can also be located in the hallway. Location Situated in the popular area known as "The Tonsleys", East Hill is moments from the open expanses of Wandsworth Common and Old York Road, with its village-like atmosphere and array of popular independent shops, restaurants and bars. Southside shopping Centre, with its excellent shopping facilities, supermarkets and cinema is also nearby. For those travelling into central London, Wandsworth Town mainline station, a short walk away, provides frequent and direct services to Waterloo (15 mins by train) and Clapham Junction offers a ten-minute train ride into Victoria. In addition there are numerous bus services that link the area with Fulham and Chelsea. Square Footage: 560 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

bullet_points:
'Between the Commons'

Double fronted house;Five bedrooms;Two Bathrooms;Two Cloakrooms;Utility Room;Cellar;Large Garden;EPC Rating = D
station_info: [(0.5, 'Clapham Junction Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-overground'), (0.7, 'Clapham South Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.9, 'Wandsworth Common Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: An exceptional double fronted house located 'Between the Commons'  Description A rare opportunity to purchase a double-fronted house giving the lateral space so coveted nowadays and covering in excess of 2600 sq ft.  The house is ‘Between the Commons’ and ideally placed for many of the local amenities including Clapham common, Clapham junction and Northcote Road. This stunning, bright house has a host of period features including original fireplaces, cornicing and stained glass. Approached through the front garden delivering you to the elegant wide entrance hall with a lovely tessellated floor. To the left is the 27ft dual aspect, light-filled reception room complete with a feature fireplace and bespoke shelving and cabinetry. The reception room also in turn gives access via French doors to the 60ft garden. To the right is a wonderful kitchen breakfast room that has been designed to allow for a large dining table. There is a modern kitchen with Shaker style units as well as a large Butler sink with a sash window overlooking the garden. There is a separate cloakroom and on the lower ground floor is the spacious utility area as well as generous storage in the cellar.  The garden is part-paved creating a secluded relaxing area with the rest of the garden being part-Astro and then decked to provide a lovely Dining area. On the first floor are four large double bedrooms, two with large bay windows and all with fitted wardrobes, as well as a generous family bathroom and separate cloak room. The second floor completes the accommodation with a further double bedroom including fireplace and balcony; a dressing room and a large bathroom with double sinks, a free standing bath and walk-in shower. There is also additional storage in the eaves.  The property benefits from planning ref 2020/1145 which includes increasing the size of the top floor and digging the basement. Location Grandison Road is a quiet road ideally placed ‘Between the Commons’  benefiting from the many local shops and restaurants situated on Northcote Road and Battersea Rise.  Access north of the river can be achieved from Clapham Junction over ground station with direct links to Victoria and Waterloo and from Clapham South underground station.    The wide open spaces of Clapham Common are moments away (approximately 217 ft). There is an excellent selection of schools in both the state and private sector. Square Footage: 2,681 sq ft  Brochures Web Details
