The property comprises a well-lit reception room, modern fitted kitchen, stylish bathroom, and a spacious double bedroom.  The property is ideally located moments from Northcote Road and is only minutes from Clapham Junction Station. This fantastic one double bedroom flat would make an ideal first-time-buy or investment.

bullet_points: Close to the river and park;Attractive and sought after location;Lovely period features;Light and airy feel;Fabulous reception room and extended loft;Great storage space and cellar;Garden;EPC Rating = D
long_description: A beautifully presented five bedroom period home.  Description A handsome, period terraced house that has been much improved and extended by the current owners.  It is moments from the river and Wandsworth park, and also in the Brandlehow catchment. This well presented and attractive family home has excellent (over 2,000 sq ft) , bright accommodation arranged over four floors including a fabulous extended loft plus a cellar. The double reception room has high ceilings and fire place with fitted cupboards and shelving to the alcoves. To the rear, is a delightful fitted kitchen with quality appliances and a bright dual aspect. This leads to a pretty paved west facing garden which offers much shelter and privacy. On the first floor, there are three bedrooms and a generous sized family bathroom with separate shower stall. The main bedroom is on the second floor with a lovely en suite and separate walk in cupboard/dressing room. A further bedroom and en suite can be found on the upper top floor. Location Bective Road runs just to the east of Putney High Street and is therefore well located for all the excellent local facilities.  Putney mainline station on Putney High Street with direct trains to Waterloo is 0.4 miles away and the nearest underground is East Putney which is 0.3 miles away. Square Footage: 2,050 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

bullet_points: Five bedrooms;100 ft. South facing garden;Off-street parking;Great entertaining space;Period Features
long_description: This beautiful home boasts a modern kitchen with dining area, separate reception with feature fireplace and doors leading onto a superb 100 ft. South facing garden.  There is also a utility room, WC and cellar. The first floor consists of a master bedroom, two additional double bedrooms, a smaller bedroom and a family bathroom. On the top floor there is a double bedroom and en suite bathroom. The property also benefits from off-street parking. Old Devonshire Road is a short walk from Clapham South and Balham underground and overground stations. The local Henry Cavendish primary school is also a close walk from the property. Brochures Particulars

bullet_points: Stunning First Floor Conversion Flat;2 Double Bedrooms, 1 Bathroom, 1 En-Suite;Bright and Spacious Accommodation with Stylish Interiors;Superb Open Plan Reception/Kitchen;Private Terrace - South-West Facing;Close to Streatham Common and Streatham Stations;Moments From Shops and Amenities;72.08 sq m / 775.86 sq ft
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 103 years remaining Beautifully presented and finished to a high standard throughout, this stunning first floor conversion flat offers light and spacious accommodation with ultra-stylish interiors. Boasting a delightful south-west facing private terrace - ideal for al fresco drinks and entertaining - the property occupies an enviable position in a sought after residential road just a short walk from both Streatham Common and Streatham stations. Accommodation comprises entrance hall leading into the light and airy, open plan reception/kitchen with direct access onto the terrace and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and metro-tiled splash-back, incorporating inset sink unit, electric hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, integrated dishwasher, and further space for appliances. There are two well sized double bedrooms, each with inbuilt storage and with sleek en-suite shower to the master. A stylish family bathroom with a white three piece suite and elegant tiling completes the generous accommodation. The apartment benefits from wooden shutters throughout and a lease with 103 years remaining. The property is superbly located within a short walk of both Streatham Common and Streatham stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes, all providing excellent links into Central London and to the surrounding area. Streatham itself offers an array of shops, bars, restaurants, cafes and delicatessens, as well as supermarkets and leisure facilities including an Odeon cinema. Streatham Common is just a stroll away providing fantastic open space and recreation ground, ideal for families, and the area is well served by excellent local schools. Viewings are highly recommended.

bullet_points: EWS1 COMPLIANT;856sq.ft (79sq.m);Stunning River Aspect;2 Double Bedroom Apartment;Right to Park;Dual Aspect Open Plan Reception Room;Gym Overlooking the Thames;Swimming Pool, Spa, Steam Room & Jacuzzi;24 Hour Concierge;Moments from Nine Elms & Battersea Power Station Underground Stations
long_description: A direct river facing 2 bedroom apartment of 856sq.ft (79sq.m) available in Riverlight Quay, a modern development by St James in the heart of Nine Elms on the banks of the River Thames. With secure underground parking included, the property is one of the most spectacular apartments in the development benefitting from a dual aspect open plan reception room with full height floor to ceiling windows with unrivalled natural light and incredible views over the River Thames & City of London. There is also a smart integrated kitchen, 2 spacious balconies and fantastic on-site facilities including a health spa with a “river view” gymnasium, a heated swimming pool, virtual golf, a resident’s lounge and a 24-hour concierge service. Riverlight is well located for access to local shopping facilities at Waitrose Nine Elms, as well as exciting new Bars & Restaurants forming the Nine Elms regeneration. Battersea Power Station is a short walk away with the shopping centre due to open September 2022 providing further amenities on your doorstep. The new Nine Elms Tube Station and Battersea Power Station Tube Stations are also close by providing the Northern Line tube service allowing easy access into Central London, as are the transport links of Vauxhall, including rail, tube, bus, and a river taxi service.  Lease: 999 years from 1 January 2012 Service charge: Approx. £6,000 per annum  Ground rent: £700pa Brochures 3 Riverlight Quay, Nine Elms, SW11 Brochure

The apartment is well laid out as well as being very bright. The apartment comprises of an open plan living kitchen area complete with wooden floors and branded appliances in the fitted kitchen. The large double bedroom has fitted wardrobes with extended storage. The apartment also benefits from underfloor heating (bathroom), Cat 5 cabling for Sky/Broadband, secure bike store, double secure entry and door entry system. West Elms Studios is ideally placed to take advantage of the local transport links with Vauxhall only being 9 mins (Google) walk, Oval and Battersea Park are also nearby. The amenities of Wandsworth Road are close by where you can choose from Bars, Restaurants and Gyms. bullet_points: 13th floor (with lift);River & Westminster Views;Parking included;Master bedroom with ensuite;Bedroom 2;Second bathroom;2 Private Balconies;24 Hour Concierge;Swimming Pool;Residents-only gym and spa
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 999 years remaining Fabulous two bedroom apartment and certainly one of the best types, in Riverlight development. This direct river facing prow unit on the 13th floor has the most impressive views of London's skyline from all principal rooms. Underground parking included.    This is one of the largest type 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms apartments (1118 square feet) in the development. There are also 2 private balconies and an underground parking. Open plan kitchen with an island which divides the room between the kitchen and the reception areas. Two bedrooms, one of which is en-suite and a family bathroom. Utility cupboard.   Facilities in this popular riverside development include a 24 hour concierge, a well-equipped "river view" gymnasium, a heated swimming pool with a steam room, sauna and jacuzzi, there is also a private cinema, virtual golf and a business suite.  Riverlight Quay has an enviable position on the south bank of the River Thames between Vauxhall and Battersea Power Station. On site amenities include: Sainsbury's, a couple of restaurants, a coffee shop, nursery and a pub. A very large Waitrose is located just across the road. This development is conveniently located for the exciting new bars, restaurants and shops at the Battersea Power Station. The transport links of Vauxhall and of the new Battersea Power Station tube station (Northern Line extension) are within a few minutes walk. The river bus from the nearby St George Wharf pier connects to the City, Canary Wharf and Greenwich. * No chain * Cladding certificate EWS1 passed Tenure: Leasehold (999 years) Ground Rent: £750 per year Service Charge: £7,500 per year Brochures Brochure

Offering a luxurious selection of 1, 2 & 3 bedroom apartments through Shared Ownership* in one of the most sought-after locations in South West London, The Switch is perfect for first-time buyers.  Plot 111 - The Concorde Shared Ownership Cost Breakdown - 25% Share  * Full market value = £650,000 * Example 25% share price = £162,250 * Rent = £894pcm (charged at 2.2% of the unsold equity) * Estimated service charge = £310pcm Shared Ownership Cost Breakdown - 40% Share  * Full market value = £650,000 * Example 40% share price = £260,000 * Rent = £715pcm (charged at 2.2% of the unsold equity) * Estimated service charge = £310pcm Shared Ownership Cost Breakdown - 75% Share  * Full market value = £650,000 * Example 75% share price = £487,500 * Rent = £298cm (charged at 2.2% of the unsold equity) * Estimated service charge = £310pcm How does Shared Ownership work? Shared Ownership is a Government-backed scheme for first-time buyers who are unable to afford a suitable home at the full market price. You initially purchase between 25-75% of the home's market value. You then pay subsidised rent on the remainder calculated at 2.75% per annum. Am I eligible? To be considered eligible for the Shared Ownership scheme your yearly income must be below £80,000. For London the limit is £90,000. Those who already own a home are not eligible for the scheme. You would need to sell your current home to be considered Will I need to pay a deposit? In terms of a deposit you will need 5% of the percentage of the home you're purchasing. Kitchens come with fully integrated appliances, designer units and stone worktops. Bath and shower rooms offer oak veneered alcoves, porcelain tiled floors and walls and chrome- plated fixings. Bedrooms feature floor-to-ceiling fitted wardrobes, brushed metal sockets and subtle  light grey carpets. All apartments at The Switch are offered on the  Shared Ownership scheme, making them ideal for  first-time buyers. Don't miss out on coming to view these stunning apartments - register your interest now We look forward to seeing you soon! Every year, we calculate your new rent and will write to you to confirm what your new rent will be. Depending on your new home, youâ��ll also pay a service charge. This covers a proportion of the cost for the services, management and maintenance of the your building and development where you live. Your lease will detail whatâ��s down to you in terms of repairing and maintaining your home. To find out more visit   and speak to our sales team. Offering a luxurious selection of 1, 2 & 3 bedroom apartments through Shared Ownership* in one of the most sought-after locations in South West London, The Switch is perfect for first-time buyers.  Plot 111 - The Concorde Shared Ownership Cost Breakdown - 25% Share  * Full market value = £650,000 * Example 25% share price = £162,250 * Rent = £894pcm (charged at 2.2% of the unsold equity) * Estimated service charge = £310pcm Shared Ownership Cost Breakdown - 40% Share  * Full market value = £650,000 * Example 40% share price = £260,000 * Rent = £715pcm (charged at 2.2% of the unsold equity) * Estimated service charge = £310pcm Shared Ownership Cost Breakdown - 75% Share  * Full market value = £650,000 * Example 75% share price = £487,500 * Rent = £298cm (charged at 2.2% of the unsold equity) * Estimated service charge = £310pcm How does Shared Ownership work? Shared Ownership is a Government-backed scheme for first-time buyers who are unable to afford a suitable home at the full market price. You initially purchase between 25-75% of the home's market value. You then pay subsidised rent on the remainder calculated at 2.75% per annum. Am I eligible? To be considered eligible for the Shared Ownership scheme your yearly income must be below £80,000. For London the limit is £90,000. Those who already own a home are not eligible for the scheme. You would need to sell your current home to be considered Will I need to pay a deposit? In terms of a deposit you will need 5% of the percentage of the home you're purchasing. Kitchens come with fully integrated appliances, designer units and stone worktops. Bath and shower rooms offer oak veneered alcoves, porcelain tiled floors and walls and chrome- plated fixings. Bedrooms feature floor-to-ceiling fitted wardrobes, brushed metal sockets and subtle  light grey carpets. All apartments at The Switch are offered on the  Shared Ownership scheme, making them ideal for  first-time buyers. Don't miss out on coming to view these stunning apartments - register your interest now We look forward to seeing you soon! bullet_points: Period features;Pretty garden;Great family kitchen / breakfast room;End terrace with side access;Two reception rooms;Five bedrooms;Garden;Bathroom;En-suite shower;EPC Rating = E
long_description: A delightful end terrace period family home.  Description A beautifully presented family home that has been much improved and extended by the current owners with much expense and attention to detail. The property offers excellent and flexible accommodation of nearly 2,000 sq ft over three floors plus a cellar.     To the front of the house are two well-proportioned reception rooms with high ceilings, lovely period fireplaces and a handsome shuttered bay window.  To the rear, is an extended kitchen / reception / breakfast room which enjoys a light and airy feel. This is a major feature of the property with its quality units and work surfaces as well as its sliding engineered doors opening out to a delightful sheltered and private garden. Being an end of terrace property, there is also useful side access to the rear. Elsewhere are five bedrooms, all with fitted cupboards / wardrobes, well supported by a main bathroom and en-suite shower. Storage is also excellent with eaves space and a cellar. Location This charming end terrace period home is situated in a pretty tree lined road. The nearest undergrounds are East Putney and Southfields (District line) with Putney mainline (Waterloo) on Putney High Street. There are also excellent local schools close by as well as a good selection of local shops and amenities towards the end of West Hill Road. Square Footage: 1,830 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: The beautifully presented accommodation which offers stunning period features throughout includes: spacious entrance hall with corner fireplace, downstairs WC, separate utility area and access down to the cellar. From the entrance hall, there is access through to an impressive sitting room comprising a beautiful tiled fireplace and bay window to the front. There is a wonderful kitchen/dining/reception room with bespoke kitchen units, integrated appliances, further tiled fireplace and French doors opening to the south-west facing garden. There are three bedrooms and a beautifully appointed family bathroom on the first floor and the top floor comprises an impressive principal bedroom with en suite bathroom, separate dressing area and a separate study/bedroom 5. Outside The south-west facing garden is a particular feature of the property being mainly laid to lawn and enjoying a paved patio area adjoining the rear of the house. The whole being interspersed by numerous specimen trees and flanked by flower and shrub borders. Additional benefits include useful side access to the rear garden. Situation The property is located within this sought after street moments from Clapham Common. The area  boasts a wonderful selection of both private and state schools including Honeywell and Belleville School, Broomwood Hall, Northcote Lodge, Thomas's Clapham, Eaton House, Parkgate and L'école de Wix Lycée français. Nearby Northcote Road provides an extensive range of shops together with a fantastic epicurean selection of bars and restaurants. There are good transport links both by tube (Clapham South) and train (Clapham Junction) offering the Northern Line and frequent trains to Victoria/Waterloo respectively. Additionally, there are wonderful recreational and sporting facilities at both Clapham Common and nearby Wandsworth Common. Brochures Particulars

long_description: Located on the first floor of a wonderful Victorian building, is this immaculate one-bedroom flat, measuring approximately 642 Sq. ft and beautifully presented, it has an excellent feeling of light and space throughout. To the left of the entrance hall is the spacious reception room featuring two large sash windows providing an abundance of natural light, a stunning period fireplace and built-in cabinetry flanking the chimney breast. There is ample space for both living and dining, perfect for entertaining. Opposite is the kitchen which has been tastefully finished, fitted with plenty of gloss wall and base units and modern integrated appliances. A large double bedroom benefits from fitted wardrobes and a quiet location being positioned to the rear of the building. Completing the property is a contemporary bathroom with bath and walk in shower, and a separate toilet.  Additionally, this flat offers alocated off-street parking for one car.    This attractive property is well located for the open spaces of Wandsworth Common. The amenities and more extensive shopping are available at The Southside Centre and transport links are good with Wandsworth Town and Clapham Junction stations nearby, providing services to Victoria and Waterloo. bullet_points: Wide Victorian house;Two reception rooms;Large kitchen/dining room;Principal bedroom suite with dressing room and en suite bathroom;Three further double bedrooms all with en suite bathrooms;Utility room;South facing garden;Chain free;Council Tax Band: G
long_description: A beautiful and wide semi-detached house with south facing garden on this much sought-after residential street between the Commons. This wider than average and stunning Victorian house is situated on this quiet residential road, close walking distance from Clapham Common and Northcote Road. Recently extended and fully refurbished to a very high specification by the current owners, this stylish home measures nearly 2,500 sq. ft., and has width and proportions that are hard to find. As you enter the house you immediately feel the width this property has to offer. The very wide and elegant reception room, with natural wood flooring running throughout, is a versatile living space owing to the floor to ceiling sliding door concealed within the wall. The main reception room to the front is bright due to its large windows and boasts concealed cabling for an entertainment system. The second reception area features an original Victorian fireplace and surround with views down into the kitchen and garden beyond. The wow-factor continues as you step into the very light and spacious kitchen/dining room. With porcelain tiling and underfloor heating, this room is perfect for family life and entertaining and there is space for a large dining table. The bespoke kitchen itself boasts a wide range of wall and base units and a good sized central island with pendant lighting above. There are multiple integrated appliances including a Hoover American-style fridge freezer, dishwasher and two Bosch ovens. Through floor to ceiling glass sliding doors you step out into the south facing garden that attracts light for much of the day. There is a patio area immediately outside the kitchen with matching porcelain tiling. The lawn area is laid with artificial grass and there are raised borders with elegant up lighting. Completing the ground floor is a guest cloakroom and a good-sized cellar which has been converted into a utility room with plenty of additional storage space if required. A particular feature if this family house is the stunning principal bedroom suite located on the first floor to the front. The main bedroom area, with high ceilings, is very bright and features a large bay window which overlooks gardens across the road and therefore is not overlooked. There is a spacious dressing room with similar views to the front. The luxurious en suite bathroom, with porcelain tiles running throughout, boasts a freestanding designer bath, a large walk-in shower and double countertop sinks.  This family home comprises three further double bedrooms, each with their own en suite bathrooms. Two of the generous double bedrooms occupy the rear mezzanine levels on the first and second floor of the house. With views over the garden each has its own well-designed and modern shower rooms. On the top floor you enter a substantial double bedroom with double aspect views to the front and rear of the house. This sizeable bedroom with good ceiling height leads into a large en suite bathroom with walk-in shower and a freestanding bath. An impressive feature is the wall-to-wall window panel which provides extensive views across neighbouring gardens and London beyond. Roseneath Road offers easy access to the amenities of Northcote Road, Webb’s Road and Clapham South with its vast array of restaurants, shops, cafés and bars. The wide-open spaces of Clapham Common are just moments away with all its amenities, including tennis courts, cafes, ponds and playing fields. There is an excellent variety of well-established independent and state schools in the area, with the closest being Thomas’s Clapham and Broomwood Hall and including Honeywell School and Holy Ghost Catholic Primary school.  The property benefits from the excellent transport links of Clapham South underground station, Clapham Junction and Wandsworth Common mainline railway stations, and an extensive network of bus routes.

long_description: A wonderful two bedroom Victorian terrace house located on Battersea High Street moments away from local amenities in Battersea Square and includes an off street allocated parking space. The house comprises a large front reception room, ground floor WC and open-plan kitchen dining space with bi-folding doors onto a west facing rear courtyard garden. Upstairs offers two good size double bedrooms, family bathroom and ample storage. Brochures Full Details

long_description: SUMMARY A recently refurbished and well-presented 2 bed flat arranged on the ground floor of this period conversion, offering a versatile layout and a delightful, shared sunny garden. DESCRIPTION A recently refurbished and well-presented 2 bedroom flat arranged on the ground floor of this converted Victorian house with access to sunny garden. The property benefits from contemporary, stylish decor throughout with wooden flooring and a wealth of character.  Further benefits include a versatile layout, a large kitchen/reception room, good storage and a delightful shared, sunny garden with an open aspect to the south-west and with side access. Furthermore, the property has a share of the freehold. Set in this desirable location, Steerforth Street is a tree-lined residential street moments from Earlsfield mainline station and the popular coffee shops, bars and restaurants of Garratt Lane. Viewing advised We currently hold lease details as displayed above, should you require further information please contact the branch. long_description: Beautifully presented one bedroom 2nd floor flat located a short walk from Battersea Park and Chelsea Bridge. Comprises good size reception room opening onto south facing private balcony, separate modern kitchen, double bedroom and stylish bathroom. Features include solid wooden flooring, gas central heating, good natural light. Well maintained Ex-Local Authority low rise block with communal gardens. Fantastic location near the Thames with excellent transport links. perfectly placed for both Queenstown Road Station (Waterloo in 8 minutes) and Battersea Park Station (Victoria in 5 minutes) and has the new Battersea Power Station Tube stop (Northern Line) also closeby. A network of local buses are on hand servicing the West End, City and surrounding areas and resident's off street parking is available via application to Wandsworth.  This property is perfect for the first time buyer or letting investor and available with no chain. Brochures Strasburg Road, London Brochure

bullet_points: Long Lease;Communal Gardens;Close to Southfields Station;Low Service Charge
long_description: ** Guide Price £450,000-£460,000** Bright and airy two bedroom apartment convienently located for access to both Southfield and Earlsfield. ** Guide Price £450,000-£460,000** This modern apartment is occupied on a second floor of a small modern development and  offers over 700 sqft of accommodation. The hallway provides access to two good sized double bedrooms, bathroom, and a generous sized open plan kitchen and dining area. Mill Court is surrounded by a lovely communal garden with a secure bike storage. Best known as the home of the Wimbledon Tennis Championships there are many other reasons why Southfields should grab your attention. The village now offers a well-stocked selection of boutique shops, restaurants and supermarkets, but has never lost its local community feel. The district line tube station has regular links into London and further South to Wimbledon. *As this is a leasehold property you are likely to be responsible for management charges and ground rent. You may also incur fees for items such as leasehold packs and in addition you will also need to check the remaining length of the lease. You must therefore consult with your legal representatives on these matters at the earliest opportunity before making a decision to purchase.* Brochures Particulars

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Catalyst Homes The Switch is available through Shared Ownership. Marketing suite and new show apartments now open Thursday- Monday â�" book a viewing today!  NOW 75% RESERVED! INCLUDES PARKING!* The Switch is part of an extensive regeneration programme, set across a large mixed-use project complete with a new purpose-built Wimbledon Football Club Stadium, which is set to transform the surrounding area. Offering a luxurious selection of 1, 2 & 3 bedroom apartments through Shared Ownership* in one of the most sought-after locations in South West London, The Switch is perfect for first-time buyers.  Plot 130 - The Sirocco Shared Ownership Cost Breakdown - 25% Share  * Full market value = £665,000 * Example 25% share price = £160,250 * Rent = £914pcm (charged at 2.2% of the unsold equity) * Estimated service charge = £311pcm Shared Ownership Cost Breakdown - 40% Share  * Full market value = £665,000 * Example 40% share price = £266,000 * Rent = £732pcm (charged at 2.2% of the unsold equity) * Estimated service charge = £311pcm Shared Ownership Cost Breakdown - 75% Share  * Full market value = £665,000 * Example 75% share price = £498,750 * Rent = £305pcm (charged at 2.2% of the unsold equity) * Estimated service charge = £311pcm How does Shared Ownership work? Shared Ownership is a Government-backed scheme for first-time buyers who are unable to afford a suitable home at the full market price. You initially purchase between 25-75% of the home's market value. You then pay subsidised rent on the remainder calculated at 2.75% per annum. Am I eligible? To be considered eligible for the Shared Ownership scheme your yearly income must be below £80,000. For London the limit is £90,000. Those who already own a home are not eligible for the scheme. You would need to sell your current home to be considered Will I need to pay a deposit? In terms of a deposit you will need 5% of the percentage of the home you're purchasing. Kitchens come with fully integrated appliances, designer units and stone worktops. Bath and shower rooms offer oak veneered alcoves, porcelain tiled floors and walls and chrome- plated fixings. Bedrooms feature floor-to-ceiling fitted wardrobes, brushed metal sockets and subtle  light grey carpets. All apartments at The Switch are offered on the  Shared Ownership scheme, making them ideal for  first-time buyers. Don't miss out on coming to view these stunning apartments - register your interest now We look forward to seeing you soon!  Financials  Length of lease: 250 years  Annual ground rent: £350 per annum from final staircasing  Ground rent review period: 25 years  Annual service charge: £3.50 per sq.ft Service charge review period: Yearly Council tax band: (E £2171.23, F 2566.00, G £2960.77, H £3552.92) As a shared owner, youâ��ll pay rent for the percentage of the property that you donâ��t yet own. Every year, we calculate your new rent and will write to you to confirm what your new rent will be. Depending on your new home, youâ��ll also pay a service charge. This covers a proportion of the cost for the services, management and maintenance of the your building and development where you live. Your lease will detail whatâ��s down to you in terms of repairing and maintaining your home. To find out more visit   and speak to our sales team. station_info: [(0.3, 'Clapham Junction Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-overground'), (0.8, 'Imperial Wharf Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (1.0, 'Wandsworth Town Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 155 years remaining The Property A perfectly formed 2 double bedroom flat in a quiet corner of SW London.  Looking around, one would not be aware of the fact that you are in fact only moments away from Clapham Junction.   At 635 sqft, there is plenty of room here and there is a lovely balance of space and sense of proportion. The flat would suit people looking for a home or someone looking for a good investment - flats like this in this area rent very easily. This area has always been immensely popular and the location is special. It has deservedly earned itself the reputation as a great place to live. There is a real buzz in this part of town and one is spoilt for choice with all the pubs, bars and restaurants locally as well as both Wandsworth and Clapham Commons. Transport is another strong point here with both the A205 South Circular and the A3 being a short drive away and Clapham Junction (a few hundred metres walk) providing great services for those wishing to commute to the City or West End for example. Organise a viewing through our 24/7 Purplebricks booking app Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

SOLD WITH NO ONWARD CHAIN AND THE BENEFIT OF THE LOFT DEMISED - An exceptional first floor two bedroom period maisonette situated on one of Tooting Bec’s most sought after roads. Stapleton Road is located on a quiet one way road, a stone’s throw from the tube station, at 905 SqFt this substantial first floor property offers two generously sized double bedrooms both with original feature fireplaces. There is a beautiful full width West facing reception room to the front of the property with a large bay window, sash windows and a feature fireplace. To the rear of the flat is a modern kitchen/dining room with an external staircase to the private South West facing rear garden.  This exceptional maisonette has the added benefit of being sold with a 125 year lease and the loft demised.  Stapleton Road is ideally located with excellent transport links including Tooting Bec Underground station. Balham and Wandsworth Common stations are easily accessible as are the extensive green spaces of Tooting Bec Common and many local amenities, including Tooting Bec, Balham and Tooting Broadway Market. long_description: A beautifully presented four bedroom house moments from Battersea Bridge. The house enjoys ample, light living space on the ground and lower ground floors with bifolding doors onto a South facing rear patio garden as well as a spacious principal bedroom with dressing area and en suite bathroom occupying the whole first floor. Battersea Church Road leads into Battersea Square with its popular 'open air' restaurants and shops. Further shops and restaurants can be found on Battersea Bridge Road as well as access to Chelsea being a short walk over Battersea Bridge. Transport north of the river is on Battersea Bridge Road and a "Hoppa" bus runs along Battersea Church Road from Victoria Station south to Clapham Junction.  In addition there is a peak hour river taxi to the City and docklands that travels along The River Thames.  Brochures Particulars

bullet_points: Four bedroom maisonette;Spilt level;Two bathrooms;Rear garden;Dressing room;Well presented;No onward chain;Good location
long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with C James & Co Four bedroom purpose built, split level maisonette with rear garden Offered for sale is this large split level purpose built period maisonette. This home has been extended into the loft space which has bestowed this already spacious property with a further two bedrooms, a principal bedroom and a box room/study.  In addition to this there is a large and well fitted dressing room leading into an equally impressive shower/wet room. On the first floor are a further two double bedrooms, another bathroom and a very good size lounge with a period fire place giving a good focal point. A kitchen to the rear with stable doors leading to a staircase onto a private rear garden further compliments this remarkable property. This home is in great condition but has served as a family home, this in my opinion still leaves room for a new owner to put their own personal touch to the property and even reconfiguration to individual needs. Situated in Tooting Graveney in the heart of Tooting, Bickley Street is located off Tooting Broadway and runs parallel to Tooting High Street. Wandsworth Council, Tax Band C, £769.83 pa, 974yr lease Brochures Bickley Street, Tooting, Tooting EPC Brochure

bullet_points: EWS1 COMPLIANT;766sq.ft (71sq.m);No Chain;Secure Underground Parking;2 Bedrooms;South-West Facing;2 Bathrooms (1 En-Suite);Directly Opposite Battersea Power Station Tube Station;Residents Gym & Concierge;Wandsworth Council Tax Band E
station_info: [(0.1, 'Battersea Power Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.3, 'Battersea Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.4, 'Queenstown Road (Battersea) Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: A bright and spacious 2-bedroom apartment of 766sq.ft (71sq.m) available in Viridian Apartments, a modern development in Nine Elms. The apartment has been well maintained and is in a quiet position overlooking Thessaly Road and further benefits from an open plan reception room with floor to ceiling windows and access to a full width private terrace with a bright South-West facing aspect and views of Battersea Power Station. This apartment also comprises 2 spacious bedrooms, 1 en-suite bathroom, a well-equipped kitchen, good storage throughout and benefits from a secure underground parking space. Viridian Apartments is a popular development in a fantastic location and residents benefit from a 24-hour concierge service, roof terraces with panoramic views of London and a well-equipped gymnasium. Battersea Power Station tube station is now open and located directly opposite the building, providing access to the Northern Line allowing very easy access throughout London. The rail links of Battersea Park and Queenstown Road are also a short walk away, as are the green open spaces of Battersea Park. The redevelopment of Battersea Power Station is also directly opposite the building, with the shopping centre at the Power Station due to open this Autumn highlighting the exciting transformation of the area that residents will benefit from. Leasehold: 141 Years Remaining  Service Charges: Approx. £5,000 per annum (includes heating & hot water charges)  Ground Rent: £320 per annum  Council Tax band: E - Wandsworth Council (total: £1,097.90 per annum 2022/2023). Brochures Viridian Apartments, 75 Battersea Park Road, Londo Brochure

station_info: [(0.5, 'Queenstown Road (Battersea) Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.6, 'Battersea Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.9, 'Clapham Junction Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-overground')]
long_description: At just under 2400 square feet, this is a well presented Victorian house situated on one of Battersea's most sought after roads, just off Prince of Wales Drive and moments from Battersea Park. There are five bedrooms, a separate study and a stunning main suite on the top floor. The house enjoys high ceilings throughout, wonderful proportions and a west facing garden. Should there be the need for even more space, there is also scope to extend further by way of a basement excavation (subject to obtaining the necessary consents), like others have done already on the road. Beechmore Road runs between Prince of Wales Drive and Battersea Park Road. There are local shops and restaurants on Battersea Park Road together with bus routes that run to Victoria and Liverpool Street.  Battersea Park and Queenstown Road mainline stations, with services to Victoria and Waterloo respectively, are close by. The wonderful open spaces and leisure facilities of Battersea Park are moments away.  ENTRANCE HALL Encased radiator. Cornicing. Corbels. Wooden floor. Dado rail. Spotlights. Storage cupboard containing hanging rail and shelving. DOUBLE RECEPTION ROOM Bay sash windows to front. Cornicing. Wooden floors. Fireplace with marble surround and slate hearth. Double glass doors leading to: KITCHEN BREAKFAST ROOM Window to rear. Range of wall mounted and base units. Gaggenau four ring induction hob with extractor hob above. Marble work surfaces. Inset stainless sink steel with mixer tap and further drinking tap. Two integrated Gaggenau electric ovens. Integrated fridge freezer. Spotlights. Glass ceiling side return. French doors leading to: GARDEN Paved with boarders containing shrubs. Lighting. CLAOKROOM Wooden floor. Wash hand basin. W.C. Spotlights. CELLAR Space and plumbing for washing machine and tumble dryer. Sink stainless steel sink. Gas and electric meters. Fuse box. FIRST FLOOR BEDROOM Sash window to rear. Fitted wardrobes containing shelving and hanging. Further cupboard containing wash hand basin with mixer tap and mirror above. Spotlights. BATHROOM Sash window and further window to side. bullet_points: Nearly 500Sqft.;Own Front Door;Excellent Location close to Chelsea and Battersea Park;Private Patio Garden;Long Leasehold;Low Service Charge & Ground Rent

long_description: A lovely, spacious maisonette perfectly located a short walk from Battersea Park and Chelsea. This lovely property briefly comprises a large reception room with feature fire place and high ceilings and a large sash window, the kitchen is a galley style and is well appointed with plenty of storage. The corridor leads to the master bedroom with a lovely aspect to the patio garden and ample storage. To the rear of the property is the bathroom suite, set with modern metro tiles with a bath and shower above. The property further benefits from a private west facing patio garden to the rear, perfect for a summer BBQ or morning coffee. The property further benefits from its own font door and two large storage cupboards under the pavement to the front of the property. This property is being sold chain free with a long lease. This well configured one bedroom apartment is available on a fully furnished basis from late July. The property briefly comprises a spacious living room, double bedroom and fully fitted kitchen with dishwasher and gas oven leading through to the private garden and bathroom.   The flat is located just moments from Battersea Park and the scenic promenades of the River Thames; as well as the excellent range of shops, restaurants and bars on Battersea Park Road and the more exclusive range of boutiques and bars in Chelsea and King's Road just across the river. The nearest station is Clapham Junction (National Rail), which offers regular services both in and out of London. There is also a good bus service just a few yards away offering easy access to Vauxhall and Victoria Underground stations. Brochures Particulars

bullet_points: Neutrally decorated;Separate kitchen;Private balcony;Modern bathroom;Off-street parking;Amenities within easy reach;Council Tax: Band B
station_info: [(0.6, 'Wandsworth Common Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.8, 'Clapham Junction Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-overground'), (0.8, 'Wandsworth Town Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: A stylish, modern one bedroom flat with balcony overlooking Wandsworth Common. This bright and airy flat is on the third floor of a popular purpose built building with lifts and benefits from leafy views of Wandsworth Common. The accommodation comprises: a spacious living room with dual aspect windows which floods the room with light, a separate fully-fitted kitchen, a large double bedroom with built in wardrobe, modern bathroom with shower over bath, spacious balcony, good storage and off street parking. The property is well connected via the transport links at Clapham Junction and Wandsworth Common stations (BR). Fitzhugh Grove benefits from a strong community presence, and the estate has recently opened a flourishing community garden. Wandsworth has a lot to offer families and sharers alike. Wandsworth Town has the Southside shopping centre including large cinema and gym, then Closer to Wandsworth Common is Bellevue Road which is home to a string of fantastic shops, popular bars and a Michelin starred restaurant. Transport links at Wandsworth Town and Common offer easy access into Central London. The area is typified by delightful Victorian terraced houses whereas the prestigious ‘Toast Rack’ area offers generous family accommodation. This property would be perfect for a first time buyer or a fantastic investment opportunity. Brochures Particulars

long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 999 years remaining The Modern, Embassy Gardens 4th Floor - MB0412    This amazing 1,089msqft 3 bedroom apartment boasts a fully integrated kitchen and appliances with custom wardrobes in the bedrooms and bespoke bathrooms and a 101sqft balcony.  Each apartment has its own aspect, whether that's looking up to the Sky Pool, across to the US Embassy, or into one of our beautiful garden squares  The aesthetic is inspired by classic 1950s American design which manifests itself through the creative use of space, materials and detailing. Generous spaces and floor to ceiling windows together with materials such as marble and walnut parquet flooring quietly impart quality and class, reinforcing the sense of solidity and enduring good taste.   About Embassy Gardens   Embassy Gardens is a 21st-century development on the South Bank of London, looking across the River Thames to Chelsea and Kensington. With its own green space, art trail, shops, restaurants and cafés, Embassy Gardens offers residents and their guests the complete London experience in the centre of the city.   3 minute walk to the new Nine Elms tube station  10 minute walk to Vauxhall overground/tube station   7 minutes to Oxford Circus from Vauxhall station  12 minutes to Eurostar and Kings Cross from Vauxhall station   24 minute walk to Battersea Park   Less than 40 minutes to London Gatwick, Heathrow and London City Airports   All Embassy Garden residents gain exclusive membership to the Eg:le Club which grants our residents and their guests access to the Sky Deck with Sky Pool and Orangery rooftop bar, Maureen O'Hara private cinema, Belmont Gym and so much more.  Residents at Embassy gardens will be able to float through the air in the world's one and only Sky Pool. Spanning the Embassy Gardens' Legacy Buildings, the Sky Pool is the world's first 'floating' swimming pool. Once installed, the 25-metre long acrylic pool will allow members of the development's exclusive Eg:le Club to glide between buildings 35 metres up in the sky.

bullet_points: Five Bedrooms;Exciting Refurb Opportunity;Excellent School Catchments;Garage;Generous Rear Garden;No Chain
long_description: SUMMARY Offering fantastic refurbishment potential this semi-detached house is conveniently situated on a prestigious residential street in Southfields. The property has the potential for a variety of extension options, and is offered to the market with the added benefit of no onward chain. DESCRIPTION Offering fantastic refurbishment potential this semi-detached house is conveniently situated on a prestigious residential street in Southfields.  Downstairs the property currently comprises of a kitchen diner, a double reception room, a downstairs w/c and an integral garage. On the first floor there are five generous bedrooms, a family bathroom and a separate  w/c, as well as access to a large loft area which could be suitable for conversion (STPP). The property may also have potential for extension to the side and rear (STPP), and although there is a lean to extension at the rear currently, this area of the house require immediate structural attention.  Further benefiting from off road parking to the front, a front garden, a very generous rear garden and also falling within excellent school catchments, the house would make an ideal family home. Offered chain free, an early internal viewing is highly recommended to avoid disappointment. long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 123 years remaining The Property A luxury one bedroom apartment overlooking the highly sought after Embassy Gardens development. These properties very rarely come to the market and you can see why - people want them as a high spec, modern property to live in or as ideal investments.  This property boasts a large open plan kitchen and living area, double bedroom, bathroom, in built storage and a private balcony with views of a manicured garden and courtyard. This area has, in a very short period of time, deservedly earned itself the reputation as a great place to live.  This stretch of the Thames has been regenerated as part of the Battersea Power Station and Nine Elms development project, alongside the American Embassy.   The property itself is closely situated to Battersea Park as well as being only a 10 minute walk to Vauxhall, Battersea Power Station and Nine Elms stations.  Local residents benefit from great locals bars, eateries and supermarkets. Viewing highly recommended via the 24/7 Purplebricks booking system Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. bullet_points: Spacious Kitchen / Diner;Split Level;Over 1500sqft;Large Eaves Storage;Light and Bright
long_description: Marsh & Parsons is pleased to present this incredible 1500sqft split level flat in the heart of the Nightingale Triangle. This property is a must see for anyone wanting living space and a sense of grandeur, with large windows, high ceilings, a beautiful feature fireplace and a spacious kitchen/diner. The kitchen is newly renovated with integrated appliances (including a dishwasher as well as a large gas hob and double oven). Being on the upper floors, this property is flooded with natural light, brought to life beautifully in the kitchen which has quality bifold doors and sky lights to give the indoor-outdoor living feeling. Upstairs the property has two large double bedrooms with built in storage, ideal to rent a room, use as a study or have guests over. The split-level nature gives a feeling of being in house whilst having security of being an upper floor. Balham Grove is situated seconds from Waitrose and the shops, cafés and restaurants of Balham High road. Transport links are excellent with Balham station offering easy access into The City via the northern line and overground trains running to Victoria via Clapham Junction. There are also frequent buses servicing local areas. Council Tax Band - D Brochures Particulars

The property is presented in excellent order throughout and benefits from a garage in a nearby block.  The front door opens to a spacious hallway which opens up to a stunning open plan kitchen / living area with access to a private balcony. There is also generous built-in storage on this floor and a separate W/C. On the upper level there are large double bedrooms and a smaller double room, all with built-in wardrobes. There is also a modern family bathroom and storage cupboard on the landing.   The property is within easy reach to local buses that take you to Putney, Barnes, and Central London. Richmond Park and Wimbledon Common are close by and Roehampton University and the local amenities are also just a short walk away. The property comprises of its own private entrance, a large open plan living space with high ceilings and retains many of its original features. A modern fitted kitchen with space to dine with a large double bedroom and contemporary bathroom. The property further benefits from a front garden with off street parking for two cars, a share of the freehold, distinctive architectural features, a combination boiler and fitted white goods. This property is light and spacious and is a must see. The property is within easy reach of all the amenities of the surrounding area including, Richmond Park, access to the A3, Barnes Station is a five minute walk away with regular bus services into town running every four minutes. bullet_points: Private balcony with stunning views*;Zoned under-floor heating;Integrated kitchen appliances by Siemens;24-hour estate CCTV and security;12-hour daytime concierge;Secure bicycle storage;Private resident's roof terrace, with children's play area;Excellent transport links to London and Surrey;North-East facing;Excellent transport links to London and the beautiful Surrey;Wandsworth Town and East Putney Tube stations less than 15 minutes' walk away;Abundance of green space, with King George's Park right at your doorstep;All the amenities you need just a stones throw away;Private balcony and residents roof terrace;Daytime concierge services;Siemens integrated appliances;Hardwood flooring with zoned underfloor heating;Less than 15 minutes walk to Wandsworth town station, East Putney Tube Station and the Thames Clipper;Steps away from Southside Shopping Centre
long_description: ABOUT BRONZE   Luxury open plan apartment benefiting from high-end specification, large terraced balcony and storage space.   Ready for you to move in and start enjoying the stunning King George's Park and an abundance of amenities on your doorstep.   Excellent transport links to London and the beautiful Surrey.  High speed broadband ready for those working from home.  SPECIFICATION   *	Feature interior designed entrance lobby *	Engineered grey hardwood flooring to halls and living areas *	Handless kitchen units with soft close doors *	Mirrored bronze glass splashback *	Integrated Siemens fridge freezer and dishwasher  *	Integrated extractor *	Feature LED lighting to wall units *	Centralized heating system *	Zoned under-floor heating *	LED down-lighters throughout *	High-speed fiber optic broadband available *	Fully tiled bathrooms and shower rooms *	Composite stone countertop to bathrooms/shower rooms *	Brushed chrome heated towel rail to all bathrooms *	Full height fitted wardrobes with bronze tinted mirror doors in the bedrooms *	Carpet in beach pebble color, hardwood flooring to studio  ABOUT THE AREA   All the amenities you need are on your doorstep.   Explore the green spaces of King George's Park or watch the latest blockbusters at Cineworld.  Shop at Waitrose or Planet Organic.  Short walk to Old York Road where you can enjoy the many independent restaurants.  Stroll or go for a run by the Thames on the weekend.  Easy access to the rest of London with Wandsworth town station, East Putney Tube Station and the Thames Clipper all less than  15 minutes' walk  away.  At Bronze, you can truly enjoy the best of London life.  ABOUT STRAWBERRY STAR   We are Strawberry Star - an international company with a mission to build  quality homes  for aspiring homebuyers.  We focus on unique, quality homes at  prices  that are  achievable  to everyone.  From first- time buyers, young families, commuting professionals, local home-movers, buy-to-let investors, and international buyers in Greater London and the commuter towns.  On Completion, we do not hand you over to another company. Instead, we provide  continuity of service  and stay on to manage the estate as no one else will know the development and your home as we do.   *CGIs are for illustrative purposes only. Actual show home photography.  BOOK YOUR VIEWING TODAY

bullet_points: Victorian house;Four bedrooms;Two living rooms;Kitchen;Two bathrooms;Garden;Cellar;Cloakroom;1645 sq ft;Chain free
long_description: This lovely four double bedroom house, which has Clapham Common at one end of the road, has already had the loft extended but does offer the potential to extend further on the ground floor (STPP).  There are plenty of period features such as the original wooden floors which run throughout the ground floor, into the living room, dining room and kitchen.  French doors lead out into the gorgeous garden with a lawn at the front and decking at the rear, taking advantage of the afternoon sunshine.  It would also be an ideal spot to build a garden office.  Upstairs there the four double bedrooms and two large family bathrooms.  There is also a cellar, perfect for storage and a cloakroom on the ground floor.  The house has the additional benefit of being sold chain free. Situation Alderbrook Road is a very quiet, residential road about a third of a mile from Clapham South tube station with services into the West End and the City.  There is a huge collection of supermarkets, shops and restaurants in Balham, the vast majority of which are less than half a mile away from the house.  A great selection of great primary schools are in the area, both private and state, such as Oliver House, Hornsby House, Alderbrook, Broomwood and Holy Ghost. Additional Information Council Tax: Band F Brochures Particulars

Further benefits include sash windows and wooden floorboards. long_description: Tenure:  Freehold A fantastic family home, situated in the popular Furzedown area, offering a bright and airy front reception room, three bedrooms, two bathrooms, an eat-in kitchen and a good sized west facing garden. Presented to a high standard, this mid terrace house has the scope to extend both into the loft to create extra bedrooms and to extend to the rear (SSTP). Location Nimrod Road runs between Moyser Road and Southcoft Road, and is close to the bus routes to Tooting Boadway and Streatham.  The nearest stations are Tooting Overground (Thameslink) and Tooting Broadway Underground (Northern Line). Moyser Road has a wide variety of shops, including an artisanal pizza restaurant, fishmonger, coffee shop and Art Gallery. In 2018 the Sunday Times rated Furzedown as one of the 10 best places to live in London. Green spaces nearby include Tooting Bec Common and Tooting Bec Lido is a popular attraction in the summer months. Schools Close by, Ofsted rated "good" schools include Furzedown and Penwortham Primary Schools.  The nearest Secondary is Graveney School, rated outstanding by Ofsted. Reference Number IS0028 - Iain Selwyn-Reeves is a Bespoke Estate Agency with 15 years local market experience powered by eXp. Viewings are Strictly by Appointment via eXp as Sole Agents in the sale of the property.    Brochures Brochure 1

long_description: An immaculate four bedroom house with off-street parking.  Description Arranged over three beautifully presented floors is this sensational four bedroom house boasting over 2190 sqft of well-organized living and entertaining space.  The ground floor is composed of two spacious reception rooms, the foremost boasting a gorgeous square bay window and a functioning wood burner and the latter providing a relaxed kitchen snug area, equally a perfect home office space. The kitchen is situated to the rear of the property with a  ribbon of skylights flooding the room with natural light throughout the day. The kitchen is fitted with a variety of integrated appliances such as an Everhot as well as a gas hob, electric oven and log burning stove. The dining space comfortably seats eight and a central island provides a convenient breakfast bar. Large glass doors lead onto the 43ft carefully planted and incredibly private patio garden, the garden has a raised section at the back with a wooden veranda, a wonderful space to enjoy during the sunnier months. The ground floor further benefits from a W.C and access to the cellar, currently used as the utility/ laundry room.  The first floor holds three immaculate bedrooms all with built in wardrobes, maximizing floorspace. One of these bedrooms benefits from an ensuite shower room whilst the other two bedrooms are served by a modern family bathroom. The second floor holds the principal suite which provides an abundance of storage, both wardrobes and in the eaves and an ensuite bathroom with double vanity and bath. Location St Ann's Hill is a popular residential road in Wandsworth, close to a number of  schools, with a good repute locally, and located moments from numerous parks, Old York Road, Southside Centre and Sainsburys on Garratt Lane. There is ample amounts of green space nearby, with Wandsworth Common, Wandsworth Park and St Georges Park a short distance away. Transport links are excellent; Wandsworth Town Station is easily accessible as is Clapham Junction Station, providing services along with numerous bus routes to central London and the City. Square Footage: 2,191 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: This exemplary two-bedroom apartment, with swimming pool, gym, roof terrace and 24-hour porter is situated on the second floor of Hightrees House, a beautifully maintained residential Art Deco block on the south side of Clapham Common. The building was completed in 1938 to a design by RWH Jones, renowned architect of the much-celebrated Saltdean Lido. The apartment was renovated and re-wired around 10 years ago. Many original features have been retained including brass ironmongery, cast-iron radiators, and in the bathroom, an original steel towel rail. Internal accommodation extends to approximately 700 sq ft and is accessed by lift from the ground floor lobby. Entry is through the original front door.  A long corridor extends along one side of the flat with rooms branching off, each looking outward pver Clapham Common through original Crittal windows. The flat is flooded with natural light. The reconfiguration has been designed to maximize storage. In the kitchen, appliances are neatly integrated. In the master bedroom, a bespoke sliding-door wardrobe has been installed.  A full renovation of the building was also completed a few years ago, and a substantial sinking fund exists for any future works. A beacon of luxury living at its conception, the building also contains an indoor swimming pool, gym, communal gardens and an expansive roof terrace with wonderful views over the tennis courts and green open spaces of Clapham Common. Secure bicycle storage is also provided. Hightrees House is brilliantly located for the bars, restaurants, and independent shops of Clapham Common, Balham and Northcote Road. From Michelin starred restaurants such as Chez Bruce on Wandsworth Common, to the more rustic local delights of Balham Bowls Club, there is a broad range of facilities within easy walking distance. There are local weekly farmers and food markets on Venn Street and in Balham, and the excellent Moxon’s fishmonger is a three-minute walk. The Clapham Picture House shows both mainstream and independent films and the common itself offers a programme of live entertainment and events, along with basketball courts, tennis courts, batting nets, childrens’ play areas and a bowls club.  Tenure: Shared Freehold Council Tax: D Lease Remaining: 985 Current ground rent: £0.00  Ground rent review period: every 1 year Annual ground rent increase: 1%

long_description: A wonderful four bedroom, terraced family house, located on a popular road in Wandsworth.  Description Arranged over three beautifully presented floors is this superb four bedroom family home providing a wealth of well-organized accommodation. Upon entry you are welcomed into a spacious hallway which leads into the double reception, benefitting from wonderfully high ceilings and and a pretty bay window letting light flood in. To the rear of the ground floor is the open-plan kitchen/ dining room that is fitted with a central island and a range cooker as well as a plenty of space to seat six at the dining table. Two over head skylights and bi-folding doors to the rear open up the kitchen space providing a wonderful space to entertain and enjoy. This property enjoy the use of an approximately 25ft garden which is laid mostly to Astro style lawn with patios to the rear and front, perfect for alfresco dining in the sunnier months. The ground floor also benefits from the use of a W.C. The first floor houses three double bedrooms, two of which have built in wardrobes. These bedrooms are served by a large family bathroom fitted with a walk-in shower. The second floor completes the property with the fourth double bedroom that also has a Juliette balcony. There is a second family bathroom on this level fitted with a roll top bathtub. Location Brocklebank Road is a quiet tree lined street close to the green open space of Wandsworth Common. Ideally located for all the amenities of Garratt Lane, as well as the excellent choice of shops and restaurants in both Earlsfield and the Southside Centre. The area is renowned for its excellent choice of schools and there is good transport from both Wandsworth Town and Earlsfield mainline stations. Square Footage: 1,556 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Prime London This exceptional and brand new 953 sq ft / 88.5 sq m two bedroom two bathroom apartment, set in a prime position within the Battersea Roof Gardens phase of the highly desirable Battersea Power Station development (next to the River Thames, Battersea Park and the upcoming Battersea Power Station Northern Line station), is available for off-plan sale through Prime London. Finished to an incredibly high standard throughout, this apartment comprises of open-plan fully equipped and integrated kitchen and reception room leading to a substantial private winter garden and balcony. The property further comprises two well-proportioned double bedrooms with built in wardrobes and dressing area, a further private balcony, and two family bathrooms, one of which is en suite. Resident facilities include a first-class 24-hour concierge, on-site gym, a rooftop infinity pool boasting views over Battersea Power Station, spa, cinema, games room, meeting room and a 250-square-meter roof garden designed by New York landscape firm James Corner Field Operations.  The Skyline section of the Battersea Power Station development is designed as an undulating volume containing shops, a medical centre, and the hotel – which will be operated by boutique brand Art'otel. Art'otel also plans to create an elevated bar and restaurant offering panoramic views of the city skyline, as well as a public art gallery accompanied by a lounge and cafe. The Battersea Power Station is a vibrant new destination for London, creating a new community of homes, shops, cafes, offices, leisure, and cultural venues, with over 19 acres of public space. The brand-new Zone 1 Tube station, meanwhile, will provide excellent connectivity to the rest of London, with Waterloo (7 minutes), London Bridge (10 minutes), Bank (12 minutes), and King's Cross (20 minutes) all within easy reach. *Images and location plan are for illustrative purposes only, and are intended as an approximate guide* Brochures Full Details

long_description: A substantial family home with wonderful living and entertaining space overlooking Wandsworth Common.  Description Set back from the road behind a pretty front garden is this immaculate five bedroom family home overlooking Wandsworth Common.  Upon entering the property you are greeted by a long hallway with tessellated flooring which leads into the grand double reception room, of which has retained many of its original features including two ornate fireplaces and panelled ceilings. A glass door leads into the beautifully extended kitchen/ dining room. The contemporary kitchen benefits from another fireplace and a wide range of units including a central island with breakfast bar. There is ample space for dining, and French doors open onto a well-maintained, mature, South--facing garden which is laid mostly to Astro-Turf with boarders for planting and a patio perfect for alfresco dining in the warmer months. There is also a W.C and access to the cellar on the ground floor.  The first floor is comprised of three large double bedrooms all with built in cabinetry served by a family bathroom that benefits from both wall mounted bath and walk in shower. Second floor completes the property with two further double bedrooms and a family bathroom with access to a large eaves storage space. Location Heathfield Road is a pretty tree-lined road overlooking Wandsworth Common. It is ideally located just over the common from the wonderful shops and restaurants on the Bellevue Road and Northcote Road. The area is renowned for its choice of schools, both state and private. Transport is excellent with trains from Wandsworth Town and Clapham Junction mainline station, as well as a variety of bus routes close at hand. Square Footage: 3,174 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

The property has recently been renovated and is situated in-between Southfields and Putney with exceptional transport links. A sweeping driveway leads to the imposing entrance and the flat has its own internal staircase leading up to a wide welcoming hallway. From here you get a sense of the great proportions and natural light this flat has to offer. Three bedrooms, many with terrific views, are serviced by a bathroom and ensuite to the principal bedroom. The double aspect open plan kitchen/dining/sitting room is a delightful entertaining space with a fully fitted kitchen opening to a well-defined dining and living area. To the rear is a south-facing garden shared by three of the five flats and to the front the flat is granted an off road parking space. long_description: An exceptionally stylish family home with off-street parking, beautifully landscaped private garden and highly practical garden studio in the prestigious Emerald Square community.  The current owner has taken the solid bones of the original townhouse and lavished enormous attention to detail to create a luxury interior-designed finish throughout, maximising the sense of light and the potential for storage.  The property offers flexible accommodation for every demographic. On the ground floor accommodation there is a large open-plan kitchen reception room which leads directly into the sophisticated and easy-to-maintain landscaped private garden. The ground floor study could be used as a fifth bedroom for guests, with a guest shower room / cloakroom next door. There is a dedicated separate laundry room.  At the end of the garden a modern studio room offers a flexible space that could be a home office or kid’s den. On the first floor there is a spacious main bedroom suite with fitted cupboards and luxury en-suite bathroom, which offers a bath and separate double width walk-in shower. The first floor reception room allows further flexibility for entertaining and like the ground floor reception opens out to further elegant private outside space: a heated terrace with awning that can be enjoyed all year around.  On the top floor there is a further bedroom suite with its own private west facing terrace. Then two further bedrooms, a family bathroom and huge and easily accessible loft storage. Situation Emerald Square is a well maintained and exceptionally quiet, private estate that has established itself as a safe place to call home. There is a bus stop outside the estate that means the location is well-connected to tube and train links into town. The house is also moments from Richmond Park and in close proximity to a selection of excellent schools. Additional Information Freehold Estate Charge: £1,100 per annum.  Council Tax: Band G Brochures Particulars

long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 97 years remaining The Property Stunning two bedroom ground floor maisonette with private low maintenance garden and own entrance, enviably located in the sought after Furzedown area of Tooting, close to excellent transport links and amenities.  The property has been beautifully appointed with stylish interiors throughout, whilst also retaining the elegance and style of this period building with a wealth of original features including large windows, high ceilings, cornicing and wood flooring.  Further features include a light and spacious reception room with ornate fireplace, well equipped kitchen, modern bathroom, gas central heating, double glazing and ample inbuilt storage.   Accommodation comprises entrance hall with lovely front door with stained glass insert and deep understairs storage, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with attractive square bay to front and feature cast iron fireplace with tiled insert and wooden surround.  The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances.  There are two well sized bedrooms, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.   The property is enviably located within easy access of Streatham, Streatham Common and Tooting stations, all providing excellent links into Central London. Nearby Streatham High Road provides a fashionable array of shops, bars, restaurants and amenities and the area is also well-served by well respected local schools, including Penwortham and Goldfinch Primary Schools. long_description: This beautiful four double bedroom, two bathroom luxury apartment boasts access to a stunning private roof terrace. The property is located on a popular residential road in the heart of Furzedown, Wandsworth.  Offering over 1100 sq.ft of living and entertaining space, split over two floors. The apartment comprises of a modern kitchen with AEG integrated appliances with polished granite counter tops, a light and airy reception room with a beautiful radius window and liberty white marble fire place.   The four double bedrooms are very well proportioned. One is currently being used as a second living room, giving access to the stunning roof terrace with stone marble tiling and obscured safety glass surround. There is good storage throughout the property, and the split level element makes this luxury apartment feel like you have an entire house.   Ribblesdale road is situated within the highly acclaimed Furzedown location. A wide range of local amenities can be found within easy reach of Balham, Moyser Road and Tooting High Road and Tooting Bec Common. Transport links are found a short walk away at Tooting Bec Underground (Northern Line) and Balham Underground and overground providing access to London Bridge, Victoria and Clapham Junction.  The information contained in these particulars is for general information purposes only. Douglas & Gordon does not provide information or give any warranty with regards to train, tube, tram lines or flight paths. Prospective purchasers or tenants are advised to carry out their own research if they have any concern about train, tube, tram lines or flight paths. Brochures More details

bullet_points: Semi-Detached Family Home;Six Bedrooms;Four Bathrooms;Heaver Estate;No Onward Chain;South Facing Garden
long_description: A fantastic opportunity to acquire an extended semi-detached house spanning in excess of 3200sqft.This Victorian family home is offered to the market in good condition and with no onward chain. The ground floor has been extended and opened up to create a fabulous open plan living space with a reception room to the front and the kitchen and dining space to the rear with bifolding doors leading out on to a mature south facing garden. The basement has been converted to create a further reception room, bedroom, utility area and a WC. The top two floors consist of five/six double bedrooms, four of which have en-suites. Located on Ritherdon Road, in the heart of the Heaver Estate, this beautiful home is within easy reach of Balham where there are a large variety of restaurants and bars, as well as shops and supermarkets. Balham also offers excellent transport links by way of the underground, offering northern line services, and the mainline with easy links to the city. Tooting Bec Common is also within easy reach located at the top of Bedford Hill. Brochures Brochure 1

bullet_points: Two Double Bedrooms And 2 Bathrooms;2 Bathrooms;Private Garden;Family Bathroom And Ensuite Upstairs;Open Plan Kitchen Reception Room;Ground Floor Flat;Cellar;Good Transport Links;Quiet Residential Area;Close To Lavender Hill And Northcote Road
station_info: [(0.5, 'Clapham Junction Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-overground'), (0.8, 'Queenstown Road (Battersea) Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.9, 'Wandsworth Road Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: The Property An eclectic property that mixes historic features and modern amenities, paired with a tranquil private garden that washes away the stress of the city. This two bed, two bath, Share of Freehold flat sits on a quiet residential street, and the open plan kitchen/reception/dining area offers a spacious layout to enjoy sunlight streaming through the large bay windows. Featuring original Victorian mouldings, a working gas fireplace, high ceilings and a handy cellar, this property (with potential to extend) has kept its charm through modern renovations which include double glazed timber doors and windows on the entire ground floor. The flat is made more unique in that the second bedroom is located on the upper floor, a real luxury complete with an ensuite bathroom and shower. This layout offers exceptional privacy for all residents, and even comes with a priceless view of the Shard. The property’s best kept secret waits in the master bedroom, where French doors open to the secluded garden, and you just might forget you’re actually in London. A stone path also leads directly from the kitchen to the garden, adding a wonderful sense of continuous space and making it perfect for barbecues and outdoor dining. Nearby Lavender Hill offers every convenience one could ever need, while trendy Northcote Rd is full of delectable restaurants, bars, and a score of independent shops. Clapham Common and Battersea Park are just a short walk away and the diverse transport links at Clapham Junction provide an easy hop to Victoria, Waterloo, Shoreditch, Gatwick, or practically any shortcut you can imagine. Lastly, if you’ve little ones to consider, the selection of outstanding schools and nurseries is second to none. This area has continually earned a reputation as a great place to live or invest, and has thoroughly justified that.  Viewings can be booked 24/7 via the Purplebricks website. Share of Freehold Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure
