station_info: [(0.2, 'Merton Park Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink'), (0.3, 'Dundonald Road Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink'), (0.4, 'South Wimbledon Station', 'svg-underground')]
long_description: A beautifully presented extended four bedroom end of terrace house, located in the centre of Wimbledon Town.  Description A superb four bedroom family house located in the very popular Ministers area of Wimbledon in the heart of Wimbledon Town. The property is arranged across three floors and offers well-balanced accommodation for family living and entertaining.  On the ground floor to the rear is a wonderful extended family kitchen/dining room which benefits from an abundance of natural light. A contemporary German kitchen features an extensive range of units and cupboards, fully integrated Miele appliances and a large kitchen island. A large picture window overlooks  a private, paved rear garden. To the front is a generous double reception room with attractive wood flooring and fire place. The house also benefits from a downstairs cloakroom.  Upstairs, on the first floor there are two double bedrooms, a single bedroom and a family bathroom. The principal bedroom is located on the top floor with a stylish en suite shower room and useful eaves storage. Chain free. Location Russell Road is a popular residential street in the centre of Wimbledon Town just off the Broadway, 800m approx. from the train station. Wimbledon rail station (approx. 17 minutes to London Waterloo) and underground District line provide easy access into the West end and the City. South Wimbledon Northern line underground is within 650 metres, as are the shops, cinema, supermarkets and restaurants of Wimbledon Town. There are a great selection of schools locally, with St Mary's RC Primary school located on Russell Road. Wimbledon Village with its cafes, restaurants and pretty boutiques is 1 mile approx. away as is Wimbledon Common with 1200 acres of open space to golf, horse ride, cycle and walk. Travel times provided by   Distances provided by Google Pedometer All measurements are approximate. Square Footage: 1,604 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Turners OPEN HOUSE FOR SATURDAY THE 18TH OF JUNE BETWEEN 10:00 - 13:00. PLEASE EMAIL US at   TO BOOK YOUR VIEWING. Turners are pleased to present to the market, a well-presented, two bedroom, end-of-terrace house with off-street parking and attractive garden. The property is located on Malling Gardens, within approx 1 mile of Morden station and just moments away from Morden Hall Park. This two, double-bedroom house would make a great buy for first time buyers or buy-to-let investors. The property has lots of natural light and comprises; Living room painted in pale grey with and dark wood laminate floor, the kitchen has ample cabinets, composite worktops and tiled splash-backs. The main bedroom, painted pale grey, benefits from built-in cupboards leaving plenty of space for a king-size bed and bedside furniture while the second double bedroom can also easily accommodate a double bed and freestanding furniture.  There two bathrooms, the downstairs having a three-piece bath suite with shower over the bath while the upstairs shower room has a contemporary, walk-in shower. Outside is an attractive garden with decked patio leading down to lawn area while hidden around to the side is a secluded seating area perfect for bbq’s and alfresco entertaining. The property also benefits from off-street parking. Malling Gardens is located just off St Helier Avenue, there are excellent transport links with several bus routes serving the local area including Morden, Sutton, Croydon and Wimbledon. Morden town centre is itself within a mile and the National Trusts’ Morden Hall Park is just a short stroll away.  There are a number of good primary schools in the area, such as St Teresa’s and Malmesbury Primary schools as well as the Harris Academy for older children. This property would make a lovely first time purchase for buyers looking to get on the property ladder or for buy to let investors looking for their next acquisition, the location, good condition, off-street parking and charming garden all being key benefits. bullet_points: Flexible Accommodation;Recent Conversion;Smart & Neutral Finish;Gorgeous Bathroom;Open Plan Kitchen / Living Area;Private Rear Garden;Cycle Storage;Share of Freehold;Moments From Tooting Station;No Onward Chain
long_description: A recently converted garden flat for you to call home!  With modern and neutral tones throughout, the accommodation is flexible as it could easily be 3 bedrooms or 2 bedrooms with 2 receptions! The kitchen has an island (who doesn't love an island!) giving you extra space to cook something tasty! This is a super area to entertain and socialise, and with those bifold doors opened, you are literally extending and merging your home with the delightful private rear garden.  This home occupies an enviable 'end of terrace' plot on Links Road which means that everything that vibrant Tooting has to offer is literally 'on your door step'.  The bars, the restaurants, the markets are all on hand from this residential location. If, however you feel the need to venture into central London (or anywhere else for that matter) then worry not, transport links are plentiful.  Tooting Rail Station (Southern & Thameslink) is no more than a couple of minutes stroll whilst Tooting Broadway underground is circa 15 minutes walk (depending on how long your stride is!).

bullet_points: SHOW FLAT NOW AVAILABLE TO VIEW;London's best Large Scale Project at the 2022 Energy Efficiency Awards 2022;1 bedroom;538 SQFT;‘A’ Rated Energy efficiency apartments ensuring huge savings on energy bills;Italian kitchens with Silestone worktops and splashbacks;Siemens appliances;Italian 2 tone Ivory and Tobacco bathroom tiles;Solar energy shared between apartments;Tesla batteries storing excess solar and off-peak energy for occupants
station_info: [(0.3, 'Raynes Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.4, 'Wimbledon Chase Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (1.0, 'Dundonald Road Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink')]
long_description: The Zero started with a vision. To create one of the most planet-friendly developments in the UK, without compromising on design or function.   The Zero blazes a new trail in high-quality, zero carbon living. From creating a thermally efficient building to reducing the energy demands of each apartment and the building as a whole, every detail and every decision delivers maximum sustainability – and maximum wow factor.  At the Zero, we’ve harnessed the natural resources of the sun’s power and use it to our owners’ benefit to help save the planet and reduce their energy bills. Using the most technically advanced solar panel system combined with a bank of Tesla Powerwall storage batteries, we’ve created a building where during certain times of year we are completely self-sufficient.   The Zero offers every apartment with open plan, free flowing living spaces with glass internal doors to allow light to flood through.  Every detail has been finished to the highest specification, thoughtfully designed to make the most of the living space. Triple glazed windows open inwards to allow for easy cleaning. Breakfast bars offer a second dimension to modern living lifestyles. Stylish Italian kitchens with beautiful Silestone Calcutta worktops throughout, kitchens include filtered boiling water taps.  The door entry system has been designed to ring your phone when visitors arrive, so you can open the door from the touch of a button on your mobile, wherever you may be.    Every flat has its own private balcony which is constructed in solid concrete and finished beautifully with maintenance free composite wood. They need little maintenance, look good and are long lasting. They even feature inward opening doors so you’ve got more outdoor space to relax. Welcome to the most beautiful energy-efficient apartment building in the UK. Situation The Zero itself is located in Raynes Park. A peaceful, green, family-friendly area with a vibrant community feel. A safe and leafy suburb just 20 minutes by train from the centre of London, much of Raynes Park is low-rise, creating a sense of open space that is a rare find in London. The lively local high street was a Great British High Street finalist in 2015 and offers every amenity you need for day-to-day life. Less than 1.5 miles away is the chic Wimbledon Village, with a huge array of stylish boutiques, artisan coffee shops and speciality food stores, along with a plentiful choice of buzzing bars and restaurants. There are also the elegant homes and wide green spaces of Combe Lane and Copse Hill, a neighbouring conservation area. Raynes Park has an active residents’ association, which helps ensure community support for projects such as tree planting and improved cycling and walking routes. Only 10 min cycle from Richmond Park. Additional Information Lease: Leasehold 250 years  Service charge: £1,603 Ground Rent: £350 The above is to be reviewed annually Brochures Particulars

long_description: Set on the first floor of this popular development the front door opens into a small entrance hall offering access to all the accommodation as well as a cupboard offering additional storage.   The open plan living/dining/kitchen area provides a range of modern low level and eye level units and integrated appliances.  There is space for a dining table and glazed double doors opening onto a Juliette balcony.   The double bedroom is spacious and offers built-in wardrobes.  The bathroom has a tiled floor and part tiled walls, a bath with wall mounted overhead shower, shower screen, wash hand basin with storage mirror above, W.C. with concealed cistern and wall mounted heated towel rail. Outside, the development benefits from a well-maintained communal roof garden and a residents cycle store. Situation The flat is situated approximately half way between Wandsworth Town centre with the Southside Centre and Earlsfield. The nearest transport links are provided by Earlsfield Train station (0.6m), with train services in to Waterloo via Clapham Junction. The green open spaces and sporting facilities of King George's Park are also close by. bullet_points: Two double bedrooms;Reception room;Kitchen;Bathroom;Balcony;Communal garden
long_description: Located on the third floor of a beautiful converted Victoria building with period features,  is this light and sunny two  bedroom flat.  Tastefully presented throughout with well proportioned good size rooms, including modern kitchen and bathroom.   Excellent storage space.  The flat measures 1,028 sq ft and enjoys large south facing attractive communal garden, which allows considerable privacy. Upon entrance the property opens to a large central hall with built-in storage, and a wonderful reception room featuring a stunning feature fireplace and window overlooking the pretty gardens.  To the front of the property, the kitchen offers a fantastic amount of natural light with two large sash windows. Tastefully finished, the kitchen is fitted with plenty of wall and base units, modern integrated appliances, smart work surfaces, and space for a breakfast table.  A light and airy principal bedroom features a large bay window and built-in shelving, and a spacious second double bedroom includes floor to ceiling built-in storage and glass French doors that open out onto the balcony. A luxurious bathroom with a bath and separate walk-in shower completes the property.   This property is ideally located on Nightingale Lane near the junction of Endlesham Road. Transport can be found at either Clapham South tube or Wandsworth Common over ground. The amenities of Northcote Road and Bellevue Road are within easy walking distance as are the shopping facilities at Clapham South and Balham. long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Garton Jones This brand new second floor apartment located in the world famous architect, Frank Gehry's first residential building in the UK is comprised of a fully equipped kitchen with integrated appliances. Two generous sized bedrooms and two large bathrooms. Floor to ceiling windows and taller than average ceilings to maximize the views out and let light in. The finishes blend modernity and luxury throughout . Wooden floors with under floor heating and an open layout that generates a feeling of space and warmth. Europe's largest redevelopment project is arguably the most exciting residential and commercial development in the world. At the heart of this 40 acre site is the iconic Battersea Powerstation, immortalised in countless movies as well as the famous Pink Floyd album cover the “Power is back on” so much so it has attracted Apple to take half a million square feet of office space alongside some of the world’s leading companies and retailers.  With world renowned Architects such as Frank Gehry, Sir Norman Foster and Rafael Vinoly have strengthened the developments position as the jewel in London's residential crown.  With planning for 3500 residential apartments, a boutique shopping mall, 5 star hotels, state of the art office facilities and with a the northern line tube located at its heart this development has to be seen to be believed!

long_description: The property is approached through a small private walled front garden. Following through the large hallway to the bright living/dining area featuring a fireplace and conservatory that allows the room to fill with natural light and gives access to the well-sized rear garden which attracts the sun throughout the day.  The kitchen is spacious and fully-integrated including a modern wine fridge, dishwasher, fridge/freezer and washing machine.  The first floor consists of two spacious bedrooms with large built-in wardrobes, a family bathroom and a large landing. The primary bedroom is situated on the second floor with a modern en-suite and benefits from additional built-in storage as well as eaves storage.  Overall, this property has had recent refurbishment over the last 18 months including new carpets, decoration and furnishings throughout.  Centrally located in Battersea and ideally placed for access to Clapham Junction mainline station as well as plenty of local bus routes offering easy access into Clapham, Nine Elms, and Chelsea. The property is within walking distance of an array of shops, restaurants and pubs located on Lavender Hill, Battersea Rise and Northcote road. The green, open spaces of Clapham Common and Battersea Park are also moments away. There is ample on-street parking outside of the property and a Boris Bike station only metres away. The seller has no onward chain.

bullet_points: 2 Double Bedrooms;Split - Level Accommodation;En-Suite To Principal Bedroom;Light, Light and More Natural Light;Smart & Neutral Finish;Private Balcony / Terrace;Moments From Tooting Station;Share of Freehold
long_description: The thing with the word stunning is that it is often used too loosely, however this 2 double bedroom split level conversion is definitely gorgeous and yes, I'm going to say it, it is STUNNING!  The principal bedroom, complete with ensuite, is a space that you would never want to leave, whilst the second bedroom is a great size with the main bathroom right next door! The stylish open plan kitchen /living space has access to your own private balcony which has enough space to dine al fresco! This home has plenty of natural light flowing through it and with the accommodation arranged over 2 floors (the apartment itself over 3 floors) it almost feels like a house!  It occupies a favourable 'end of terrace' plot on Links Road and you will find everything that vibrant and exciting Tooting has to offer is close by.  The bars, restaurants and markets are all within walking distance from this residential location.  If, however you feel the need to venture into central London (or anywhere else for that matter) then you will find that transport links are plentiful. Tooting Rail Station (Southern & Thameslink) is less than a couple of minutes stroll whilst the tube at Tooting Broadway is circa 15 minutes walk (depending on how long or short your stride is!).  With the apartment you'll also have a Share of the Freehold giving you that sense of control regarding your home and the building. Plus, with no onward chain you could be in your new home a lot sooner than you think!  Viewings start Saturday 11th June. Contact me to book your slot.

long_description: A stunning, three double bedroom, Victorian family home located within the highly sought after Battles area, being within easy reach of both Northern Line and mainline stations, Wimbledon town centre and excellent local schools.  On the ground floor is a spacious through reception room with feature fireplace which leads into a stunning open-planned kitchen/dining area with floor to ceiling doors that open out to a lovely garden. Upstairs are two double bedrooms, a modern family bathroom whilst the master bedroom with en-suite is in the converted loft, all done to a great specification.  Houses in Battles of this quality are rare at present so an early viewing is recommended. Brochures Hardy Road, London Brochure

bullet_points: Ready to move in to ;Tranquil riverside location;Modern living;Beautiful spaces with terraces to admire the view;Secure bike parking and car charging points;Excellent location;Exceptionally connected;2 bed 2 bath ;New Build;Private Balcony
long_description: Welcome to Ravensbury Terrace, Earlsfield, SW18.  Akai homes are proud to present Ravensbury Terrace, a special development of 24 high specification apartments that offer a tranquil riverside location, yet minutes away from the bustle of Garratt Lane and just 12 minutes from the city.  Modern living is at the heart of the design throughout. Each apartment benefits from emphasis on natural light and warm, neutral tones that make them immediately welcoming - and ripe for personalising. Beautifully conceived space and highquality finishes lead out to private terraces encircling the stunning communal garden from an award-winning designer or opening to views across the River Wandle.  The Ravensbury embodies the seemingly impossible juxtaposition of the excitement and opportunities of city life with the peaceful haven yearned for at the end of a long day. It is, in fact, the perfect sanctuary nestled within an urban village.  Ravensbury Terrace Specifications INTERNAL FINISHES: * Linen lined Built-in wardrobes with automatic LED lighting * Integrated Coat/storage cupboards in hallways * Utility cupboard including washer/dryer * independently controlled under-floor heating zones and towel rails * Gas fired central heating and hot water system * Domus flooring to hallways and living areas * luxury carpets to all bedrooms  KITCHEN * Poggenpohl designed and supplied kitchens with Soft-close handle-less doors and drawers * Quartz worktop and splashback with integrated undermounted sink * Contemporary mixer-taps. * Undercounter wine cooler * Integrated waste separation recycling bins * Siemens Oven * Siemens Combination Microwave - Oven * Siemens Induction Hob * Siemens Fridge/freezer * Siemens Dishwasher * Siemens Washer/Dryer *Penthouses include instant boiling water tap  BATHROOMS * Design by CLG Designs and supplied and Fitted by CP Hart * Mirrored cabinet including LED lighting and integral shaver socket * Composite stone vanity shelf * Wall mounted WC with concealed cistern * Wall mounted ceramic basin with deck mounted taps * Low profile shower trays * Heated towel rail  SECURITY: * Apartment entry multi-point locking door system * Security-fob access control to all building entrances * Video entry-phone to all apartments * 240V smoke, heat and Carbon Monoxide alarms  GARDENS AND TERRACES: * All flats have their own terraces accessed by sliding doors * They also all have access to the stunning landscaped communal gardens.  SUSTAINABILITY FEATURES: * Landscaped garden to encourage biodiversity * Electric car charging points * 100% low energy lighting Energy efficient appliances * Dual flush WC * Solar panels powering all communal areas * Electric charging points & parking available * Cycle storage * Green Sedum roof to encourage biodiversity * Lift to all floors  This Location:  Increasing numbers of new buyers coming to Earlsfield and the area is also now home to lots of young professionals who can take advantage of the 13 minute train journey to Waterloo. On moving in, they're finding that Earlsfield's trendy bars and restaurants centred on the beating heart of the neighbourhood, Garratt Lane, coupled with inviting green spaces and a friendly community spirit, provide the perfect living environment.

bullet_points: Five Bedrooms;Two Bathrooms;Sitting Room;Kitchen/Dining/Living Room;Downstairs Cloakroom;Utility Room;Enclosed Westerly Rear Garden
long_description: A substantial five bedroom family home located on a well regarded residential street within easy reach of Wimbledon Park and Southfields. Designed to meet the demands of a modern family home while retaining the proportions and light flow of its Edwardian heritage. A recently finished loft conversion provides two bedrooms and a shower room adding to the original three bedrooms and family bathroom. The wide entrance hall leads to a cloakroom, welcoming sitting room and the heart to the home a kitchen/dining/living room. This incorporates a fully fitted kitchen and leads to a private westerly aspect rear garden. Brochures Brochure

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with ludlowthompson This spacious double bedroom property located on Dinton Road in Colliers Wood is an irresistible find with a superb private garden, fantastic transportation links and its proximity to many local amenities and attractions.  The property is perfect for a first time buyer or a buy to let investor, having two bedrooms, a modern bathroom, bright reception area and a handsome kitchen leading out into the private, sunny garden. Perfect for gardening lovers or a sunny barbeque!   Just a few minutes walk from Wandle Meadow Nature Park, St George's Hospital and in the catchment area of a number of schools. The area is also full of local amenities like gastro-pubs, restaurants and shops. Various bus stops and train stations are within walking distance. You would be living just 10 minutes walk away from Colliers Wood and Tooting Broadway Underground Stations, giving easy access to the heart of London! And 20 minutes away from Tooting and Haydons Road Train Stations.  Council tax: TBC. Brochures Brochure 1

bullet_points: Brand new development;Two Bedroom, two bathroom apartment;Open-plan living;Poggenpohl kitchen;Siemens appliances;Private terrace;Lift to all floors;Solar panels to communal areas;Green sedum roof;Landscaped communal gardens
long_description: Nestled down a quiet residential street and moments from the River Wandle, you will find The Ravensbury, a brand new riverside development comprising 24 luxury one, two and three bedroom apartments in Earlsfield. The well-balanced accommodation has been meticulously designed to flow seamlessly. This beautifully designed two bedroom apartment features a light-filled open plan reception room, bespoke Poggenpohl kitchen with Siemens appliances, two opulent bathrooms, two double bedrooms and a private terrace.  The Ravensbury is perfectly positioned to enjoy the neighbourhood amenities on Garratt Lane and Earlsfield Station is just a three minute walk from your front door.  The development features an expertly-designed residents’ garden, a lift to all floors, secure car parking spaces available for purchase, cycle storage and a 10 year new build warranty.   Complete & ready to move into today.  * Images are of the show apartment and are for illustrative and indicative purposes only.

bullet_points: Chain Free;Share Of Freehold;Period Property;Two Double Bedrooms;Beautiful Private Garden;Refurbished To a Very High Standard;High Spec Appliances, Fixtures & Fittings;Open Plan Kitchen/Living;3 Minutes' Walk To Tooting Rail Station;20 Minutes Walk To Tooting Broadway
long_description: A stunning two double bedroom garden flat offered to the market CHAIN FREE. This apartment has been stylishly refurbished to an extremely high standard and offers modern, bright and spacious living and is situated on a quiet residential street close to vibrant Tooting Broadway and all it has to offer.   Accommodation comprises two beautiful double bedrooms, with the largest bedroom at the front of the property benefiting from a huge window including bespoke wooden shutters for added privacy. To the rear of the property there is a sophisticated bathroom, with marble effect tiling and modern matt black fixtures and fittings.   The heart of this property is the truly stunning open plan kitchen, living and dining area. The kitchen area has high spec integrated appliances, beautiful muted grey wooden cabinets and solid worktops. This well-proportioned and laid out area offers plenty of cooking and entertaining space and is welcoming and bright from the three skylights and French doors opening up onto the delightful garden.    The fantastic easy to maintain garden features a patio area laid with wood decking...perfect for a table and chairs and a lovely spot to relax. Steps lead up to an immaculate artificial grass area with raised beds to one side and to the rear of the garden.   Located only a 3 minutes’ walk away from Tooting Rail Station (Thameslink and Southern Rail services) and a 20 minute walk to Tooting Broadway Station (Northern Line, Zone 3) and the eclectic array of shops, bars and restaurants the area offers including the award winning buzzing Tooting Markets. The popular Gorringe Park pub is moments away and green open space of Figges Marsh. The property is also ideally located close to a number of good schools.  Tenure: Share of Freehold.  Council tax: TBC. Brochures Brochure 1

long_description: Laurels are delighted to present this magnificent two double bedroom penthouse to the market, located in a highly desirable area of SW19. With a plethora of travel options including Colliers Wood Underground station, a ten-minute walk away (0.5 miles), Morden Road Tram Stop a fifteen-minute walk away (0.8 miles) and Merton bus garage a seven-minute walk away (0.4 miles).  Upon entrance to the property, you will find yourself on the fifth floor where you have your family bathroom, a three-piece suite with shower over the bath and your generous two double bedrooms, the main of which has a private balcony and a stunning en-suite. Heading up to the second floor you are greeted by a magnificent open plan living and dining area, a fitted kitchen with built-in appliances and panoramic views from the large terrace, overlooking Merton Abbey Mills and with views of London’s city skyline.  Further benefits include ample built-in storage, lift access and a secure communal garden. A short drive to Wimbledon Town Centre and Colliers Wood Tandem Centre. The property is within the catchment area for several excellent schools including Harris Academy and Merton Abbey Primary School.  The property has a Tax Band of 'E' and the Local Authority is Merton. This property is a Leasehold with 107 years remaining on the lease, the annual service charge is £2400 and the annual ground rent is £250. Brochures Full Details

bullet_points: 2 Spacious Bedrooms;Own Parking Space;Private South Facing Balcony;En Suite;Family Bathroom;Open Planned Kitchen;Newly Built Property;Larger Roof Terrace;Equidistant to Raynes Park & Wimbledon Chase Stations;Superbly Presented
station_info: [(0.2, 'Wimbledon Chase Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.5, 'Raynes Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.6, 'South Merton Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: A luxury Recently Built First Floor 2 Double Bedroom Apartment Within A Secure Gated Development, Situated Favourably Between Raynes Park And Wimbledon Chase Stations. The Property Benefits From A Private Balcony, Roof Terrace, En Suite, Open Plan Living & A Parking Space.  * Council Tax Band D  *Lease 125 years remaining  *SC   *GR This luxury, recently constructed, first floor, 2 bedroom apartment offers spacious rooms, modern and high quality living whilst being very convenient for both Raynes Park & Wimbledon Chase Station. The property offers a large stylish family bathroom with underfloor heating, two spacious bedrooms with the main bedroom accompanied with an en-suite, and a spacious and open plan kitchen/living accommodation.  The kitchen is fully fitted with high quality dishwasher, fridge/freezer, and all appliances required.  The property also benefits from having a private south facing balcony along with a larger outside communal terrace. This property is located in a new development surrounded by luxury apartments & houses, the ideal location for both Raynes Park & Wimbledon Chase. The useful amenities of Raynes Park including the David Lloyd Sports Centre, a Public Library, Waitrose, a selection of coffee shops and restaurants are close by. Raynes Park commuter station offers fast and frequent rail connections to London Waterloo, whilst Wimbledon Chase Primary School, station and shops are also nearby. Brochures Wellsborough Mews, Bushey Road, Raynes Park, SW20 Brochure

bullet_points: Reception Hall;Large Sitting Room;Fitted Kitchen/Breakfast Room;Master Bedroom with en-suite Bathroom;Guest Bedroom;Guest Bathroom;Private Patio;Communal Gardens;2 Underground Parking Spaces;Large locked storage cupboard in locked storage room in the underground car park.
long_description: The apartment has undergone extensive refurbishment and fittings that are sourced from exclusive bespoke suppliers. This includes new contemporary bathrooms, fitted with bespoke majestic shower enclosures, Dornbracht shower and bath appliances, silver grey Italian porcelain and mother of pearl panelled niches with Thassos marble. There is Element 7 Oak flooring in all rooms, except the kitchens and bathrooms, and silver hand blown handles from McKinneys. Approached via a smart communal entrance with generous communal areas designed by Hill House Interiors (completed in December 2018), the apartment has a spacious hallway leading to an elegant 24' sitting room with a Chesney's fireplace and double doors leading to a private patio. The fitted kitchen/breakfast room has grey wall and base units with black granite work surfaces, bespoke Armac Martin handles, Italian tiles and Miele & Neff appliances. The excellent master bedroom has mirror fronted wardrobes and a smart newly fitted en-suite bathroom. There is a good size second bedroom with mirror fronted fitted wardobes and a newly fitted second bathroom with a bath as well as a shower which has the same exceptionally high level of finishes as the master bathroom. The patio is located to the front of the sitting room, whilst there are meticulously maintained communal gardens to the rear. A lift in the communal hallway leads down to the underground car park in which the apartment has two large designated car parking spaces. All apartments have access to the communal gardens. There is a large locked storage cupboard in the locked storage room in the underground car park which comes with the apartment. Situation Oxford House is a prestigious block of 18 flats built by Octagon immediately opposite Wimbledon Common on Parkside. The Mainline train station and District Line Tube station in Wimbledon town provide fast and frequent services to the City and West End. Additional Information The property is to be sold as a Share of Freehold with an underlying lease of 125 years which was granted in July 1996. The vendors have advised that the present service charge is £6,641.66 which is paid in two equal installments. The ground rent is £300 per annum. Brochures Particulars

There is a large garden with storage sheds.  The first floor includes two double bedrooms, a good sized third bedroom and a shower room. Further benefits from ample storage throughout, the potential of a loft conversion & a side return ( STTP). Frimley Gardens offers access to a number of shops including the Sainsburys superstore and Tandem centre, Mitcham's town centre which has a number of supermarkets. The property is also close to Morden Hall park with its open spaces. long_description: A newly built semi-detached four bedroom house situated on high ground overlooking south west London, while being securely located in a gated private development close to Wimbledon Village. Blossom Square was built by the boutique London developer Coronado, who are well known for their build quality and high specification finishes. Council Tax Band H. Upon entering the Blossom Square development one is greeted by a gorgeous garden with south west views. The property itself has a large integral garage and off-street parking. Built to a high specification throughout, the house is spread across four floors where the front entrance leads into the entrance hall, a separate study, a large reception room with a south west facing terrace with steps down to the garden, and a cloakroom.  The garden floor comprises a superb open plan kitchen/dining/family room that leads out to the south westerly facing garden. The kitchen is fully fitted with a range of units with integrated appliances and European composite stone worktops featuring LED concealed lighting. A cloakroom, utility room and plant room complete this floor. Upstairs on the first floor is the generously sized principle bedroom and guest bedroom suites, both with dressing rooms and en-suite bathrooms. The second floor compromises of two further double bedrooms, both with en-suite shower rooms. Wimbledon Village is renowned for its unique 'countryfied' feel whilst being only 17 mins by rail to Waterloo.  This property is conveniently located for  both  offering an excellent range of boutique shops, bars and restaurants, while also having access to the plentiful open green spaces of Wimbledon Common. The area is well regarded for its sporting and recreational facilities as well as for its choice of 'outstanding' schools in both the state and private sectors, including Kings College School and Wimbledon High School. The famous All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club is only 1.5 miles away. Transport links are close at hand, the nearby A3 provides access to major motorways and into central London. Local bus routes are towards Wimbledon and Putney, with rail and tube stations that have regular services into London Waterloo and greater London. Brochures Blossom Square, Wimbledon, SW20 Brochure

The conservatory benefits from underfloor heating and opens to a private, secluded 50' 'rear garden complete with garden studio/home office. There is also a downstairs cloakroom. Upstairs, on the first floor there is a modern family bathroom and three double bedrooms, one of which opens to a roof terrace overlooking the garden. station_info: [(0.8, 'Wimbledon Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-underground;svg-tramlink'), (0.8, 'Wimbledon Park Station', 'svg-underground'), (1.0, 'Dundonald Road Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink')]
long_description: A stunning and substantial seven-bedroom detached house of over 6,700 sq. ft, located in a quiet and sought after road in Wimbledon Village.  The house has ample off-street parking behind secure gates to the front and a generous, secluded and beautifully landscaped garden to the rear. This impressive luxury house offers flexible accommodation over four floors and has been completed to an exceptional standard of finish.   The generous accommodation is well balanced and comprises; an open-plan kitchen/dining/family room to the rear of the house providing fabulous space that opens out onto the patio and garden areas, which have a feeling of great privacy and security; a multiplex room with options to create a games room/bar/media room/gymnasium with separate shower on the lower ground floor; a magnificent principal bedroom suite with dressing room and en-suite bathroom; three further bedrooms with en-suites; and three further bedrooms that share a family bathroom. The specification of the house is impressive and includes solid floors for better sound and thermal insulation; hardwood double glazed windows; 3m high ceilings on the ground floor and 2.8m on the lower ground floor; Wi-Fi throughout; part air-conditioning to kitchen/family room and master bedroom; underfloor heating throughout; boosted water system and water softener; bespoke kitchen with feature breakfast bar and large walk-in pantry; feature oak staircase and bannister; a mixture of solid wood, marble and porcelain tiled floors; media and communications package and security system CAT 6, Control 4 integration; fitted quality wardrobes; pre-wired for all future requirements; mains smoke detectors, CCTV and alarm system; BLP Housing Warranty Insurance underwritten by Allianz Group. The house sits at the top of a quiet cul-de-sac, a few hundred metres from Wimbledon Village with its excellent shops, exclusive boutiques, cafes, restaurants and wine bars and Wimbledon Common.  The surrounding area of Wimbledon offers an excellent choice of schools in both the private and state sectors, including Kings College School for boys (girls are now allowed entry into the 6th form) and Wimbledon High School for girls, both within walking distance. Recreational facilities are excellent with several golf clubs, fitness and tennis clubs and a riding stables in the Village. Connections to central London are either by road or rail, with the A3 trunk road directly into London or regular mainline and District Tube lines rail services located in Wimbledon town centre (Waterloo approximately 15 minutes). long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 996 years remaining The Property A bright, modern and well-appointed two bedroom apartment with a share of Freehold, sold with no chain, in a private, well-maintained building with communal gardens and allocated off-street parking on Pelham Road, a sought-after, quiet residential road in central Wimbledon a few minutes' walk to Wimbledon mainline and tube station and all that Wimbledon has to offer.  Set on the ground floor of this well-kept, smart and modern purpose-built private apartment block, the development benefits from communal gardens and lawn areas and off-street allocated parking. The property is set back from this desirable residential road. There is a welcoming and spacious-feeling hallway upon entry with useful built in storage space. There is a large living room with space for a dining table next to the window and a separate kitchen  set off with a separating door in case of cooking smells. The fitted kitchen is of a good size, bright and modern and has integrated appliances.  There is a large bathroom and two bright bedrooms. The larger bedroom has a walk in wardrobe area with intelligent built-in storage space. The smaller bedroom fits a double bed and also has a built-in wardrobe.  The property is in excellent condition and has double glazing throughout. There are wood and tiled floors in hallway, living room, kitchen and bathroom, carpets in the bedrooms and the property has recently been modernised and decorated in a neutral style.  Pelham Road is in a highly sought-after Wimbledon location. It is a quiet residential road perfectly situated for the high street with it's many shops, restaurants, gyms, leisure centre, two cinemas and Wimbledon Theatre. Wimbledon Station with tube and regular mainline services to Waterloo in under 20 mins is close by, as is South Wimbledon tube with direct services to the City. South Park Gardens is a few roads over and Wimbledon Common and Village a short walk up the hill.   A perfect first purchase, Buy to Let investment or pied a terre. long_description: For sale an end-of-terrace, two-bedroom house with single storey extension, off-street parking and patio garden located on the ‘central Morden end’ of Middleton Road, SM4 This two bedroom property presents prospective purchasers with a blank canvas to simply move in and make their own, or the chance to remodel the layout to suit one’s own personal taste. Each room has been painted in plain, neutral colours and has wood laminate to the living room dining room and bedrooms while the kitchen has tiled floor and the main bathroom, modern vinyl flooring. Currently the property comprises spacious living room, separate dining room and kitchen, downstairs shower room and a study/3rd bedroom all on the ground floor. Upstairs, are two double bedrooms and a family bathroom with white three-piece bath suite and shower over the bath. The front of the property benefits from two, off-street parking spaces while to the rear is a simple-to-maintain hard-landscaped garden, which would provide ample space for outdoor furniture along with planters for flowers and shrubs. It is worth noting that many of the properties in the area have loft conversions and this property has the potential for that as well as the opportunity to consider reconfiguring the current layout to create an open-plan, family room on the ground floor. Located on Middleton Road the property is at the ‘central Morden end’ making it just 1 Mile to Morden Station and the town centre, (approx 20 mins walk based on Google Maps) and only a few minutes’ walk to St Helier Station. In addition there is a Sainsbury Local on Central Road, just moments away meaning this property certainly passes the ‘pint of milk test’. Morden Rec is opposite giving you lots of open green space, fitness facilities and local sports such as Merton Rugby Club and a local cricket club. There is also a kindergarten in the rec. With its simple interior, side extension, off-street parking and further potential, not to mention the good location this property has the potential to be a lovely family home and advise any interested partied to book to view asap. Brochures Middleton-Road-18-sales-particulars-Turners-Proper EPC

long_description: This property is situated on the popular ‘Willows’ development, within 0.5 miles to Morden Town Centre, which benefits from the Northern Line tube station and an array of bus routes linking Croydon, Sutton and Wimbledon. St Helier, South Merton and Morden South Train Stations link to Sutton and Wimbledon, and further into London. This part of Morden accommodates green spaces at Ravensbury Park and Morden Hall Park, which forms part of the National Trust. A rare opportunity to buy a contemporary family home built in 2012, with many modern features. Upon entry, there is an entrance hall with storage and ground floor cloakroom, which leads in to an open plan living area, which is ideal for families and entertaining. The kitchen is fitted with modern units and a selection of integrated appliances. There are doors leading onto the garden, which is low maintenance and ideal for BBQ's with friends and family. On the first floor, there are two bedrooms and a family bathroom. On the second floor is the master bedroom, which also benefits from its very own en-suite shower room. The property is freehold and only eight years old. There are many other benefits including a driveway and a separate garage. Designed very much with families in mind, this modern three-bedroom family home is in an excellent location and we recommend arranging a viewing as quickly as possible. long_description: A five bedroom detached house on a south west facing plot that is well located close to Wimbledon Village and Wimbledon Park. There is development potential subject to planning consent.  Description A rare opportunity to buy a spacious detached five bedroom house with excellent lateral living space and a wonderful west facing garden. The property offers great potential to create a wonderful family home by way of extension subject to consent. The house is set back from the road behind a generous front garden with off street parking for two cars. The property opens into a central reception hall, leading to a double reception space with a dual aspect and double doors opening to a large westerly facing garden at the rear.  Alongside is a large fitted kitchen with a separate breakfast room, utility room and guest cloakroom. There is also a fifth bedroom on this floor with a guest bathroom. Upstairs, there is a large principal bedroom with fitted wardrobes, a further three double bedrooms and a family shower room with separate WC. A loft storage area offers great potential to increase the square footage further, subject to approved consent.  A superb private west facing rear garden has a paved terrace overlooking an impressive lawn with well stocked mature borders. Location Lambourne Avenue is located within 1000m of Wimbledon Village and Wimbledon Park District Line Underground station. Wimbledon Park is also around 1000m away and offers fabulous space with its beautiful boating lake, golf course, cafe, tennis courts and playgrounds.  Wimbledon Village has several pretty boutiques and restaurants with Wimbledon Town offering a more comprehensive array of supermarkets, a cinema, and restaurants.  Locally are a number of sought after schools with King's College and Wimbledon High both around one mile away and Bishop Gilpin Primary around 600m. long_description: A beautiful two-bedroom garden flat set on the quiet yet well connected Marian Road.   This maisonette is accessed by its own front door and comprises; two well-proportioned double bedrooms, modern bathroom, an eat in kitchen with plenty of space for dining, a separate living room and steps down to a private garden.   This wonderful home has been well looked after by the current owners and would be perfect for a first time buyer or home mover looking for outside space.   The flat is ideally located near to Streatham Common station with direct access to Clapham Junction, Balham, London Victoria, and London Bridge. The shops, bars and restaurants of Streatham Vale and Streatham High Road are within easy reach of the property including the well-regarded Mere Scribbler and Railway pubs. The wide, open and leafy Streatham Common is just a short walk away. Brochures Property Brochure Full Details

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with eXp UK PLEASE QUOTE JW0326 A brand new development very close to completion. Knapton Mews is a collection of high spec new build properties tucked away in a quiet location right on the doorstep of the vibrant Tooting Broadway. The developers of this boutique collection of properties have taken real care and attention to create a modern living solution with very generous square footage. The property is duplex with its own front door and private outdoor space which while technically an apartment gives a real sense of living in a house. RESERVE FOR JUST £1500. Once complete the development will also benefit from a sizable landscaped communal garden space which coupled with being set back in a mews will really and to the sense of community.  Set over 1200 sqft not only is this a large property but exceeds equivalent unextended 2/3 bedroom victorian terraces in the area at a similar price point. House of this type often come in at around 950-1050sft so combine that with the fact that you are buying brand new with all the comfort and energy efficiency that brings and you are getting serious value here. Built to a discerning specification and with smart technology throughout this is more than you standard apartment. For full details please see the accompanying brochure. Both bedrooms are upstairs are incredibly spacious and both have their own bathrooms one of which is set up as a "jack and Jill" which allows access should you have guests. The ground floor also boasts a fantastic open plan kitchen and reception room but also a study that is larger than many bedrooms in the victorian sector and can be used however the new owner wishes Tooting Broadway has in recent years gone through and extensive regeneration and been dubbed by some to be the "Shoreditch of the South" The total revamp of the undercover Tooting Marketplace has injected a real vibrance to the area with its host of independent bars and eateries it is a real destination for local people. There are a whole host of decent schools close buy along with shops, green open spaces and the transport options of Tooting Broadway underground Zone 3 Northern line and the overland at Tooting Station. Investors and homebuyer alike can also be reassured by the strong rental proposition of this property based on current values and estimated sales price they are showing c.4% yield which is very good indeed. Service charge c£3200pa Ground rent 0.01% of sales price c.65pa lease 250yr     LIVING AREA * Wood strip flooring to all living areas and hallways * Adjustable underfloor heating KITCHEN. * Sleek and contemporary kitchen with modern integrated NEFF appliances * White low energy LED spotlights  * Mains fed smoke/heat detectors * Adjustable underfloor heating BATHROOM * Stylish toning wall and floor tiling * Adjustable underfloor heating * Contemporary bathroom fixtures BEDROOMS * Built in wardrobes to master maximising space * Toning expertly fitted carpet GENERAL * Low maintenance and noise reducing carpet fitted to internal stairs and landings SECURITY & SAFETY *  entry system  * Secure Main entrance * Security locks to all windows and balcony doors. * Smoke alarms * Heat detector fitted in kitchen EXTERNAL * Private outside space for each apartment * Electric main front gate with pedestrian entrance by keypad * Car free development with bike store and easy access to transport * Sustainable heating for energy efficiency * Attractive exterior lighting to rear of ground floor homes NEW BUILD SECURITY Your 10-year New Build Warranty is provided by BLP, a Registered User of the Consumer Code for New Homes (CCNH), approved by the Chartered Trading Standards Institute. long_description: Open Day Saturday 18th June - A superb four bedroom townhouse with a southerly facing garden and off street parking close to Wimbledon Village and the AELTC.  Description This wonderful four/five bedroom townhouse offers generous living and entertaining space across three floors. The house is set back from the road behind a deep front garden and off street parking. On the ground floor to the rear is an impressive open plan kitchen/dining/reception space with French doors leading to a pretty southerly facing rear garden. The contemporary kitchen offers an excellent range of fitted units and cupboards with stone work tops and a breakfast bar. The house also benefits from a guest cloakroom, utility room and useful bike storage in the garage.   Upstairs, on the first floor is a formal reception room/bedroom five and the principal bedroom with a stylish en suite shower room and well designed fitted wardrobes. There are a further three bedrooms and a contemporary family bathroom on the top floor. We have been told that this property has no cladding. Location Newstead Way is located off Somerset Road near Wimbledon Village and between Wimbledon Common and Wimbledon Park and Lake. 1000m away approx, the Village High Street offers a variety of charming boutiques, shops and restaurants. Wimbledon Common with 1,200 acres provides a wide range of outdoor activities including golf, cycling, riding and walking.  The area is highly regarded for the quality of its schooling in both the private and state sectors.  For transport links, the property is conveniently located for Wimbledon mainline train and District underground stations (17 min approx to London Waterloo), and bus facilities. Source of times     Source of distances Google Pedometer All measurements are approximate Square Footage: 1,788 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: Situated within a superb new conversion of a beautiful period mansion, this apartment occupies the whole floor and benefits from its own private front door. The flat has been finished to a fabulous specification throughout and includes smoked oak herringbone flooring, air conditioning and underfloor heating throughout. There is a fantastic open plan living area with a fully-fitted Italian kitchen and 7m wide bi-fold doors opening out to a substantial south facing private garden. The principal bedroom has a dressing area with built-in wardrobes and an ensuite shower room. The spacious second bedroom has built-in wardrobes and there is a separate large bathroom with a walk-in shower and jacuzzi bath.  The flat is share of freehold and has a long underlying lease of 999 years and there is residents' permit parking directly opposite the apartment. Thornton Hill is a sought-after road on the "slopes" of Wimbledon, conveniently situated for both Wimbledon Village and the town centre with its mainline station and District line link. Wimbledon Village offers a range of exclusive boutiques, bars and restaurants, while many more high street names are to be found in the town centre. Wimbledon Common is just a short walk away and the area contains some excellent schools including Kings College and Wimbledon High School. Brochures More Details brochure

long_description: A split level period 3 double bedroom maisonette which has just been refurbished and fully extended into the roof space is being offered for sale. The property forms part of this attractive semi detached residence, located on this tree lined residential road in the heart of central Colliers Wood, just moments from the bustling High Street. All local facilities are easily accessible, with shops, transport, schools, parks and St Georges hospital on your doorstep. The bright, spacious and contemporary accommodation consists of a living dining room, a shower room, family bathroom and a modern kitchen breakfast room with integrated appliances. Several of the rooms are dual aspect and with roof lights within the loft rooms allow light to flood in.  In the loft area there is some eave storage and the ceiling height is a feature that is often forgotten but there is ample, with well over 2 meters of head room. The property has no onward chain and has an extremely long lease of approx. 950 years remaining (999 from 25.3.1973). Brochures Warren Road, Colliers Wood Brochure

station_info: [(0.3, 'Raynes Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.4, 'Wimbledon Chase Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.8, 'South Merton Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: The Zero started with a vision. To create one of the most planet-friendly developments in the UK, without compromising on design or function.   The Zero blazes a new trail in high-quality, zero carbon living. From creating a thermally efficient building to reducing the energy demands of each apartment and the building as a whole, every detail and every decision delivers maximum sustainability – and maximum wow factor.  At the Zero, we’ve harnessed the natural resources of the sun’s power and use it to our owners’ benefit to help save the planet and reduce their energy bills. Using the most technically advanced solar panel system combined with a bank of Tesla Powerwall storage batteries, we’ve created a building where during certain times of year we are completely self-sufficient.   The Zero offers every apartment with open plan, free flowing living spaces with glass internal doors to allow light to flood through.  Every detail has been finished to the highest specification, thoughtfully designed to make the most of the living space. Triple glazed windows open inwards to allow for easy cleaning. Breakfast bars offer a second dimension to modern living lifestyles. Stylish Italian kitchens with beautiful Silestone Calcutta worktops throughout, kitchens include filtered boiling water taps.  The door entry system has been designed to ring your phone when visitors arrive, so you can open the door from the touch of a button on your mobile, wherever you may be.    Every flat has its own private balcony which is constructed in solid concrete and finished beautifully with maintenance free composite wood. They need little maintenance, look good and are long lasting. They even feature inward opening doors so you’ve got more outdoor space to relax. Welcome to the most beautiful energy-efficient apartment building in the UK. Situation The Zero itself is located in Raynes Park. A peaceful, green, family-friendly area with a vibrant community feel. A safe and leafy suburb just 20 minutes by train from the centre of London, much of Raynes Park is low-rise, creating a sense of open space that is a rare find in London. The lively local high street was a Great British High Street finalist in 2015 and offers every amenity you need for day-to-day life. Less than 1.5 miles away is the chic Wimbledon Village, with a huge array of stylish boutiques, artisan coffee shops and speciality food stores, along with a plentiful choice of buzzing bars and restaurants. There are also the elegant homes and wide green spaces of Combe Lane and Copse Hill, a neighbouring conservation area. Raynes Park has an active residents’ association, which helps ensure community support for projects such as tree planting and improved cycling and walking routes. Only 10 min cycle from Richmond Park. Additional Information Lease: Leasehold 250 years  Service charge: £2,264 Ground Rent: £450 The above is to be reviewed annually Brochures Particulars

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Coombe Residential A well-presented two bedroom apartment on the fourth floor of a modern block with a large balcony offering panoramic views across West Wimbledon and beyond.  Situated close to Raynes Park train station and #57 and #131 bus routes to Kingston and Wimbledon town centres, and a wide variety of shops and restaurants.  The property is well laid out and offers two double bedrooms with built-in wardrobes and base units, a well-equipped kitchen and a spacious bathroom with separate thermostatic control shower unit. Another great bonus to the apartment are the extra built-in store cupboards with accessory shelving. LOCATION West Wimbledon is conveniently located close to Wimbledon and Kingston town centres with their excellent shopping facilities, as is the A3 trunk road offering fast access to Central London and both Gatwick and Heathrow airports via the M25 motorway. The train station at Raynes Park provides frequent services to London Waterloo with its underground links to points throughout the city, with the nearest tube station being Wimbledon. The immediate area offers a wide range of recreational facilities including three golf courses, tennis and squash clubs. Richmond Park, which is an area of natural outstanding beauty, provides a picturesque setting for picnics, horse riding, jogging or just leisurely walks. Theatres at Richmond and Wimbledon are also popular alternatives to the West End together with an excellent choice of restaurants. There are also numerous schools for all ages, Public and State and International. Brochures Particulars

bullet_points: Heart of Wimbledon Village;Five bedrooms;Views of St Mary’s Church and the Green;Gated property;Walled grounds;Triple garage;Annexe;EPC Rating = E
station_info: [(0.5, 'Wimbledon Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-underground;svg-tramlink'), (0.7, 'Wimbledon Park Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.7, 'Dundonald Road Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink')]
long_description: A substantial family house built around the turn of the 19th and 20th Centuries in the heart of Wimbledon Village with views of St Mary’s Church and the Green.  Description St Mary's Road enjoys the seclusion of mainly walled grounds and is approached via a gated driveway.  The ground floor has an oak panelled reception hall along with the original parquet flooring.  The drawing room to the right of the hall is an excellent size with an impressive wide bay window and a feature fireplace, shared with the adjoining dining room. A beautifully fitted study is also approached from the drawing room, featuring an extensive range of shelves and cabinets and incorporating a matching desk.  Adjoining the study is a temperature controlled wine cellar with a de-humidifier.   To the left of the hall is a large and versatile open plan kitchen and day room that offers great entertaining accommodation.  The bespoke kitchen is comprehensively fitted with Cherrywood units, including superb appliances including a five ring gas hob and built in steamer by Gaggenau, twin built in ovens by de Dietrich, a dishwasher, microwave oven and a fridge/freezer. The breakfast area has a feature fireplace and a generous seating area overlooking the garden.  The adjoining playroom/garden room has an abundance of fitted shelves and cupboards. There is also a utility room with washing machine and drier, second dishwasher, second fridge/freezer and a guest cloakroom.  A door from the family area leads to an annexe with a staircase to a gymnasium on the first floor and a second ground floor cloakroom. This could be adapted as a guest/au-pair suite if required as there is a separate external entrance from the drive as well. Arranged over the first and second floors, there are five double bedrooms including an exceptional master suite with its own lobby, a large dressing room and a luxuriously appointed marble tiled bathroom with separate shower and adjoining WC with bidet. The other two first floor bedrooms each have a bathroom en suite and there is a large family bathroom on the second floor.  A large loft provides excellent storage and could be possibly be converted to provide additional accommodation subject to the necessary consents if required.  Other features include a built in speaker system in the reception rooms, kitchen and master bedroom suite; underfloor heating throughout the ground floor and in the master suite; Crestron controlled lighting and air conditioning is fitted in the kitchen, playroom/garden room, gym and all the first floor bedrooms. Google nest smart thermostats are also fitted throughout the ground and first floors. The house has a large and secluded garden which enjoys a bright southerly aspect with a wide detached terrace and then a mature lawn surrounded by well stocked borders and with mature trees. The generous triple car garage also provides plenty of storage and lots of room for bicycles and sports equipment, and there is ample parking in the driveway for a number of vehicles. A power shower is also located at the back of the garage for use with dogs or similar. Location St Mary’s Road is adjacent to St Mary’s Church in the heart of Wimbledon Village. Wimbledon Village High Street is around 500 metres away. Wimbledon Village is charming with a number of boutique shops, restaurants and bars. Wimbledon Common, with about 1200 acres, is perfect for walking, riding, cycling or golf at one of its three courses. Wimbledon underground and railway station is around 800 metres away in Wimbledon Town with a fast and regular link to central London (Waterloo approximately 17 minutes). Locally are a number of highly regarded schools. Sources of Distances: Google Pedometer Sources of Times: Transport for London All measurements are approximate Square Footage: 5,117 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: A wonderful ground floor three bedroom apartment with a garage and beautiful communal gardens, close to Wimbledon Common and the village.  Description This impressive three double bedroom ground floor flat benefits from an integral garage and is located within a substantial period property on the doorstep of Wimbledon Common.  To the front is a generous bay fronted reception space with a south westerly aspect and an attractive fireplace with a welcoming log burner. A contemporary fitted kitchen, with integrated appliances and wood work surfaces, is located to the rear of the reception space. The integral garage is accessed from the kitchen. The principal bedroom is towards the rear and offers excellent fitted wardrobe space and a stylish en suite shower room. There are a further two bedrooms, one is currently used as a study, and a generous family bathroom with a freestanding bathtub and twin basins. Externally are beautiful communal gardens to the rear and an integral garage. We have been told that this property has no cladding. Location Calonne Road is well located just 200 metres from Wimbledon Common (1,200 acres) and 700 metres from Wimbledon Village High Street. Wimbledon Village has a charming selection of cafes, restaurants and boutiques. There is a good range of schools in the area including King's College School, The Study and Wimbledon High School. Wimbledon Town Centre, is approximately 1.5 miles away and offers a department store, supermarkets, theatres and a cinema.  Wimbledon Station provides fast overground rail and District line underground connections to central London (approximately 19 minutes to Waterloo) and to the south of England. Source of times    Source of distances Google Pedometer All measurements are approximate. Square Footage: 1,505 sq ft Leasehold with approximately 164 years remaining. Brochures Web Details

long_description: Fabulous 1930’s style four-bedroom end of terrace house with a large westerly aspect garden, off street parking and double garage. This property has no forward chain and has been extended to provide four/five good sized bedrooms, two bath/shower rooms, kitchen, open plan dining room with doors onto generous sized garden which has a double garage at the end of the garden with electricity and potential as a home office/workshop.  It is located in this residential road convenient for Wimbledon Chase, South Merton and Raynes Park commuter stations with its fast rail links to Waterloo is a short distance whilst Morden underground station is nearby, with also bus routes to Wimbledon, Raynes Park, Epsom and Sutton all from the end of the road. There are numerous local schools including Hillcross primary on Monkleigh Road, John Fisher school, Rutlish High school, and Wimbledon Chase middle school.  This house has been redecorated with new flooring and with no ongoing chain can be purchased quickly. One of its main benefits is the side access to a large double garage at the end of the garden that gives a real opportunity with the possibility of changing it to a studio/home office/family den. The open green spaces of Cannon Hill Common is very close, whilst Morden Park and Merton College leisure centre/pool/gym. Mostyn Gardens, Joseph Hood and John Innes Park are also short distance. long_description: Forming part of this exclusive private gated estate, Blossom Square has been recently constructed to a very high finish and is enviably located close to Wimbledon Common. This unique-to-market detached house  comprises on the ground floor a bright reception room/dining room with glazed doors out to the west-facing roof terrace. Off this room leads a open plan contemporary modern kitchen, with island counter and integrated appliances. On the lower ground floor is the additional main large reception room leading out to the garden as well as a king size guest bedroom/study and guest bathroom. There is also a utility room and additional storage. On the first floor is a the main principlal bedroom with dressing area and a beautiful contemporary en suite bathroom with separate shower. There are three additional double bedrooms spread over the first and second floor and a large family bathroom.  The bedrooms on the upper floors also benefit from stunning westerly views over South London. Externally there is a bright west-facing garden, accessed from the lower ground floor and and a terrace off the main reception room on ground level which also share beautiful views over south London.  Additionally there is off street parking to the front of the house. Blossom Square is located in a prime residential area on the edge of Wimbledon Village – one of the most picturesque parts of London - and within 0.25 mile of the open space of Wimbledon Common. Above all it is internationally renowned as the home of the All England Tennis Club – hosts of the Tennis Championships. Central London (Hyde Park) is only 8 miles away and is easily accessible by road or by fast and frequent mainline/underground train services. Unlike many parts of south west London, the area is not under a regular flight path yet communications are excellent with the A3 being approximately 1.2 miles away offering fast access to Central London, the M25 and London's main airports at Heathrow or Gatwick. The educational facilities are second to none with two of the country's best performing schools – King's College School and Wimbledon Girls High School – being about 0.6 miles from the development and attracting buyers from home and abroad. Brochures More Details brochure

bullet_points: HELP TO BUY AVAILABLE * on eligible units *;Stylish Kitchens & Bathrooms;MOVE IN NOW;999 Year lease ;Ground Floor;Bespoke specification;5 Minutes to Earlsfield station;PRIVATE OUTSIDE SPACE ;*£1000 legal fee allowance for buyers using a recommended solicitor;BRAND NEW SHOW HOME AVAILABLE TO VIEW BY APPOINTMENT;CCTV covering communal areas;Lift ;Secure cycle storage;Build zone 10-year building warranty;A stylish collection of apartments, penthouses and freehold houses ;Luxury bespoke interiors;Less than a few minutes walk from Earlfield station;Contact Earlsriver Limited for more information
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 999 years remaining * Earlsfield Place is a stylish collection of 102 apartments, penthouses and freehold houses situated in picturesque Earlsfield, the development comprises of a selection of studio, 1,2, 3 bedrooms apartments, penthouses & 6, 3-bedroom freehold houses situated in a tranquil setting by the River Wandle. Earlsfieldplace.co.uk  The apartments and houses have a stylish interior and include integrated appliances, stone worktops, chic bathrooms and contemporary kitchens all handpicked to create a home with an enviable finish.  The development is less than a few minutes' walk from Earlsfield station so commuting around London will be a simple journey no matter where the office is located.  Situated in a quiet corner of Wandsworth, Earlsfield was overlooked for many years in favour of its more well-known neighbours, Wimbledon and Clapham, but with its picturesque terraced houses and wide-open spaces, leafy Earlsfield now shares many of their characteristics and now, it seems, the secret is out. A steady stream of buyers are putting down roots here and the neighbourhood is flourishing as a result.  Earlsfield really does offer something for all its residents and is now one of the most sought-after locations South of the river and it's easy to see why with its village feel, small boutique shops, bakeries and coffee shops making it desirable for Families and young professionals alike.   CALL US TODAY FOR MORE INFORMATION  earlsfieldplace.co.uk  SHOW HOME AVAILABLE TO VIEW BY APPOINTMENT *Stamp duty payable on asking prices

Converted to a high standard from a single dwelling just over 10 years ago, this spacious split level apartment is the perfect home for a growing family climbing the property ladder and offers great value for money.  As you open the door to your private entrance you climb the stairs to the first floor where you will find a huge 17'9" x 17'0" kitchen/living and entertaining area which is oozes an abundance of natural light. The trendy kitchen is fitted and has ample cupboard and work surface space. The living area has more than enough space to create a separate dining and evening room. In addition, floor one also has a full bathroom suite, the third bedroom, which could also serve as multi uses, e.g. a play room or home office and is where you will find stairs down and direct access to your own private garden. Perfect for the upcoming summer months and hosting those family/friend BBQ's. The second floor is where you will find a further two double bedrooms, and a second family bathroom.  This property is offered for sale with a share of the freehold, is double glazed and gas centrally heated throughout. Both the electrics and boiler are regularly serviced.  Park Avenue is a quiet residential road positioned in between Tooting and Streatham Common train stations. The property is well located for local shops, cafes, restaurants and gyms. Council Tax - Merton, Band C - £1583 Per Annum. Brochures Brochure 1

long_description: Our client has accepted an offer on this property and there are no further viewings taking place (STC), please feel free to register your interest by contacting us. Situated in one of the most sought after roads in Wimbledon, a short walk from the district line station at Arthur Road, a beautifully presented and extremely well-maintained, bright and spacious, semi-detached family house with a stunning mature westerly facing garden that extends to around 100ft. This most attractive period property has four bedrooms, wonderful high ceilings, feature fireplaces and extremely well proportioned rooms and whilst the current accommodation extends to some 2000 sq. ft there is the potential to enlarge the house significantly (subject to normal consents).  Other features of the house include some attractive stained-glass windows, a lovely spacious hallway, a westerly facing secluded patio, built in wardrobes and a modern well fitted open plan kitchen dining room. To the front of the house is an attractive easy to maintain landscaped garden packed with a variety of shrubs and plants, there are easy rising steps to the front porchway and an off-street parking space. long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 100 years remaining Welcome to Waterway | Properties are Available to Move into TODAY !   Our show home is open for viewings by appointment.  These remaining remarkable riverside, two bedroom apartments, are available through Shared Ownership with Optivo.  We are DELIGHTED to offer our final (two bed) apartments at a discounted renting price, see price list attached. *Views from Waterway are NOT discounted!   Plot A107, Flat 107 is a first floor] 819 sqft two-bedroom apartment in Block A, complete with private terrace or balcony (3.73 x 2.15m 12'3'' x 7'1'') and a large open plan kitchen/living/dining room with integrated appliances.  Available from £156,250 for a minimum 25% share (£625,000 full market value), Waterway provides the perfect opportunity to get onto the property ladder in one of the most sought-after districts of Southwest London on the banks for the River Thames.  The Costs:  Full market value £625,000 Share 25% Share £156,250 Deposit (min. 5%) £15,625 Mortgage required £140,625 Estimated monthly mortgage £822 Monthly rent £656 Estimated monthly service charge £282 Estimated total monthly costs £1,761 *Costs shown are intended as a guide only and will vary depending on your individual circumstances. See price list or speak to the sales team for full details and supporting information about pricing.  The Area   These apartments are situated in one of the most sought-after districts of South West London on the banks of the River Thames, where Wandsworth meets Putney. You'll be living in an area that's home to a colourful mix of shops and restaurants, bars and boutiques. Local leisure facilities are excellent and you'll also be near lots of luscious green spaces, from Wandsworth Park to Putney Heath.  At Waterway, you'll also enjoy fast transport links to the heart of the city; you can get to Waterloo from Wandsworth Town Station in under 15 minutes, while rail services from East Putney can quickly take you to Victoria. From Wandsworth Riverside, directly next to your new home, you can sail on the Thames Clipper to Westminster, Embankment and London Bridge.  About Shared Ownership   Now that you have found your dream property you're probably asking, "is Shared Ownership right for me?" At Optivo, we know that a new home is one of the biggest purchases you will ever make, and Shared Ownership helps make this a reality.  You'll start by buying a share in your property that's between 25% and 75% of the full value, using a combination of a mortgage and a deposit. You will then pay a subsidised rent on the share you don't buy.  In the future, if your circumstances change and you'd like to, you can purchase more shares in your home, right up to 100%. As your share increases, the rent you pay decreases.  Contact a member of our sales team to discuss your future with us today.  KITCHEN   Fully fitted kitchen from Symphony White gloss units with downlighting Symphony slate grey effect worktop Integrated appliances from Zanussi to include ceramic hob, electric oven, stainless steel extractor hood, dishwasher, washer/dryer, and fridge/freezer  BATHROOM & ENSUITE*   Contemporary bathroom suite from Roca Heated towel rail Grey ceramic tiles, staggered to full height around bath Shaver socket Fitted mirror  SECURITY & CONNECTIVITY   Audio visual entry system to each apartment, allowing communication and entry Mains powered smoke and heat detectors Sky Q and BT sockets to lounge and bedroom (service subject to owners subscription)  FLOORING   Neutral wool mix carpet to bedrooms Engineered oak wood flooring to kitchen, lounge and hallway Grey ceramic tiling to bathroom floor  GENERAL   Balcony or terrace with river views to all apartments 12-year NHBC warranty Built-in wardrobe to master bedroom Underfloor heating Secure allocated parking Cycle storage to ground floor of apartment blocks  *en-suite in specified apartments only All homes are unfurnished with whitewashed walls Brochures Brochure 1

bullet_points: Located within a gated development;Wonderful Georgian room proportions;Lateral accommodation;Garden studio;Carport;Vaulted ceiling in main bedroom suite;South facing landscaped garden;EPC Rating = E
