long_description: A superb three bedroom Georgian Grade II listed house with a wonderful south facing garden.  Description This elegant three double bedroom property is beautifully presented and offers wonderful lateral living and entertaining space across two floors. The house opens into a central hallway to the right is an exceptional drawing room with an attractive fireplace and three beautiful arched windows allowing an abundance of natural light to radiate in.  To the left is a superb kitchen/dining/reception room offering a superb multi-purpose living space.  Full height double glass doors off the reception room open to a 67' south facing landscaped garden with an attractive garden studio and carport. A solid wood kitchen offers an extensive range of fitted units and cupboards, with fully integrated appliances. The utility room is conveniently located off the kitchen. The house also benefits from a downstairs cloakroom. On the first floor an impressive principal suite with an exposed beamed vaulted ceiling, that comprises a generous double bedroom with well designed wardrobe space, dressing room, and luxurious en suite bathroom with a bath tub and a separate glass shower. There are further two double bedrooms and a family bathroom. Location Prospect Place is located off Copse Hill within 1000m of Wimbledon Village and Common. The Village offers a wide variety of pretty boutiques and restaurants with the open space of Wimbledon Common providing over 1,000 acres of parkland ideal for riding, cycling and walking. Within the Common are three golf courses with the famous Royal Wimbledon Golf Club on Camp Road. Locally are a number of highly sought after schools with The Rowans pre-prep and Kings College School both within 800m. Central London can be reached from either Raynes Park or Wimbledon station both accessible via the regular 200 bus route or via foot (Raynes Park 1500m). Train times to London are between 15 and 20 mins with peak times services every 5-7 minutes. Agent's Note: Savills would like potential purchasers aware that Prospect Place is covered by the Copse Hill Conservation Area. bullet_points: Very spacious flat;First floor;Residential road;Garage;Share of freehold;Positioned in quieter corner of the block;Big windows - lots of natural light;Close to Barnes Common, Barnes Station, Putney, East Sheen & Barnes town centres;Smaller block with lower service charges;Near good schools
long_description: A very spacious first floor flat in a friendly low-rise block with a communal garden and reasonable service charges. The flat is well positioned to benefit from plenty of south-facing natural light.  It has spacious rooms, large windows and is located on a quiet residential road.  The accommodation consists of a roomy entrance hall with storage, a lovely bright front lounge with original wood flooring and clear space for living and dining, a really large main bedroom, second double bedroom with an additional area ideal as either a study, wardrobe or could possibly be an ensuite and a recently modernised kitchen and bathroom. The flat is currently serving well as a family home but could serve as an ideal bolt-hole or a more spacious first time buy.  It is move-in ready having had work done throughout and comes with a share of freehold and a garage. Barnes station is a few minutes walk from the property and the amenities of Putney and East Sheen are within walking distance, or a few bus stops away.  A parade of shops at Dover House are also nearby and the green spaces of Richmond Park and Barnes Common are on the doorstep. Brochures Web Details Particulars

long_description: Welcome to Waterway | Properties are Available to Move into TODAY !   Our show home is open for viewings by appointment.  These remaining remarkable riverside, two bedroom apartments, are available through Shared Ownership with Optivo.  We are DELIGHTED to offer our final (two bed) apartments at a discounted renting price, see price list attached. *Views from Waterway are NOT discounted!   Plot B406, Flat 406 is a fourth floor, 704 sqft two-bedroom apartment in Block B, complete with private terrace or balcony (3.73 x 2.15m 12'3'' x 7'1'') and a large open plan kitchen/living/dining room with integrated appliances and parking.  Available from £163,125 for a minimum 25% share (£652,500 full market value), Waterway provides the perfect opportunity to get onto the property ladder in one of the most sought-after districts of Southwest London on the banks for the River Thames.  The Costs:  Full market value £652,500 Share 25% Share £163,125 Deposit (min. 5%) £16,313 Mortgage required £146,813 Estimated monthly mortgage £858 Monthly rent £685 Estimated monthly service charge £226 Estimated total monthly costs £1,769 *Costs shown are intended as a guide only and will vary depending on your individual circumstances. See price list or speak to the sales team for full details and supporting information about pricing.  The Area   These apartments are situated in one of the most sought-after districts of South West London on the banks of the River Thames, where Wandsworth meets Putney. You will be living in an area that's home to a colourful mix of shops and restaurants, bars and boutiques. Local leisure facilities are excellent, and you'll also be near lots of luscious green spaces, from Wandsworth Park to Putney Heath.  At Waterway, you will also enjoy fast transport links to the heart of the city; you can get to Waterloo from Wandsworth Town Station in under 15 minutes, while rail services from East Putney can quickly take you to Victoria. From Wandsworth Riverside, directly next to your new home, you can sail on the Thames Clipper to Westminster, Embankment and London Bridge.  About Shared Ownership   Now that you have found your dream property you're probably asking, "is Shared Ownership right for me?" At Optivo, we know that a new home is one of the biggest purchases you will ever make, and Shared Ownership helps make this a reality.  You'll start by buying a share in your property that's between 25% and 75% of the full value, using a combination of a mortgage and a deposit. You will then pay a subsidised rent on the share you don't buy.  In the future, if your circumstances change and you'd like to, you can purchase more shares in your home, right up to 100%. As your share increases, the rent you pay decreases.  Contact a member of our sales team to discuss your future with us today.  KITCHEN   Fully fitted kitchen from Symphony White gloss units with downlighting Symphony slate grey effect worktop Integrated appliances from Zanussi to include ceramic hob, electric oven, stainless steel extractor hood, dishwasher, washer/dryer, and fridge/freezer  BATHROOM & ENSUITE*   Contemporary bathroom suite from Roca Heated towel rail Grey ceramic tiles, staggered to full height around bath Shaver socket Fitted mirror  SECURITY & CONNECTIVITY   Audio visual entry system to each apartment, allowing communication and entry Mains powered smoke and heat detectors Sky Q and BT sockets to lounge and bedroom (service subject to owners subscription)  FLOORING   Neutral wool mix carpet to bedrooms Engineered oak wood flooring to kitchen, lounge and hallway Grey ceramic tiling to bathroom floor  GENERAL    Balcony or terrace with river views to all apartments 12-year NHBC warranty Built-in wardrobe to master bedroom Underfloor heating Secure allocated parking Cycle storage to ground floor of apartment blocks  *en-suite in specified apartments only All homes are unfurnished with whitewashed walls  Brochures Brochure 1

There is a light entrance hall which leads to a front reception room with square bay, a second reception that has patio doors leading to a good size garden with brick outbuilding, a galley style kitchen and downstairs W.C.  On the first floor there are two double bedrooms, a single bedroom and family bathroom.  On the second floor there is a master bedroom and en-suite shower room. bullet_points: In the Heart of the Colliers Wood Community.;Double Glazing Throughout.;Wooden Floors Throughout.;Open Plan Kitchen Living Room.;5 Minutes Walk to Colliers Wood Underground Station.;Strong Rental Yield c. £1450pcm / 5.3% yield;ocal Amenities at Colliers Wood High Street.;Bright and Charming Apartment.;Close to Merton Abbey Mills, Wandle Park, and the Award Winning Colliers Wood Recreation Ground;EPC is rated C
long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with eXp UK PLEASE QUOTE JW032 If you are looking for your first step onto the property ladder or a strong performing buy to let ( c. £1450pcm / 5.3% yield,)  this charming apartment in the heart of the Colliers Wood community offers a fantastic opportunity at a very attractive entry point. This beautifully presented one-bedroom ground floor apartment is located on the highly sought-after tree-lined residential Wilton road, just moments from Colliers Wood High Street, all of the local shops and amenities at the Tandem Centre retail park, an award-winning nearby park, and a five-minute walk to the Colliers Woods Northern Line Tube station. Within a handsome converted building, the apartment is presented immaculately and benefits from high ceilings, wooden flooring, and charm throughout. The apartment consists of an open plan kitchen with full modern appliances, a bright and airy living room, a spacious master bedroom with large bay windows, letting in lots of light throughout the whole day, and a well-appointed modern bathroom. Wilton Road is a stone’s throw away from the many shops, bars, and restaurants of Colliers Wood High Street and the open spaces of the Award Winning Recreation Ground featuring a children's playground, ornamental gardens, and a paddling pool, the National Trust Wandle Park, the Wandle Meadow Nature Park the heritage centre at Merton Abbey Mills, offering independent eateries, an arts and crafts market and summer festivals. A selection of nurseries and the outstanding Singlegate gate School are also close by. Tooting High Street including the ever-famous Tooting Markets is also just a stroll from your front door and the gorgeous Wimbledon Village and Wimbledon Common, which share the SW19 postcode, are also close by. The apartment benefits from double glazing throughout and Residents Permit Parking is also available on the street. 90 Year Lease Remaining SC c.£1500pa Ground rent £150pa Brochures Brochure 1

long_description: Situated on the ground floor of this imposing Victorian building this cleverly arranged one bedroom apartment enjoys easy access to the amenities of Earlsfield and is ideally located within 0.9m of the mainline station. The open-plan kitchen/reception room features a large bay window and high ceilings whilst coving and fireplace remain in situ. Off-street unallocated parking is an added benefit along with use of communal grounds. Tenure: Leasehold Auctioneers Additional Comments Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.   Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.  This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent.  The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website. Auctioneers Additional Comments Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer.  A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.  In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures. Auctioneers Additional Comments In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon exchange of contracts the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit of 5% of the purchase price of the property. The deposit will be a contribution to the purchase price. A non-refundable reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of 6,000 inc VAT) is also required to be paid upon agreement of sale. The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs.  Both the Marketing Agent and The Auctioneer may believe it necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or indeed obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services. Brochures Brochure

long_description: A rare opportunity to acquire a ground floor, one bedroom maisonette, being offered with no onward chain, in the ever popular Durham Road in West Wimbledon. With the benefit of Off Street Parking, Private Garden & Being Share of Freehold this property is ideal for first time buyers, downsizers and investors.   * Council Tax Band C  *Lease 63 years remaining  *SC N/A  *GR N/A This beautiful ground floor one bedroom property has a long drive way allowing for off street parking for one car. The spacious double bedroom has large built in storage. The comfortable reception room has double doors leading to the rear garden which allows the room to have ample light and air. The kitchen is to the rear of the property with eye and base level units with ample space for a dining table and chairs. The  bathroom has a tiled floor, low level W/C, wash hand basin and a bath.  The garden is a great size with a path leading from the front to back. The property is situated on a most sought after residential road, well placed for access into Raynes Park with its commuter station offering fast and frequent services to London Waterloo.  A selection of useful shops (including Waitrose) and businesses, the green spaces of Wimbledon Common, Holland Gardens and Cottenham Park are also within easy reach. long_description: *** Vendor comments *** "Before viewing the property, we sat in our car and just enjoyed the quiet! It was bliss for us, living at the time on a busy main road. When we came through the door, we both liked the spacious feel of the entrance, the high ceilings in the bedrooms and the abundance of natural light the property has (even then with a galley kitchen!). The large garden and detached double garage were the icings on the cake and in 2004 we became the proud owners. The property borders 3 local councils with excellent transport links from Mitcham Eastfields, Streatham Common and Norbury, making getting to Central London so easy. Buses and the Tram make getting to Croydon or Mitcham Town Centre a quick commute. Mitcham Common is our best-kept secret and we have enjoyed exploring it on foot and cycle rides. We are now 16 years on... with walls removed, new walls created, an open plan integrated kitchen put in and French doors to the garden. We also have a paved patio area to sit and enjoy a cup of tea. We have enjoyed our home and wish we could transport our home to South Hams, but alas that is not possible so we will take with us instead, all our beautiful memories from "Sunny" (nicknamed such because of the natural light throughout the property). We know it will be a lovely home for its new owners." Front garden 17' 3" x 37' 9" (5.26m x 11.51m) Front reception room 11' 11" x 13' 3" (3.63m x 4.04m) Downstairs WC Open plan kitchen & dining room 17' 3" x 11' 11" (5.26m x 3.63m) Bedroom one 11' 2" x 0' 0" (3.40m x 0.00m) Bedroom two 10' 8" x 11' 11" (3.25m x 3.63m) Bathroom 6' 8" x 5' 11" (2.03m x 1.80m) Bedroom three 6' 8" x 6' 5" (2.03m x 1.96m) Rear garden Double Garage 21' 2" x 19' 3" (6.45m x 5.87m) Brochures Brochure 1

Falcon Wharf is located on Lombard Road, close to Battersea Square and benefiting from all the local shops and restaurants of the Square and the surrounding area. Battersea Bridge is close by giving easy access over to Chelsea as well as Battersea Park, with its 200 acres of recreational space. Clapham Junction is close by, and frequent trains run to both Victoria (in 7 minutes) and Waterloo (in 9 minutes). Transport further into the City and Canary Wharf can also be accessed via Clapham Junction and the Clipper Boat. There are also several bus routes a short walk from Falcon Wharf that run over the bridges. The buyer will require a deposit to obtain a mortgage for this property. bullet_points: HELP TO BUY AVAILABLE * on eligible units *;Stylish Kitchens & Bathrooms;MOVE IN NOW;999 Year lease ;Ground Floor;Bespoke specification;5 Minutes to Earlsfield station;PRIVATE OUTSIDE SPACE ;*£1000 legal fee allowance for buyers using a recommended solicitor;BRAND NEW SHOW HOME AVAILABLE TO VIEW BY APPOINTMENT;CCTV covering communal areas;Lift ;Secure cycle storage;Build zone 10-year building warranty;A stylish collection of apartments, penthouses and freehold houses ;Luxury bespoke interiors;Less than a few minutes walk from Earlfield station;Contact Earlsriver Limited for more information
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 999 years remaining * Earlsfield Place is a stylish collection of 102 apartments, penthouses and freehold houses situated in picturesque Earlsfield, the development comprises of a selection of studio, 1,2, 3 bedrooms apartments, penthouses & 6, 3-bedroom freehold houses situated in a tranquil setting by the River Wandle. Earlsfieldplace.co.uk  The apartments and houses have a stylish interior and include integrated appliances, stone worktops, chic bathrooms and contemporary kitchens all handpicked to create a home with an enviable finish.  The development is less than a few minutes' walk from Earlsfield station so commuting around London will be a simple journey no matter where the office is located.  Situated in a quiet corner of Wandsworth, Earlsfield was overlooked for many years in favour of its more well-known neighbours, Wimbledon and Clapham, but with its picturesque terraced houses and wide-open spaces, leafy Earlsfield now shares many of their characteristics and now, it seems, the secret is out. A steady stream of buyers are putting down roots here and the neighbourhood is flourishing as a result.  Earlsfield really does offer something for all its residents and is now one of the most sought-after locations South of the river and it's easy to see why with its village feel, small boutique shops, bakeries and coffee shops making it desirable for Families and young professionals alike.   CALL US TODAY FOR MORE INFORMATION  earlsfieldplace.co.uk  SHOW HOME AVAILABLE TO VIEW BY APPOINTMENT *Stamp duty payable on asking prices

long_description: SUMMARY CHAIN FREE two bedroom spacious flat located within close proximity to transport links and local shops. DESCRIPTION CHAIN FREE two bedroom spacious flat located within close proximity to transport links and local shops.  A two double bedroom, ground floor apartment located within a nature park is offered to the market with no ongoing chain and located within close proximity to an array of local shops, cafes and further amenities. A spacious ground floor two bedroom apartment with large living room, separate kitchen, family bathroom and patio. The property is chain free, benefits from very long lease and a private garage. This would make a good first purchase or BTL investment with the opportunity for any purchaser to place their own stamp on the property. Located on the borders of Morden and Mitcham located within close proximity beside the River Wandle Trail and is surrounded by the beauty of the Watermeads Nature Reserve and convenient bus routes at the base of the road and Tram Station within striking distance. Auctioneer's Comments   This property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited.  This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.  The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 inc VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack. The estate agent and auctioneer may recommend the services of other providers to you, in which they will be paid for the referral. These services are optional, and you will be advised of any payment, in writing before any services are accepted. Listing is subject to a start price and undisclosed reserve price that can change. long_description: SeOUL Residential are delighted to offer you this larger than average semi- detached 3 bedroom home, located on a lovely and charming cul-de-sac off Grand Drive in Raynes Park. This property is arranged over 2 floor, the ground floor accommodates a large reception room, dining room and kitchen, all bright and airy. On the first floor there comprises 2 sizeable double bedrooms, a single room and a family bathroom with a separate W.C. Externally this lovely home comes with a front garden and driveway big enough for 2 vehicles. The property boasts a large plot to the side of the premise from the front driveway all the way to the rear garden, with one planning permissions granted for an extension and loft conversion available. Great Development/ Investment opportunity. In the rear garden at the tip of the lawn contains 2 sheds available for storage. Second Planning permission granted to build a separate house on side of the property. The property is in need for an update and renovation as it has not been updated in a while. Suitable for someone who is happy for a project. Equally convenient for the commuter as Raynes Park Train Station is only 0.5 miles away from the property. Which all go into Central London Waterloo Station in under 30 mins. The A3 is also only a moments drive away and leads to Central London or Guildford in the opposite direction and both Heathrow and Gatwick Airport. Suitable for families as there are plenty of green space around like Cannon Hill, Ofsted credited `Good` schools around the area. long_description: A well presented and spacious one bedroom first floor Retirement living PLUS development conveniently located for local shops, medical center and transport links.. Summary  - Liberty House is a purpose built Retirement Living Plus development built by McCarthy & Stone, designed specifically for the over 70s, for those who wish to enjoy independent living but may need some extra care and support. There is an Estate Manager who leads the team and oversees the development. The apartment comprises of a fully fitted kitchen, underfloor heating, fitted and tiled shower room, spacious bedroom and lounge. 24 hour emergency call system. Communal facilities include a Club lounge where social events and activities take place, a function room and a roof top terrace there are also landscaped gardens. There are two fully equipped laundry rooms and a restaurant which is table service and serves freshly prepared Lunch and evening meals daily. If your guests wish to stay, there is guest suite accommodation which can be booked (fees apply). There is a 24 hour emergency call system provided by a personal pendant and call points in your bedroom and bathroom as well as onsite management 24 hours a day. One hour of domestic support per week is included in the service charge at Liberty House with additional services including care and support available at an extra charge. However, this can be from as little as 15 minutes per session which can be increased or decreased to suit your needs.  Liberty House is conveniently located within the London Borough of Merton, between Wimbledon and New Malden and only 8 Miles from Central London, Raynes Park is a popular spot with a bustling social scene. Entrance Hall  - Front door with spyhole leads to the entrance hall, the 24 hour Tunstall emergency response pull cord system is in place. Illuminated light switches and smoke detector. From the hallway there is a door to a walk in storage and airing cupboard. Doors lead to the bedroom, living room and shower room. Living Room  - A very well presented spacious living/dining room. Fitted storage cupboard Two ceiling light points, raised power points. TV & telephone points. Partially glazed doors lead onto a separate kitchen. Full length windows overlooking landscaped gardens with a South-Westerly aspect. Kitchen  - Fully fitted kitchen with modern cupboard doors and co-ordinating work surfaces. Contemporary ceiling lights. Stainless steel sink with chrome mixer tap. There is an integrated fridge/freezer, a fitted electric oven and built-in microwave oven and a fitted electric ceramic hob with extractor over and tiled splashbacks. Bedroom  - A spacious double bedroom with door to walk-in wardrobe. Underfloor heating, TV and phone point and ceiling lights. Full length windows overlooking landscaped gardens. Shower Room  - Modern suite comprising of; close-coupled WC, vanity wash-hand basin with fitted furniture surround including storage both below and to the side, fitted mirror, shaver point and down lights over, walk-in level access shower with thermostatically controlled shower. fully tiled walls and wet room tiled flooring, electric heated towel rail, emergency pull cord and ceiling spot light. Service Charge (Breakdown)  - • Cleaning of communal windows   • Water rates for communal areas and apartments  • Electricity, heating, lighting and power to communal areas  • 24 hour emergency call system  • Upkeep of gardens and grounds  • Repairs and maintenance to the interior and exterior communal areas  • Contingency fund including internal and external redecoration of communal areas  • Buildings insurance  • The apartment heating and hot water One hour of domestic support per week is included in the service charge  The Service charge does not cover external costs such as your Council Tax, electricity or TV, but does include the cost of your Estates Manager, your water rates, our 24 hour emergency call system, the heating and maintenance of all communal areas and all external window cleaning, exterior property maintenance and gardening. Find out more about service charges please contact your Property Consultant or Estates Manager. Service charge: £9,198.34 per annum (for financial year ending 30/09/22) Leasehold  - Ground Rent £495 p.a Ground rent review date: June 2030 999 Years from 2015 Brochures Liberty House, Kingston Road, Raynes Park, London EAC link

long_description: The Property NO ONWARD CHAIN. Beautifully appointed two double bedroom Victorian house with many original features, ideally located on a highly sought after road minutes from Wimbledon town center and excellent transport links. NEW BATHROOM and offered with NO CHAIN. To the ground floor the entrance hall is adorned with a beautiful prime oak floor which extends throughout the ground floor. There is an impressive double reception room complete with a feature bay window that allows for plenty of natural light and there is a stunning original stain glass window adjacent to the dinning area. As you approach the rear of the property you enter the modern kitchen which is an ideal size and provides access to the rear decked garden. The kitchen is just off the living dinning area and has recently been updated and also leads to a handy utility room with downstairs w.c. To the first floor there is a new luxury family bathroom with rainfall shower over the bath and two double bedrooms both with prime oak floor. Particular mention must be made of the master bedroom which is of a particularly good size with fitted wardrobes either side of the feature fireplace and has large sash windows. Outside, there is a private walled courtyard garden which requires very little maintenance and is fitted with decking. Location The property is ideally located on a highly sought after road just off the High Street and Wimbledon Theatre is just at the top of the road.  Wimbledon Mainline Station and South Wimbledon Underground Station are within easy walking distance making it a perfect location for anyone commuting into the City. There are also a number of outstanding Schools nearby, including St Mary’s Primary School. Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. long_description: A unique 2 bedroom mews house with a garage  Description Set within a secure gated development, this unique mews house offers light and spacious accommodation throughout with a private terrace and off-street parking. On the ground floor you have the main bedroom which is presented beautifully with an en-suite bathroom and built in wardrobes, the second bedroom and a family bathroom opposite. The floor completes with a very useful utility room and private garage which could be converted in to a further bedroom STPP. The first floor offers open plan living space with double height ceilings and huge floor to ceiling window letting in an abundance of natural light. The kitchen is sleek with integrated appliances and plenty of storage. This house offers great entertaining space as well as the sunny west facing terrace which is ideal for alfresco dining. Location Zulu Mews is a private gated development located just off Cabul Road. It is only a short walk from Battersea Square, Battersea Park and Clapham Junction and is excellently located for the well-known Thomas’ School on Battersea High Street. The property is well situated for all the amenities in the local area, including Battersea Park which provides excellent recreational facilities, including tennis courts and cafes. Clapham Junction, Queenstown Road and Battersea Park stations are all nearby with services into the City and West End. There are also many good bus routes in the area which take you North of the river to Chelsea via either Battersea or Chelsea Bridges.  The property also benefits from the new development in Nine Elms, including the Power Station. This will provide a number of wide boulevards offering many amenities including restaurants, shops, bars and cinemas. There is also the new Northern line tube station. Square Footage: 1,303 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

station_info: [(0.4, 'Imperial Wharf Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.7, 'Clapham Junction Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-overground'), (1.0, 'Wandsworth Town Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: A three storey town house in a superb location moments from Battersea Square, benefitting from a 32ft South facing garden and off street parking, with significant potential to improve and extend (subject to planning permission).  Accommodation is currently configured over three floors. Entering the house on the ground floor there is a reception/dining room to the front of the property, a central staircase leading upstairs and guest WC. To the rear of the ground floor is the bright eat in kitchen leading through to the conservatory and out into the 32ft South facing  garden.  The first floor has a formal reception room to the front and principle bedroom to the rear with en suite shower room, over looking the garden. There are a further two bedrooms on the third floor, one with en suite shower room and a separate family bathroom.  The approximate internal area of the house is currently 1,503sqft with potential to extend significantly, subject to planning permission.  Location  Vicarage Crescent is a quiet residential Street, located close to the shops and restaurants of Battersea Square, including The Woodman Pub, Gails Bakery and London House by Gordon Ramsey. Thomas's School is also located close by.  The wide open spaces of Battersea Park are close by, as well as the iconic Battersea Power Station. Crossing the river via Battersea Bridge takes you into Chelsea via Beaufort Street. Local transport links include the 170 bus to Sloane Square and mainline services from Clapham Junctions Station.

long_description: The property benefits from 904 sqft of internal space and opens into a central hallway on the first floor. Off the hallway is a  stylish shower room and fantastic open plan kitchen/dining/ living space, perfect for entertaining. There is a west-facing private balcony off the living area with views over the communal gardens.  The contemporary kitchen offers an extensive range of fitted units and cupboards with integrated appliances. Stairs lead down to two double bedrooms; the principal bedroom contains a spacious family bathroom and doors leading directly out onto the communal gardens.  The building itself has a porter, gym and 15 seater cinema for the use of all residents. There is an allocated underground parking space and communal gardens to enjoy. The property is leasehold and presented to the market chain free. The Downs is a short distance to Wimbledon Common, the Village and Wimbledon mainline train station and underground train station (District Line). There are many good schools in the area, both in the private and public sector and a wide range of recreational activities are available such as tennis and golf clubs. bullet_points: Two double bedrooms;Award winning gated mews development;Moments from Clapham Junction Station;Modern loft-style open plan reception;Study with glass partition wall;High ceilings;Hi Spec kitchen with dining area;Master bedroom with en-suite shower room;2nd double bedroom and shower room;Chain Free
station_info: [(0.2, 'Clapham Junction Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-overground'), (1.0, 'Clapham South Station', 'svg-underground'), (1.0, 'Wandsworth Town Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: Immaculately presented two bedroom, two bathroom loft style apartment situated on the first floor of an exclusive gated mews development close to Clapham Junction and Clapham Common.  Enter via a private gate and you'll discover a peaceful cobbled courtyard, unchanged since its first life as an industrious Victorian bakery. The large, lateral apartments that make up The Bakehouse are completely unique. Designed to retain as many original features as possible, they all have their own distinct personality, with handmade kitchens and bespoke flooring designed to celebrate and accentuate every nuance.  This beautifully designed apartment consists of a large loft-style reception room and open plan kitchen and dining area which benefits from fully integrated Siemens appliances, American style fridge freezer and a Franke sink. The remainder of the apartment consists of a master bedroom with vaulted ceiling, built in storage and en suite shower room and a further large bedroom and bathroom.  Further features include high ceilings, under floor heating throughout and an intercom to the electric gates fronting onto Altenburg Gardens.  Location  There is no need to escape the city if you live in Battersea. Wandsworth is the greenest London borough with over 1,700 acres of outdoor spaces to enjoy, including the iconic, 200-acre, Battersea Park and the wide open spaces of Clapham Common and Wandsworth Common.  Battersea and nearby Wandsworth are packed with wonderful gastro pubs and an unrivalled mix of high-end restaurants and famous local gems - from Michelin star cuisine at Chez Bruce, to the many local restaurants, boutique shops and cafes on the Northcote Road, which includes Gails, Oree, The Bolingbroke pub and many more.  Battersea is famous for being super-connected, allowing you to get anywhere in London quickly and easily. Trains frequently run from Clapham Junction station into both London Victoria and London Waterloo stations.

bullet_points: 5 bedrooms;5 reception rooms;4 bathrooms;Period;Detached;Garden;Parking;Patio;Town/City;Private Parking
station_info: [(0.3, 'Wimbledon Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-underground;svg-tramlink'), (0.6, 'Dundonald Road Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink'), (0.7, 'Wimbledon Park Station', 'svg-underground')]
long_description: Situated on a highly desirable residential street close to Wimbledon Village, this well presented five-bedroom detached house offers almost 4,000 sq ft of family space and a large south-facing garden. Briefly comprising a large entrance hall off which is a bright study and large double reception room, with balcony overlooking the garden.  Downstairs on the garden level is a spacious kitchen/family room, prep kitchen, utility and storage room as well as a playroom. On the first floor is a grand principal bedroom with a walk-in dressing room and en suite bathroom. Additionally, there are two further bedrooms and a family bathroom. On the top floor are two more double bedrooms, a separate bathroom and plenty of eaves storage.  The house benefits from stunning views over Wimbledon and towards the Surrey Hills from the first and second floor rooms. At the rear is a large south-facing garden with patio space accessed via the kitchen. The remaining garden is a lawn with artificial grass.  At the front is a sweeping carriage driveway allowing parking for several vehicles. Belvedere Drive is considered one of the finest addresses in Wimbledon Village, being near the Village High Street and Common as well as being convenient for the Mainline and Tube stations in Wimbledon Town.  There are many excellent local schools in the area both in the State and Private Sectors and a variety of leisure facilities including Golf Courses, Tennis Clubs and Health Clubs. Heathrow and Gatwick Airports are both accessible via the A3 and M25 motorways. Brochures More Details brochure

bullet_points: Share Of Freehold + Chain Free Sale;Private Rear South-Facing Garden ;Bathroom In Centre Of Flat With Kitchen At Rear;Large Living Room And Master Bedroom;Newly Redecorated, Double Glazing And New Boiler;Quick Walk To Tube Station And Shops;Close To River Wandle Walks And Cycling Routes
station_info: [(0.1, 'Colliers Wood Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.6, 'Haydons Road Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.7, 'Tooting Broadway Station', 'svg-underground')]
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 110 years remaining The Property A delightful, two bedroom maisonette, with Share of Freehold and long lease, being sold with no chain. With its own front door, period features, high ceilings and private South-facing garden, the maisonette is ideally located on College Road a short walk to Colliers Wood high street, tube station, supermarkets and gym, and close to local parks and the river Wandle.  This fantastic property is spacious and bright throughout. Set on the ground floor, there is a welcoming hallway upon entry with useful built-in storage space. At the front is a bright living room with high ceilings, cornicing and period fireplace. The larger of the two bedrooms is behind this with window onto the garden, built-in wardrobe and also with high ceilings. There is a lovely second bedroom beyond, and the layout has been reconfigured so the full, modern bathroom is at the middle of the property. At the end of the hallway is a spacious, stylish fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, plenty of storage and space for dining. French windows provide access to the private and secluded-feeling South facing garden with decking which enjoys the sun year round. The property has double glazing throughout, has just been redecorated and a new Baxi boiler was installed last year. As a share of freehold maisonette there is no ground rent or service charges.  College Road is a quiet residential road, perfectly located around the corner from Wandle Park and moments from Colliers Wood high street and tube station. Both central Tooting and Wimbledon are within walking distance. There is a large M&S Foodhall, Sainsburys and Nuffield Gym with swimming pool within easy walking distance in Colliers Wood. Historic Merton Abbey Mills with popular restaurants and bars is close by and the Wandle riverside provides idyllic walking routes to the National Trusts Morden Hall Park. Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

long_description: Our client has accepted an offer on this property and there are no further viewings taking place (STC), please feel free to register your interest by contacting us. Set in a wonderful, secluded location in the heart of Wimbledon Village moments’ walk from the local boutiques, cafes and restaurants, an extremely well maintained double fronted five-bedroom three bathroom modern end of terrace house with a westerly facing garden that attracts the afternoon sun and two unusually good sized single garages, with light and power. The property forms part of a crescent of houses set back off Church Road in an exclusive small, well-maintained development which is surrounded by beautiful mature trees and has ample parking space for residents. The property has undergone conversion of the loft space, which has appealing views to the rear, and the installation of three new bathrooms in the past few years and the garden has been beautifully designed with an extensive array of shrubs and flowering plants surrounding the spacious patio. DESCRIPTION Barnard Marcus are delighted to offer to the market this large split level maisonette boasting 848 sq ft of living and entertaining space.  The property is arranged over the first and second floors of this purpose built accommodation and boasts a private balcony, with stunning views of the well kept communal gardens.  Upon entering the property, you have an eat in kitchen to the front of the property and towards the rear of the property is the lounge and balcony.  Leading upstairs, the property offers 3 bedrooms, all of which are adorned with storage, and a family bathroom. Carey Gardens is ideally located for Battersea Power Station while Vauxhall and Stockwell are nearby. Excellent transport links are in abundance with bus links nearby and the Battersea Power Station (Northern Line) and Wandsworth Road (Overground).  The property is within walking distance to Battersea Park and Clapham Common as well as the Battersea Power Station development. Auctioneer's Comments   This property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited.  This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.  The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 inc VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack. The estate agent and auctioneer may recommend the services of other providers to you, in which they will be paid for the referral. These services are optional, and you will be advised of any payment, in writing before any services are accepted. Listing is subject to a start price and undisclosed reserve price that can change. We currently hold lease details as displayed above, should you require further information please contact the branch. long_description: Offered to the market this second floor apartment which is located within a stone’s throw from the world famous Battersea Power station. The property comprises one double bedroom, spacious reception room, kitchen diner which offers space for a small table and chairs, residents parking and a communal garden. The property further benefits from being offered to the market chain free.  Thessaly Road is a great location near Battersea Power Station, venture just a bit further out of this delightful backwater of streets and you will come across the well renowned Battersea Park much appreciated for the well-kept wide open green spaces, a favorite place to be during the summer months. Also nearby are a cosmopolitan mix of shops, bars, boutiques and restaurants. The transport links are excellent, with Battersea Park railway stations with direct trains to Victoria, and Queenstown Road with direct trains to Waterloo. There are also a variety of good bus routes locally with buses heading north of the river to Chelsea, Kensington and Knightsbridge.

long_description: A bright, spacious flat in a lovely lodge building with two double bedrooms and two bathrooms plus parking.  The flat is in a quiet residential area surrounded by trees and greenery.  The flat is offered to the market with no chain and benefits from large windows with plenty of light and an airy feel.  The flat is on the first floor of a lovely building completed only circa 2008 but with a period feel to it.  Both bedrooms are comfortably doubles and the main bedroom has an ensuite.  There is decent storage throughout, attractive wood flooring and double glazed windows. The flat is a short walk (approx 10 minutes) to Southfields offering a tube station and plenty of shops and cafes. long_description: A sensational two bedroom split-level flat with a private roof terrace.  Description Situated on the second and third floors of a charming period terrace house is this beautifully presented two bedroom flat with a sensational roof terrace. The second floor is comprised of the two generously proportioned bedrooms towards the rear, one of which benefits from dual aspect windows and an ensuite bathroom with a bath shower. The second bedroom has access to a private balcony and a sliding door shower as well as the use of the single W.C accessed via the hallway.    The main living and entertaining area is situated towards the front of the property and benefits from double height ceilings and a triptych of sash windows as well as sky lights flooding the room with light from all angles. The reception room is complemented with stylish radiators, an ornate fire place and built in shelving. Stairs lead up to the kitchen area on the third floor which has a glass balcony looking down into the sitting room. The modern, eat-in kitchen benefits from a variety of integrated appliances such as a glass hob, wine fridge and oven. A large glass door leads out to the approximately 18ft roof terrace, a wonderful suntrap during the summer months and a fantastically private outdoor space. Location St. Ann’s Crescent is situated in the heart of a predominantly residential area. Wandsworth Town station provides the nearest mainline transport with services into Waterloo. The area is well known for the excellent recreational facilities of Wandsworth Common and benefits from a wide selection of local shops, bars, restaurants and Southside shopping centre. Square Footage: 991 sq ft Leasehold with approximately 102 years remaining. Brochures Web Details

long_description: A brand new development situated in the heart of desirable Wimbledon. 17 Russell Road is a chic and stylish property comprised of studio, one bedroom and two bedroom apartments, all finished to an exceptional standard and each benefitting from its own private outside space (garden, terrace or balcony). The kitchens are fully handle-less, German engineered (by Krieder) and include linear LED lighting to wall units, 20mm thick quartz worktops (by Caesarstone), Blanco sink & tap, Siemens oven, induction hob and canopy hood, along with integrated dishwasher and fridge freezer (by Blaupunkt). The bathrooms feature Duravit bathroom sanitaryware with Crosswater Taps, bespoke mirrored wall cabinets, Strata feature ceramic tiles and shaver sockets. Other advantages include (but are not limited to) underfloor heating throughout, high efficiency electric boilers, mechanical ventilation with heat recovery, individual Solar Photovoltaic panels serving each apartment with individual smart meters, low energy LED lighting throughout, mains smoke and heat detectors, fibre broadband and telephone points, access to Virgin Media and Openreach, video-entry system to all apartments, individual post boxes and a secure Cycle storage cupboard for each dwelling. In addition, all apartments are offered with a 10 year structural warranty. The excellent location and transport links provide fast access to businesses, shops, entertainment and international travel. Prices range from £450k to £750k, with 40% Help to Buy London available on the units up to £600k. Available to view from 25 June, please call now to register your interest or pre-book your viewing. Photos are indicative only. station_info: [(0.9, 'Beddington Lane Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink'), (0.9, 'Norbury Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (1.0, 'Therapia Lane Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink')]
long_description: *** Vendor comments *** "When I first saw this property I knew it was the one for me. I had been looking for a while and had not seen such a great space! It felt and still feels incredibly homely. It is neatly tucked away in the corner, so it is incredibly quiet, which is an added bonus. I particularly loved how I had my own front door, as it meant I had my own private entrance, something which was really unique to this flat. I have recently renovated the flat to a modern standard, which adds to allowing it to feel like a home, instead of just a house. Each room is a fantastic size! The bedroom can fit a double bed in, and I have also added a desk which is useful on the days I work from home. The bedroom also has a built-in wardrobe which is huge! I have had the added bonus of having an incredibly generously sized garden, which is the perfect space for children to play in, or for having friends and family over in the summer months. There is also, of course, scope to extend the flat too. Visitors are always impressed at the size of the living room, and the fact that I have a separate kitchen as well! With an integrated fridge/freezer, oven and microwave, you could easily feel at home from the moment you move in. This property also is fortunate to have a private garage space, what more could you really ask for? Well, there is more! Being 30 seconds to a minute walk away from bus stops that can take you to local areas around such as Streatham and Croydon, in as little as 15 minutes is definitely an added bonus. The flat is also close to three Zone 3 train stations which can take you into Central London in as little as 15 minutes. If you are a driver there is plenty of free parking around, as well as the garage space. There is also a range of local shops within a two-minute walk, which has been useful when I’ve forgotten the crucial ingredient or item off of my shopping list! Buying this property was undoubtedly the best decision I have made. I have lived here for two and a half years, and after much deliberation, I have decided to move on to be closer to family." long_description: The Property A bright and immaculately presented three bedroom end of terrace house for sale, with off street parking, large garden and garage, and all located within easy reach of both Mitcham Eastfields and Tooting City Thameslink and Tooting Broadway underground stations.   This delightful home offers three bedroom and two bathrooms, with the potential to be extended further into the loft STPP. The ground floor boasts a large, bright extended kitchen/ diner with bifold doors leading on to the rear garden. Also on the ground floor are two further reception rooms, one of which has a cosy working log burner. The utility space leads to a downstairs bathroom.   The garden is large, established and traps the south westerly sun. It offers both rear and side access, and comes complete with a garage and potting shed. The property also has a dedicated off street parking space at the front.    Edgehill Road is a quiet, residential cul de sac, within catchment of a number of good schools, and has Figges Marsh, Tooting, Mitcham and Streatham Commons all close by. This is the perfect family home! long_description: An attractive four bedroom detached family house in a much sought after location on the Drax Estate.  Description This impressive four bedroom family home has been extended and offers well balanced living and entertaining space with scope to extend further into the loft subject to the required consent. A deep, wide entrance hall leads to a generous bay fronted double reception room to the front, currently used as a drawing room and dining room. To the rear is a wonderful  conservatory that runs across the back of the house overlooking the garden. Two sets of double doors open to a large paved terrace featuring a wooden pergola creating a lovely shaded outside dining space.  The kitchen is fully fitted with integrated appliances, base units and cupboards with stone work tops. There is also a large utility room running from the front to the back of the house, a garage and downstairs cloak/shower room. The principal bedroom is located to the rear of the house on the first floor, with well designed fitted wardrobes, a generous en suite bathroom with twin sinks and lovely views of the garden. There are three further bedrooms on this floor, two have built in storage and one has a stylish en suite shower room. There is also a separate WC on this floor. The beautiful west facing garden has a large terrace, mature trees and well kept flowerbeds. To the front  is off street parking for several cars and a garage. Location Barham Road is located in Wimbledon just off Copse Hill. A good collection of everyday shops and cafes on Coombe Lane are within 400 metres Wimbledon Common with its fabulous open space, ideal for riding, walking and cycling is only 500 metres away, with Raynes Park station being around 1 mile away offering a fast and regular link to central London in around 20 minutes. Wimbledon Village with its popular bars and pretty boutiques is around 1.5 miles away.  Locally are a number of sought after schools with The Rowans and St Matthews Primary School both within 800 metres. Further afield in Wimbledon Village are King's College and Wimbledon High. and kitchen, offering the perfect space for dining and taking in the fantastic views with surrounding double glazed windows, with carpet flooring within, many plug sockets and one radiator.  KITCHEN surrounding the panelled bath with an overhead shower, low level WC, hand wash basin, heated towel rail and carpetted flooring.  BEDROOM   TWO   15' 11" x 11' 5" (4.85m x 3.48m)  Generous double long_description: The agent dealing with this property is Elle Osborne, please press 1 when dialling. EO Estate Agents are excited to introduce to the market this large and elegant three-bedroom flat. The home is a Victorian conversion that has been newly renovated to a high specification and offers over one thousand square feet of space. It has access to a private garden, has its own dedicated office room and is light and bright throughout. It is a stunning mix of Victorian design and modern convenience.     The first-floor bedroom is spacious and benefits from plenty of natural light as well as pleasant views of the neighbourhood. Both second-floor bedrooms are similarly light and bright and the smaller of the two looks out onto the beautiful garden and surrounding rooftops. The kitchen is fully fitted and cutting-edge, offering a built-in oven and hob, a fridge freezer, and also boasting quartz worktops. The private garden is long and sunny, a perfect place to lounge in the summer. With marble-style tiling and golden-tinted faucets, the bathroom looks stunning and elegant.     The home is well located, being well within walking distance of Figges Marsh, a wide and open green area, and is only a seven-minute walk from Tooting Train Station. In the nearby London Road, it is easy to find a wide variety of restaurants, bars and shops that will cater to your needs. The combination of being well-located and connected, alongside the high-spec renovation makes this flat a must-view for any buyer.

long_description: A very well presented apartment superbly located  within the most sought after gated development, Claremont Lodge. This impressive property is on the first floor and offers excellent living space, including a very good sized reception room with private balcony and a gas fire. The modern kitchen is large enough to accommodate a breakfast table. The apartment is flooded with natural light. There is a master bedroom which has built in wardrobes which benefits from an en-suite bathroom with separate shower. There is a spacious second bedroom with built in wardrobes and a family bathroom completes the accommodation. The property also benefits from covered parking beneath the  development. Outside The gardens are a beautiful feature of this development mostly being on the south west side. They include some beautifully kept box hedges and  well stocked flower and shrub beds. Situation The property is located in The Downs, a residential road on the Slopes that runs off Ridgway. Wimbledon Common is approximately one third of a mile away and Wimbledon Village, which borders the Common, has an attractive High Street lined with an exclusive range of boutiques and restaurants. Wimbledon Town has a wider range of amenities with an excellent shopping centre, as well as Mainline Train and Underground services. Additional Information The property has an underlying lease of 125 years  which was granted in June 1997. The vendor has advised that the present service charge is £4,124 per annum which includes water supply and building insurance and is paid quarterly. The reserve charge is £1760 per annum. The ground rent is peppercorn. Brochures Particulars

long_description: A well presented and spacious one bedroom first floor apartment in this lovely Retirement living Plus development conveniently located. Summary  - Liberty House is a purpose built Retirement Living Plus development built by McCarthy & Stone, designed specifically for the over 70s, for those who wish to enjoy independent living but may need some extra care and support. There is an Estate Manager who leads the team and oversees the development. The apartment comprises of a fully fitted kitchen, underfloor heating, fitted and tiled shower room, spacious bedroom and lounge. 24 hour emergency call system. Communal facilities include a Club lounge where social events and activities take place, a function room and a roof top terrace there are also landscaped gardens. There are two fully equipped laundry rooms and a restaurant which is table service and serves freshly prepared Lunch and evening meals daily. If your guests wish to stay, there is guest suite accommodation which can be booked (fees apply). There is a 24 hour emergency call system provided by a personal pendant and call points in your bedroom and bathroom as well as onsite management 24 hours a day. One hour of domestic support per week is included in the service charge at Liberty House with additional services including care and support available at an extra charge. However, this can be from as little as 15 minutes per session which can be increased or decreased to suit your needs.  Liberty House is conveniently located within the London Borough of Merton, between Wimbledon and New Malden and only 8 Miles from Central London, Raynes Park is a popular spot with a bustling social scene. Entrance Hall  - Front door with spyhole leads to the large entrance hall, the 24 hour Tunstall emergency response pull cord system is in place. Illuminated light switches and smoke detector. From the hallway there is a door to a walk in storage and airing cupboard. Doors lead to the bedroom, living room and shower room. Living Room  - A very well presented spacious living/dining room. Feature fire surround with decorative electric fire. Two ceiling light points, raised power points. TV & telephone points. Partially glazed doors lead onto a separate kitchen. Full length windows and glazed patio door opening onto a juliet balcony overlooking landscaped gardens and car park with a Westerly aspect. Kitchen  - Fully fitted kitchen with modern cupboard doors and co-ordinating work surfaces. Contemporary ceiling lights. Stainless steel sink with chrome mixer tap. There is an integrated fridge/freezer, a fitted electric oven and built-in microwave oven and a fitted electric ceramic hob with extractor over and tiled splashbacks. Bedroom  - A spacious double bedroom with door to walk-in wardrobe. Underfloor heating, TV and phone point and ceiling lights. Full length windows overlooking landscaped gardens and car park. Shower Room  - Modern suite comprising of; close-coupled WC, vanity wash-hand basin with fitted furniture surround including storage both below and to the side, fitted mirror, shaver point and down lights over, walk-in level access shower with thermostatically controlled shower. fully tiled walls and wet room tiled flooring, electric heated towel rail, emergency pull cord and ceiling spot light. Service Charge (Breakdown)  - • Cleaning of communal windows   • Water rates for communal areas and apartments  • Electricity, heating, lighting and power to communal areas  • 24 hour emergency call system  • Upkeep of gardens and grounds  • Repairs and maintenance to the interior and exterior communal areas  • Contingency fund including internal and external redecoration of communal areas  • Buildings insurance  • The apartment heating and hotwater One hour of domestic support per week is included in the service charge  The Service charge does not cover external costs such as your Council Tax, electricity or TV, but does include the cost of your Estates Manager, your water rates, our 24 hour emergency call system, the heating and maintenance of all communal areas and all external window cleaning, exterior property maintenance and gardening. Find out more about service charges please contact your Property Consultant or Estates Manager. Service charge: £9,198.34 pa (for financial year ending 10/22) Leasehold  - Ground Rent £495 p.a Ground rent review date: June 2030 999 Years from 2015 Brochures Kingston Road, Raynes Park, London EAC Link

long_description: VIEWINGS AVAILABLE SEVEN DAYS A WEEK!  Laurels are delighted to present to the market with NO CHAIN this superb two double-bedroom property in the highly-sought after location of West Wimbledon. Just moments from Motspur Park and Morden tube stations (Zone 4, approx. 20-25 mins to Central London), the property also offers excellent transport links. Set in an oasis of greenery with Pyl Brook flowing behind it, this property is perfect for any first time buyer, investor, young family or commuter alike.   Upon entrance to the property, you are greeted by a lovely spacious hallway which leads into the beautiful living room. This room offers direct access through sliding doors to the private balcony where you can enjoy your evenings with a cup of tea and fresh air. Further internal accommodation includes a family size kitchen fully equipped with all integrated appliances and recently redecorated. This brilliant home offers two generous sized double bedrooms, both with an abundance of natural light and ample storage. The property also boasts a family bathroom that has been recently refurbished to an impeccable standard.  Further benefits of this top floor flat include off-street parking, easy access to Wimbledon and Raynes Park, close proximity to St. John Fisher R.C. School and King's College School, among others. Early viewings are highly recommended and can be accommodated seven days a week (including Bank Holidays!).  For more information or to arrange a viewing, please contact the Laurels Team today! Brochures Property Brochure Full Details

long_description: Offered chain free is this two double bedroom apartment, situated in the heart of Wimbledon, on the doorstep of local shops and restaurants  The property has a spacious kitchen that has spotlights on its ceiling, brightening the area. It has been fully fitted with modern in built appliances, wooden cupboards for an abundance of storage and lots of worktop space too. A flat archway leads into the light reception. It features two large sash windows, bringing in a great deal of natural light and also has spotlights on the ceiling. A small dining set can be set up in the corner of the reception for you to enjoy meals with others on. Both the kitchen and reception feature wooden floors. In the hallway, ample storage space is provided. Accommodation comprises of two double bedrooms, with the stunningly tiled bathroom conveniently located beside Bedroom 1.   Set just a 4 minute walk from Wimbledon Station (District Line, South Western and Thameslink), you can easily access London Waterloo. Dundoland Road Station (Tram) and Merton Park Station (Tram) are also close by. Quiet strolls can be taken in the open green space of South Park Gardens, that is home to a café and moments away from the apartment.  Tenure: Leasehold.  Lease length: 125 years.  Council tax: Band B. Brochures Brochure 1

long_description: This two double bedroom, top floor apartment is in a prime location in the centre of Wimbledon and is being offered chain free to the market.   The property has an open plan kitchen and reception room complete with wooden floors. The kitchen features modern fixtures and fittings, with wooden cupboards providing ample storage space. A dining area can be set up in the room too, right in front of the sash windows that bring in lots of natural light. Further light is added to the space by the spotlights on the ceiling. Both double bedrooms are airy spaces, with Bedroom 1 offering gorgeous skyline views and Bedroom 2 offering a fantastic skylight. The neatly tiled bathroom contains an inviting bathtub.  Wimbledon Station (District Line, South Western and Thameslink) is a short 4 minute walk away from the apartment, which provides you with tremendous access to London Waterloo and Earls Court. Other nearby stations include Merton Park Station (Tram) and Dundoland Road Station (Tram), both less than a 10 minute walk away. Lots of shops, eateries and amenities are within close proximity, as well as South Park Gardens which boasts a café.  Tenure: Leasehold.  Lease length: 125 years.  Council tax: Band B. Brochures Brochure 1

long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 121 years remaining The Property A spacious TWO DOUBLE BEDROOM apartment with two South-facing private balconies, high ceilings and lots of natural light, in 2a Cavendish Road - a quiet, recently built, small apartment building in a secure, gated development away from the road, but only moments from Colliers Wood Tube station, supermarkets, gyms and cafes.  Ideally located for the Northern Line tube, local shops and cafes, and with a high, 84 EPC rating, the apartment has excellent green/economic credentials. The apartment benefits from two good-sized double bedrooms, both with dual aspect windows, so plenty of natural light, and one with private balcony. A spacious central hallway welcomes you on entry and has useful storage for shoes and coats. There is a stylish, modern full bathroom. The highlight is the large reception space, which is open plan to the fantastic, fitted kitchen with integrated appliances and with a second South-facing balcony, perfect for your morning coffee in the sun, entertaining friends or for a quiet evening drink.  Cavendish Road is a quiet residential road off of Colliers Wood high street, perfectly located for modern apartment living. It is moments from Colliers Wood tube station on the Northern Line, direct to the City and central London. The property has communal bike storage and the CS7 Cycle Route is direct to the City. There are also regular bus services to nearby Wimbledon and Tooting.  Popular pubs, cafes and Post Office are around the corner. A large M&S Foodhall, Sainsburys, Tandem Shopping Centre and a large Nuffield Health gym, swimming and spa are close by. Both Colliers Wood sports fields and Wandle Park, with it's nature trail and riverside path and cycle route to historic Merton Abbey Mills and the National Trust's Morden Hall Park are a minutes walk away.  Ideal for first time buyers, BtL investors, a couple or as a pied a terre.  SC & GR Approx. £1,500 p.a. Building is Fire Safety Regulation Compliant Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

station_info: [(0.8, 'Raynes Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (1.3, 'Wimbledon Chase Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (1.3, 'New Malden Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: A locally listed detached family house in need of complete refurbishment set on a substantial plot of almost an acre backing Royal Wimbledon golf course.  Description An exceptional and rare opportunity to purchase a detached family house over 5,000 sq ft on one of the most impressive plots in the whole of Wimbledon.  The overall plot is almost an acre and backs onto the Royal Wimbledon golf course. Having suffered fire damage in 2018 to half of the first floor and part of the roof, the house requires extensive refurbishment throughout.  However, there is plenty of scope to extend and renovate this wonderful period property (STPP). Set back from the road this period home offers well balanced living and entertaining space across three floors with a central galleried stairwell.  To the rear of the house is a terrace overlooking the spectacular private, mature gardens and there is also a swimming pool and a tennis court both of which require refurbishing. Location Drax Avenue is one of Wimbledon's more sought after addresses and is a quiet private 'semi rural' street close to the Common. Wimbledon Common is located at the end of the road and only around 600 metres away. The Common offers 1,200 acres of open space and is ideal for riding, walking or cycling.  Locally there are a number of useful everyday shops on Coombe Lane with a more comprehensive range of shops, bars and restaurants in Wimbledon Village, around 1500 metres away. Central London can be reached by car from the A3 or rail from Raynes Park station around 1500 metres distant and accessible via the regular 200 bus. There are a selection of highly regarded schools with The Rowans School on Drax Avenue itself just 35 metres away and Kings College around 1500 metres distant. Source of distances Google Pedometer All measurements are approximate.  Brochures Web Details

long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 100 years remaining The Property Situated within a popular modern, quiet development and surrounded by greenery, you are close to Raynes Park station, restaurants and shops. This superb one double bedroom apartment offers a potential buyer a wonderful, modern, spacious and bright apartment which would make a fantastic home and would also be ideal for a first-time purchase or as a rental investment. As you enter the apartment via a secure communal hallway with entry phone system and the benefit of a lift, you are greeted with a larger than average entrance hall with plenty of space for storage of shoes and coats. Off the hallway there is a  very bright and spacious double bedroom which looks over the well maintained communal grounds and has fitted wardrobes. The modern and well appointed bathroom is generously sized and perfect for modern living. The real jewel in the crown is the modern open plan kitchen / reception which is incredibly spacious and ideal for entertaining. The modern fitted kitchen features all of the mod-cons one would expect from a modern apartment and great for the budding chef. In addition to this, there is an allocated parking space for the flat and bike storage. This is a wonderful flat which needs to be viewed to be truly appreciated. Location Located in South West London you will find this beautiful apartment a short walking distance from Raynes Park and Wimbledon Chase. This fantastic location offers shops, cafes, restaurants and plenty of local green spaces. Transport links aplenty; you are situated in between a number of train stations offering very frequent trains including Wimbledon (Rail, District Line Tube, Thameslink, Tram), Raynes Park (Rail) with its direct links into London Waterloo (approx 25 mins) and Wimbledon Chase (Thameslink) as well as bus routes along Worple Road and Kingston Road.  The A3 is super close and provides great access to the South East’s road networks with Gatwick airport a short distance and Brighton beach a short car journey away.  SW20 and SW19 are both affluent and vibrant areas of London with lots to offer a prospective purchaser. The area boasts some outstanding schools in both the state and private sectors. There are excellent gyms, shops and restaurants close by including both Wimbledon and Raynes Park town centres as well as Wimbledon Village.  Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

long_description: **GUIDE PRICE £425,000 - £450,000** Rare opportunity for anyone looking to aquire a first time home on 'The Grid'. One bedrom modern period flat finished to a very high standard with a brand new bathroom. This top floor apartment is situated on Revelstoke Road, just 0.3 miles from the entrance of Wimbledon Park with its beautiful green area and lake. The accommodation offers 546 sqft of internal area and plenty of natural light through cleverly located Velux type windows. The property is comprising entrance hall, open plan livingroom/kitchen with integrated appliances, spacious bedroom with plenty of storage and a brand new bathroom. The property is available with no onward chain and it would make a great purchase for anyone looking for a new home or an investor. The Iconic Southfields Grid takes its name from its arrangement of horizontal and vertical roads as viewed from the air. Offering access to Southfields Village with its selection of boutique shops, restaurants and wine bars the district line tube station offers regular links in to London. Well served by the outstanding Sheringdale, St Michael's and Wimbledon Park Primary schools the area also enjoys the wide open spaces of Wimbledon Park.
