This generous home offers great space throughout the accommodation, featuring a bright and airy through lounge reception room great for entertaining. The ground floor of this property consists of a modern large through lounge that leads to the open plan kitchen, utility room, well maintained landscaped rear garden. The first floor consists of two double bedrooms with built in wardrobes, generous single bedroom and a MODERN bathroom. The second floor offers a VERY LARGE BEDROOM with an ensuite and lots of storage space Auctioneer's Comments   This property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited.  This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.  The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 inc VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack. The estate agent and auctioneer may recommend the services of other providers to you, in which they will be paid for the referral. These services are optional, and you will be advised of any payment, in writing before any services are accepted. Listing is subject to a start price and undisclosed reserve price that can change. 1. long_description: A most attractive and truly delightful 6 bedroom detached house built in 2004 by the renowned house builder, Lifestyle Projects and located in the sought after Drax Estate, with the added benefit of a self contained 1 bedroom flat. The house is set back from the road and is approached via a carriage driveway with ample off-street parking.  On the ground floor the house comprises:  an impressive entrance hall; a spacious kitchen/breakfast room with quality appliances and double doors to the terrace and garden; a large drawing room, with doors opening up onto Juliet balconies overlooking the garden; a dining room; a family room; a study; a cloakroom and access to the integral garage with stacker unit. The lower ground floor is almost as impressive with a large games/cinema room, gymnasium, utility room, cloakroom and a 1 bedroom 'annexe' flat with separate kitchen and bathroom and accessed both from the hall on the lower ground floor and from the front driveway. On the first floor is the impressive master bedroom suite complete with dressing area and en-suite bath and shower room.  3 further bedrooms and 2 further bathrooms (one en-suite) complete this floor.  On the second floor are 2 large bedrooms, both connected to a 'Jack and Jill' shower room. To the rear of the house are attractive gardens with mature trees and shrubs and a large entertaining terrace.  Drax Avenue is a private road within a peaceful conservation area about a mile from Wimbledon Village where one finds an excellent selection of shops, boutiques, restaurants, cafés and bars in a unique and charming atmosphere.  The surrounding area offers many good schools including King’s College School for boys, the Study and Wimbledon High School, both for girls, the Rowans and Wimbledon Common preparatory School, several being within walking distance of the house. Recreational facilities are well catered for with golf, tennis and fitness clubs nearby and riding stables in Wimbledon Village. Central London is easily accessible by car or train, using the A3 trunk road, or the mainline stations from where regular trains provide access to Waterloo in 12 – 15 minutes. The Jubilee link at Waterloo now means that Canary Wharf is also within easy reach of Wimbledon. Brochures Particulars

long_description: A superb two bedroom first floor apartment within a period building with parking and landscaped communal gardens.  Description This wonderful two double bedroom property is located on the first floor of a handsome Victorian house set back from the road behind a sweeping driveway with off street parking.  The apartment opens into a central entrance hall with a guest cloakroom. A generous reception room, with far reaching views across London, has good natural light features an attractive fireplace. Alongside is a contemporary  kitchen with a good range of base units and cupboards with integrated appliances. The principal bedroom offers excellent fitted wardrobe space. There is a second double bedroom with built in storage space and a modern bathroom with a shower above the bath. Outside are beautiful communal gardens to the front and back with a parking space. Chain free. Location Arthur Road is located within 1,000 metres of Wimbledon Village. This property is 160m to Wimbledon Park Underground station (District line) and 320m to Wimbledon Park itself, which offers fabulous space with its beautiful boating lake, golf course, tennis courts and playground. Wimbledon Village has a number of pretty boutiques and restaurants with Wimbledon town offering a comprehensive array of shops and a theatre. Locally are a number of sought after schools with Kings College and Wimbledon High both around one mile away and Bishop Gilpin Primary around 600 metres. In addition, the vast recreational spaces of the National Trust's Morden Hall Park being only a short distance away provide a unique blend of convenience with peace and tranquillity. Being sold for the very first time, this stunning property boasts bright and airy spacious accommodation comprising of open plan lounge/kitchen/dining area which opens to a private balcony to the front elevation, double bedroom and bathroom all presented to an incredibly high standard throughout. Externally the property benefits from communal gardens. An internal viewing is highly recommended to avoid almost certain disappointment of missing out on the opportunity of being the first owners of this truly stunning home. long_description: The apartment is one of only 2 unique executive built suites, situated within a modern estate. The flat is situated on the second floor comprising of 2 double bedrooms; a spacious living room, an equally large kitchen / diner and family size bathroom.  It has been freshly redecorated, including the installation of a brand new kitchen with dishwasher and washing machines, bathroom and new energy efficient central heating boiler. There are pleasing views from every window and the large balcony, and in addition there is the convenience of allocated parking space. It is offered on the market chain free and ready to move into immediately. Much cherished by the residents is that the estate is situated within an oasis of greenery; just a minute walk from your front door, you will be surrounded by trees and the running water of the Pyl Brook. The property is conveniently situated for commuting with either Raynes Park Railway station (25 minutes to the centre of London), or Morden Underground station, in addition to a very reliable bus service. The residents are spoilt for choice when it comes to shopping, surrounded by the 3 major shopping centres of Wimbledon; Kingston and Sutton to choose from, featuring all the major high street names in shopping and award winning eateries. There is even a major hypermarket and pharmacy open 24 hours a day close by. The flat is central to 3 major hospitals including St Helier, St Geoges and Kingston Hospital, and a large choice of GPs some within walking distance. There are a number of fitness centres including Virgin Active and the famous David Lloyd Centre nearby, frequented by Wimbledon tennis players and celebrities.  The area is home to popular schools including, St John Fishers, Aragon and Hatfield Primary schools. Also Blossom House, Coombe Boys and Raynes Park High, with Kingston and Roehampton Universities nearby. These and many more services together with the warm and welcoming neighbourly atmosphere contribute to making the residence highly desirable and very sought after by home buyers. How to view: Please contact our Wimbledon Hill office on  , Wimbledon Park office on   or our Putney office on   for more information or to book a viewing. We are open from 8:30am - 7pm Monday to Friday and 9am - 6pm on weekends. Sole Agents.

long_description: New to the market is this delightful three-bedroom semi-detached bungalow in Mitcham, London    The property comprises a hall upon entry, leading to a spacious front reception room and a modern kitchen with fitted units and appliances. The kitchen doors lead out to an east-facing rear garden, which is perfect for those long summer days and is ideal for hosting. It also benefits from an outside gym/workroom at the back of the garden. Also on the first floor are two double bedrooms and a family bathroom. On the first floor is a further double bedroom with its own en suite shower room.    There are plenty of schools, supermarkets, parks and other local amenities within close proximity    Tooting Station - 0.9miles  Streatham Common Station - 1.2 miles    This property is located in the sought after area of Mitcham, London    Early viewing is recommended to appreciate all of the features this property has to offer

bullet_points: One Double Bedroom First Floor Flat;0.3 Miles To Colliers Wood Tube Station;Kitchen-Dining Room;Large Lounge & Separate Office/Study;Modern Shower Room;Loft/Attic Storage Space;Ideal For First Time Buyers & Young Families;Close To Great Primary & Secondary Schools;Off Street Parking;Double Glazed & Central Heating
station_info: [(0.3, 'Colliers Wood Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.4, 'South Wimbledon Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.4, 'Haydons Road Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 96 years remaining The Property One bedroom first floor flat with a 96 year lease boats a spacious kitchen-dining room, a large separate lounge and adjoining office/study, situated 0.3 miles from Colliers Wood tube station making this an ideal home for 1st time buyers and investors. The flat is accessed by a secure communal entrance with stairs leading up to the first floor. The flat has an entrance hallway that branches off right into a generous kitchen-dining room,  with cupboard space to two sides, integrated electric hob, fan oven and space for a dining table & chairs. There is access from the kitchen to a utility room/ storage area with space for a fridge-freezer, washing machine and floor to ceiling cupboards.  Back along the hallway is the large lounge with windows to one side and a separate office/study area. Previous owners converted the office; formally a built in balcony/terrace (as can been seen on neighbouring properties), the new layout allows use of the area throughout the year and provides flexibility for those wanting to work from home.  Multiple windows to the front and back of the property allow aligned East to West allow light to flood the kitchen, Lounge and Study throughout the day.  The bathroom was recently renovated (<4 years), housing a modern corner shower cubicle, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail. The flat has no shortage of built in storage, with wardrobes in the bedroom, an area for towels/ laundry etc hidden out of sight in the bathroom, the utility room, and access to a large private loft that runs the length x width of the property.   Outside there is a dedicated parking space split with the flat below. On the occasion this is not free there is access to a 10+ Off and On road parking spaces that are designated for residents of Woburn Close only.  Woburn Close is a very quiet cul-de-sac with no through traffic and the neighbours are all very friendly. Clarion Housing & Merton Council regularly clean the street and tend to soft landscaped areas.  Location The property is located 0.3 miles from Colliers Wood tube station (Northern Line) and 0.4 miles from Haydens Road train station which has links into London Blackfriars, London Bridge and Wimbledon. There are also nearby regular bus links into Wimbledon and Tooting. For primary schools, All Saints' CofE Primary School is 0.1 miles away and Singlegate Primary School, Holy Trinity CofE Primary School & Merton Abbey Primary School are all within 0.5 miles. For secondary schools, Harris Academy Wimbledon is 0.4 miles away and both Ricards Lodge High School & Wimbledon High School GDST are within 1.1 miles. Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

bullet_points: Two bedroom Duplex;Moments from Wimbledon Village;Stylish co-working lounge;Residents only gym;Private outdoor space;1119 sq. ft.;Gated Communal Courtyard;Fibre-optic Broadband to All Apartments;Underfloor Heating
station_info: [(0.2, 'Colliers Wood Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.5, 'South Wimbledon Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.5, 'Haydons Road Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 250 years remaining A two bedroom DUPLEX located in the sought after Colliers Wood, SW19. This home is part of the spectacular Stiles West development which offers 41 new homes by the River Wandle and within close vicinity to Merton Abbey Mills and Wimbledon Village.  All homes have been completed to high specification throughout with a contemporary modern design to accommodate the modern lifestyle. Think of this as your own private members club. Residents at Stiles West are able to benefit from a plethora of amenities including a co-working lounge area, communal gardens and a fully fitted residents only gym (with showers and changing rooms).   Envisaged with a sense of serenity and practicality in mind, you’ll find a combination of style and comfort in thoughtfully designed spaces that offer all that’s needed for thoroughly contemporary life.  While it’s the lawns of Wimbledon’s namesake tennis club that conjure up inimitable thoughts of summertime greenery, it’s the great expanses of grassland, heath, and woods at Wimbledon Common that offer not only a space to breathe but a place to come together. The River Wandle, which weaves its way through the neighbourhood, is your starting point for the Wandle Trail: a nine-mile cycle and walking route. Being only 30 minutes from the city centre. you might need to remind yourself that you’re still in London!

bullet_points: Gym;Video Entry;Shops and amenities nearby;Fitted Kitchen;Double glazing;Concierge;Close to public transport;Balcony;Smart Design;Lounge
long_description: Stylish, spacious and functional in design, this modern two bedroom apartment boasts stylish interiors fit for 21st century living. As residents enter the apartment, they’ll find a large cupboard and the main bathroom — pristine and immaculately finished with marbled porcelain tiling and a white suite. Bright and inviting, the lounge area leads to a private balcony presenting the ideal space for entertaining al fresco. The Lshaped kitchen features soft-closing doors with concealed handles, a reconstituted stone worktop and a range of fully-integrated appliances. The principal bedroom enjoys a fitted floor-to-ceiling wardrobe whilst the second bedroom would also make a great study room. This apartment is part of the Stadia One collection. Presenting 364 apartments, Stadia One is one of the initial phases of the Wimbledon Grounds landmark scheme that sees the creation of over 600 homes and an 11,000-seat football stadium for AFC Wimbledon. Alongside this, there is a public realm including retail and sports facilities. Wimbledon Grounds is located within close proximity of Tube and mainline stations, including Tooting Broadway, as well as being within easy reach of recreational spaces such as Wimbledon Common. The world-famous Wimbledon All Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club — which hosts the annual Tennis Championships — is just eight minutes’ drive away.

bullet_points: 6 bedroom detached house;5 bath/shower rooms (3 en-suite);Approximately 5200 ft2/488 M2;Residential cul-de-sac;Close to Wimbledon Village and the Common;Opportunity to extend and refurbish (STPP);3 reception rooms;Utility Room;Approximately 63ft/20m garden;Integral Garage and off-street parking for several cars
long_description: A substantial detached 6 bedroom house with extensive lateral living space, tucked away in a quiet residential cul-de-sac, close to Wimbledon Village and Wimbledon Common. This family home has incredible potential to add even further value with the opportunity to refurbish and extend if need be. Council Tax Band H. Greenoak Way is approached via a residential cul-de-sac.  The house itself has off-street parking for multiple vehicles, which in turn leads into the integral double garage. The house is spread across three floors where the front entrance leads into the spacious entrance hallway from which multiple rooms have access from. The double drawing room has a number of incredible period features including a marble fireplace. The French doors provide direct access out to the rear garden offering natural light from both sides of the room.  Off the entrance hallway are a number of other rooms including the dining room, family room, utility room, WC and access to the integral garage. The generously sized kitchen/breakfast room also leads out the the rear garden. On the first floor, there are five large double bedrooms. The principle bedroom features built-in wardrobes and an en-suite bathroom with a separate shower.  There are two further en-suites and a family bathroom on the first floor.  The second floor features an additional storage/office space, which is ideal for working from home. a separate family bathroom and a sizeable sixth bedroom, overlooking the extensive 20 metre private rear garden. The property is conveniently located for Wimbledon Village High Street, which offers an excellent range of boutique shops, bars and restaurants, while also having access to the plentiful open green spaces of Wimbledon Common. The area is well regarded for its sporting and recreational facilities as well as for its choice of 'Outstanding' schools in both the state and private sectors, including Kings College School and Wimbledon High School.  The famous All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club is only 0.5 miles away. Transport links are close at hand, the nearby A3 provides access to major motorways and into central London. Local bus routes are towards Wimbledon and Putney, with rail and tube stations that have regular services into London Waterloo and greater London. Brochures Greenoak Way, London Brochure

long_description: New to the market is this six bedroom split level maistonette in Streatham Common, London SW16    This is an investors dream opportunity with the possibility of buying two properties adjacent to one another. The property consists of four bedrooms on the first floor as well as a lounge, kitchen and bathroom. To the second floor includes two bedrooms and another communal shower room, and to the rear of the property is a private garden. There is the possibility to convert the property into a HMO as it already includes fire doors and smoke alarms, and potential to provide a parking space to the front. Further benefits include gas central heating and double glazing and good decorative order      There are plenty of supermarkets, restaurants and other local amenities within close proximity.    Streatham Common Station - 0.6 miles  Norbury Station - 1 mile    Early viewing is recommended to fully appreciate all the features this property has to offer.    Currently tenanted providing excellent rent with good long term working tenants.     NO SERVICE CHARGE   GROUND RENT JUST £50 per year

This property further benefits from allocated parking and a Big Communal Garden at rear  Kennedy Close is set within a vibrant and diverse community of Mitcham, an up-and-coming suburban area south of London. Kennedy Close is tucked away in a sought after residential location, surrounded by green spaces, whilst also a short distance from bustling shops and restaurants. The upmarket area of Wimbledon is nearby and, just to the south, Croydon offers all the amenities of a large town outside of London. Its proximity to the city, good transport links, as well as plenty of nurseries and schools, make it the perfect choice for families seeking a fantastic quality of life. Mitcham is located in Travelcard zones 3 and 4 and provides easy access to the underground at Colliers Wood and Tooting Broadway, both are serviced by the Northern Line. bullet_points: Spacious Double Bedroom;Open-Plan Living Room & Kitchen;Good Decorative Order;Private Parking;Secure Gated Development With Communal Gardens;Walking Distance to Morden Station & Amenities
long_description: For sale, a one-bedroom, apartment in good decorative order with secure-entry system, communal gardens and parking all within walking distance of Morden Station, SM4 This very well-presented flat offers first time buyers a great opportunity to get on the property ladder and move straight into a property without needing to do any work. Painted in soft, neutral colours throughout, the property comprises large open-plan living room and kitchen with dining area, a double bedroom, bathroom and hallway with utility cupboard. The open-plan living space has cream coloured walls which are off-set by the darker wood laminate floor both of which provide a simple background for any purchaser to really make their mark with furniture, pictures and personal items.  Whether you want to maintain the monochromatic, minimal theme of the current occupant or completely go overboard with colour and pattern, the large open-plan arrangement allows for this; rather than each living space being smaller, boxy rooms.  In the kitchen area, simple units with chrome handles and black marble effect worktop make the kitchen easy to maintain. The bedroom, similarly decorated in neutral colours; this time with a soft carpet rather than wood floor, gives a calming, relaxed atmosphere to drift off from the stresses of the daily grind.  In the bathroom, once again simplicity is key with a white bath suite consisting bath with shower over, wash-basin and WC. Chrome fittings, mirrored, medicine cabinet and pale, wall tiles with a dark feature wall add to the functionality of the room making it easy to keep clean and fresh. Field House is on Schoolgate Drive and is located in the popular Willows Development. Morden town centre and underground station is approximately 0.6 miles away, about 10-15mins walk, (see Google maps). A number of bus services that run to Wimbledon, Sutton, Croydon and beyond can also be found nearby.  The property comes with  a dedicated parking bay, secure bike storage in the basement and is the only block with direct elevator access to all floors. There is plenty of green space with quiet, substantial communal gardens; as well as Morden Hall Park  being just a short stroll away as well as a Sainsbury local just over the road and the local shops and amenities of Morden all being close by. Brochures Field House-64-sales-particulars-Turners-Property-

long_description: A generous top floor two bedroom apartment with a south facing balcony and an allocated parking space.  Description A wonderful two bedroom, top floor apartment located within this attractive small block of flats on Chambers Park Hill, off Copse Hill in West Wimbledon.  The property is beautifully presented in fresh neutral tones and offers excellent lateral space occupying the whole of the top floor of the building. The apartment opens into a central hallway, to the right is a superb open plan kitchen/dining/living room with a dual aspect offering great multi-purpose living space. Double glass doors lead out to a pretty south facing balcony. The contemporary kitchen offers an excellent range of fitted units and cupboards with integrated appliances. There are two well proportioned double bedrooms and a stylish bathroom. The apartment also benefits from a useful laundry room.  The apartment comes with one parking space. Location The development has lovely communal gardens and Wimbledon Hill Park itself backs onto Metropolitan Open Land. Raynes Park is nearby and the flat is approximately 100 yards from the 200 bus stop on Copse Hill which serves Wimbledon Town centre and the mainline station.  Wimbledon Village is within one mile with its delightful collection of shops and restaurants. The Common with its 1,200 acres of open space is approximately 800 metres and approaches the Village to create a sense of country living within London. Central London is approximately 8 miles away and can be reached via the A3 or by rail from with Wimbledon mainline or Raynes Park (18 minutes) both accessed via the regular 200 bus route on Copse Hill.  Locally are a number of excellent schools with The Rowans Prep school 150 metres away and the highly sought after, Kings College School around 1000 metres distant. long_description: This period home comes with good proportions and is located in the popular Alphabet Streets. The ground floor accommodates a front reception room with large windows allowing for plenty of natural light. The galley kitchen, as well as a separate dining/reception room follow, with the sunny conservatory to the rear allowing for access into the garden. Two large double bedrooms are located on the first floor with a further bedroom/study. This floor also boasts a generous family bathroom.  One of the key opportunities within this house is that there is potential to add even more square footage by extending the property into the loft and on the ground floor (subject to planning). This should provide a new owner with the ability to stay in the house for longer, save on future moving costs and create a space that is tailored to their specific style and taste. This house is located halfway down Deal Road. London Road is only a short walk away where a plethora of local amenities can be found. Tooting Station (National Rail), as well as Tooting Broadway (Northern line, zone 3) and local bus routes allow for frequent access into and out of the City. The Development Manager can be contacted from various points within each property in the case of an emergency. For periods when the Development Manager is off duty there is a 24 hour emergency Appello call system. Each property comprises an entrance hall, lounge, kitchen, one or two  bedrooms and bathroom or shower room. It is a condition of purchase that single residents be over the age of 60 years, or in the event of a couple, one must be over the age of 60 years and the other over 55 years.  Please speak to our Property Consultant if you require information regarding Event Fees that may apply to this property. long_description: Our client has accepted an offer on this property and there are no further viewings taking place (STC), please feel free to register your interest by contacting us. Available for the first time in thirty years, a substantial and architecturally appealing semi-detached family home located in this sought after street within South Park Gardens. The property, which is presented in very good order throughout, has been lovingly maintained by its current owners and provides great scope for extension works across and along the side to the rear ground floor (stpp), to attain its true and full potential. The current accommodation is laid out across three floors with the ground floor providing a double reception room with bay window and a large kitchen/diner. Three double bedrooms and a family bathroom are located on the first floor, whilst the converted loft houses the principal bedroom with en-suite shower room. This wonderful residence is complimented by a very pretty and mature rear garden, laid with lawn and patio and benefiting from a charming summer house. Wimbledon Town centre with its excellent schools, transport and shopping facilities is moments away whilst Wimbledon Village is also in easy reach. long_description: An exceptional, fully refurbished and extended five double bedroom Victorian house in the heart of South Park Gardens in Wimbledon.  Description This wonderful five double bedroom family house has been beautifully refurbished and extended to offer well balanced family living and entertaining space across three floors.  Off the hallway to the front is a generous bay fronted double reception room with contemporary cabinetry, display shelving, and an attractive fireplace. The rear of the reception room flows through to a contemporary kitchen / dining space allowing open plan living. The modern kitchen benefits from good natural light with an impressive glazed side return extension and offers an extensive range of stone topped units, fully integrated appliances and large central island/breakfast bar.  Glass doors open onto a large terrace overlooking a landscaped garden with low maintenance artificial grass and a garden shed for storage. The house also benefits from a downstairs cloakroom and a utility space in the hallway.  Upstairs, on the first floor to the front is a generous principal bedroom with a square bay allowing good natural light and well-designed fitted wardrobes. There are two additional double bedrooms both built in cupboards space and a contemporary family bathroom.  On the top floor are two additional double bedrooms, alongside a stylish en suite shower room and accessible storage under the eaves. Location Birkbeck Road is located within the ever popular South Park Gardens area of Wimbledon and is around 600 metres from South Park Gardens itself. Within 600 metres is the sought after Holy Trinity Primary School. Wimbledon town provides an extensive selection of everyday shops with the useful Centre Court shopping centre, the Wimbledon Theatre, supermarkets and cinemas.  Good links to central London with the District Line Underground and overground to London Waterloo (17 minutes). Haydons Road Thameslink station and South Wimbledon Underground (Northern Line) are both within 800 metres with trains to the City. long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 91 years remaining The Property A delightful, ground floor TWO DOUBLE BEDROOM Maisonette with it's own front door, private West-facing garden, and spacious, well-appointed layout, on Acre Road, a quiet residential Cul-de-Sac road within easy walking distance of Colliers Wood and Tooting Broadway tube stations, parks, the river Wandle, supermarkets and local stores. Set back from the road, the property has been newly rendered externally and has a small front garden. Your own front door opens into a welcoming hallway with solid oak floors and a large storage cupboard. There are two large double bedrooms both with high ceilings and plentiful natural light. The hallway leads through into a light, homely living room that has intelligently designed storage along one wall. There is a characterful fitted kitchen off the living room which has good storage. A hallway beyond provides access to a secluded West-facing patio garden which enjoys the sun in the afternoon and evening. At the rear of the property is a stunning, recently refurbished full bathroom which is of a good size and has been done to a high specification throughout and with Villeroy and Boch units.  The property benefits from double glazing throughout, has gas central heating and a good EPC rating of C.  Acre Road is a quiet, residential road with no through traffic, residents' permit parking and a communal bicycle store with spaces available through the council. The CS7 Cycle Route close by runs all the way to the City. Colliers Wood tube is a 5 minute walk, Tooting high street 10 minutes and central Wimbledon around 20 minutes.  Parks, the river Wandle and nature trail are close by, as is popular Merton Abbey Mills with restaurants and popular pubs. There is also a Nuffield Gym with swimming, and a large M&S Foodhall and Sainsburys at Colliers Wood.  Service Charge for '22-'23 is £240.48 and Ground Rent is £10.  Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. long_description: Presented in excellent condition throughout, this five bedroom semi-detached house is laid out over three floors giving a wonderful balance of living and bedroom accommodation. There is off-street parking for two + cars at the front and a lovely garden with Southerly aspect to the rear. On the ground floor there is a bright formal reception room, a cloakroom and a utility room with side access. At the rear is large open-plan kitchen, dining, family room that is flooded with light.  From the rear of the family room is a wall of glass with super views of and access to the lovely terrace and garden. On the first floor there are three bedrooms, an en-suite shower room, a family bathroom and a study. Both of the bathrooms have been recently installed and are of great style and quality. On the second floor there are two good bedrooms, an en-suite shower room and access to plentiful eaves storage. The garden is 78 feet long with terraces both at the rear of the house and at the bottom of the garden. Laid mainly to lawn, there are mature shrub and plant borders which make it supremely attractive. Situated on Marryat Road the house is a short walk to all the amenities of Wimbledon Village and the common. There are excellent schools in the area and a wide range of recreational activities are available such as golf, tennis and fitness clubs. The A3 is a short distance away with its direct route into central London and connections to the M25 network. Brochures More Details brochure

long_description: Our client has accepted an offer on this property and there are no further viewings taking place (STC), please feel free to register your interest by contacting us. Undoubtedly one of the most beautifully finished and creatively inspired houses that we have marketed in recent years. This elegant period house, situated in a highly sought after location, has a stylish contemporary interior which includes a breath-taking open plan living room to the rear, which incorporates a kitchen, dining and seating area with a wall of Schuco doors, that offer a seamless aspect into the beautifully landscaped south west facing garden. The property has four bedrooms, two of which are boutique style suites on the first floor, both with luxurious en-suite bathrooms, the main bedroom having a walk through dressing area. Every inch of the incredible interior has been painstakingly planned by the owners, who bought the house almost ten years ago. Additional features of the house include a superb Cesar kitchen with Silestone work tops, solid oak doors, porcelain tiles, Lutron LED lighting, heated vanity mirrors with touch lighting, under floor heating in the tiled areas, custom fitted window shutters, a first-floor utility cupboard and limed solid oak flooring in the principle reception rooms. There is an induction hob and an additional gas hob, steam and convector ovens and separate food preparation area off the kitchen. The property must be viewed to be fully appreciated and is a short walk from the town centre and mainline station. bullet_points: 2 BED, 2BATH, 2 RECEPTION ROOM SPLIT LEVEL DUPLEX NEW BUILD, FEELS LIKE A HOUSE;PLEASE QUOTE JW0326;NEARLY COMPLETED;ECO FRIENDLY AND EFFICIENT HEATING AND INSULATION FOR LOW ENERGY COSTS;VIBRANT LOCAL AREA;CLOSE TO TUBE AND TRAIN;OWN FRONT DOOR AND PRIVATE OUTSIDE SPACE;RESERVE FOR JUST £1500, 10 year NHBC warranty;Rental valuation c £2,600pcm, over 4.5% yield.
long_description: PLEASE QUOTE JW0326 A brand new development very close to completion. Knapton Mews is a collection of high spec new build properties tucked away in a quiet location right on the doorstep of the vibrant Tooting Broadway. The developers of this boutique collection of properties have taken real care and attention to create a modern living solution with very generous square footage. The property is duplex with its own front door and private outdoor space which while technically an apartment gives a real sense of living in a house. RESERVE FOR JUST £1500! Once complete the development will also benefit from a sizable landscaped communal garden space which coupled with being set back in a mews will really and to the sense of community.  Set over 1200 sqft not only is this a large property but exceeds equivalent unextended 2/3 bedroom victorian terraces in the area at a similar price point. House of this type often come in at around 950-1050sft so combine that with the fact that you are buying brand new with all the comfort and energy efficiency that brings and you are getting serious value here. Built to a discerning specification and with smart technology throughout this is more than you standard apartment. For full details please see the accompanying brochure. Both bedrooms are upstairs are incredibly spacious and both have their own bathrooms one of which is set up as a "jack and Jill" which allows access should you have guests. The ground floor also boasts a fantastic open plan kitchen and reception room but also a study that is larger than many bedrooms in the victorian sector and can be used however the new owner wishes Tooting Broadway has in recent years gone through and extensive regeneration and been dubbed by some to be the "Shoreditch of the South" The total revamp of the undercover Tooting Marketplace has injected a real vibrance to the area with its host of independent bars and eateries it is a real destination for local people. There are a whole host of decent schools close buy along with shops, green open spaces and the transport options of Tooting Broadway underground Zone 3 Northern line and the overland at Tooting Station. Investors and homebuyer alike can also be reassured by the strong rental proposition of this property based on current values and estimated sales price they are showing c.4% yield which is very good indeed. Service charge c£3200pa Ground rent 0.01% of sales price c.65pa lease 250yr     LIVING AREA * Wood strip flooring to all living areas and hallways * Adjustable underfloor heating KITCHEN. * Sleek and contemporary kitchen with modern integrated NEFF appliances * White low energy LED spotlights  * Mains fed smoke/heat detectors * Adjustable underfloor heating BATHROOM * Stylish toning wall and floor tiling * Adjustable underfloor heating * Contemporary bathroom fixtures BEDROOMS * Built in wardrobes to master maximising space * Toning expertly fitted carpet GENERAL * Low maintenance and noise reducing carpet fitted to internal stairs and landings SECURITY & SAFETY *  entry system  * Secure Main entrance * Security locks to all windows and balcony doors. * Smoke alarms * Heat detector fitted in kitchen EXTERNAL * Private outside space for each apartment * Electric main front gate with pedestrian entrance by keypad * Car free development with bike store and easy access to transport * Sustainable heating for energy efficiency * Attractive exterior lighting to rear of ground floor homes NEW BUILD SECURITY Your 10-year New Build Warranty is provided by BLP, a Registered User of the Consumer Code for New Homes (CCNH), approved by the Chartered Trading Standards Institute. This provides support and protection to you as a purchaser of a new build home and assures high standards of construction. Brochures Brochure 1

bullet_points: 9 bedrooms;5 reception rooms;3 bathrooms;0.46 acres;Period;Detached;Double Garage;Garden;Parking;Patio
long_description: Set in an elevated position on Arthur Road, this charming detached house offers huge potential for redevelopment and modernisation. This substantial house currently offers over 7,000 sq ft of living space, and nine bedrooms. Offered for sale for the first time in over 60 years, the house now offers huge potential for a buyer to create a unique family home. Briefly comprising on the ground floor a generously sized entrance hallway, three large principal reception rooms, with high ceilings, original cornicing and feature fireplaces, a breakfast room, kitchen, dining room and utility room. Additionally there is a guest cloakroom and original conservatory. On the first floor are five large double bedrooms and the main principal bedroom, with en suite and stunning views towards London and overlooking the All England Lawn Tennis Club. There are  also two further family bathrooms. On the top floor are a further three double bedrooms and plenty of eaves storage. There is also a substantial unmodernised lower ground floor, with storage rooms, and wine cellar. Externally the house sits in a plot of almost 0.5 acres with a sweeping carriage driveway at the front offering parking for several vehicles,  a large garage and bike store.  At the rear is a substantial 115ft rear garden, mainly laid to lawn and offering beautiful views over Wimbledon towards Central London. Arthur Road is a short distance from Wimbledon Common, the Village, Wimbledon Park Station, Wimbledon mainline train station and underground train station (District Line). There are many good schools in the area, both in the private and public sector and a wide range of recreational activities are available such as tennis and golf clubs. The A3 is close by with its direct access into central London and links to the M25 network to both Heathrow and Gatwick Airports. Brochures More Details brochure

It has a large living room, great for spending quality time with friends and family or enjoying individual pursuits. There is a separate W/C and bathroom. There are two spacious double bedrooms both with plenty of space for other furniture.   Thanks to its nearby train stations and local bus routes, transport links are excellent, with Morden South station close to the property.  This home is situated within a very sought-after area, with an array of local amenities including shops, bars, eateries, supermarkets, and green spaces.  Viewings here are a must! Tenure: Leasehold Council Tax: C Lease Remaining: 90 Current ground rent: £10.00 Per Year Ground rent review period: every 0 year Annual ground rent increase: 0%

station_info: [(0.6, 'Wimbledon Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-underground;svg-tramlink'), (0.7, 'Dundonald Road Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink'), (1.0, 'Wimbledon Chase Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: A generous first floor three bedroom flat located within a handsome period property close to Wimbledon village.  Description This three double bedroom first floor flat is one of only three located within this substantial converted detached Victorian house close to Wimbledon village.  The flat has a private garden to the front of the property with steps down to the cellar offering useful secure storage, with a work bench and fitted shelves and cupboards. The apartment also benefits from a garage to the rear and a share of the freehold.    A pathway through the private front garden leads to an entrance porch with a communal hallway and staircase to the first floor. The apartment offers excellent lateral living space and opens into a central entrance hall with stripped pine flooring.  A generous reception room with two sash windows allows green views of neighboring gardens and features a stripped pine floor with an impressive fireplace with marble slips and hearth. The kitchen offers a dual aspect with views to the front. There is a good range of white fronted fitted wall and base units with a pull out larder, tiled splash backs and integrated appliances. Three double bedrooms all feature cast iron fireplaces and stripped pine floors. A contemporary bathroom has an overhead shower unit with a glazed shower screen above the bath tub with a marble topped vanity unit.  The apartment also offers a study/home office. Location The Grange is positioned on one of the areas finest and most sought after roads in the heart of Wimbledon Village with the Common being approximately 150m away.  Wimbledon Village High Street with its popular boutiques, bars and restaurants is also approximately 400m away. Wimbledon Village retains a true village feel whilst being only 6 miles from central London with stables and small public houses that spill out onto the Common.  The Common is perfect for walking, riding or cycling with many routes and bridleways and three popular golf courses. There are a number of excellent schools within a few hundred metres with Kings College School for boys 400m away. Wimbledon mainline station is 1200m distant and offers a fast and regular link to central London (18 minutes) Source of times     Source of distances google pedometer All measurements are approximate Square Footage: 1,249 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: SUMMARY CALLING CASH BUYERS AND INVESTORS. A fantastic three bedroom first floor maisonette, with no onward chain, across the road from delightful Morden Hall Park, close to the Northern Line tube station, Morden South station and shops, cafes, parks and gyms. DESCRIPTION ***FANTASTIC FIRST FLOOR MAISONETTE ***             ***SHARE OF FREEHOLD*** ***CALLING ALL CASH BUYERS AND INVESTORS*** This fabulous first floor three bedroom maisonette situated on a popular residential road close to transportation links and local amenities. The property offers a fantastic accommodation throughout, benefits from lots of natural light, double glazing, central heating and high ceilings. Consists with fully fitted kitchen, three DOUBLE bedrooms, family bathroom, GARDEN to rear and private parking. The property is at the Southern corner of wonderful, popular Morden Hall Park with National Trust cafe, historic buildings and the river Wandle with it's many nature trails and running and cycling routes. Morden Park, with it's wide, open green spaces, gym and swimming pool is also within easy walking distance. There are local convenience stores nearby and Morden, with it's many shops, supermarkets and tube station is close by. Morden mainline station is also a short walk, as is the tramline from nearby Wimbledon and to Croydon. An ideal purchase for a couple, first time buyers, as a Buy to Let investment or as a London pied-a-terre with the Northern Line and CS7 cycle route providing direct, easy access to central London and the City. Auctioneer's Comments   This property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited.  This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.  The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 inc VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack. The estate agent and auctioneer may recommend the services of other providers to you, in which they will be paid for the referral. These services are optional, and you will be advised of any payment, in writing before any services are accepted. Listing is subject to a start price and undisclosed reserve price that can change. 1. long_description: Lynmouth avenue is situated within a popular residential road in the Lower Morden area.  Lower Morden offers bus routes servicing Wimbledon, Putney, Sutton, Raynes Park and Cheam, as well as ease of access onto the A217 which links Fulham down to Gatwick Airport, and the A3 for links to Clapham and Portsmouth. Wyevale Garden Centre is situated in Lower Morden, as well as playing fields and Morden Park, for leisure activities.  There are three primary schools in this locality, one being Catholic. Stonecot Hill offers an array of local shops and amenities. This property benefits from a lease of over 900 years with no service charges. Offering light and airy spaces, the accommodation briefly comprises a reception room which is flooded with natural light via the large double glazed windows, two well-proportioned bedrooms, with the master facing East and overlooking out in to the garden, a kitchen benefiting from integrated appliances and a three piece family bathroom completes the accommodation.  You will also find the additional benefit of storage by way of access to the loft from the bathrroom.  Outside, situated to the rear of the property, you will find your very own private garden, it is laid to lawn with a small patio area, making it ideal for hosting those summer barbecues for all your family and friends. To the rear of the garden is the converted garage which is currently being used as a studio/home office with a separate storage area.  *As this is a leasehold property you are likely to be responsible for management charges and/or  ground rent. You may also incur fees for items such as leasehold packs and in addition you will also need to check the remaining length of the lease. bullet_points: Refurbished One Double Bedroom Flat;No Onward Chain;Private SW-Facing Walled Patio Garden;Bespoke Designed Storage And Features Throughout;Good-Sized Luxury Bathroom;Central Heating And Double Glazing;Excellent Central Wimbledon Location;Short Walk To Multiple Transport Options
station_info: [(0.3, 'South Wimbledon Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.5, 'Merton Park Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink'), (0.5, 'Haydons Road Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 89 years remaining The Property A stylishly refurbished one bedroom Victorian conversion flat with Southwest-facing private patio, period features and high ceilings with original cornicing, and filled with bespoke design features and with NO ONWARD CHAIN on Merton Road. Ideally situated for central Wimbledon shopping, restaurants, gyms and attractions and a few minutes' walk to Wimbledon Mainline and Tube Station and also South Wimbledon Tube.  Set on the raised ground floor of a Victorian terraced building, the flat is set back from the road and towards the rear of the building. The living room and bedroom both benefit from wonderful, corniced high ceilings and have had fantastic, bespoke designed storage made and fitted by an English cabinet maker, including a brilliant walk-around wardrobe and dressing space in the bedroom, and design lighting also installed throughout. The property also benefits from gas central heating and double glazing.  The bathroom is of a large size, has been stylishly refurbished with walk-in shower and has additional storage space. The kitchen has direct access to the private, walled patio garden that is Southwest-facing, so enjoys the Sun for much of the day and year, and there is rear garden access. The kitchen benefits from plentiful storage, fitted units and appliances. Ideally situated close to local shops and leisure centre with swimming pool, the property is a few minutes' walk to both Wimbledon Station with District Line tube and mainline services to Waterloo in around 17 mins. every few minutes, out to the South coast, and the flat is also close to South Wimbledon tube with Northern Line services to the City.  The plentiful shops, cinemas, theatre, gyms, restaurants and cafes of Wimbledon are just up the road a few minutes' walk away, and both South Park Gardens and Haydons Road Recreation Ground are close by.  An ideal, characterful and unique property for a first time buyer, couple, as a London pied-a-terre or as a Buy to Let investment. Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 250 years remaining A three bedroom DUPLEX apartment benefiting from outside space, open-plan living and private outdoor space. This home is part of the spectacular Stiles West development which offers 41 new homes by the River Wandle and within close vicinity to Merton Abbey Mills and Wimbledon Village.  All homes have been completed to high specification throughout with a contemporary modern design to accommodate the modern lifestyle. Think of this as your own private members club. Residents at Stiles West are able to benefit from a plethora of amenities including a co-working lounge area, communal gardens and a fully fitted residents only gym (with showers and changing rooms).  Envisaged with a sense of serenity and practicality in mind, you’ll find a combination of style and comfort in thoughtfully designed spaces that offer all that’s needed for thoroughly contemporary life.  While it’s the lawns of Wimbledon’s namesake tennis club that conjure up inimitable thoughts of summertime greenery, it’s the great expanses of grassland, heath, and woods at Wimbledon Common that offer not only a space to breathe but a place to come together. The River Wandle, which weaves its way through the neighbourhood, is your starting point for the Wandle Trail: a nine-mile cycle and walking route. Being only 30 minutes from the city centre. you might need to remind yourself that you’re still in London!

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Turners Turners Property have been instructed to sell this three-bedroom, mid-terrace house presented with a private rear garden,  garage and off-street parking, situated in a neighbourly residential area of Morden, SM4. Set back from the road, the front door opens into the porch and on into the hallway. To the left is the well-presented living room with thru dining room which has pale-grey painted walls complimented by the white woodwork and pale carpet.  With large windows at both ends of the room there is plenty of natural light and lots of scope to lay the room out as discrete living and dining areas.  The kitchen is fully-tiled with simple, white tiles and contemporary contrasting grouting the clean modern look is continue with the white units and dark grey counter tops and floor. On through the kitchen, into the single-storey, half-width extension, is a utility room providing ample space for additional white goods and providing a useful space for airing clothes and doing laundry.  Upstairs to the first floor are two, double-bedrooms and a smaller single room. The two double bedrooms benefit from bay lovely period bay windows. The front-facing bedroom has built-in wardrobes and both rooms have plenty of space for a double bed, and freestanding furniture.  The third bedroom benefits from a built-in cupboard and has a charming oriel window. Potential purchasers however may prefer to use this as a home office if your job now allows working from home. The bathroom is fully tiled and has a simple white bath suite, with wash basin, WC, bath and separate walk-in shower. Up into the loft which has been fully-boarded and is used as a store room with two roof-lights with further storage into the eaves. Building regulations have not been applied for, so this cannot currently be classed as a bedroom. However, new occupants may look to take advantage of a full, dormer extension being allowed under permitted development (restrictions & regulations may still apply). Back downstairs and the dining room has double doors leading out into the private rear garden which has been hard-landscaped; making it easy to maintain. At the end of the garden is a garage with an access road to the rear of the property. Situated at the ‘Grand Drive’ end of Aragon Road, this family home has good access to local amenities with a Co-op food store, just a few minutes’ walk away. There are a number of regular bus services into Morden Town Centre and Raynes Park. Turners are sole agents on this property and expect a good level of interest, therefore we advise any potential purchasers to be ready to move and have your finances in place. Brochures Aragon-Road-240-Particulars-For-Sale-Apr-2022.pdf

long_description: West-facing, and featuring an open-plan kitchen-reception room, this contemporary and well-designed lateral apartment has underfloor heating, a combination of engineered oak flooring and carpets, and a fully fitted kitchen with Siemens appliances. Ridgmount Apartments are designed to be a departure from the traditional concept of the age-exclusive apartment. Combining a luxury, elegant interior with ample living accommodation, an apartment here is the perfect base from which to enjoy later life. Please contact Knight Frank to arrange your appointment to view the show apartments and completed building. * please note photos are for illustrative purposes and are not plot specific * Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography. Conveniently located for both Wimbledon Village and Broadway, Ridgmount Apartments is a boutique development of just 20 residences exclusively for occupiers aged 55 and over, with private outside space, secure underground parking and concierge service. Located on Darlaston Road, and convenient for everything Wimbledon has to offer, the apartment benefits from a desirable, established, and peaceful residential setting. Brochures More Details

long_description: A semi-detached 3 storey contemporary house featuring four bedrooms, two bathrooms, a large reception room with elevated westerly aspect, kitchen diner, separate utility room, downstairs WC , garage and off street parking. Situated in this most desirable West Wimbledon location at the top of Lambton Road, close to Holland Gardens and the highly regarded Hollymount School. Council Tax Band F The front garden provides off street parking leading to the garage.  The ground floor accommodation comprises of an entrance porch, hallway, downstairs WC, utility room, large kitchen breakfast room leading to a private westerly aspect rear garden.  On the first floor there is a  large reception room with an elevated open aspect, double bedroom with built in cupboards and a family bathroom. On the top floor there are three further bedrooms and a bathroom. The property is situated in the much sought after Lambton Road, a prime residential address, ideally situated to take advantage of the many conveniences close at hand such as Raynes Park Station with frequent trains to Waterloo and Raynes Park Centre with a range of restaurants, coffee shops and supermarkets. Holland Gardens and Cottenham Park green spaces are also within a short walk, Wimbledon Common and Village are accessible via a brisk walk or 200 bus. Wimbledon Town is conveniently nearby for more extensive shopping and further transport connections. The area is well served with flagship schools in both the state and private sectors, including Kings College & Hollymount School. Brochures Lambton Road, West Wimbledon, SW20 Brochure

long_description: The agent dealing with this property is Elle Osborne, please press 1 when dialling. EO Estate Agents, is thrilled to present this share of freehold, spacious, two-bedroom maisonette. The property has two large forward-facing bedrooms with views of the neighbourhood, and a modern, sleek bathroom built to high specifications. The home holds an open plan, fully fitted kitchen and diner which leads out to the balcony. The view from the balcony is breath-taking, with a green vista as far as the eye can see.      From there you can observe the beautiful private garden that comes with the property, perfect for lounging in the summer or activities in any season. The maisonette comes with its own off-street parking with space for two vehicles, and even offers an enormous loft space currently being used as an additional bedroom and office space/ gym. It also offers ample storage space. Brimming with potential, this property is a must-view for any purchaser.     It is in a cul-de-sac midway between Raynes Park and New Malden train stations and has easy access to Raynes Park itself as well as multiple amenities. This includes nearby golf and tennis venues and diverse restaurant options. It also provides convenient access into the A3, further facilitating travel.

long_description: A spacious and well-presented apartment  occupying the entire ground floor of an imposing  period property. The apartment has elegant high ceilings and many attractive period features. The welcoming and spacious reception hall, with wood flooring, leads to a magnificent reception room with beautiful windows and a large fireplace. The modern kitchen is a generous room with space for a dining table and suitably adjoins the property's utility room. There are four bedrooms, one of which has an en-suite shower room. There is also an additional family bathroom. The basement, which is approximately 24' by 16' could be converted to further accommodation (subject to consents). Outside The property is approached by a gated gravel  driveway with off street parking for several cars. The garden is accessed from the reception room and has a decked area leading to the  private garden beyond. Situation Arthur Road is a popular residential road ideally located for the District Line station, amenities and local shopping facilities of Wimbledon Park and is within easy reach of the exclusive bars, boutiques and restaurants of Wimbledon Village. Wimbledon Park itself offers acres of open space and leisure facilities and National Rail services to Waterloo are available in Wimbledon Town. The area is renowned for its excellent schools in both the state and independent sectors. Additional Information The property has an underlying lease, granted in March 1999 for a term from 31/3/1999 - 24/3/2959. We are waiting for the vendors to confirm the present service charge. long_description: A generous two bedroom apartment located on the sixth floor of a much sought after private estate off Somerset Road, close to AELTC.  Description A superb two bedroom apartment on the sixth floor of this highly regarded development with secure underground parking and far reaching views towards London. The apartment opens into a large central hallway, with several useful storage cupboards. Off the entrance hall to the front is  a generous double aspect reception room benefitting from good natural light with a formal dining room. Alongside a contemporary kitchen offers a good range of fitted units and cupboards with integrated appliances.  The principal bedroom has a wall of fitted wardrobes complete with a luxurious en suite bathroom, and offers far reaching views. There is a second double bedroom and a modern guest shower room. The property has a secure underground parking space and there is further visitors' parking within the development. The development also benefits from lift access, a porter and well maintained communal gardens. Location Burghley House is located within The Oaklands Estate, a very well regarded private estate off Somerset Road, neighbouring the All England Lawn Tennis Club and sitting between Wimbledon Park and the Common. Wimbledon Village is within one mile and has a choice of exclusive boutiques, bars and restaurants, while Wimbledon Town just over one mile away has a wider selection of high street stores, a District Line underground station and mainline station with overland services to Waterloo. long_description: The Zero started with a vision. To create one of the most planet-friendly developments in the UK, without compromising on design or function.   The Zero blazes a new trail in high-quality, zero carbon living. From creating a thermally efficient building to reducing the energy demands of each apartment and the building as a whole, every detail and every decision delivers maximum sustainability – and maximum wow factor.  At the Zero, we’ve harnessed the natural resources of the sun’s power and use it to our owners’ benefit to help save the planet and reduce their energy bills. Using the most technically advanced solar panel system combined with a bank of Tesla Powerwall storage batteries, we’ve created a building where during certain times of year we are completely self-sufficient.   The Zero offers every apartment with open plan, free flowing living spaces with glass internal doors to allow light to flood through.  Every detail has been finished to the highest specification, thoughtfully designed to make the most of the living space. Triple glazed windows open inwards to allow for easy cleaning. Breakfast bars offer a second dimension to modern living lifestyles. Stylish Italian kitchens with beautiful Silestone Calcutta worktops throughout, kitchens include filtered boiling water taps.  The door entry system has been designed to ring your phone when visitors arrive, so you can open the door from the touch of a button on your mobile, wherever you may be.    Every flat has its own private balcony which is constructed in solid concrete and finished beautifully with maintenance free composite wood. They need little maintenance, look good and are long lasting. They even feature inward opening doors so you’ve got more outdoor space to relax. Welcome to the most beautiful energy-efficient apartment building in the UK. Situation The Zero itself is located in Raynes Park. A peaceful, green, family-friendly area with a vibrant community feel. A safe and leafy suburb just 20 minutes by train from the centre of London, much of Raynes Park is low-rise, creating a sense of open space that is a rare find in London. The lively local high street was a Great British High Street finalist in 2015 and offers every amenity you need for day-to-day life. Less than 1.5 miles away is the chic Wimbledon Village, with a huge array of stylish boutiques, artisan coffee shops and speciality food stores, along with a plentiful choice of buzzing bars and restaurants. There are also the elegant homes and wide green spaces of Combe Lane and Copse Hill, a neighbouring conservation area. Raynes Park has an active residents’ association, which helps ensure community support for projects such as tree planting and improved cycling and walking routes. Only 10 min cycle from Richmond Park. Additional Information Lease: Leasehold 250 years  Service charge: £2,892 Ground Rent: £350 The above is to be reviewed annually Brochures Particulars

This award-winning five-bedroom home, tucked away in a quiet residential road near Wimbledon Park, is one of a pair of timber-framed houses designed in 2011 by the leading architect Andrei Saltykov for his own occupation. Contextually driven in response to an unusually shaped site, the design is inspired by the nautical layout of a boat, with beautifully light open-plan living areas ‘floating above the sea-level gardens like elevated decks’ and more intimate sleeping areas set in the lower levels. Internal living space of over 1,915 sq ft extends across three storeys, with full-height glass walls framing verdant views across the treetops. Private enclosed gardens extend to the front and a carport is set beneath the cantilever.  The Architect  Andrei Saltykov studied at the Moscow Architectural Institute and Bartlett School of Architecture. He was awarded the prestigious Queen’s Award and became a Chevening Scholar. In the following years, he lived in the UK and USA working as an Associate for Richard Rogers Partnership and as an Associate Partner for Foster + Partners. In 2011 he co-founded his own practice, Lacey+Saltykov Architects.  The Tour  Approached via a quiet residential road, the two houses sit side by side on the corner plot, where a defining angular profile of charcoal grey draws a striking impression against the skyline. Construction is of prefabricated timber panels, with wall insulation made of shredded paper injected into the panels through circular holes. A water-based heating network runs underfoot.  A gated walkway leads through enclosed front gardens, primarily laid to lawn and bordered by mature hedging. The primary entrance is neatly enclosed in the front façade and accessed via a set of external steps, which in turn opens into a bright hallway with a cloakroom set to one side and storage concealed within bespoke cabinetry.  The primary living spaces are organised in an open plan across the upper-ground floor. The living and dining areas are positioned on the south-easterly aspect, where the natural light is exceptional. A floor-to-ceiling glass wall frames verdant views across the treetops, and the park beyond. Solid timber flooring runs underfoot with pleasing aesthetic continuity. A fireplace partition neatly divides the living and kitchen areas, retaining an impressive sense of open space and volume.  At one side of the room, a cleverly conceived modern kitchen is defined by clean lines of cabinetry, partially free-standing and partially built into the stairwell. Every inch of space has been carefully considered to create an intimate area for cooking, adapting with ease from a sociable entertaining layout to a space that can accommodate the daily practicalities of family life.  A glass panel sensitively screens the timber-tread stairwell, which leads to the main bedroom suite and a fantastic additional living space on the upper storey. Currently set out as a home office, this is a quiet and peaceful space with ample space for two desks, and would equally well suit an additional bedroom. Full-height glazing optimises the wonderfully green backdrop, and a free-standing bathtub has been strategically placed to optimise the dramatic views.  The main bedroom is located on the north side of this level and is another restful room with a generous provision of storage. An en suite bathroom is positioned centrally, with a skylight overhead, allowing light to stream down into the shower.  The additional three bedrooms are positioned on the lower-ground floor, one of which has an ensuite.The other two bedrooms are served by a family bathroom. The integral garage can also be accessed from this level, with additional storage space and utilities and an electric up-and-over door leading to the cantilevered carport. In total, there are three private parking spaces; two beneath the car port and one space in the garage.  Outdoor Space  The front gardens have been beautifully landscaped while retaining an ease of maintenance and upkeep. A wide expanse of lawn is bordered by mature hedging and fencing to ensure excellent privacy, and there are several areas for eating and relaxing in warmer months.  The Area  Neighbouring Wimbledon is one of London’s most attractive areas, with its large, open green space of Wimbledon Park and The All England Tennis Club, a 20-minute walk away. An excellent selection of independent restaurants, cafés and boutiques in Wimbledon Village can also be easily reached on foot. The New Wimbledon Theatre, one of London’s largest Edwardian theatres, is a 15-minute train journey. The new AFC Wimbledon football stadium on Plough Lane is also within walking distance.  Tooting Broadway and Tooting Market are a 10-minute journey by bus. The red-and-white fronted covered Tooting market has been there for 80 years and is open daily. While it still offers the local community a place for their weekly shop for staples (butcher, baker), it’s also a hub of great eateries, where you can find Venezuelan arepas, ramen or Guyanese dhal pouri with fluffy roti, served out of hatches or permanent restaurants.  The house also sits within catchment for a number of excellent schools, including Wimbledon Park Primary School (Ofsted Outstanding).  There are excellent transport links, with Wimbledon Park (District line) and Earlsfield (Mainline) a five-minute walk away. There is also easy access around Wimbledon via car, as it borders the A3.  Council Tax Band: G
