long_description: About the property: Brinkley's Estate Agents are delighted to offer this larger than average, semi-detached residence, located on a sought after road, within Wimbledon Park. There is scope to further extend the loft space.  Further benefits include gated, secure off street parking for several cars, large terrace with stunning London views and no onward chain. Offers 2413 sq ft of internal accommodation. Location: Arthur Road is in the popular area of Wimbledon Park. The property is located approx 50m from Wimbledon Park Underground station, and the local shops and amenities on Arthur Road. Wimbledon Village is within 1 mile away with the town centre (mainline railway station) around 1500m. Locally are a number of popular schools. Wimbledon Village offers a pretty collection of boutiques, restaurants and public houses with easy access onto the 1100 acres of Wimbledon Common. You also have the All England Lawn Tennis Club close by.  Central London can be reached within approx 17 minutes from Wimbledon train station and via the District Line underground. How to view: Please contact our Wimbledon Hill office on  , Wimbledon Park office on   or our Putney office on   for more information or to book a viewing. We are open from 8:30am - 7pm Monday to Friday and 9am - 6pm on weekends. Sole Agents. EPC:

This striking three-bedroom home, tucked away in a quiet residential road near Wimbledon Park, is one of a pair of timber-framed houses designed in 2011 by the leading architect Andrei Saltykov. The design is contextually driven in response to an unusually shaped site. Although independent of each other, there is great potential to join the two houses from the primary living areas. Internal living space of over 1,200 sq ft spans two storeys, with ribbons of carefully-positioned glazing framing verdant views and inviting an excellent quality of natural light and private enclosed gardens extend to the front of the house.  The Architect  Andrei Saltykov studied at the Moscow Architectural Institute and Bartlett School of Architecture. He was awarded the prestigious Queen’s Award and became a Chevening Scholar. In the following years, he lived in the UK and USA working as an Associate for Richard Rogers Partnership and as an Associate Partner for Foster + Partners. In 2011, he co-founded his own practice, Lacey+Saltykov Architects.  The Tour  Approached via a quiet residential road, the two houses sit side by side on the corner plot, where the defining angular profile in charcoal grey draws a striking impression against the skyline. Construction of both houses is of prefabricated timber panels, with wall insulation made of shredded paper injected into the panels through circular holes and a water-based underfloor heating network.  A shingle walkway leads through the enclosed front gardens to the primary entrance, set neatly within the façade of the house. The bright entrance hall at ground level, in turn, opens onto a timber-tread stairwell leading up to the primary living areas across the upper floor.  The layout is inspired by the nautical design of a boat, with beautifully light open-plan living areas ‘floating above the sea-level gardens like elevated decks’ and more intimate sleeping areas set on the lower levels.  The living, dining and kitchen spaces are characterised by clean lines and an excellent quality of natural light, which streams in through expansive skylights and carefully positioned vertical ribbons of glazing. Timber flooring runs underfoot with pleasing aesthetic continuity.  A fireplace, flanked by bookshelves, forms a natural focal point at one side, while low lines of bespoke cabinetry create neat divisions and provide additional storage.  The cleverly conceived modern kitchen is set on the northerly side of the plan, with bespoke cabinetry set into the wall creating an intimate, practical area for cooking while optimising every inch of space. The dining area is positioned adjacently.  The three bedrooms, positioned on the lower-ground floor level, are wonderfully quiet and peaceful. Each has large picture windows inviting a good level of natural light and framing leafy views of the gardens. The main bedroom, on the southerly side of the plan, has an en suite shower room. The additional two bedrooms are served by a family bathroom with a shower and a bathtub. The services and laundry facilities are housed in a large utility room, also on this level.  Outdoor Space  The front gardens have been beautifully landscaped while retaining an ease of maintenance and upkeep; primarily laid to lawn with mature hedging and fencing to ensure excellent privacy, and a side border for growing herbaceous plants throughout the seasons.  The Area  Neighbouring Wimbledon is one of London’s most attractive areas, with its large, open green space of Wimbledon Park and The All England Tennis Club, a 20-minute walk away. An excellent selection of independent restaurants, cafés and boutiques in Wimbledon Village can also be easily reached on foot. The New Wimbledon Theatre, one of London’s largest Edwardian theatres, is a 15-minute train journey. The new AFC Wimbledon football stadium on Plough Lane is also within walking distance.  Tooting Broadway and Tooting Market are a 10-minute journey by bus. The red-and-white fronted covered Tooting market has been there for 80 years and is open daily. While it still offers the local community a place for their weekly shop for staples (butcher, baker), it’s also a hub of great eateries, where you can find Venezuelan arepas, ramen or Guyanese dhal pouri with fluffy roti, served out of hatches or permanent restaurants.  The house also sits within catchment for a number of excellent schools, including Wimbledon Park Primary School (Ofsted Outstanding).  There are excellent transport links, with Wimbledon Park (District line) and Earlsfield (Mainline) a five-minute walk away. There is also easy access around Wimbledon via car, as it borders the A3.  Council Tax Band: F

bullet_points: Grand Entrance Hallway;Formal Living Room and Study;Dining Room;Stunning Sun Room;Kitchen/Dining Room;Media Room;Gymnasium;Principal Bedroom suite with individual e/s bathrooms and dressing rooms;5 further Bedrooms;4 further Bath/Shower rooms
station_info: [(0.9, 'Wimbledon Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-underground;svg-tramlink'), (1.0, 'Wimbledon Park Station', 'svg-underground'), (1.1, 'Dundonald Road Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink')]
long_description: Old Pound House on Parkside is a tasteful, fully renovated and modernised 6 bedroom family home that is ideal for family living and entertaining.  It offers timeless elegance and provides delightful open views across Wimbledon Common, with its acres of woodlands and walks.  Securely set back behind the two pairs of gates of the carriage driveway, there is also ample off-street parking for several cars and a double garage. Old Pound House offers the most incredible turn-key solution for a family looking for a stunning, newly modernised laterally configured 6 bedroom home that offers great space and volume.  The quality throughout is exceptional.  Set predominantly over only 3 floors within the original envelope of an impressive early 1900's period house, this stunning property retains some of the original features and provides flexibility across 5 beautifully appointed reception rooms with extremely generous proportions – all set in over 0.5 acre of landscaped gardens.  The master bedroom is one of the finest we have seen – a double aspect bedroom with ‘his and hers’ en-suite bathrooms and ‘his and hers’ dressing rooms.  3 of the other bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms and there is also a family bathroom on the first floor.  In addition to the fabulous reception rooms, there is a gymnasium with doors out to the garden.   Plans have been approved for a stunning outdoor swimming pool, offering the perfect expansion to summer entertainment and relaxation, moving from the exquisite interiors of this home to the breath taking natural greenery of the private gardens.  Planning has also been approved for the pool outbuilding, which will provide a luxurious outdoor changing room, storage area and will house the pool plant equipment. The gross internal area of the pool outbuilding will be 27.8 sqm. Parkside is one of Wimbledon Village's most popular and sought-after streets, located within 300m of the High Street with the Common across the road.  The Village is renowned for its unique 'countryfied' feel, whilst being only 17 mins by rail to the City.  The High Street has a number of pretty shops, restaurants,  bars and a riding stables available for riding on the Common. The Common itself is over 1100 acres and is perfect for walking, riding, cycling or golf at one of the 3 courses within the Common. Wimbledon railway station is around 800m away with a regular rail and tube link to central London. Locally are a number of excellent schools with King's College School and Wimbledon High School close by. Brochures Particulars

long_description: A beautifully presented two bedroom semi detached house which was a brand new development just ~6 years ago. Benefiting from a large, sunny private garden with private side access and on-street permit parking. Offered to the market Chain Free.  The property has a real sense of space and is fantastically bright throughout.  The ground floor consists of a large open plan kitchen joining a generous reception which is ideal for entertaining leading out through full width bi-fold doors to a beautiful garden, and a WC. The first floor has two double bedrooms and the family bathroom. The garden has a nice outdoors seating area and a gorgeous apple tree; perfect for gardening lovers and summer gatherings, or simply for enjoying an afternoon tea in the good weather. There is ample space for the addition of a large garden studio (as neighbor's exemplify.) The Reception / kitchen has a superb modern finish, with sleek kitchen fittings. The bedrooms are airy with plenty of space and get flooded with sunlight. There is also a large loft area offering an abundance of storage space.   The property is conveniently located just 0.3 miles from Tooting station. Tooting Broadway and Colliers Wood Tube (Northern) are also near by.  The place is surrounded by amenities and it is short walk to Figges Marsh Park and Garden, Tooting Market and Streatham Ice and Leisure Centre.  Tenure: Freehold.  Council tax: Band D. Brochures Brochure 1

long_description: A stunning example of a four bedroom Victorian family home, that has been thoughtfully renovated to an excellent standard, in a prime location.  The ground floor benefits from ample entertaining space with a fully extended rear and a spacious eat-in kitchen with an additional sung area adding to your living space. The bi folding doors lead onto a low maintenance tiled garden that extends your living space further in the summer months and comparatively for the area is private and not overlooked. Further benefits include separate utility room and a downstairs WC.   The first floor provides two well-proportioned double bedrooms with a Jack & Gill family bathroom. The second floor comprises two further bedrooms, one with an en suite shower room, and plenty of eaves storage space.   The property has been fully modernised throughout yet has managed to keep its charm and character in abundance. The house also benefits from good levels of natural light.  Located on a much sought after road in Earlsfield, the property is well placed for some of the most desirable schools and is a stone’s throw away from Earlsfield mainline station and Southfields Underground Station (Distirct Line). Garratt Lane with its vast array of shops, bars and restaurants is within easy reach and the green open spaces of King George's Park and other local parks are also close by.  Brochures Particulars

bullet_points: Almost 800 Sq. Ft. Three Bedroom Flat;Large Living Room And Separate Kitchen;Lots Of Natural Light And Top (2Nd) Floor Flat;New Roof And Double Glazing Recently Done;New Hot Water Cylinder And New Electrical Wiring;Walking To Wimbledon Park + Central Wimbledon;Close To Large Waitrose And Local Shops
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 93 years remaining The Property A bright and spacious - almost 800 sq. ft. - three bedroom flat with large living room and large separate kitchen, with new double glazing and residents off-street parking, in Poplar Court, a quiet development off Gap Road in SW19, a short walk to Wimbledon Park tube and shops, and to central Wimbledon, supermarkets and mainline station.  Set on the second (top) floor of this well maintained, purpose-built development the flat is well appointed throughout with three good-sized bedrooms, a spacious living room and a full bathroom. The property recently had new double glazing and a new roof installed, a new hot water cylinder installed in the flat and the electrical wiring in the flat was also replaced. The large windows throughout and well-appointed rooms give the property a light and airy feel. There is a separate, spacious kitchen with lots of fitted storage and space for dining.  The building is set within extensive communal gardens and grounds. There is plentiful residents' parking, large well-kept lawn areas, a children's play area and a basketball court. With many long term residents and families, there is a safe, community feel. Poplar Court is a couple of minutes' walk to popular Leopold Road cafes and boutique shops. There is a large Waitrose supermarket close by on Alexandra Road. Wimbledon Park with sailing lake and sports facilities is a short walk away and Wimbledon Village and Common is within walking distance. Central Wimbledon with it's many attractions, cinemas, gyms and theatre is close by. Wimbledon Park tube station, Wimbledon mainline and tube station and Haydons Road station are all within easy walking distance.  Merton Band C Council Tax. Ground Rent £10 per annum. Service Charges approx. £460 every 6 months (Incl. of Building Insurance). Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

long_description: An extended detached six bedroom family house in an elevated position on a popular no through road close to Wimbledon Common and Village.  Description An extended and spacious detached family house that has been meticulously refurbished by our clients to a high standard.  On the ground floor a spacious and light filled reception room offers flexible accommodation, currently used as a drawing/dining room, providing access onto the terrace. The modern family kitchen is accessed from the central hall and reception room with doors also onto the rear terrace and garden.  On the first floor there are three double bedrooms and two bathrooms (one en suite)  and a further bedroom. There are a further two bedrooms and bathroom on the second floor with fantastic far reaching views and plenty of storage in the eaves. The lower ground floor comprises of a flexible area that could be used as a  bedroom/playroom/cinema room, shower room and laundry room. This accommodation is separate from the other bedrooms, ideal for a nanny/housekeeper. Outside to the front is an area of off street parking behind wooden electric gates with a purpose built studio/home office.   At the rear is an area of terrace for entertaining and landscaped garden. Location The house is located in a popular residential road approximately 0.5 of a mile from Wimbledon Common which provides the perfect setting for a variety of outdoor pursuits including golf, riding and walking.  The area is highly regarded for the quality of its schooling with Kings College school around 600 metres away and Hollymount Primary School 500 metres. Raynes Park railway station is within 1000 metres and offers a fast and regular rail link (London Waterloo 19 minutes) with Central London. Wimbledon Village is less than one mile away with its pretty boutiques, cafes and restaurants. Source of times   Source of distances Google Pedometer Square Footage: 3,047 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: An exceptional double fronted four bedroom house, occupying a substantial plot of 0.13 Acres with a beautiful south west facing garden, approached via an attractive gated forecourt with ample parking and garage. Internal accommodation of 2216 sq ft boasting three separate reception rooms, as well as a generously proportioned, quality kitchen, with a vaulted dining room.  The four first floor bedrooms are complimented by 2 bath/shower rooms including an en-suite to the principle bedroom. The property is situated in a prime location on the west side of Lambton Road, being conveniently situated between Wimbledon Common & Raynes Park. A property of this calibre is rarely available to the open market and presents a wonderful opportunity to secure a property of special stature in this fabulous location. Council Tax Band G An exquisite double fronted detached house with garage, providing spacious accommodation featuring a gated forecourt with ample off road parking, Ground floor comprises three formal reception rooms, quality kitchen diner with vaulted ceilings leading to a wide south west facing garden, downstairs WC and a utility room leads through to the garage. First floor comprising, four bedrooms, two bath/shower rooms, access to loft space, the loft presents ample scope for a loft conversion or complete additional floor STPP. Historic planning permission was granted for a full floor extension with double gable and front dormer floor, it's likely a similar or alternative modern design could be appropriate STPP. especially given the scale of neighbouring properties with similar substantial extensions. A truly rare and wonderful opportunity to secure a spectacular home in a most desirable & convenient West Wimbledon location with space to grow into one of the largest detached houses in the area. The property is situated in the much sought after Lambton Road, a prime residential address, ideally situated to take advantage of the many conveniences close at hand such as Raynes Park Station with frequent trains to Waterloo and Raynes Park Centre with a range of restaurants, coffee shops and supermarkets. Holland Gardens and Cottenham Park green spaces are also within a short walk, Wimbledon Common and Village are accessible via a brisk walk or 200 bus. Wimbledon Town is conveniently nearby for more extensive shopping and further transport connections. Richmond Park and the river scene at Kingston with its substantial shopping centre is a short drive or 57 bus ride away. The area is blessed with flagship schools in both the state and private sectors, including Kings College & Hollymount School. Brochures Lambton Road, West Wimbledon, SW20 Brochure

long_description: A beautifully presented four bedroom family period house in Wimbledon Town.  Description This four bedroom end of terrace house is set back from the road and offers spacious family accommodation over three floors. To the front is a generous bay fronted double reception room with a gorgeous fire place. The reception leads into the light open plan family kitchen/breakfast room. Alongside the kitchen is a separate utility room and guest WC.  Upstairs there are three bedrooms and a beautifully appointed family bathroom. There is a fourth bedroom and en suite shower room on the top floor with superb views across Wimbledon. The rear garden is private, easy to maintain and has attractive flower borders. The property is just 300m from Wimbledon mainline train and District line underground station which provides a fast and regular link to London (Wimbledon to Waterloo 17 mins). station_info: [(0.6, 'New Malden Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.7, 'Raynes Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (1.0, 'Motspur Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: Perfect for a small family or first time buyers, you enter our property on the ground floor, here you will take the stairs to the first floor and find yourself in the entry way of your 2 bedroom maisonette. Once at the top of the stairs you will see a peak into the master bedroom. This is where the magic happens, and of course by magic we mean sleeping. It feels like magic when you get more than 6 hours right? Also in the bedroom there is a big bay window for natural light, great for those selfie takers among us.  Ok, let's not pretend that this flat is close to the A3 and sometimes you might get a little hum of a passing Ferrari but the good double glazed windows work well to block out all the unwanted noise. The second bedroom is just nearby, it's the perfect size for a nursery and right next door you don't have to worry about your little ones in the night. And if you're not quite ready for little ones then this is your office/place to stash your overnight guests. Just opposite the second bedroom is a family bathroom. Displaying a new modern suite, it's a good place to clean up after a messy day. Moving on to the reception/living room, if you need a place to unwind in the evenings, you've found your spot. There is room for two double sized sofas and even possibly another arm chair if you are expecting guests.  With a kitchen large enough for a decent table you get to choose where you have your morning coffee. There's no feeling of being cramped here with the doors to the garden and being connected to the living room.  You don't have to worry about those spilt cups of tea, the tea towel will be there in seconds to wipe it up. The cream coloured modern shelving give the room a bright and airy feel as you look out into your garden. If we've learnt anything the last few years, it's that we all value having a garden. On Huntley Way you could have your own private South West facing plot with plenty of room for all your gardening tools and very important swing sets. There is also access to a loft which has plenty of space for hiding all your Christmas decorations and embarrassing senior school photographs. If of course you don't have any embarrassing school photos there is a potential to extend (subject to the freeholder and planning consent).   This area between New Malden and Raynes Park is highly sought after. You're just half a mile from New Malden mainline Station which has direct train links into London Waterloo. Making this the spot to be for commuters.  Local schools in the area include St. Matthew's CofE Primary and Raynes Park High School. Both of these are rated Good by OFSTED.

bullet_points: Viewings are Highly Recommended!;Ample Storage Space Throughout ;Peaceful Private Garden ;Fantastic Transport Links With Access To Three Mainline Stations;Quiet Residential Road;Five Bedrooms + Three Bathrooms Including Downstairs Shower Room;Highly Sought-After Location;Excellent Local Schools
long_description: Laurels are delighted to present to the market this immaculately presented five-bedroom family home. This fantastic property is situated on a quiet residential street in Streatham and benefits from being between three mainline stations and multiple bus routes, giving excellent transport links into Central London. The property also benefits from being a short walk from the local amenities and green space of Mitcham Common. Guide Price of £625,000 - £650,000  As you enter the property, on your left is the large living area, perfect for hosting family events, following through into the bright entrance hallway through to open plan kitchen and dining area. At the rear of the kitchen are doors opening up into the sunny private garden with patio area and shed for extra storage. On the first floor are two large double bedrooms, one single room and a large family bathroom. The third floor consists of one double bedroom and a single room, twinned with another family bathroom.  Additional benefits include free on-street parking, large private rear garden, quiet road and large bedrooms. station_info: [(0.9, 'Wimbledon Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-underground;svg-tramlink'), (1.0, 'Wimbledon Park Station', 'svg-underground'), (1.1, 'Dundonald Road Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink')]
long_description: Old Pound House on Parkside is a tasteful, fully renovated and modernised 6 bedroom family home that is ideal for family living and entertaining.  It offers timeless elegance and provides delightful open views across Wimbledon Common, with its acres of woodlands and walks.  Securely set back behind the two pairs of gates of the carriage driveway, there is also ample off-street parking for several cars and a double garage. Old Pound House offers the most incredible turnkey solution for a family looking for a stunning, newly modernised laterally configured 6 bedroom home that offers great space and volume.  The quality throughout is exceptional.  Set predominantly over only 3 floors within the original envelope of an impressive early 1900's period house, this stunning property retains some of the original features and provides flexibility across 5 beautifully appointed reception rooms with extremely generous proportions – all set in over 0.5 acre of landscaped gardens.  The master bedroom is one of the finest we have seen – a double aspect bedroom with ‘his and hers’ en-suite bathrooms and ‘his and hers’ dressing rooms.  3 of the other bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms and there is also a family bathroom on the first floor.    Plans have been approved for a stunning outdoor swimming pool, offering the perfect expansion to summer entertainment and relaxation, moving from the exquisite interiors of this home to the breath taking natural greenery of the private gardens.  Planning has also been approved for the pool outbuilding, which will provide a luxurious outdoor changing room, storage area and will house the pool plant equipment. The gross internal area of the pool outbuilding will be 27.8 sqm.   Parkside is one of Wimbledon Village's most popular and sought-after streets, located within 300m of the High Street with the Common across the road.  The Village is renowned for its unique 'countryfied' feel, whilst being only 17 mins by rail to the City.  The High Street has a number of pretty shops, restaurants,  bars and a riding stables available for riding on the Common. The Common itself is over 1100 acres and is perfect for walking, riding, cycling or golf at one of the 3 courses within the Common. Wimbledon railway station is around 800m away with a regular rail and tube link to central London. Locally are a number of excellent schools with King's College School and Wimbledon High School close by. Local Authority - Merton Band H annual estimate £3,617 pa Brochures Particulars

Set behind a secure gated entrance, this fabulous apartment includes two private parking spaces and access to beautifully landscaped communal gardens to the rear. Eagle House is located right in the heart of Wimbledon Village, just off the High Street and near the open spaces of Wimbledon Common yet accessible to both Wimbledon Tube and Mainline stations. Shops, boutiques and restaurants are literally on the doorstep. long_description: A handsome mid Victorian five bedroom detached house located on a wide plot with a two storey extension offering superb lateral living space and a southerly facing 80' rear garden.  Description A wonderful opportunity to buy a superb five bedroom detached double fronted family house offering wonderful lateral living space set back from the road behind a gravel drive way and off street parking for several cars. The house opens into a central entrance hall with wood flooring which extends across the ground floor. To the left of the hall is a generous double reception room with an attractive bay window, offering a dual aspect with direct access to the garden at the rear. A large family room is alongside, with a playroom/study that also overlooks the garden.  A cleverly designed kitchen/dining/living room runs from the front to the back of the house, providing a superb multi-purpose living space. Glass doors at the rear open onto the mature, private,  southerly facing 80' rear garden complete with a garden shed. The modern kitchen features an extensive range of units and cupboards, stone work surfaces and fully integrated appliances. The utility room is conveniently located on the lower ground floor alongside a useful study/home office and there is also an impressive wine cellar. Upstairs, on the first floor is a generous principal bedroom suite which runs across the front of the house, with a fully fitted dressing room or additional bedroom and a luxurious en suite bathroom with a double rainfall shower. There are a further three bedrooms, a stylish shower room and a generous family bathroom with a separate glass shower. Location Denmark Avenue is an attractive residential street on the slopes of Wimbledon Hill. The property is ideally situated for the centre of both Wimbledon Village and Town being within 800 metres of the High Street and railway station.  Wimbledon Village is well known for its pretty boutiques, restaurants and public houses as well as the wonderful open space of Wimbledon Common, which is around 800 metres away.  Wimbledon town centre offers excellent day to day shopping facilities with a department store, cinema, supermarkets, gyms and the Centre Court shopping centre. Wimbledon rail station offers a fast and regular link to central London with over ground trains taking 15-18 minutes and the District Line giving easy access to the West End. Source of times   Source of distances Google Pedometer All distances/measurements are approximate. Square Footage: 3,175 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: A wonderful double fronted detached house located on a much sought after road in Wimbledon village with approved planning permission to extend.  Description This superb detached house offers a wealth of period features with attractive oak paneling, exposed beams, open fireplaces and leaded windows located in the heart of Wimbledon village. The property is accessed via a solid oak front door and opens to an impressive central wood paneled entrance hall. To the front is an elegant bay fronted reception room with French windows to the side and a formal dining room with an attractive stone fireplace. To the rear is a fitted kitchen opening to a breakfast room with green views of a large mature rear garden. There is a further reception room with doors to the garden and a downstairs cloakroom. Upstairs, the principal bedroom is located to the front with a dressing room. There are a further four bedrooms, a family bathroom and a separate WC.  There is approved planning permission for a complete renovation to refurbish and extend.  Merton council planning ref: 19/P1743 for a two storey rear extension, single rear and side extensions, provision of accommodation at basement level and conversion of the roof space including a rear roof extension, erection of a garage, new vehicle access onto Lancaster road, landscaping and associated works. Location Lancaster Road is located in Wimbledon Village around 140 metres of the High Street. Wimbledon Village is known for its uniquely rural feel with 1100 acres of Wimbledon Common bordering the High Street alongside pretty boutiques, restaurants and bars. The All England Lawn Tennis Club is approx. 1200 metres away. Central London can be reached from Wimbledon railway station, also around 1200 metres away with a regular link to London Waterloo (17 minutes approx). long_description: A beautifully presented and larger than average one bedroom, first floor apartment with a south westerly aspect in this sought after retirement living development. Liberty House boasts a table service restaurant open lunchtimes and early evening serving freshly prepared meals daily. Summary  - Liberty House is a purpose built Retirement Living Plus development built by McCarthy & Stone, designed specifically for the over 70s, for those who wish to enjoy independent living but may need some extra care and support. There is an Estate Manager who leads the team and oversees the development. The apartment comprises of a fully fitted kitchen, underfloor heating, fitted and tiled shower room, spacious bedroom and lounge. 24 hour emergency call system. Communal facilities include a Club lounge where social events and activities take place, a function room and a roof top terrace there are also landscaped gardens. There are two fully equipped laundry rooms and a restaurant which is table service and serves freshly prepared Lunch and evening meals daily. If your guests wish to stay, there is guest suite accommodation which can be booked (fees apply). There is a 24 hour emergency call system provided by a personal pendant and call points in your bedroom and bathroom as well as onsite management 24 hours a day. One hour of domestic support per week is included in the service charge at Liberty House with additional services including care and support available at an extra charge. However, this can be from as little as 15 minutes per session which can be increased or decreased to suit your needs.  Liberty House is conveniently located within the London Borough of Merton, between Wimbledon and New Malden and only 8 Miles from Central London, Raynes Park is a popular spot with a bustling social scene. Entrance Hall  - Front door with letterbox and spyhole leads to the spacious entrance hall where entry door panel and the 24 hour Tunstall emergency response system is in place. Illuminated light switches and smoke detector. From the hallway there is a door to a walk in storage and airing cupboard. Doors lead to the bedroom, living room and shower room. Living Room  - A bright and larger than average very well presented living/dining room. Two ceiling light points, raised power points. TV & telephone points. Full length windows and a glazed patio door opening to a juliet balcony overlooking landscaped gardens with a South-Westerly aspect. Open Plan Kitchen  - Fully fitted kitchen with modern cupboard doors and co-ordinating work surfaces. Contemporary ceiling lights. Stainless steel sink with chrome mixer tap. There is an integrated fridge/freezer, a fitted electric oven and built-in microwave oven, a fitted electric ceramic hob with extractor over and tiled splashbacks. Window with a south-westerly aspect. Bedroom  - A spacious double bedroom with door to walk-in wardrobe. Underfloor heating, TV and phone point, raised electric sockets and ceiling lights. Full length windows overlooking landscaped gardens. Shower Room  - Modern suite comprising of; close-coupled WC, vanity wash-hand basin with fitted furniture surround including storage below, fitted mirror, shaver point and down lights over, walk-in level access shower with thermostatically controlled shower unit, fully tiled walls and wet room tiled flooring, electric heated towel rail, emergency pull cord and ceiling spot light. Service Charge (Breakdown)  - • Cleaning of communal windows   • Water rates for communal areas and apartments  • Electricity, heating, lighting and power to communal areas  • 24 hour emergency call system  • Upkeep of gardens and grounds  • Repairs and maintenance to the interior and exterior communal areas  • Contingency fund including internal and external redecoration of communal areas  • Buildings insurance  • The apartment heating and hotwater One hour of domestic support per week is included in the service charge  The Service charge does not cover external costs such as your Council Tax, electricity or TV, but does include the cost of your Estates Manager. Find out more about service charges please contact your Property Consultant or Estates Manager. Service charge: £9,198.34 pa (for financial year ending 10/22) Leasehold  - Ground Rent £495 p.a Ground rent review date: June 2030 999 Years from 2015 Brochures Kingston Road, Raynes Park, London EAC Link

long_description: A wonderful architecturally designed four double bedroom house recently refurbished, extended and remodeled by the existing owners to create a superb family home.  Description This impressive early Victorian four bedroom house has been re designed and extended to an exceptional standard, providing flexible accommodation for both entertaining and family living. The property is set back from the road, with off street parking behind an electric gate, and beautifully landscaped gardens. The house also benefits from a second entrance to the lower ground floor. The property has been totally refurbished throughout with remarkable attention to detail. Double glazed timber windows, an acoustic wall, and a fully automatic ventilation system create a quiet and calm interior. To the front is a generous bay fronted reception space with a stone flagged floor that flows into a spectacular kitchen/dining/living room offering a wonderful multi-purpose open plan living space. Clement metal framed windows to one wall provide an abundance of natural light. The superb bespoke kitchen features an extensive range of fitted units and cupboards with Corian work surface and fully integrated appliances. The house also has a ground floor cloakroom. Stairs lead down to the lower ground floor which benefits from high ceilings and, again, Clement metal framed windows, creating a wonderful sense of light and space. The lower ground floor comprises a fully fitted utility room, a stylish shower room, a family room, with bespoke built in storage, opening to a large study/WFH area with French windows on to the courtyard, which is alternatively configured to be a double bedroom. Steps lead up to beautifully landscaped gardens with a pretty arbour and raised flowerbeds.  Upstairs, on the first floor to the front is a luxurious principal suite with custom built wardrobes and a generous en suite bathroom with a bathtub plus wall and separate hand showers. To the rear is a guest double bedroom with fitted cupboards and a contemporary en suite shower room.  On the top floor is a further double bedroom with storage under the eaves. Location St John's Road is located close to the heart of Wimbledon Village, and comprises characterful period houses of varying sizes. Local shops for everyday needs are within 50m, the central Village shops, restaurants and Wimbledon Common are within 600m.   Wimbledon town is within easy reach and provides more comprehensive shopping facilities, supermarkets, a theatre, cinema and Wimbledon Station with over ground and underground links to Central London. Source of times   Source of distances Google Pedometer All measurements are approximate Square Footage: 2,683 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

station_info: [(0.9, 'Raynes Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.9, 'Wimbledon Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-underground;svg-tramlink'), (0.9, 'Dundonald Road Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink')]
long_description: A four bedroom property positioned in a private cul de sac just moments from Wimbledon Common. The property is being sold with a freehold tenure. Overview Nestled between the sprawling greenery of Wimbledon Common and the lush formal gardens of Cannizaro Park is Lordell Place. The property is part of an exclusive cluster of homes that sit within a private cul de sac, offering a quiet escape from the city. All while remaining in close reach of commuting opportunities, as Central London is a 25-minute journey from the property.  Sitting on the former grounds of Chester House, Lordell Place has the unique benefit of being of newer construction, meaning extensive remedial works to bring the home up to modern standard are not required as would be the case with an older property. By the same token, Lordell Place retains a sense of historic charm that is often lost in modern architecture, therefore offering the new owners the best of both worlds. Its construction was also met with several awards upon completion, including the Evening Standard Best Development Award and the Green Leaf Award. Giving a grand first impression of the property is the entrance hall, with the additional option of entering the home through the double garage. Several rooms lead off from this most welcoming of entrance spaces. Most notably, the reception room creates the feeling of an infinite amount of living space as it features an intuitive open plan layout connecting it with the rear dining room. Fused by the clean and bright decor that features throughout, a generous use of skylights maximises the amount of natural light the space receives, ensuring year-round enjoyment of the key living areas of the home.  Moving through to the kitchen, which features modern built-in cabinets and appliances, creating a neat and practical environment. As a central hub of the home, the kitchen is easily accessible from all other living and dining spaces. Elsewhere on the ground floor is a study, a utility room and a downstairs bathroom. Heading upstairs where the first of the property’s four bedrooms, the master suite, can be found. Accompanied by fitted wardrobes and an en-suite bathroom, enchanting views over the garden create a peaceful ambiance. The additional three bedrooms have been cleanly finished with fresh plastering and a neutral colour scheme, ensuring the new owners can easily make the space their own. A separate family bathroom also serves the additional three bedrooms and features a bath and a shower facility.  Shrouded by mature trees offering an optimum amount of privacy, the rear garden creates a tranquil spot that is abundant in usage potential. The garden is also popular with local wildlife, in particular a set of badgers that frequent the area. The front communal garden areas also come with a management company which include all responsibility for landscaping and general maintenance.  In summary, for any property hunters in search of a solid family home offering an abundance of living space while remaining in close reach of the city of London, arranging a viewing of Lordell Place should be a top consideration.  Location Wimbledon is located within the London borough of Merton, which along with nearby Richmond, is routinely voted as one of the safest areas to live in London. Recent data also suggests that crime in Wimbledon has fallen to its lowest levels in over five years, making it easy to see why the area is particularly attractive to families who relocate here. Likewise, the area is popular with working professionals and retirees alike due to its relaxed pace of life.  A number of schools and colleges lie within the catchment area of the property. Over 30 of which have been rated as ‘Outstanding’ by Ofsted, including Ursuline High School, Dundonald Primary School, Wimbledon Chase Primary School and Merton Park Primary School.  The world-famous Wimbledon tennis tournament doesn’t just create a buzz in the town every year but also opens up the potential for short term lets in the area, which can be a particularly lucrative opportunity for homeowners.  Wimbledon Village is only a 10-minute stroll from the property and is packed with a plethora of boutique shops and restaurants that instantly give the feel of quaint country life. Cinemas, theatres and even an interesting mix of museums can also be found here. Residents enjoy an abundance of green spaces on their doorstep in Wimbledon, with Wimbledon Common, Richmond Park, Bushy Park, Morden Park and Mitcham Common all close by. In addition, the area has a number of gyms and health clubs.  Transport Lordell Place is extremely well connected via public transport options, as well as being close to several arterial road networks. The property is 0.5 miles from the A219, which continues north towards Chelsea. Other major roads, including A3 and A24, are also within a short drive, connecting with Central London as well as the wider South East.  Wimbledon Tube Station (District Line) is 1.4 miles from the property. The Circle Line, Piccadilly Line, Central Line, Victoria Line, and London Overground services are all within a short commutable distance.  The tube station also connects with Wimbledon Train Station, offering frequent direct services to London Waterloo, Richmond, St Albans, Woking, Hampton Court, Sutton, Shepperton, Guildford and Dorking.  Dundonald Road Tram Stop is 1.8 miles from the property, with services running between Beckenham Junction and Wimbledon.  Nearby bus services include 200 (Lambton Road to Mitcham Green Fair), which leaves from nearby Ridgway, and is 0.4 miles from the property.  For international travel, Heathrow Airport is 11.1 miles away.  VIEWINGS - By appointment only with Daniel White from Fine & Country Wimbledon. Please enquire and quote DWA.

Set back from this broad and quiet residential road, the house has a driveway at the front with space for 2 vehicles. There is a welcoming, bright hallway upon entry with useful under stairs storage. A large living room is at the front, flooded with natural light from the bay window. At the rear is a dining room which is open plan with the fitted kitchen and both enjoying views of the large back garden. There is a patio area, perfect for entertaining, for a drink at the end of the day or for your morning coffee. Beyond is lawn area and there is shed storage and a brick garage/outbuilding with rear access.  On the first floor are two large double bedrooms, both with big windows, a smaller third bedroom and a spacious, modern family bathroom.  The property benefits from gas central heating, double glazing, has a light and spacious feel throughout and there is further potential to extend both into the loft and at the rear into the garden.  Seymour Avenue is a sought-after residential road in Lower Morden close to popular primary schools and a short walk to local supermarkets, cafes, restaurants and pubs.  Motspur Park and St Helier Stations are both within walking distance and the area is well served by bus routes. The A24 and A3 provide swift road access into, and out of London to the countryside for the weekend. King George's Playing Fields are just around the corner and huge Morden Park with it's wide open green spaces, perfect for long walks, and also a leisure centre with swimming pool is a short walk away. The property consists of reception room with juliet balcony, direct access to kitchen with a window, family bathroom, two double bedrooms and a generous hallway with plenty of storage.  Bradbury Court itself is a modern development that is conveniently located only moments away from Raynes Park station and high street. Raynes Park also benefits from excellent transport links with a train line into and out of Waterloo 12 times an hour, and bus services to Wimbledon, Kingston and beyond. Located between New Malden and Wimbledon, Raynes Park has one of the largest proportions of green open space in south west London. With a number of parks including Cottenham park Recreation Ground and Cannon Hill Common with its 140-year old woodland that provides a habitat for a variety of flora and fauna, Raynes Park is excellent for both greenery and city convienience. The centre of Raynes park is built around the station and offers a variety of amenities with shops, pubs and restaurants including a Sainsbury`s Local Supermarket, Health Centre and Post Office. long_description: The Zero started with a vision. To create one of the most planet-friendly developments in the UK, without compromising on design or function.  The Zero blazes a new trail in high-quality, zero carbon living. From creating a thermally efficient building to reducing the energy demands of each apartment and the building as a whole, every detail and every decision delivers maximum sustainability – and maximum wow factor. At the Zero, we’ve harnessed the natural resources of the sun’s power and use it to our owners’ benefit to help save the planet and reduce their energy bills. Using the most technically advanced solar panel system combined with a bank of Tesla Powerwall storage batteries, we’ve created a building where during certain times of year we are completely self-sufficient. The Zero offers every apartment with open plan, free flowing living spaces with glass internal doors to allow light to flood through. Every detail has been finished to the highest specification, thoughtfully designed to make the most of the living space. Triple glazed windows open inwards to allow for easy cleaning. Breakfast bars offer a second dimension to modern living lifestyles. Stylish Italian kitchens with beautiful Silestone Calcutta worktops throughout, kitchens include filtered boiling water taps.  The door entry system has been designed to ring your phone when visitors arrive, so you can open the door from the touch of a button on your mobile, wherever you may be. Every flat has its own private balcony which is constructed in solid concrete and finished beautifully with maintenance free composite wood. They need little maintenance, look good and are long lasting. They even feature inward opening doors so you’ve got more outdoor space to relax. Welcome to the most beautiful energy-efficient apartment building in the UK. Situation The Zero itself is located in Raynes Park. A peaceful, green, family-friendly area with a vibrant community feel. A safe and leafy suburb just 20 minutes by train from the centre of London, much of Raynes Park is low-rise, creating a sense of open space that is a rare find in London. The lively local high street was a Great British High Street finalist in 2015 and offers every amenity you need for day-to-day life. Less than 1.5 miles away is the chic Wimbledon Village, with a huge array of stylish boutiques, artisan coffee shops and speciality food stores, along with a plentiful choice of buzzing bars and restaurants. There are also the elegant homes and wide green spaces of Combe Lane and Copse Hill, a neighbouring conservation area. Raynes Park has an active residents’ association, which helps ensure community support for projects such as tree planting and improved cycling and walking routes. Only 10 min cycle from Richmond Park. Additional Information Lease: Leasehold 250 years  Service charge: £1,352 Ground Rent: £250 The above is to be reviewed annually Brochures Particulars

There is a well-equipped fitted kitchen and a superb open plan adaptable living/dining room providing the perfect space to entertain or relax, with direct access onto the stunning terrace. Location Lansdowne Road is a quiet tree lined street, just 800 metres from the charming Wimbledon Village, off Ridgway. long_description: This rarely available detached property is a three double bedroom family home. It is located in the popular, sought after conservation area of Cricket Green and is being offered for sale with no onward chain. It is deceptively more spacious on the inside than its external appearance would suggest. Cricket Green has the World's Oldest Cricket Club. The park opposite the property has a pond, a running track also the Canons Leisure Centre with a Gym & a Pool Etc. There are other green spaces close by, convenient for walking activity & outdoors exercising pursuits.    This property could be ideal as "Work from Home" with the double windows of the Office (which is Bedroom Three) overlooking the green. Just 800 meters away is Mitcham Tram stop, which connects to Wimbledon or East Croydon. Mitcham Junction over ground Train Station connects to London Victoria & Sutton. Local Buses go to Sutton, also to the tube stations of Morden, Colliers Wood & Tooting.   This property offers generous proportions with much higher than average ceilings along with many period features.  There is a spacious lounge area with a feature fireplace, a cosy dining area, a separate kitchen, a family bathroom & an attractive, easy to manage enclosed rear garden.  Other benefits include double glazing & gas central heating. A warm & cosy home with French doors opening onto the garden with a patio.    The owner states that the generous loft space gives an opportunity to be converted by possibly adding a Dormer (STPP) . Recently decorated and presented as ready for you to “just move in”.  Must be seen, to be fully appreciated. So call now to book a viewing. Nearby Schools: St Peter and Paul Catholic Primary School - 0.03 miles  Date Valley School - 0.16 miles  Cricket Green School (Outstanding) - 0.18 miles  Nearby Transport Links: Mitcham Police Station Bus Stop - 0.04 miles  Mitcham Tram Stop - 0.25 miles  Mitcham Junction Rail Station - 0.61 miles      IMPORTANT NOTE TO PURCHASERS:  We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. long_description: The open plan reception space is generous with a solid oak floor and a large period fireplace. There are large south facing windows with shutters making this area light and airy. The flat has a superb kitchen with granite worktops, Bosch oven and hob and an intergrated washing machine and dryer. The two spacious bedrooms have built in wardrobes, a separate luxury shower room with marble tiling and under floor heating. The property has some exquisite cornicing and period details with excellent storage and built in bookshelves. The flat also has a video entry phone system. Outside The front of the building is beautifully presented with landscaped gardens, wrought iron railings, and sandstone paving and front steps. To the rear of the property there is access to off street parking. Situation Homefield Road is a sought-after residential road in the heart of Wimbledon Village which offers an exclusive range of boutiques, bars and restaurants. The flat is a short stroll to Wimbledon Common, and is within easy reach of transport facilities including a District Line link, Tram link and mainline station with regular services to Waterloo and beyond. Additional Information The property is being sold as share of freehold with an underlying lease of 999 years granted in January 2018. The vendors have also advised that the building insurance is £269 per year and that there is no service charge or ground rent. Brochures Particulars

long_description: EWS1 CERTIFICATE & CHAIN FREE! A note from the Vendors: "The principle attraction to buy my flat was its location, but it's also a good size (particularly for a 1 bed) and the terrace and balcony mean you can enjoy good weather in relative peace.  It has all the convenience of being in London but looks onto a quiet branch of the river Wandle, with its tree-lined banks and wildlife (seeing cranes - in bird form - used to be a rarity!). Merton Abbey Mills is a must. The restaurants and entertainment are so unknown it's a hidden gem. Everything's at our fingertips: If we forget something in the weekly shop or need to get some dinner, Sainsbury's and M&S are on the way home or just a 5 minute walk away. It's easy to get into central / across London on the Northern line, and there's no need to keep an eye on first or last trains at the weekends. Sainsbury's, M&S, the Priory retail park and Tandem centre cover almost every desired bit of shopping between them, but failing that bus links are good to Wimbledon, New Malden. And if we want a break, the Wandle Trail takes you to Morden Hall Park and garden centre". EPC 'C' Brochures 6 Chapter Way, South Wimbledon Brochure

long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 992 years remaining The Property Cash Buyers / Investors Only- A bright, spacious - 780 Sq. Ft. - modern TWO DOUBLE BEDROOM apartment with long lease, South East-facing balcony with panoramic views, being sold CHAIN FREE, on Milner Road in SW19 close to the Northern Line tube station at South Wimbledon and central Wimbledon shopping and transport links.  Set on the 6th floor (with lift access) of this recently built, stylish apartment building this fantastic apartment benefits from a high specification throughout, neutral modern design, floor to ceiling double glazing, spacious rooms and plentiful storage space. There is a welcoming hallway with useful built-in storage cupboards, two large double bedrooms flooded with natural light and space for large wardrobes and desks. There is a stylish, tiled, full bathroom and a large, open-plan living and dining room with modern fitted kitchen with fully integrated Bosch appliances and further storage. A balcony, accessed from the living room, enjoys East-facing panoramic views  - perfect for a morning coffee or relaxing drink at the end of the day.  The property has a 79 Energy Performance rating, so good efficiency, green credentials and low bills, and the building has a modern communal heating and hot water system with bills included in the annual service charges of currently £160 pcm, which also include building maintenance, cleaning and insurance, and the ground rent is £250 pa.  Milner Road is close to South Wimbledon tube station and the CS7 cycle route, both leading directly up the Northern Line to the City of London. There are supermarkets, cafes and gyms, including hot yoga and F45, on your doorstep. Central Wimbledon with its many shops, cinemas, theatre, restaurants and station with tube and mainline services into and out of London is a short walk away. Abbey Recreation Ground and playing fields are just around the corner, the river Wandle with nature trail and parks, and historic Merton Abbey Mills are also close by. long_description: This truly breathtaking five bedroom semi detached home has been completely refurbished throughout to an exceptional standard to create flexible and modern living accommodation. The property has the rare benefit of having a separate studio allowing for rental opportunity or home office. Council Tax Band F The ground floor is welcomed by a spacious entrance hall with under stairs storage cupboards. The front reception room is spacious with wooden floor and large triple glazed windows allowing for ample natural light in the room.  The open planned kitchen/dining room has been extended providing a glorious room with a high end fully fitted kitchen, space for dining table, under floor heated tiles and modern sliding doors leading to a rear garden. The kitchen leads onto a separate utility room housing a downstairs WC, new boiler, Mechanical Ventilation Heat Recovery system and a separate door leading to the rear garden. The property also has the extremely rare benefit of having a separate studio connected to the property. The studio is newly built with its own integrated kitchen, bathroom and separate electric from the main house. This is ideal for a side let or gym/office, to suit multiple needs.   The first floor has been extended to allow for four spacious bedrooms all with wooden floor, triple glazed windows and radiators which can be temperature regulated separately. The first floor also has two bathrooms which are modern.  The master bedroom on the second floor is spacious with built in storage and an en-suite.  The property also has a private south facing garden and a separate garage which is accessed via the off street parking. The property is situated close to Dundonald Park with several excellent schools including Dundonald & Wimbledon Chase primary with Wilton Tennis club also being close-by. Wimbledon Town centre with a wide variety of shops and restaurants, is also nearby. Transport links include Wimbledon and Wimbledon Chase stations offering quick and easy access to London Waterloo. Wimbledon and South Wimbledon tube stations and the tram link at Dundonald Road are also close at hand. Brochures The Quadrant, Wimbledon, SW20 Brochure

station_info: [(0.4, 'Dundonald Road Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink'), (0.5, 'Wimbledon Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-underground;svg-tramlink'), (0.6, 'Wimbledon Chase Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: A spectacular and meticulously refurbished six bedroom detached double fronted house with off street parking, a south west facing rear garden and a swimming pool.  Description This handsome six bedroom detached family house offers superb lateral living space across four floors and a separate annexe with street access. The property has been beautifully refurbished throughout with remarkable attention to detail.  The house is set back from the road behind a deep driveway with off street parking. There is a raised ground floor entrance, opening into a deep entrance hall that creates a wonderful sense of light and space with a guest's cloakroom.  Off the hallway full height double doors to the left open into an elegant reception room with an attractive marble fireplace and solid wood flooring. To the right is a wonderful open plan kitchen/dining/family space cleverly designed with glass doors opening at the rear to a large glass sided terrace that runs across the back of the house overlooking the swimming pool and south west facing landscaped rear garden. There is an additional decked terrace to the side near the pool perfect for outside entertaining and a pretty summer house. The stunning bespoke kitchen features an extensive range of quartz topped units and cupboards, fully integrated appliances and a large central island and breakfast bar. The lower ground floor comprises to the rear a gym and games/media room with a second kitchen. Large sliding glass doors open to a paved terrace allowing access to the pool and the garden. To the front is a study, a double bedroom, a shower room, wine store and plant room. There is also a separate self contained annexe with its' own street access perfect for a nanny/house keeper. Upstairs, on the first floor is a generous principal bedroom suite with a dressing area fitted with well designed wardrobes and cupboards, a luxurious en suite bathroom with both a bathtub and double glass rainfall shower with wonderful green views to the rear. Alongside is a guest suite with contemporary fitted wardrobes and a smart en suite bathroom. On the top floor are a further three double bedrooms all with fitted wardrobes, one with a stylish en suite shower room, and a generous family bathroom which includes a concealed laundry area. There is air condition throughout the house, expect for the top floor and annex. Location Thornton Hill is a well known residential street close to Wimbledon Town and Village. Wimbledon Village High Street with its popular collection of shops, restaurants and bars is around 800 metres away with Wimbledon Common and its 1,200 acres of open space, ideal for walking, riding, cycling and golf a similar distance.  Wimbledon rail station with its fast and regular link to central London (approximately 20 minutes) is within 1,000 metres. King's College School and Wimbledon High School for Girls are both around 800 metres. Source of distances Google Pedometer Source of times ww.tfl.gov.uk All measurements are approximate. Square Footage: 4,750 sq ft  Brochures Web Details

long_description: Laurels are delighted to present this superb two double bedroom mid floor flat to the market, located in a highly desirable area of  Wimbledon. Within walking distance to both Haydons road mainline station (National Rail- 35minutes to London Waterloo) and Wimbledon mainline station with access to National Rail (17 minutes to London Waterloo), Tube and Tram.  The property comprises a spacious open plan kitchen and living area with built in appliances, a South East facing balcony in addition to a Juliette balcony in the dining section. A luxurious three-piece family bathroom  with shower over bath and two fantastic sized double bedrooms, the main boasting a South facing Juliette balcony, with ample storage throughout the property.  Further benefits include secure gated parking for one vehicle, easy access to Wimbledon town centre and all it has to offer including cafes, restaurants and its well known weekend food markets and festivals. The property is within the catchment area for a number of excellent schools including The Priory Church of England Primary School, Bishop Gilpin CofE Primary School and Ricards Lodge High School.  The property has a Tax Band of 'E' and the Local Authority is Merton. Early viewings are highly recommended and are available seven days a week including Bank Holidays! Brochures Full Details

bullet_points: Close proximity to all local amenities;Three bedrooms;Approximately a two minute walk to Mitcham Eastfields Station;Private west facing rear garden;Close to a wide range of local gyms;Potential to extend into the loft;Bright and deceivingly spacious throughout
long_description: ***Vendor’s comments:*** “If you want the perfect mix of convenience and space, whilst still feeling like you’re not in the hustle and bustle of London then this is the place for you! I’ve lived in this house since 2006 and throughout that time it’s shown me its versatility and adaptability. I moved in as a single first-time buyer and had more space than I knew how to handle as it is deceivingly spacious. The large bedroom at the front was my reception room, the now living room was the dining room and the third bedroom was my study. Now with many years passed, a child and a partner in addition it has taken on a whole new form and still feels spacious. This place really can accommodate a wide range of people with different needs and you still have the option to extend into the loft area. We’re moving as it’ll be our first property together and with future plans, a lot more space will be required. We won’t be going too far though as this area really is ideal. The west-facing garden means that in the summer the majority of the sun is directly in the garden till sunset. You can really enjoy the summer months with the space and privacy it provides as well as getting the BBQ going without any smoke going into the house. Living so close to the station is something I’ll forever miss once we move. It is 20 minutes direct to London Victoria & 28 minutes to London Blackfriars and with a short walk to the departing platform it really doesn’t get any better. You are also only 8 minutes and 1 stop away from Balham; perfect for the Northern line or to enjoy what Balham itself has to offer. Convenience really couldn’t be any better: LIDL (take your pick there’s 4 close by), Morrison’s and ASDA are all within a short walking distance along with the local newsagents right at the bottom of the road. You also have the Tandem Centre in nearby Colliers Wood should you fancy a Nando’s or require anything from Argos, Dunelm or Curry’s, it's only a 5-minute drive or 15 minutes on the 152 bus. You really are in the centre of it all without having the noise and congestion to deal with. Lastly, but not least, we have Figges Marsh or Mitcham Common which has perfect open green spaces for a walk or a run. There’s also a wide range of local gyms (Kings, Nuffield, The Gym or Better Gym) should you require the use of such establishments." Entrance Front reception 13' 5" x 8' 9" (4.09m x 2.67m) Kitchen 7' 9" x 5' 9" (2.36m x 1.75m) Bedroom one 14' 2" x 8' 4" (4.32m x 2.54m) Bedroom two 14' 2" x 8' 4" (4.32m x 2.54m) Bathroom Bedroom three 7' 3" x 6' 7" (2.21m x 2.01m) Private rear garden 18' 2" x 16' 9" (5.54m x 5.11m) Brochures Brochure 1

This property is located just moments away from excellent transport links, including Mitcham Eastfield’s and Mitcham Junction train stations offering the southern line and Thameslink services into London Bridge, Milton Keynes, Watford, Clapham, Brighton and many more brilliant locations.  As you enter the property, on your left you are welcomed by a spacious reception room fully fitted with shutters, featuring enough space for a dining table which is the perfect spot for relaxing! long_description: Brinkley's Estate Agents are pleased to bring to the market this stylish, bright and airy, one bedroom flat.  This one bedroom flat provides well-presented living space in an enviable location.  Minutes from Wimbledon town centre and within close proximity to all shops bars and restaurants. The property is ideal for an investor or a first time buyer. Nestled in the heart of Wimbledon within walking distance to the mainline station, tube and tram link. There is a large reception/kitchen area featuring a luxury kitchen with fully integrated appliances and stone worktops. The property was built in 2003 and so benefits from modern building standards, but retains the charm of this street. Further notable benefits include no onward chain and a new 125-year lease.  Very well built and cleverly designed with extra high ceilings, making it feel bigger than most second floor flats. How to view: Please contact our Wimbledon Hill office on  , Wimbledon Park office on   or our Putney office on   for more information or to book a viewing. We are open from 8:30am - 7pm Monday to Friday and 9am - 6pm on weekends. The first floor landing is accessed via a split staircase so to the left is a self contained bedroom with en-suite and to the right three further bedrooms and a family bathroom. long_description: On the periphery of Wimbledon Village is this bright and spacious two bedroom, two bathroom garden flat set within a handsome period property. long_description: This lovely ground-floor maisonette is well presented and finished to a high standard throughout. The kitchen is fully functional and has plenty of storage from the base and wall-mounted units. The living room has plenty of natural light and is great for spending quality time with friends and family or enjoying individual pursuits. The bathroom is modern and consists of a three-piece suite with a large walk-in shower. There are two spacious double bedrooms both with plenty of space for other furniture. This home also benefits from its own private garden with a patio area creating a great space to enjoy those summer BBQs whilst providing a safe space for children to play.  Transport links are excellent thanks to its nearby train stations and local bus routes.   This home is situated within a very sought-after area, with an array of local amenities including shops, bars, eateries, supermarkets, and green spaces. Viewings here are a must!

long_description: Our client has accepted an offer on this property and there are no further viewings taking place (STC), please feel free to register your interest by contacting us. Situated a stone’s throw from Wimbledon Common and Kings College School is this beautifully designed, state of the art luxury family home which has undergone a substantial re-build over the past couple of years and now boasts a stunning contemporary interior of around 2,000 sq. ft. Upon entering the house, the aspect from the entrance hall is straight through the spacious open plan main living area to the south facing garden and patio. The main reception areas have extensive concealed storage and shelving for display, appealing wood flooring, a feature fireplace and a wall of bi-fold doors leading to the patio. The open plan kitchen is beautifully fitted and has a breakfast bar and full range of quality integrated appliances.  A spacious utility room, study and cloakroom complete the ground floor accommodation. Upstairs there are four bedrooms, two of which have luxurious en-suite bathrooms and there is a further equally luxurious family bathroom. To the front of the property there is parking for several cars.  Additional notable features include the use of concealed lighting (both inside and out), picture windows, lightwells and a superb wood and glazed feature staircase. There is underfloor heating, and the property has been constructed using high quality materials and to maximise efficiency there solar panels on the roof and a air source heat pump. long_description: An impressive three bedroom penthouse apartment with a private terrace in a much sought after location in Wimbledon Village.  Description A beautifully refurbished three bedroom penthouse apartment of substantial proportions. The property is set on the second floor of an impressive detached period house on one of Wimbledon Village's most desirable roads. The apartment benefits from fantastic natural light and comprises a generous reception room with attractive parquet flooring which extends across the kitchen and hallway. Bi folding glass doors to the side open to the private decked terrace with attractive views. Off the reception space is a stunning contemporary kitchen with an extensive range of units and cupboards with fully integrated appliances and breakfast bar. The large principal bedroom features a well designed dressing area and a luxurious bathroom with a freestanding bath tub and rain shower. There is a generous guest bedroom with a stylish en suite shower room, an additional double bedroom and a contemporary bathroom. The property has a large loft area with planning consent granted for conversion to residential if desired. Parking is provided by way of residents parking. Chain free. Location Parkside Gardens is widely regarded as one of Wimbledon's finest addresses within 500m of Wimbledon Village and Wimbledon Common. Wimbledon Village offers a charming selection of shops, restaurants, cafes and bars with the Common and Cannizaro Park ideal for riding, walking, golf and cycling. station_info: [(0.3, 'Wimbledon Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-underground;svg-tramlink'), (0.3, 'Dundonald Road Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink'), (0.7, 'Merton Park Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink')]
long_description: A truly outstanding 5 bedroom modern detached house in this sought after road in Wimbledon.  The house has been finished to a very high specification and offers exceptionally comfortable family accommodation, complete with off-street parking and a pretty south-westerly garden This fabulous house has ample off-street parking to the front and is entered into a bright and spacious hall with a sunken wine cellar (complete with electrically controlled glass cover).  From here all the principal rooms run:  a spacious living room with a wood burning stove and a concealed projector and cinema screen; his and her studies, a full width and very special kitchen/dining/family room with bi-fold wooden doors on 3 sides leading to the garden; a pantry; and a cloakroom.  On the first floor the magnificent principle bedroom suite has an en-suite bathroom with separate shower and a dressing room.  There is also a concealed fridge, boiling an cold water tap and a mirror TV.  There are 2 further bedrooms on this floor, both with en-suite bathrooms and the utility room. On the second floor, there are an additional 2 spacious bedrooms, both with en-suite shower rooms. All of the bedrooms have fitted wardrobes. The whole house is light and airy, with underfloor heating throughout, CCTV and very good volume to the rooms because of the generous ceiling heights. To the rear of the house is a generous landscaped garden, with a good sized patio for al-fresco dining. Malcolm Road is a quiet cul de sac accessed off Worple Road conveniently close to the Village and Wimbledon town, mainline station, tube and all its amenities.  The A3 is easily accessible with its direct route into central London and connection to the M25 network for both Heathrow and Gatwick airports. There are many good schools in the area both in the private and state sector, including Kings College School, Wimbledon High, The Study, Ursuline and The Norwegian School.  Recreation activities in Wimbledon Village & Town include 2 riding stables, multiple golf courses within a 3 mile radius, tennis and fitness clubs and Wimbledon Common itself consisting of 1200 acres. Brochures More Details brochure

station_info: [(0.3, 'Raynes Park Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.4, 'Wimbledon Chase Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.8, 'South Merton Station', 'svg-nationalrail')]
long_description: The Zero started with a vision. To create one of the most planet-friendly developments in the UK, without compromising on design or function.   The Zero blazes a new trail in high-quality, zero carbon living. From creating a thermally efficient building to reducing the energy demands of each apartment and the building as a whole, every detail and every decision delivers maximum sustainability – and maximum wow factor.  At the Zero, we’ve harnessed the natural resources of the sun’s power and use it to our owners’ benefit to help save the planet and reduce their energy bills. Using the most technically advanced solar panel system combined with a bank of Tesla Powerwall storage batteries, we’ve created a building where during certain times of year we are completely self-sufficient.   The Zero offers every apartment with open plan, free flowing living spaces with glass internal doors to allow light to flood through.  Every detail has been finished to the highest specification, thoughtfully designed to make the most of the living space. Triple glazed windows open inwards to allow for easy cleaning. Breakfast bars offer a second dimension to modern living lifestyles. Stylish Italian kitchens with beautiful Silestone Calcutta worktops throughout, kitchens include filtered boiling water taps.  The door entry system has been designed to ring your phone when visitors arrive, so you can open the door from the touch of a button on your mobile, wherever you may be.    Every flat has its own private balcony which is constructed in solid concrete and finished beautifully with maintenance free composite wood. They need little maintenance, look good and are long lasting. They even feature inward opening doors so you’ve got more outdoor space to relax. Welcome to the most beautiful energy-efficient apartment building in the UK. Situation The Zero itself is located in Raynes Park. A peaceful, green, family-friendly area with a vibrant community feel. A safe and leafy suburb just 20 minutes by train from the centre of London, much of Raynes Park is low-rise, creating a sense of open space that is a rare find in London. The lively local high street was a Great British High Street finalist in 2015 and offers every amenity you need for day-to-day life. Less than 1.5 miles away is the chic Wimbledon Village, with a huge array of stylish boutiques, artisan coffee shops and speciality food stores, along with a plentiful choice of buzzing bars and restaurants. There are also the elegant homes and wide green spaces of Combe Lane and Copse Hill, a neighbouring conservation area. Raynes Park has an active residents’ association, which helps ensure community support for projects such as tree planting and improved cycling and walking routes. Only 10 min cycle from Richmond Park. Additional Information Lease: Leasehold 250 years  Service charge: £1,729 Ground Rent: £350 The above is to be reviewed annually Brochures Particulars
