long_description: Retirement Development Exclusively For Those Aged 70+ A large South-West facing one bedroom apartment in the age-specific development of Liberty House, Raynes Park/Wimbledon. The apartment is in excellent condition throughout and boasts a stunning decked terrace overlooking the communal garden and is accessed directly from the spacious reception room. The apartment comprises a spacious reception room with direct access to the terrace and modern kitchen, walk-in shower room, double bedroom with walk-in wardrobe and hallway with plenty of storage. In addition, the apartment has under floor heating and is offered with no onward chain. In our opinion, the apartment is located in one of the best positions within the development due to easy access to both lifts, the roof top gardens, as well as the added security of being off the ground floor. Liberty House itself offers many facilities including onsite management 24 hours a day, a restaurant, wellbeing suite, function room and garden room, landscaped communal gardens and laundry rooms on each floor, gated parking, a beautiful roof terrace and lift access across all floors. Being an assisted living development, there are care services available that are customisable to residents` needs and which can be altered as requirements change. Liberty House is adjacent to the Nelson Medical Centre and also benefits from local grocery stores within a short walk. It is located moments away from transport links into and out of Wimbledon and Raynes Park and has easy access to the A3/M25 Notice Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. long_description: This stunning first floor apartment is well-presented and finished to a high standard throughout. The open plan kitchen is perfect for modern lifestyles and benefits from plenty of storage from the base and wall-mounted units. The spacious living room has plenty of natural light and views of Morden Park. This home has two double bedrooms, both benefitting from built-in wardrobes, leaving plenty of space for additional furniture. The bathroom is modern and consists of a three-piece suite with a large walk-in shower.  The property comes with two allocated parking spaces in a private, gated residents' car park. There are excellent transport links in this sought-after location thanks to its nearby train stations and local bus routes. Morden South station is less than a minute's walk away, and Morden tube station is a 10-minute walk. There is an array of amenities nearby including shops, bars, eateries, supermarkets, gyms, and green spaces. Morden Park is just across the road, offering homeowners a space to exercise or relax. Viewings here are a must!

bullet_points: Selling via Modern Method of Auction;Ability to Purchase with Mortgage / Finance;No Onward Chain;Double Bedroom;Storage;New Build Guarantee;Residents Parking;Natural Light
long_description: The entrance hall has two storage cupboards with master double bedroom to the right and the bathroom to the left. The kitchen is open plan to the living room with dual aspect windows. The lounge has space for a dining table and benefits from a Juliet Balcony.  The modern Method of Auction is a flexible, buyer friendly method of purchase. We do not require the purchaser to exchange contracts immediately but grant 56 days to exchange and complete. Allowing the additional time to exchange on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to put down a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2  including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000 including VAT which secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The legal Pack can be downloaded for  free from the auction website or requested in branch.

bullet_points: Reception room;Kitchen dining room;Four double bedrooms;Principal en suite bathroom with dressing area;En suite shower room;Family bathroom;Utility room;South-facing back garden;Front garden
station_info: [(0.4, 'Wandsworth Common Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.7, 'Clapham South Station', 'svg-underground'), (0.8, 'Clapham Junction Station', 'svg-nationalrail;svg-overground')]
long_description: This grand semi-detached house is positioned on an extremely sought-after residential street close to Wandsworth Common. The impressive property measures approximately 2,236 sq ft, and is one of four houses that were built in 2000 as replicas of similar Victorian houses nearby. The house is a fantastic example of mixing contemporary design with Victorian-style proportions, and has an excellent feeling of light and space throughout, making it ideal for both family life and entertaining. To the front of the ground floor off the smart hallway laid with Victorian-style tiles, is the elegant reception room which benefits from high ceilings, a feature fireplace and wooden floors which add to the sense of space. To the rear of the house and beyond a downstairs cloakroom is the spectacular kitchen dining room. Extra high ceilings, exposed beams and Crittal-style windows and French doors overlooking the garden, flood the room with light and add to the great sense of space, designed to work brilliantly for both entertaining and everyday living. The kitchen itself has a unique feeling that is similar in style to a Manhattan Loft or industrial warehouse with wooden wall and base units, white marble counter tops, a butler’s sink and a large central island on heavy duty wheels. Double glazed Clement windows, a freestanding wood burning stove and ceiling lights with exposed cable ducts complete the industrial feel. Double doors open onto an attractive south-facing garden which boasts an open aspect, an easi-grass lawn and a good number of shrubs and plants which create a good sense of privacy. On the first floor, the principal suite is to the rear of the house overlooking the garden, with a large dressing area with bespoke wardrobes and a luxurious en suite bathroom with freestanding bath, a walk-in shower and twin sinks. Due to its south-facing aspect the bedroom has a wonderful light and airy feel. A second double bedroom with an en suite shower room and excellent built-in wardrobes is also on this level. Stairs lead up to the second floor and two further good-sized double bedrooms, a family bathroom and a useful utility room. This stunning property boasts a pretty front garden and is well set back from the road. The house has excellent storage in the eaves and there is possibility to further extend (subject to the usual consents). Dents Road runs east off Bolingbroke Grove between the commons. The amenities of Northcote Road are a short walk away and the open spaces of Wandsworth Common are literally at the end of the street. Wandsworth Common Overland is approximately a ten-minute walk, with regular trains into London Victoria via Clapham Junction. The area is also well-served by the 319 bus at the end of the road offering easy access to Chelsea and the King’s Road. There are numerous good state and private schools nearby (subject to catchment each year). Council Tax Band: G | EPC: C | Tenure: Freehold Brochures Particulars

long_description: A substantial 3936 sqft family home on the very popular Hocroft Road, one of the most prestigious addresses on the residential enclave known as The Hocrofts. The house is set back behind a driveway that provides parking for several cars and offers well planned living accommodation including a study and reception room to the front of the house, a substantial living room and separate dining room with open plan kitchen with direct access to the raised deck and the garden beyond. In addition there is a utility room and guest cloakroom. The first floor offers a well-appointed principal bedroom with range of built in wardrobes and bathroom en suite, along with three further bedrooms and a family bathroom with views of UCS playing fields and private tennis courts. The top floor features two bedrooms, a shower room and access to eaves storage. To the rear of the house is a 68’11 ft landscaped garden with a raised deck. The Hocrofts is favorably situated for access to the buses on Finchley Road, West Hampstead Thames Link & Underground station (Jubilee Line) as well as Finchley Road Underground station (Metropolitan & Jubilee Lines). The Broadwalk shopping centre is just over 4 miles away and offers a huge variety of retailers and restaurants.    Edgware underground station is under half a mile away and provides an easy link to the centre of the city (Leicester Square) in just under 30 minutes, ideal for both commuting and socialising.    Situated within easy reach of a number of beautiful green open spaces such as Canons Park with 45 acres to explore, Stonegrove Park offering basketball and tennis courts and a children's play area and Stanmore Country Park Reserve with its marked out nature trail.  Barnet Burnt Oak Leisure Centre is under 2 miles away. Here you can enjoy a state-of-the-art gym, astro pitch, variety of sports courts and a wide range of fitness classes. bullet_points: Beautiful Two Double Bedroom Ground Floor Maisonette;Sought After Quiet Residential Location;Bright and Spacious Reception Opening onto Garden;Separate Large Well Equipped Kitchen;Bathroom with Bath/Shower Room;South Facing Private Garden;Share of Freehold and No Onward Chain;Close to Excellent Transport Links;Easy Access Shops and Amenities;Please quote LR0444
long_description: Please quote LR0444 Superbly located in a quiet residential road, this beautifully presented two double bedroom ground floor maisonette boasting off street parking, and private south facing garden.  The property has been well maintained and updated by the current owner, offering elegant accommodation with stylish interiors throughout.  Features include an inviting reception with doors onto the garden, large well equipped kitchen, bathroom with bath and separate shower, gas central heating, double glazing, quality floor coverings, inbuilt storage, share of freehold and no onward chain.   Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with feature fireplace surround and wide bay window with doors onto the large private garden.  The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset ceramic sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, double wall mounted electric oven, and further space for appliances.  There are two generous double bedrooms, with inbuilt storage to the master, plus a family bathroom with free-standing bath suite and separate shower unit.   The property is conveniently located within easy access of Hendon, Hendon Central and Colindale stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes, all providing excellent cross-London links. There are a variety of shops and amenities within a short distance on The Hyde, as well as a selection of pleasant open spaces including nearby Sunny Hill Park.  Additionally, the site of the Middlesex University is close-by, as well as a number of excellent local schools.  Viewings are strongly recommended. long_description: SUMMARY Situated along a tree lined road you will find this double fronted 3 bedroom semi-detached home. The property is in close proximity to popular schools, shops and local amenities and is only 0.3 miles from High Barnet tube station & 0.7 miles from New Barnet station. DESCRIPTION On entering this family home the entrance hallway provides access to a living/dining area and modern fitted kitchen diner overlooking this home's rear garden. To the right of the entrance hall you will find a separate reception area with downstairs cloak room. The first floor accommodates a family bathroom and three bedrooms, with one of the bedrooms being accessed through a study/workspace area. The property benefits from a sizable front garden with off street parking space for two cars. The house can be extended into the loft STPP. High Barnet is a market town that dates back to the 12th century. Its name is often abbreviated to just Barnet, which is also the name of the borough of which it forms a part. Located in zone 5 on the borders between Whetstone and the Green belt, High Barnet tube station or New Barnet train station offers an easy commute in and out of Central London. Barnet Is considered the perfect location for those who want to be moments away from the countryside, while also being part of London's vibrant city lifestyle. 1. long_description: SUMMARY Located in the heart of Whetstone on a quiet cul-de-sac is this well-presented three/four bedroom town house. This home is perfect for the growing family looking to be close to the High Road's cafes, restaurants and shop and also those wishing to be close to transport links. DESCRIPTION The property comprises downstairs shower room and fourth bedroom with direct access to the rear garden.  To the first floor there is a sizeable living dining area and fitted kitchen whilst to the second floor there are three additional bedrooms and family bathroom. Externally there is off street parking and access to the garage and utility area. Situated just 0.3 miles from Totteridge & Whetstone Tube Station makes it very appealing for those commuting to Central London for work. Located 0.4 miles from All Saints and 0.5 miles from Sacred Heart Primary Schools both are well regarded locally making this an ideal family home. Dating back to the 15th Century, Whetstone originated in medieval times, and legend has it that the name stems from the stone that is placed outside of the Griffin Pub, where soldiers went to sharpen their swords before the Battle of Barnet. Whetstone is perfect for both commuters and families alike. Located in zone 4, Totteridge and Whetstone northern line tube station offers easy access in and out of the city and central London, whilst also being only moments away from open countryside. Ft (490 Sq. M) detached family home now in need of some updating. long_description: REAL ESTATES are delighted to offer for sale this RARELY AVAILABLE 6 BEDROOM, 4 BATHROOM DETACHED PROPERTY situated in the HEART OF TOTTERIDGE, convenient for Totteridge & Whetstone Northern Line tube station and multiple shops at Whetstone High Road. The 1st floor offers a master bedroom with en suite dressing room and large bathroom, 3 further bedrooms (2 en suite) and a 2nd utility room.  The top floor comprises 2 bedrooms (1 with a dressing room en suite) and a bathroom. Early viewing is highly recommended to avoid disappointment. long_description: We are delighted to be able to offer this rare opportunity to purchase a fabulous detached family home in one of the most sought after roads within Central Golders Green. Basing Hill is located off The Ridgeway and the property is situated on the upper/middle section. The house has fabulous views, tremendous potential and a delightful rear garden. Accommodation comprises, on the ground floor 2 formal reception rooms, a spacious kitchen/ breakfast room, utility room plus a separate annexe (this can be accessed from the side of the building as well as from internally) which has previously been used as a consulting room but could also be a 5th bedroom. There is an additional WC for this area plus also a normal guest WC off the hallway.  On the 1st floor there are 4 bedrooms plus a family bathroom and separate WC. The main bedroom has the benefit of a shower room and sink. The loft area is at present unconverted, but this is a huge space with great potential for additional bedrooms and further bathroom(s).  Both internally and externally the house has been regularly maintained however it is clearly ideally suitable for a major renovation project so as to create a fabulous family home.  Early viewing is highly recommended.  Brochures Web Details Particulars

Kitchen - Fitted with a range of recently fitted modern wall and base units with complementing worktops incorporating a stainless steel mixer tap sink unit and a four ring gas hob with an extractor hood above, as well as a range of high spec integrated appliances, tiled splashback and tiled flooring.  Bedroom One - A spacious double bedroom with large arched double glazed windows, wood flooring, ceiling spotlights, a radiator and an en-suite.  En-Suite - A modern three piece suite comprising; a walk in shower enclosure, a vanity wash basin unit with a low level WC. Fully tiled.  Bedroom Two - A double bedroom with a large arched double glazed window, wood flooring, ceiling spotlights and a radiator.  Bathroom - A modern three piece suite comprising; a panel bath with an overhead shower attachment, a vanity wash basin and a low level WC. Fully tiled and a chrome heated towel rail. long_description: TO BE SOLD BY ONLINE AUCTION AS LOT 11 ON THURSDAY 7 JUL 2022 - Freehold House Vacant Possession  Six Week Completion or Earlier  London Borough of Barnet  Situated off Goldbeaters Grove, close to local shopping/travelling facilities available on The Broadway including Mill Hill Broadway Train Station and Edgware Underground Station (Northern Line). Lyndhurst Park is also nearby.  A  Terrace House  requiring modernisation with accommodation arranged on  Two Floors  comprising:  First Floor  · Bedroom (One)  · Bedroom (Two)  · Bedroom (Three)  · Bathroom/WC  Ground Floor  · Entrance Hall   · Reception Room  · Kitchen  Garden at Rear   Off-Street Parking on Front Forecourt   Note:  There may be potential for a loft conversion subject to the necessary planning consent being obtained.  Vacant Possession   EPC Rating: D  Inspection:  By arrangement with the Auctioneers      Brochures Auction Catalogue Book a Viewing Auction Buying Guide

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Chas R Lowe Estates Located conveniently for both New Barnet and High Barnet, this extended terraced family home includes a south west facing rear garden * Four bedrooms * Two bathrooms * Two reception rooms * Kitchen/diner * Off street parking * STORM PORCH : double glazed front door leading into  ENTRANCE HALL : single radiator, phone point, stairs leading to landing, understairs storage cupboard. RECEPTION ROOM  13'6 x 11'4 into bay Double glazed sash windows overlooking front, gas coal effect fire with original surround, TV aerial point, radiator. RECEPTION ROOM  12'5 x 11'4 Original cast iron range inset into chimney breast, built in cupboards, single radiator, laminate flooring, open to KITCHEN/DINING ROOM  15'10 x 8'4 plus 6'11 recess Kitchen area : base and eye level units, wooden work surfaces to two sides, five ring gas hob with extractor fan and light above, electric oven below, plumbing for washing machine, space for condensing tumble dryer, stainless steel sink and drainer, double glazed window overlooking rear garden. Dining area : double glazed double doors leading onto rear garden, lantern skylight, double radiator. LANDING : stairs leading to bedroom 4. BEDROOM  12'6 x 11'2 Double glazed sash windows overlooking rear garden, range of built in cupboards including one housing gas central heating boiler and cylinder, power points, double radiator, original fireplace. BEDROOM  10'3 x 9'8 Double glazed sash window overlooking front, alcove cupboard, original fireplace, power points, single radiator. BEDROOM  7'4 x 7'4 Double glazed sash window overlooking front, single radiator, power points, original fireplace. BATHROOM : low level flush WC, pedestal wash hand basin, panelled bath with shower, partly tiled walls, window. Stairs leading to SECOND LANDING : Velux window. BEDROOM  15'5 into eaves x 11'0  Double glazed window overlooking rear gardens, double radiator, Velux windows to front, laminate flooring, power points, built in cupboards. ENSUITE SHOWER ROOM : low level flush WC, vanity unit with wash hand basin, shower cubicle, partly tiled walls, heated towel rail, tiled flooring, double glazed frosted window. SOUTH WEST FACING REAR GARDEN : fully paved with mature borders, seating area to rear. FRONT OF PROPERTY : block paved off street parking. Brochures Particulars
